Wish they would just make it so you could plug the fitbit itself straight into a regular USB port.Good gadget for those who want to compete with others to help get active - be sure to join a few challenges online!
review_title: Fun fitness gadget, wish charger was designed better.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Let me start by saying that i am a personal trainer. I liked the idea that i could track my clients activity level on a daily basis. That part was actually fun. Also the silent alarms and sleep tracker is s pretty good feature. My biggest issue with the FITBIT is that its almost impossible to recharge the thing. It has three metal contact point on the back, when you slide it into the charger there is some kind of connection issue. It lights up like is charging for a few seconds but when you go back to get it, its still dead. Many nights i left my FitBit to charge over night in the charger and had no juice in the morning. What's the point if its always dead! I have tried numerous methods to get it to stay on the charger but its not worth the hassle. I don't want to waste 10-15 minutes every 3-4 days trying to get it to recharge. My clients with Fitbit also have the same issues and most have given up on it as have i. FYI the band is also not very comfortable, i was constantly taking it off for some relief, some of my clients who left it on started to develop a rash. If your looking for a pedometer keep looking. I used it for a little over a month and got sick of it.
review_title: Recharging Issues, product needs a lot of work. I'm sure there are better options out there.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I absolutely love my Fitbit so much that I got my husband one for Father's Day. In my opinion, it is the most accurate tracker out there and is the best for the money. I like that you are able to track your sleep and sleep patterns and accuracy. It is also very motivating to see how many steps and calories you have burned and makes you want to "beat" your personal best everyday. The challenges are also motivating to compete with your friends. I would recommend this to anyone looking for motivation, or is just interested in how many steps/miles/calories they burn everyday.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought 2 of these for Christmas (one for me, one for my Wife) and have worn them every day since we got them! They have been such a huge motivation to get all of our exercise and we've even talked like 30 of our friends into getting them as well. (Talk about challenges!)My Fitbit has functioned perfectly and is still going strong almost 6 months later. I kinda want to upgrade to the one with the display but this wrist band model is so invisible you actually forget you are wearing it after about day 3.I've gotten mine wet in the shower on accident and it was fine. Also stands up to being jangled around during workouts and holds a charge forever, like 5-6 days at a time.The little celebration lights are fun too!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit itself has worked well for me, but the band is kind of crummy. It has fallen off or nearly fallen off several times while wearing it. There is a rip in the rubber where the Fitbit technology is inserted, but I don't really understand why (I don't insert the Fitbit roughly into the band or anything like that).Also, this Fitbit has gotten really sweaty while I'm running, which is not the Fitbit's fault. However, watch out---I've found that things can grow inside where the Fitbit is kept, and lends the thing a rather unpleasant smell (even after cleaning it). You don't notice it unless you hold it up to your nose but it's not nice to know it's there.
review_title: but I don't really understand why (I don't insert the Fitbit roughly into the band or anything like that). Also

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This item is a piece of trash. It won't keep a charge longer than 18-20 hours, nor will it stay on the proper 24 hour calendar. I have written them and just get a run around. They tell me how to keep my battery charged, etc. I have had 3 of these before and have NEVER had a problem with them. No help for the problems I am having and no hope of a refund. I DON"T recommend this product. But at your own risk.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the Fitbit Flex. I did a lot of research before choosing the Fitbit Flex, and I'm very pleased with my choice. I particularly like that the Flex automatically synchs with the iPhone app whenever I open the app. I find myself checking the app several times each day to see how many steps I've taken toward my daily goal. The food log is very good too. The food database is substantial (though not quite as comprehensive as that of the My Fitness Pal app), and there is an option inputting and logging "custom foods." Another fascinating piece of this tracker is the "Sleep Log." Tap the bracelet before you go to sleep, and again when you wake up, and the log will tell you how much you slept the night, including how many times you awakened during the night.Logging into your Fitbit account on your computer offers even more information on your data.Fitbit Flex is waterproof. I have worn it in the shower a number of times, but I do usually remove it before showering.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I received this as a gift for Mother's Day and initially it worked great.  Today is July 3, 2015 and my Fitbit Flex has not been working for over a week.  Unfortunately, Amazon's return window has expired.  I am stuck with it.  I couldn't be less pleased.  The bracelet is no longer synching with the app.  I have restarted the bracelet several times by following Fitbit's directions.  It synchs for a moment, but then not again unless I restart it again.  It is not counting my steps or monitoring my sleep. Such a Disappointment!!  (Oh and on an added note:  To track your workout, you have to carry your phone with you anyway because this unit works by bluetooth.  They do not communicate from afar!)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Had issues getting this in a timely manner. However, it was around Christmas so I will give the benefit of the doubt to Amazon. I do not like the band it has come undone a few times while my daughter was running and she could have lost it if she was not alert. I like the concept I just don't like the price for something that is put together not so great. I understand the newer models are a little more sturdy and the op program is easier to use. I may give that a try but the most I can rate this is three stars.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I  had this for approximately three months before it suddenly died. Fitbit is not the easiest customer service to work with. Their help guide and FAQs are not easy to manage. It's easy to find out what the light codes mean when the Fitbit is functioning, but when it is not functioning, there's not much to go on. Fitbit is demanding proof of purchase to replace it, which could be a real problem if the Fitbit were a gift or you didn't order through Amazon or another online merchant where you have an account. Proof of purchase also seems silly given that for the Fitbit to work, you have to register with Fitbit and obtain an account with Fitbit. That being said, when it worked it was pretty easy to use, small and lightweight - easy to forget I was wearing it. I just wish it had a bit more longevity.
review_title: Didn't last very long. Annoying replacement policy.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The actual FitBit itself is great.  I came to rely on it daily for data entry and summary.  The band, however, is the weak link.  It is not secure in any way and, in fact, I lost it on an aircraft.  $99 down the drain.  I would highly suggest a redesign of the band because, well, when it falls off, even a five star device is useless.  That said, I would recommend anyone considering this device to purchase the FitBit One.  It does all that the Flex does, and more: it measures floors ascended.  The One comes with a relatively comfortable wristband with a slotted pouch in which the device is placed so you can monitor your sleep.  The nice thing is, this goes on my nightstand in the morning and the FitBit One goes in my pocket.  No more worries about the security of the always-worn wristband of the Flex.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought it as a gift. Recipient loves it. Seems a little simplistic in what it does though the sleep tracking function is cool. Very poor instructions and initial setup of application is very poorly designed, needlessly complicated and poorly documented. Very cluttered website with poorly laid out links. After you get past initial setup things get easier.Maybe the Fitbit people need to test their web/app design on the general public, not just web design specialist/enthusiast, and reconsider some things.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got this and used it for a month.  It only tracks the movement of your arm.  It doesn't track well when your major activities are ice skating and yoga.  The rubber band that you put the fit bit in is uncomfortable and itchy.  I got a bruise on my wrist from wearing it.  They give you 2 bands with only one clasp between the 2 of them.  For the price of the item you would think they could afford to put a clasp on each band.  I tried he sleep tracker.  Apparently I move around too much in my sleep because it says I only get 2 hours of sleep at night.  To use their app and online tracker it makes you add "friends."  I don't want to force my friends to do this.  I'd say don't bother buying this.  It's not worth the money.
review_title: I got this and used it for a month. ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: its ok but find the desktop information required to be filled in not easy, ie. foods as many things are not on the list for calorie counts etc so have to compromise, also having to fill out the items eaten takes time,  the sleep log also is ok but could be better, I find if you do a 24 hr sleep range it shows many times during the day where it records you as asleep when in fact you are awake at your desk, so to me its not recording sleep it records time of inactivity. when you do the duel tap to record sleep it still asks you to record what time you went to sleep so whats the point?  Also find that the plastic band sweats a lot in the tropics and causes small sweat ulcers around the band.  But give it 3 stars as the step/walk meter recording works well.
review_title: ... the desktop information required to be filled in not easy, ie

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I can't say enough about the Fitbit Flex! It has helped my husband and I to keep track of our activity, sleep and what we eat everyday since I purchased the product. I thought my husband would stop wearing his and was hopeful it would not just be another fad diet thing I purchased to get him motivated to become more active, but he never takes it off (except to charge). Very rarely does he miss his daily goals and makes sure he is green in every section. Our next purchase is going to be the scale so we can also track our fat percentages. The Fitbit is comfortable and we love how the APP works on our phones so we don't need it attached to the computer and can check our progress throughout the day. I was wishing we had purchased the Fitbit Force since you can see the steps but now that we have it on our phones and the Flex is water safe I am very happy we purchased the Flex.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is an excellent device for tracking your walking activities along with many additional non exercise related items. My unit syncs to my Android phone and provides me with a helpful means to track my activities, calories burned, foods consumed, amount of water I have drunk, and many more. It has provided me with extra incentive to stay on track to reach my weight loss goal and has helped me to avoid unneeded food items that would only serve to impede reaching my weight loss. As it provides a visual counter, many times I will skip the elevator and walk the stairs. I think it is contributing to my returning to my healthy-self.  I especially like the sleep mode monitor as it lets me see when I am not getting the right amount of hours or rest. Weekly reports are also provided, when you sign-up to their web application.
review_title: Terrific way to stay on course with weight loss goals, providing a visual incentive to you to succeed

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Overall I like it for keeping me motivated.  However, it is not accurate for the number of steps.  My husband and I walked an identical route together, yet he logged 1000 more steps than I did. He is 4" taller than me.  I doubt our stride length is that much different.  It really needs to take stride length into consideration.  I notice if I wear it on my belt loop, I get a different reading than if I wear it on my wrist.  This is probably because I am carrying things in my hands so my arms are not moving much.  I love the silent alarm.  It is not accurate as far as what time you fall asleep.  You can lay awake still for an hour and it will say it took you 7 minutes to go to sleep.  The software needs  some tweaking to make it a really useful tool.  I wish the band came in an XL so I could put it on my ankle.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I waited 4 weeks for my Fitbit Flex and was so excited when I finally got to use it.  It has kept me focused on my fitness goals and even helped me shed a couple pounds.  Unfortunately, I did have an issue with the wristband breaking after only 2 1/2 months of use and was surprised to find out that my SquareTrade warranty didn't cover replacing it or fixing it.  However, I contacted Fitbit's customer service directly and explained the situation to them and they were kind enough to fix the band for me.  They were also quick to reply.  I would give the product 4 stars since the band isn't sturdy enough to support everyday use but I gave it an extra star for Fitbit's superior customer service.  I like their product and service so much that I've convinced my husband to buy the Fitbit Force.  :)
review_title: Good product and excellent customer service

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm so irritated by this!  I live and work in China, and bought the Flex wristband to help me keep track of my walking here.  For the first two weeks, it was brilliant!  But then one day I noticed that the band was starting to tear where the face met the band.  I hadn't gotten it wet (other than sweat), hadn't mistreated it, had only worn it normally.  And then, it snapped and the wristband was rendered useless in a moment.I then went to the Fitbit website and tried to get someone to help me get a new wristband here in China.  I logged a formal complaint, and days went by with no response.  Finally, I went onto the forum and complained that I was getting no response, and said I'd have to take it to the streets to register my dissatisfaction with the quality of the band and the lack of customer service, and I quickly got a message saying that they were backlogged with prior complaints.It is such a pity, because if the band hadn't broken so easily, I would have gladly given the Flex high marks.  As it is, I can't do it.I just hope that Fitbit will do the right thing and replace the band, so I can at least come back here and say that they did that.
review_title: I so wanted to like this product!  But the inferior quality and bad customer service has gotten in the way.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I want to give it 5 stars!  I loved the fit bit zip.  But, was interested in the sleep tracking & silent alarms.  So... I did it.  I bought the flex & sold the zip.  On the 1st night of tracking sleep data abruptly stopped @ 4am.  That's when it fell off my wrist.  Then, day 3... I tracked steps & was ready to track sleep.  Alas... It was list at dinner.  I only wish the wristband were more secure.  (Lost at dinner).  Now I'm out $$ and no tracking.  fit Bit... Please redesign the band & consider sending me another!]So, i have to say that the company is replacing my lost fit bit as a gesture of good will!  That is excellent customer service!  I am still worried about losing it again.  And, unfortunately the only other option is a "designer" bracelet that costs ~$180-- WITHOUT the flex.  I think you need more options for those of us who don't care about design but overall good health!Thank you!
review_title: 1star but loved it!  While it lasted

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Do NOT waste your money!  I have had this for more than six months.  I'm on my third wristband (they keep splitting - and after the first one fell apart, I stopped wearing it in the shower even though that is supposedly not a problem), the scale will not connect with WiFi (I am not a moron and have worked with their customer service - email only, which was ridiculous), the charger (for the Fitbit) itself requires me to breathe deeply and allow at least 5 minutes to get the charger to read that the Fitbit is in there and start charging), and now the Fitbit itself appears to have died, as it is not recognized by my iPhone (yes, the battery is fully charged, etc, etc).I have contacted their email support numerous times and all I get is the canned response.  I can't think of another product I've spent this kind of money on that seemed so cheaply made, with no customer service at all.  Happy to answer anyone's questions - I'd hate for others to have this experience!
review_title: Waste of money - flimsy product, doesn't last

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I ordered the fitbit flex at the recommendation of my daughter who really enjoys hers and I'm really excited about seeing how it will help and encourage me with its reports to increase my exercise activity. She is an iphone user and has no problem. When i tried to pair my Android Samsung Galaxy Note II it did not work. As I am now reading other reviews I see there is a problem with pairing to some Android phones. Mine is one that is suppose to pair but does not, so I only give 4 stars until such time as they get this fixed.9/7/13 Update: After spending the weekend with my daughter, I found out, and realize my thoughts were correct, blue tooth works differently with Fitbit. It does not show up on the list but actually does pair differently. I am enjoying this new tool and learning all the ways of using its unique methods of entering information, only I can provide, from my android phone. I am now changing from 4 star to 5 star satisfaction!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Even though the band has an issue (at least for me), It is by far the best product on the market. especially when compared to others like the polar loop. The sleep tracker, the silent alarm, the ability to set your actual stride so your counts are more accurate. The built in reminders to get moving, and the effortless ability to see where you are in your daily goal.You can shower, swim, sweat - and the Flex just keeps going.the only CON  is the strap. I upgraded to the ChargHR because of the new strap design, and I wanted the added benefit of the heart rate monitor. All in all FitBit has there s*** together, awesome customer service/support, a great dashboard with tons of features, a very useful and full featured phone app.Don't spend your money anywhere else. This product and company are legit.
review_title: It is by far the best product on the market

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I eventually fired out how to set the flex up but no thanks to any instructions in the packaging. Once I got it working it was fine for a while ... until just after the return policy window closed.  First sign if trouble was the 10,000 step notification stopped vibrating. Then the device couldn't sync up consistently with phone app.  Then it wouldn't reset to zero in am (unless I sleep walk three miles every night) then it started telling me the battery was dead even when it was fully charged.  The wrist nand also started to irritate my skin.  Rash and itching. Don't buy.  Just use the phone app .... which is very good for keeping track of calories.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the fitbit to keep track of my steps and it syncs to my phone.I do not like that the charging dock is a piece of crap and stopped working less than a month of use.Spending a $100 bucks on something, you expect that it would last longer than a month.  I've cleaned the chargers, I contacted fitbit and after emails, they tell me I would have to return the entire thing, when all I needed was for them to replace the defective charger.Not pleased with the aggravation that #1 the charger is defective, and the only option to return the entire fitbit. Which I of course missed the timeframe to return it completely because I wasted my time trying to troubleshoot per their instructions.If I had known the charger would do this I probably would have purchased a different bodytracker.
review_title: Fitbit is useful, however expect for the charger to break in less than a month. Beware...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got the Flex to replace the Fitbit One that I lost.  Fact is I liked the One better than the Flex but I always worried, in the couple of months that I had it, that I would loose it.  Sure enough, I must have caught it on something and it's gone!  The other problem with the One is that I would, sometimes, be out on a run and realize that I forgot to transfer it from my jeans to my running shorts.  I like wearing the Flex on my wrist most all the time (except when it's charging) but I liked the ability to get much more information from the One during the day.  I also regret that the Flex doesn't track flights of stairs like the One did.  I'm not sure while they left that feature out.  Still, nothing is worth much if you can't keep up with it.  I feel that the Flex is a good compromise.
review_title: A Flex to replace my One

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought for wife as a gift.  She LOVES this thing!!  Has had it for two weeks and told me this morning that it's the best gift I've ever bought her.  Keeps track of her sleep quality, steps during the day, etc.  Lights up and vibrates when she hits a goal and uploads to her computer with graphs or something.Note to guys: she ASKED me for this thing.  Some wives might take being given a fitness tracker as a gift in the wrong way.Wristband is a little sketchy...she had a hard time trying to figure out how to put it on when she first got it two weeks ago and also lost it in her car last night.  Rating dropped to 4 stars from 5 because of her losing it in the car due to the wristband.
review_title: Has had it for two weeks and told me this morning that it's the best gift I've ever bought her

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like it and I don't. I should have purchased one where you could see the calories you have burned as I feel like that is a major down fall. I don't like that it doesn't register if I'm riding my bike. It doesn't fully capture my work out either. The app is okay and the tracking your sleep is awesome. It's kind of a glorified pedometer with a few extras. I think this is great for very inactive people or elderly people who want to get out and move. If you are serious about fitness I would opt for a different model or something completely different.
review_title: Not really on the Fitbit wagon, still good though.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have very mixed feelings about the Fitbit. I've had mine for about 2 years and I bought one for my wife last Christmas. The product's concept and software are great. We both find it hugely motivating in getting us out walking. We make a habit of leaving it on so forgetting to use it is never an issue. It's sufficiently accurate for us. BUT the physical design or manufacturing quality is not good enough. The bands crack between the tracker slot and the LED display. I've gone through 4 bands now in 2 years. My wife's broke after only a month or two. Fitbit support was kind enough to send us a free replacement for her band which was great. However, now my charger has stopped working and I see that a replacement charger is about $20. The hidden costs for this otherwise great product are frustrating and too high. I feel like Fitbit rushed this product into the marketplace before they figured out how to make it last.
review_title: I just wish the bands and charger lasted longer

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Okay, so I am no where near an athlete or even a super active person, all I can say is I have lost 50 pounds and become more active than I have been in years since I purchased my FitBit. I am 62 and this little wristband has done something nothing else could do, it has motivated me. I find myself checking my steps all day and working toward my daily goal. I upgraded to the premium plan about 2 months in, and I love the food analysis it does, it helps me make wiser choices. I also got an Aria scale about a week ago and I like it as well, nice not to have to enter my weight daily and it tells me my body fat. I believe I can become thin, truly active, and fit again all because of this little gadget. It might not do anything for you but it has made a major impact in my life!
review_title: so I am no where near an athlete or even a super active person

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had the device for a week & love it!The supplied bands are nicely unobtrusive & seem to be fairly secure but I made myself a band out of paracord instead since I like to wear paracord bracelets but don't like having multiple things on my wrist.Battery life is right about 5 days which is fine.Functionality is what one would expect. This widget is great for what it does; the app/website lets you tweak your goals & track calories as well.I really like not having to log walks/runs manually anymore.Like anything else this can be a useful tool if you are already motivated to get off the couch & move!Integration with the Aria scale is of course flawless as well.In short:I love this thing!
review_title: I've had the device for a week & love it! The supplied bands are nicely unobtrusive & ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The flex with the companion applications make this a great device for helping you hit your fitness target. The companion application help you track much more that just steps and sleep such as water and food consumption. I have a Windows phone and being able to sync with your device via Bluetooth is a great way to continue to see your progress. I had to replace the original band after about 1 month due to way you have to pull the device out to charge it. Luckily there are lots of great third party options in all sorts of colors for reasonable prices.I had an issue with tracker not charging, after some quick trouble shooting over email with the manufacture, they decided to send a replacement device right away to get back to tracking my progress. Thanks for the great customer service.
review_title: Great device with companion apps for all platforms

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have been using pedometers since, well, forever.By FAR the most reliable are made by Omron. Unfortunately, that company appears to be content with an early 90s technological approach. In other words, if they would get it together and produce a product (and user platform) that competes against the likes of Fitbit, that's what I would own.Beyond the technology, I have to confess that I love the Fitbit dashboard and yes, I even *pay* to keep all my stats there but I am weird like that. And again, if Omron would get it together, I'd be over there in a flash.But alas, they are not and so this is what I am left with.I've already purchased two of these things (and three FitBit Ones prior to this!) and I have a third in the box ready to go when my current one goes bad which it will.The issue for me here is the battery. The way it works for me is that first it becomes more and more difficult to get the battery to charge in the USB device (even after thorough cleaning of the contacts) and then that is shortly followed by an inability to hold a charge at all.The final step is the trash.Like I said, I am able to write these off as a business expense but for anyone who doesn't want to spend $500 a year on something like this, you may want to look elsewhere. I won't even get into the inaccuracies of the step counting and such but suffice it to say, I refresh the Omron website every day in hopes of a miracle that deep down I know will never come...
review_title: Good thing it's a business expense...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Flex is awesome.  When you get it, check to make sure that there is a seal on the bottom of the box that has a symbol that looks like a Flex on it.  The first one that I ordered did not have that seal, and didn't work right.  After I got the replacement I noticed that there was a seal on it, and that the first one had been used prior to me getting get.  The replacement has been working just fine.  The app for smartphones is really easy to use and very handy, but the best way to change settings on the device is to plug it into your computer.  I have found that I get a better sleep summary with the Flex on sensitive instead of the regular.  There have been a few times, that the vibration from pushing a shopping cart, or driving on a very rough road has put my tracker into sleep mode.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love this thing.  Gives me the motivation I need to get those 10,000 steps in a day.  Love the silent alarm and have it set to wake me in the morning and to remind me that it's time to get moving.  I was curious about the sleep tracking and it works wonderfully . . . who knew . . . I actually sleep way better than I thought.  The software is extremely easy to install and I can even challenge friends that have the device.  I did have some trouble with the wrist band but I contacted the company and they were extremely responsive and replaced my product within days.  There isn't a phone number for customer service but they will answer your email within a day or two.  Highly recommend this device for anyone needing that extra push to get motivated but doesn't want something too complicated to understand.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this about 2 years didn't use it frequently...it would not keep charge. In the end couldn't sync it. I heard they had good customer service where they replaced items. I explained my situation and they said it was because of the silent alarms and auto sync...well it has those extra features for a reason it's what makes it different from a pedometer right!? I none the less disabled everything...still died within hours last email within a week was it died right off the Chargers they said they couldn't do anything and could give me 20% off a new one!! I don't have money to throw around so this was an investment I expected to last a while...not so and customer service was not at all sympathetic after all they want to sell more so they probably don't last long so u have to buy a new one 😒

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit Flex.  Unfortunately, I am currently on my 6th.  I had a Fitbit One for more than a year - and wore it daily.  I upgraded to a flex about 3 years ago, and since then haven't had one last more than 6 months, some far less.  I even took a chance on the Charge at one point, but it failed too, so I am back to a Flex.I love the convenience of wearing it on my wrist. I love the app and the autosync with my phone.The "error" I keep having is the battery dies and they just stop charging - I sometimes can coax a few more days out of one by wiggling it around in the charger - but its a brief revival at best.I am addicted, so I am going to keep buying them :) but man do I wish they could improve the lifespan of these things.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit and would give it 5 stars if it had a different clasp. I've already lost one because it fell off in a crowd. I'm sure I just brushed it against my leg and the clasp came undone because that happened once before but that time I found it. This one I'm reviewing is my second one! This time I bought these little fastener rings so the clasp can't come undone. It should come with one! Other than that, I love it. It not only motivates me to get my steps in but I use it to track my sleep. I am a light sleeper and have awakened several times a night. I like to see that data and try to find out why I'm waking up so I can try to "fix" it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got my fitbit flex on Tuesday. LOVED it! But I got up this morning, and it's not working. At all. Has a full battery charge. I went to the website and have reset it several times per their suggestion. Nothing. It won't sync, track anything, it's not even lighting up. I sent an email and am waiting for some sort of response on how to fix it from fit bit's customer service. I went to the community blog posts, and it appears that many people have had the same issue over the last few days. I uninstalled the program and reinstalled it, restarted my computer, did everything that others have tried, and still nothing.I don't like that there isn't a customer service number that I can call for help. This device is expensive, and I'm extremely disappointed right now. Hope I can return it for a replacement. Love the idea, if it actually worked properly.
review_title: Loved it, but now it's not working, after only 5 days

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This little device is the best thing I've done for my own fitness and physical activities.  I love the Fitbit dashboard and tracking capabilities--buying into the Fitbit world is worth that alone.  The wristband itself is great.It holds a charge for 5 days or more.  I found that the low battery email/texts Fitbit sends are usually a little late -- my Fitbit seems to have slowed down and be really close to dead by the time that happens. I've taken to carrying the charger with me and checking the battery level manually on the dashboard and charging it before I get the notification.  An extra charger would be a great investment, but they're a little pricey for what you're getting.I love that it came with a Large and a Small wristband, because I ended up needing the small one.  Being able to sync with my phone is a really great feature too, because I keep the wireless syncing dongle at home.Note, though, that unlike the Fitbit One, the Fitbit Flex does not have an altimeter so you won't get floors climbed.  For me, this was a no-brainer trade-off because I like the security of having it on my wrist -- I won't accidentally wash it, I won't accidentally drop it, and it's easy to have it with me all the time.  I don't care that much about altitude gain.I got the black band and it scuffs up a little.  Most of the scuffs wipe off with some water and a cloth though.Supposedly you can wear it in the shower, but I haven't been bold enough to try it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Product is good customer service of fitbit is awful!  Let's start with the product first, I have had numberous fitbit products.  The fitbit flex is so easy to wear, I don't ruin it in the washer/dryer like I did countless fitbit one's, and seems pretty accurate.  It is also water resistant which is awesome.  The downside is definitely the screen or lack of screen.  You can only see what percentage of your goal you have reached same with battery life.  The fitbit one had a great screen of info and let you know battery life, however the one I constantly left attached to clothing and either didn't have it with me the next day or put it through the washer/dryer.Lastly my fitbit flex broke 1 month into owning it, the plastic snapped.  I have been unable to get through to customer service and the only way fitbit will talk to you is through email.  This customer service is unacceptable and why I won't buy anymore of their products.I would give this product a 3 or 4 star but the customer service makes it a 1 or 2 star.
review_title: fitbit flex good product, missing key info, awful customer service

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is not at all accurate. It's supposed to track sleep, but I know for a fact it's never right on that.  If it's so bad with sleep tracking then I seriously doubt it is right with tracking steps.  In fact, it does mine the same no matter if I'm walking around the house or going up and down the stairs, doesn't matter...  The only good thing about it is the silent alarm, I love that but who wants to pay $100 for an alarm when a cell phone has all the alarms you could ever need.  I've learned a hard lesson about ordering things like this, just be sure you know what your doing before buying this product.  I'd say give it a few years to be perfected.  I do NOT recommend this product.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love it! Wear it everyday since it arrived. Works great. Has made managing my fitness level much easier and has helped to motivate me to step more and keep more active. Love the challenges on the app against my friends to motivate me even more. I absolutely live by it now. For someone who works all day long at a desk, and can go through an entire day with little movement, it helps me to gauge my movement and create achievable goals for myself. If I know what goal is reachable I make sure to step more in elevator, go for an extra walk to grab a water, etc. I know what's possible within my normal schedule, so the days I'm below my average I 'step it up' literally!!! It's been an asset to my life and a great motivator!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great supplement to monitoring exercise and sleep patterns.  The downloadable software is very functional and easy to use.  No supplied user manual but online instructions are fine.Would give it 5 stars but the clasp for the bracelet takes some getting used to (and practice!).  If you are not careful it will not be secure (this is probably why some people say it falls off their wrist while running and they lose it).  This could be easily solved if the manufacturer would include a band around the outside where the clasp is latched to give a "guide" to latching it.
review_title: Great supplement to monitoring exercise and sleep patterns

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The hardware works, it is waterproof and it syncs to my phone and computer.The tangerine is not a good color though. It wears and tears really quickly. i wore mine for 3 days and it looked like I'd had it on for months. Now 2 weeks later? I can barely see my dots light up, it's so scratched. I'm not even doing anything crazy with it. I'm going to have to buy another color, probably black. This is basically a glorified pedometer. I think it would be so awesome if they can integrate a heart monitor into this. Because if you don't run for exercise, I feel like your active minutes and calories out aren't completely accurate. I also really wish you could track progress on macros on the app. The whole calories in vs calories out mentality is outdated- we all know now that all calories are not created equal. Tracking just my calories really does nothing for me. I also think there needs to be a difference between tracking your overall calories out, including just breathing, sitting like it does, and your exercise time. I may burn 1,000 calories sitting at my desk, but that shouldn't be included in my eating calorie budget. I've continued to use MyPlate/Living Social to track my food and exercise instead of the Fitbit app, it seems to be more accurate and I can track my macros (carbs, fat, protein). It's annoying having to use two apps though. The sleep tracking is neat to look at, but I don't think it's accurate. I don't know how it could be- can you not move your arm when sleeping and still be sleeping? According to mine I only get about 2 hours of true sleep every night, and I know this is not true. Again, a heart monitor would be more beneficial.The alarm feature is nice though. All in all, I think this is a fad product. But we knew all knew that. I bought it, because I was curious how much I move every day after moving downtown and getting rid of my car. All in all, I don't really find it anymore helpful in my fit journey than my $10 pedometer and MyPlate or MyWalk apps.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I haven't even had the device 6 months and the charger no longer locks in ace to charge,  and the device does not keep day and night right,  and it does not start over at midnight and gets steps per day all Confused.  I paid $100 and can not even return it because they give u a 30 day window because they know it's a piece of crap! This is my second one.. I even gave it another try! And still had issues. , ZERO STARS

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit! It was super easy to set up right out of the box. Unlike others, I've never had an issue with it syncing. The wristband is tricky to get on the first 1 or 2 times, but after that it loosens up and is super easy to get on or off. It counts my steps very accurately. It's comfortable to sleep with if you're interested in sleep tracking (I feel it accurately tracks my sleep, also). It's fun watching your progress and how active you are throughout your day. Doing challenges with your friends & family is also a really good way to keep you motivated.The Fitbit Flex is very basic, but for my needs it's perfect. I would recommend to anyone.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this to replace my Fitbit One because it is somewhat waterproof (gives you insight into the demise of the previous 2 I'd had) and while I like wearing it on my wrist, it is hard to close and keep closed unless you purchase the little thingies to hold it in place.  In addition, I liked the readout my Fitbit One gave me of everything separately.  The Flex just lights and blinks so while you know you've accomplished some of your goal (it lights for every 20% cached then blinks if you have accomplished any portion of the next percentage) you have no idea if you are close or far away to that next percentage light.  And you don't know which goal you are working toward - maybe steps, maybe calories, I'm not sure.  You can always look online at the Dashboard but what a pain. I ride a bike quite a bit and today after a 45 minute ride, I made sure it synced with my computer.  It indicated I'd met my goal 100%, then "blinked" the sleep mode a couple of time and I realized it probably had jarred itself into and out of sleep mode more than a couple of times because the Dashboard indicated I'd only gained a total of 3,043 steps and had 3 active minutes.  Hmmmmm!  I'm going to return it and get the Fitbit One (again!).  It's cheaper, also counts stairs and is easier to wear and doesn't jar.  I'll just have to make sure this one doesn't get a bath.  My bad anyway.
review_title: Flex is nice but has drawbacks.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm really happy with the Fitbit Flex.  The silent alarm feature is fantastic.  I also use the exercise tracking and logging functions.  The only reason I haven't given it five stars is that the hardware is just not very robust.  This is the sixth flex I have owned.  I dropped number five accidentally into water and it died, which was completely my fault.  The previous four all just stopped working at some point for no reason.  They were all replaced as defective hardware, so kudos to Fitbit for their service, but it would be nice if the hardware lasted longer.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: i found all that i want in this product, excellent monitor of my daily activity and sleep, excellent battery life about 5 days, easy to sync with my pc, maybe the only thing that is not perfect is the touch response, maybe the manufacturer need to improve the online user manual because in the manual said only two quickly touches to switch sleep mode, in the real world i need to touch more than two times to switch between sleep and normal mode. I think is excellent that the manufacturer includes to bands one small and one large, at the beginning i had some troubles trying to fasten the band but after few days that became easy.UpdateAfter 6 months the tracker stops to work, very bad quality, please take care with this tracker, don't waste your money, please think two times before purchase this activity tracker!!!!
review_title: I love this band but poor quality, dont waste your money!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The first FitBit I bought had problems, as others have mentioned so be prepared to get a replacement. I also bought a warranty with this product.Pros:-Attractive and discreet-Accurately tracks steps-AMAZING online program, where you log your food and activities-Cons:-I had to get an extra clasp because it's fairly easy for it to come undone and get lost-I guess this is a good thing, but it's extra sensitive to vibrations. Pushing a grocery cart causes it to go into "sleep mode" so I have to tap it back and forth to my activity modeIf this one craps out on me, I'll definitely get a replacement. I paid the $50 to get the deluxe online tracking program, which is totally worth it. You can track custom things; I do my alcohol intake, and see your eating/activity patterns.
review_title: Not perfect, but an awesome tool!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It is the end of my second week of wearing constantly, and so far everything is working perfectly and is as advertised. I especially love the sleep-tracking feature. I can certainly tell the difference in my sleep quality on the nights my cat decides to sleep with me! I have had no issues so far with any of the functions, so hopefully that will continue to be the case. I use a stationary bike and have found that if I tape the device (or tie it with a twist-tie) around my ankle it will count my pedal turns as steps, although it does not seem to add those steps into the miles traveled calculation. (Which is okay with me, as it is not advertised to track biking activity anyway). I have also owned a Striiv pedometer for over a year and love it also, for different reasons. Except for tracking steps, the Striiv does different things in different ways than the Fitbit Flex and is a totally different product concept, so to compare them as to which is "better" would be unfair to both products. They are both excellent in my opinion. Anyway... if you are thinking of purchasing a Fitbit Flex, I think you will love it! Oh, except maybe for the backorder time which still seems to be 4 to 6 weeks, and it was also the same if trying to order from the Fitbit website. My order on Amazon was 4 weeks to delivery, but I'm glad I waited it out.p.s. Some reviewers have mentioned that the band is hard to fasten, and it is... but I have found that if I line up the fasteners and just push them hard against the back of my wrist with my thumb that it is much easier than trying to squeeze them shut with your thumb and first finger as stated in the instructions. It took me a couple of days to figure this out!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: so it defaults to 10000 steps, you think ok, i can do this.  So I was so excited to have this thing, once i got it all set up the very first thing i did was fun 1 mile, and do 30 minutes of intense Ruthless training.  I did it with a heart rate monitor on to see how the two different in tracking data.  This stupid thing gave me credit for running 1.6 miles in 18 min.  and only burning 170 calories, my heart rate monitor gave me credit for 600 calories.  At the end of the day, i didn't even have 3000 steps.  This think makes you feel depressed.  ITS ALL HYPE DON'T BUY IT.  AND YES…ITS SET UP CORRECTLY.
review_title: all hype don't buy it…seeking a refund

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Finally bought a Fitbit after going back and forth between the flex and HR version.  I just want to track steps, calories, and water so I went with the Flex.  I love it.  It was a breeze to set up and the app is so user friendly.  The app also syncs with MyFitnessPal so I only have to enter my food once.  It doesn't know HR so you just manually put in exercise which is not a huge deal for me.  I don't want to be a body builder, just being more active and health conscious as I tone up.  I can compete with friends on the app but mostly I compete with myself thinking of new ways to reach 10,000 steps.  It motivates me to see the steps and calories being tracked.  If I'm tired I check my steps and reaching that goal keeps me going.  I also love the sleep tracking.  I didn't realize how many times I wake up each night.  This wouldn't be good for a seasoned athlete but for the person who wants to be more accountable and active, it's perfect.
review_title: I love it. It was a breeze to set up ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Good idea, too many setbacks though.I really really wanted to love this, it just didn't work out for me. I have had it for a little over 3 weeks and it has already broke. The advertised battery life is about 5 days. It was doing that, but this past week I've had to charge it every 2-3 days. Not a huge deal, but annoying. Now it will randomly turn on sleep mode during the day. Last, I don't feel it is that accurate. So far it said my most active day was a day that I was sitting around in various doctor offices with my kiddo, so I'm not sure if it was tracking my movement by me lifting and putting down my child? But I know I definitely wasn't moving around much.Bottom line, way overpriced when it doesn't seem to accurately count your steps and the charging/sleep issues. Plus after only 3 weeks, and $100? Not happy with this purchase.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This thing really does help me to remember to get up off my butt at work. It's right there on my wrist-I see it and I think oh I should get up-I've been sitting here too long. I like that you can see your activity in chart form. I think the software and Internet interface are great. No complaints, in fact, pleasantly surprised by how good it is (I had emailed the company a few times about availability and frankly their customer service left a lot to be desired-not user friendly and even returns are overly cumbersome).So the only drawback I can see is that I find it too annoying to wear when I sleep. Which was a large part of what I was looking forward to using-especially the silent alarm and tracking of sleep patterns. However, maybe I'm extra sensitive and it might not bother other folks. So don't write that off on my say so.I like it and I would recommend it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got a Fitbit Ultra in August 2012 and loved being able to track my steps, sleeps and floor in the same place as my weight and food. I'm a definitely a nerd and this appealed to me. I loved the Ultra and over the next year to year and a half, I probably missed wearing it only a handful of days. Then it pulled a vanishing act between my apartment and the bus stop. After failing to find it, I ordered the Flex.The pluses (compared to the Ultra or the One or Zip):I like that the Flex has a wrist band --- it isn't going to pull a vanishing act like my Ultra did, or at the very least I would hopefully notice sooner.I had problems with the wrist band for sleep tracking coming undone during the night and the Velcro losing its stick over time with the Ultra.It is easier to keep on as I wear it on my wrist and it is waterproof. When I forgot to wear the Ultra, it was almost always because I forgot it put it back on after a shower or in the morning rushing out the door.Cons:It doesn't track stairs. I was really disappointed when I got it and found that out as I really liked the stairs metric and badges.It doesn't have a useful display. You get 1-5 lights on the display instead of a readout like the other models. I think this was simply due to the small size of the Flex compared to the other models as the Force (now discontinued) shows the data. It doesn't matter much for me, I normally would look at the data online, but having something on my wrist and not being able to get the time out of it is frustrating at times. But this is a really small "frustration."It is less "discrete" than the One/Ultra/Zip. It doesn't look bad but it is out-of-place with more formal outfits. The One/Ultra/Zip could be discretely tucked into the pocket or a bra strap and be nearly entirely invisible.If you are willing to pay the little extra, the Flex makes a great tracker for a forgetful person. It is also a good tracker for the "loss adverse" (like I was after losing my Ultra). Depending on your lifestyle, needs and memory, the One/Zip-style trackers may be better choices.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really like the FitBit. It is the perfect activity tracker if you are a walker, like me.The FitBit website that you use in conjunction with the activity tracker is great. It's fun and easy to use, if you are honest about what you eat, you can easily see how your calories out is matching up to your calories in.I'm just a pregnant lady who is not exactly trying to lose weight, and yes, there is a pregnant lady setting, I'm just trying to keep my weight in check and not let it runaway from me with out realizing it. So the food log and activity tracking has really helped me maintain my weight staying check.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love the color and fit. The one issue I had was with a days worth of steps changing from 13000 down to 1600. Contacted the company and steps to fix the issue were given. Customer service responded quickly and were very helpful. Since purchasing this product, I do wish that the battery life was a bit longer. I don't have to charge it a lot, but since you have to take it off to charge I sometimes forget to put it back on in the morning and lose all my steps until I am able to get back home.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I would highly recommend against the Fitbit Flex. It does not deliver what it markets. First, because it tracks only hand/arm movements, it is grossly inaccurate as an activity tracker.  You can literally stand still in the kitchen chopping veggies and rack up huge activity "steps." Second, it markets itself as calculating calories burned and then has the nerve to report how many calories you have left to consume for the day--you guessed it, based on grossly inaccurate activity results.  Not only is it not capable of calculating calories burned with any accuracy, whatsoever, how much harm could it be doing by recommending that you consume ever increasing amounts of calories, based on the overestimation of activity?? (Why would you want to consume additonal calories burned, anyway?) Finally, it cannot and does not at all track or monitor your sleep. It tracks the movement of your hand or arm during the time that it is activated in sleep mode. No movement does not indicate sleep, just as movement does not indicate the absence of sleep. So, this is a total waste of money.I'll give an example of results.  I used the Flex during a walk(1 min)/run (1 min) exercise activity for 60 mins and 3.3 miles. Since it does not calcuate any idividual activities, but only gives cummulative data, I wrote down the calories burned before and after the activity, performing highly advanced mathematics to subtract and come up with the difference as calories burned.  It told me that I had burned over 800 calories. Great news!! 800 MORE calories to eat that day! When I work out really hard on my AMT for 60 mins at level 10, the machine and my Garmin+heart rate monitor (and earlier my Polar+heart rate monitor) tell me that I am extremely lucky to get to 600 calories burned. So, how nice that I can go out for a gentle walk/jog and burn so many more calories than I would having to actually work hard on the machine! Suspicious, I bought the Garmin+heart rate monitor and did a test.  I used the Garmin+heart rate monitor to walk(1 min)/run (2 min) for the exact same route of 3.3 miles--guess what? Only 198 calories! Guess I will have to skip the double scoop ice cream sundae! Assuming most people want to get fit and/or lose weight, this gross inaccuracy, combined with the incredibly irresponsible suggestion to increase calorie intake based on it, make this not only a waste of money but a danger to people in making health and consumption decisions.
review_title: Fitbit Flex very misleading! Don't buy!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I think if you think of this as a disposable tool of sorts, things are great.  The bands are definitely not designed to last long, esp. with true exercise (which is fine given the industry baseline and alternatives) and the charging mechanism is still quite unreliable - without the workarounds you'll find online to maintain proper contact between the pebble unit and the contacts.That said, I love the overall solution and tracking support and am on my third unit.In terms of accuracy, I find them conservative in terms of counting less steps vs. an iPhone and an Omron (proper pedometer) - which is fine in my book.
review_title: Great solution if you keep your expectations in check....

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Not a fan.  Maybe I'm weird but I had a very unusual reaction to the Fitbit.  I was excited to receive this item and charged it right away.  I wore it the day after I received it and I felt sick to my stomach.  I didn't blame it on the Fitbit and continued to wear it.  After 5 days of being nauseous everyday I took the Fitbit off, the next day I felt fine.  I googled radio frequency side affects and nausea is one of them.  I was surprised that I was affected by this as I have 3 laptops with wifi, 4 iPhones in my house and Bluetooth in my car but I simply cannot wear this device.  To make sure my nausea wasn't a fluke I wore the Fitbit once more, within 4 hours I was feeling sick again.  This device obviously just isn't for me.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great motivator and activity tracker without spending a lot. Can be addicting: "Gotta walk/run/calisthenics before I go to bed so I get my 10,000 steps in today". Doesn't feature readout of monitored activity, just a series of 5 indicator lights that progress in 20% increments until you reach the 10,000 step goal with all 5 lighted. But at less than half the price, I can use my computer or phone to see the actual numbers using the Bluetooth connection and free app. Good design, reasonable battery life (5-6 days).

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had the Flex since the end of May. By the end of June the band was noticeably cracking at the seam. By mid-August it fully snapped in half and thankfully fell apart and the pedometer fell out when I was at home and not on the street. I contacted their customer support and they offered to send me a replacement band which is really nice. But while i was waiting for the replacement my Flex then stopped holding a charge. I would let it charge overnight and it would only record for about 90 mins. After some very prompt responses and suggestions from their customer service they are sending me a replacement. So until this all happened I would say I really liked the Flex but would probably have a better experience if i had one of the few android phones that it could sync with and didn't have to rely on my computer and the dongle (which also broke but that one was totally my fault).
review_title: fitbit has great customer service ...and you might need it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This little thing is awesome. It keeps track of so much, steps, active minutes, calories and so much more. It can fully keep track of your body's information if feel like entering your weight, food, and water either with the desktop or mobile app. The silent alarm works, and the sleep mode stats are also very cool. I use it almost every single day and the calorie goals and step counters help me keep my weight goals.Pros: Can keep track of everything, if you keep entering it.Silent vibrating alarms actually wake me up.The badges make me want to get to the next level of use.The weekly reports of activity are a nice way to see your data.The desktop app is easy to use and interpret your data.Keeping the stats makes me hate the days I forget to wear it.Cons:I wish more Android Devices were supported: currently only some newer Samsung devices.I wish there was an easier way to check the battery using the actual device, not through the app (desktop/mobile.)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm really enjoying my Fitbit with sleep band. Sometimes it gets annoying being on my wrist all the time, but I'm gratified to know that I'm sleeping a lot better than I thought I was. The unit is very easy to use and if I have any problems with it, it's my own fault (I don't "put it to sleep" at night or forget to wake it up, etc.). If I see a light flashing quickly sometimes I'll jump up to do the stairs a couple more times to get some additional steps in and go to the next level. I also found out that during Dragoncon I walked over seven miles a day! We don't call it "the Dragoncon exercise program" for nothing.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It is a great product but it does have its drawbacks.  It randomly will go into sleep mode for some reason while I am out on walks.  This happens for both myself and my husband so it is not isolated to just my fitbit.  My husband has a very hard time getting his out of sleep mode so he doesn't use his to track his sleep any longer.  it just wasn't worth it to him.  It literally would keep him in sleep mode all day long yet still track his steps and activity level.  Other than that the fitbit is a great activity tracker.  I had to mess around with my stride for about a week to get it to be as close to accurate as possible and now that I have that it works well to track my steps and my miles on my morning walks.  I think it was a good purchase overall.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have never used a fitness tracker before but I have been using fitness logs for several months. The Flex is a great tool that adds to the information I already log. It took me about an hour to fully get used to the layout of the fitbit website but I like the service.I've had the product for a week and still haven't had to recharge the device, so the battery is definitely on the higher end of 5-7 days for me. I don't have a compatible mobile device for syncing, but I use my computer often enough that the Flex syncs automatically with the included USB wart that I find I don't even need to manually sync at all. The mobile app works well for me. I don't get real-time updates because as I mentioned before I don't have a new enough device for syncing, but it does provide a convenient way to track diet and additional exercise on the go.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've really enjoyed my Fitbit Flex so far. I've read the good and bad reviews, and while it may not live up to everything Fitbit implies, it's a quite useful device. I like the visual aspect and being able to keep up with it during the day. I've tried all sorts of calorie monitors, but this is the first that has been easy and intuitive for me to follow and stick with it. The other thing that has been helpful for me is the sleep tracking. My husband has always picked on me about needing so much more sleep than he does, well, I'm seeing why. I'm in bed for eight or nine hours, but only in what Fitbit considers deep sleep about four hours. It may not be able to really analyze your sleep thoroughly, but it's telling information nonetheless. I'm sure better tech will be forthcoming for those willing to wait, but I'll still recommend the Flex if you want something in the meantime.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Updated review from two to four stars as FitBit sent me a new Flex.  Although I'd have preferred a replacement Force, I understand that the product is no longer available.  I requested a replacement Flex band, but FitBit a completely new Flex which shows responsive customer service.-----------------------------This review is for the Fitbit Flex, but also includes a recap of my overall experience with Fitbit as a company.I have been a big supporter of Fitbit products, owning a Force, Flex, Aria and the original Ultra.I purchased the Flex and used it for several months, until the wristband broke.  I ordered a replacement (large black) wristband from the Fitbit store, waited over three months, but it never shipped.  The lack of an altimeter was also disappointing after using the Ultra.  What was even more disappointing was the announcement of the Force, coming just months after I invested in the Flex.  The Force included an altimeter and a much needed display.I bit the bullet and purchased a Fitbit Force in late December.  I returned home after a workout last weekend to find that my Force was gone from my wrist. Apparently the clasp design is not quite secure enough, and the tracker came off during my workout.  After contacting Fitbit customer service, I was told they "have no way to determine the manufacturing defect of the Force's wristband".  I am among many who have reported issues with the design of the Force wristband clasp.So, now I am back to using my old Flex, with a wristband currently held together by scotch tape.  Even if I wanted to purchase a replacement Force, I cannot as it's been taken off the market due to a small percentage of users reporting a skin rash from the band.  - A once loyal, now disappointed, heavily invested Fitbit customer
review_title: No altimeter, replacement parts not available, poorly engineered wristband and clasp

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have owned the fitbit flex for about a year. For the first few months it was kind of a " toy ". I just kind of played around with it. Then April 1st my weight was fast approaching 300 lbs. I am a 53 year old female. It was my wake up call. I started a resonable portion control diet. Almost hate tosay " diet ", as it really is a life stile change. The fitbit has been very accurate with my caloriesburned.  And putting the food in as I eat makesme much more aware of what I am eating. It is so accurate , that when fitbit sends the weeklyactivity report, I do the math. I subtract calorie consumed from the calories burned. I thendevide by 3500 ( for a pound ) and it is exactly what I have lost for that week. I have lost 60lbs, and I believe the fitbit flex has been a very large part of that. When I reach my goal weight,  I will use it to help maintain the weight.The hospital that I work at has just made over 1000 of the available to employees at a third off, just to help encourage weight loss.This my first review I hsve ever written on Amazon.  But I do encourage people to get one, and use it. I have not used sny other ki d of one so I can not compare as others have. But if it ain't broke...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fitbit and I love fitbit customer service so four stars because the device ... I'm on my third. Fitbit has replaced two after suggested fixes couldn't get it working. Both times, it stopped taking a charge. I haven't touched lightning, I didn't go deep sea diving. Just stopped.However, it's under warranty and once I've worked through the possible fix, they've sent me a replacement no problem. But if this one dies, I may give up.The unit, though, does what I want. It tracks my walking/steps. When I run, I use it with RunKeeper to cross-check mileage/pace. I think it's not as accurate as RunKeeper, but pretty good. I've used it to track my food and water. I especially like the water feature because I do not drink enough during the day.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Purchased for my wife and she is now obsessed with 10K steps per day.  She even has me out on extra walks.  Application needs time to sync current step counts and will help drain battery on phone if you not careful about the update to frequently.  Seems to be a hit in our house.  Opted for the basic fitbit flex over the bigger bulkier models and that seems to have been a good choice for us.  You do need to wear it to have it record your activity, which only make sense.  This is now a second item on her wrist.  Oh the joy she gets when it rings and flashes to confirm 10K steps have been reached.  Many more activities can be tracked but we are just simple users of the pedometer.
review_title: Opted for the basic fitbit flex over the bigger bulkier models and that seems to have been a good choice for us

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got one because my husband was getting one just not this one.  I liked it at first although I don't think its really accurate especially on the sleeping. Alas I haven't worn a watch in years or bracelets because they are in my way when typing and didn't like wearing something while sleeping so I got over it and now just don't use it.
review_title: I didn't care for this kind of band.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am so disappointed in my Fitbit Flex. The two original wristbands have broken. Now it will not sync or charge and I am looking at putting out more money to make it work,When it works it is great. I was up to 10k steps for 4 straight days and thought I was on my way. Now I am not able to use it at all. Very. Very, very, unhappy. Did not abuse it. Already have had to spend money on more bands and now I have no idea what it will cost to get it going again. Tried all the reset methods.:(lUpdate 6.1.14: managed to get it going again using a different charger. Will see what happens in 5 days when I charge it again. Working. For now. Will provide update.I just bought a new one after 2 years with the old one. The clasp on this is awful. Wore it for one week and today while on a 3 mile walk with the dogs it fell off. Support helped me out with a find your Bluetooth app (free). Found in less than 10 minutes. Clasps are very flimsy.
review_title: Not working and it has only been since April 15. UPDATED 6.1.14

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Im obsessed with this little thing. Simple but so effective. Tracks my steps, my sleep movements and allows me to record my food intake as well online. I love the discreet size but wish it had some of the other features that the larger sized Bits have like the GPS which tracks your elevation and distance. It will only keep track of your daily movement, not the location. So if you go on a multi-day hiking trip and dont have the knowledge of how far you hiked and the ability to download daily, it will not keep track of the total trip. Only the last 24 hours. Alas I will never know how many miles I hiked in Yellowstone this summer.
review_title: Great for the mall or recreational walker.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This nifty little device is exactly what I needed.1) It allows me to ballpark my calorie burn throughout the day.  I have found the calories burned for run/walking activities are in line with what my heart rate monitor would tell me.  For other kinds of activities - aerobics, weigh training, I like that I can add the calorie expenditure manually.2) I used to swear by calorie counting, but knowing my steps are being counted is extremely motivating for me.  I find myself more motivated to squeeze in a run or brisk walk, even if it's only for 10 minutes.  Anything to get closer to my step goal!3) the food log is wonderful.  I know there are a million apps to track calorie consumption, but the fact that I have everything I need in one app/website is fantastic.I can't say enough about this device.  If you are someone like me who knows WHAT you should be doing, but just needs a little extra motivation to work a little harder and eat a little less, then this device might be for you!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love using my Fitbit, particularly to sync with MyFitnessPal (app) that helps me track calories. My wife has one and I like to compete with her (a teacher) to see who gets the most steps in the day. I appreciate that it's as high tech (using apps) or low tech (looking at the led light dots) as you want to track your progress.My reason for 4/5 is that the band recently fell off on a short hike in a national park and the whole unit was nowhere to be found. Very disappointed, and I reordered a new Fitbit flex and a watchband style this time around to keep the darn thing on my wrist. Overall a great tool.
review_title: Great tool, band falls off easily

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have used the Fitbit Flex for about 1.5 weeks now and I love the way I've been motivated to stick to my diet, strive a little harder for some more steps, calories burned each day, etc.  I log my food, weight, blood pressure, allergies, mood, etc. via the Fitbit website, and I find that I think twice about having something unhealthy when I know I have to journal it later.  And by logging/journaling, particularly food, I have started seeing that on days I felt like I had eaten lightly and healthy, the calories for this snack or that extra helping of something adds up really quick.Cons that keep me from giving it 5 stars: - doesn't detect/track heart rate - you have to use something else and then log it - doesn't seem to recognize intensity of effort for recumbent exercise bikes - water does get into the band cavity where the Fitbit tracker is inserted, but when I'm logging (easier on computer if you're adding new foods), I take the opportunity to remove the fitbit tracker to charge it and use a Q-tip to clean out the cavity.Overall, I love it!  Very worthwhile investment in my health.
review_title: Fitbit Helps Me Keep My Resolve!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Excellent product and customer service.  Had to replace the band once, but was hassle-free.  Need special rubber bands to keep clasp shut and to keep tight in charger, but were cheaply available on Amazon , like these: MEMO Athletics Silicone Fasteners for Fitbit Charge HR Fitbit Charge and Fitbit Force Wristband (10 Pack).Looking for something to read on your Kindle while walking to meet your fitbit step goal?  I recommend the following, available exclusively on Amazon: Trickster's Thunder (Trickster Chronicles Book 1).  It will keep you walking for a while.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought the fitbit flex after asking people who used it and tried it out. Technically wanted it for exercise tracking, i exercise at least 1 hour per day using a treadmill. First it doesn't track actual steps, if you are wearing it and keep moving your wrist it will keep counting steps even when you are sitting at your desk! if you use a treadmill or elliptical its useless in that case. I like the design of it, but the technology is not there yet where i would like it to be, i think i will try the apple watch since it uses 3 different tracking technologies and see how accurate it is although its a watch and not specifically a fitness band. I hope apple comes out with a specific fitness band one day!
review_title: if you use a treadmill or elliptical its useless in that case

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I give the Fitbit Flex a 2 star review for one reason and one reason only. First off, let me say that this product is great (when it works). I found it to be very accurate and I thought it was great that you can literally count every calorie that your body intakes. Whether you go out and you can look it up through their app or enter it in manually. The sleep aspect of it is really great too. Always wonder why sometimes you slept better than some nights? The Fitbit Flex tells you if you were either restless, asleep or awake and for how long. Great tracking of everything. The big and major downfall to this product was the lack of the ability to stay synced to my cell phone. My android is brand new this year so I know it isn't the phone. Every few hours I would check to see where I stood on my goals and I would discover that it hadn't synced to my phone in the last several hours so it didn't count anything that I had done. I grew tired of constantly having to check to make sure it was synced. When I first discovered that it was not syncing often I would just plug it back into the charger and just reset it. Eventually I grew tired of that because it happened more often and closer together. Now the Fitbit doesn't even hold a charge and can't sync at all to my phone.
