So if they could get their product to work then it's great!
review_title: It'd be great if it worked

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got it as a gift, but ended up returning it. It was not very useful, and for the price, got a pebble smart watch and it does all of this and way more stuff.  The band was hard to put on, and you have to take the whole thing apart just to charge the battery. Yes it is lite, and pretty small, but the battery did not last that long and the Android app was pretty poorly designed. Save your money and buy a pebble for $99. You will be soooo much happier, since it will do so much more than just fitness.  I now use my pebble with a $25 hart monitor strap and have a full HRM and daily weekly and monthly tracking.  Blows this away.
review_title: Don't make the mistake and buy this single use technology..

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had one of these for about 8 months, now.  This thing was a lot of fun to play with when I first got it.  I still wear it, but most of the time, do not take the time, to go into the website/app to enter my food intake, water intake, other activities, etc... anymore.Pros - Good tool for tracking your steps, exercise, calorie output, etc...  If you take the time to enter your daily info, can be a good tool for calorie intake, sleep patterns, etc..  Battery life is decent, about 4-5 days, easy to charge.  Get used to wearing it quickly(lightweight)Cons - I wish the display on the fitbit itself were easier to figure out(I believe they have update versions now, that are easier, and may also tell time, etc...)  Also you have to turn it on sleep mode when you go to bed, and turn it off when you get up in the morning.  Not a big deal, but I end up forgetting to take it out of sleep mode, til I am at work, and by that time, the sleep reading is not accurate. Also, not sure how accurate the step counter is(especially when you are carrying something and your arm is not swinging). When I am at an event where I am clapping, it often thinks I am trying to enter or leave sleep mode.  Overall, I still like it, but for $100 or whatever they go for now, make sure you find the version that is easy to use and does everything you want.
review_title: It does do what it says... kind of

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've been using the CalorieKing destop app for years. It works well, but they haven't figured out how to deal with mobile phones.  That's my benchmark.When I heard about FitBit, it sounded like a great next step.  What a disappointment.  It's basically a fancy pedometer, not much more.While the wristband is very good at counting steps and tracking sleep, the food database is laughable.  It appears to be only a fraction of what CalorieKing's database has.  Entering new foods is much more difficult and since their database is sparse, I have to do that a lot.The most maddening thing is that the clasp is extremely difficult to operate.What's good is that it gives interesting info on sleep and activity levels.In summary, it's not bad on tracking calories burned, lousy by comparison on tracking calories eaten.
review_title: Disappointing: Not the step up from CalorieKing I was looking for

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the fact that it tracks all activities, however the accuracy may not be very good. Both for tracking steps and for tracking sleep.I switched the settings online to wear it on my dominant hand so I could wear a watch on my non dominant hand and it the sleep tracker got all messed up recording most of my sleep as restless, switching it back to non dominant hand has an entirely different view of my sleep. Also sometimes I get up in the morning and check and I already have close to 50 steps even before I get out of bed. The food tracker is not the best either, but I have this hooked up with mapmyfitness which has a lot of food items on its list as well as the ability to scan barcodes of food items.Will continue using this for now as it fulfills its main purpose which is motivating me to meet my target fitness.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My biggest complaint is that I CANNOT fasten the wrist band.  I can't even get it to fasten when it is not on my wrist.  I find it to be impossibly difficult.The software although easy to download and sync is not intuitive.  I find tracking to be confusing....I have only managed to set the sleep tracker once out of 4 times correctly.I am planning to return this device.I am computer literate so it is not my lack of basic knowledge that is confounding me....

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was bought for my 11 year old daughter. She absolutely loves it, wears it everyday. She was able to use the small wrist band that came with it. The Fitbit has a great battery life and has held up well, the band is easily wiped clean and is durable with daily wear and tear. The app is easy to access and use, the instructions explain the dots that are featured on the screen well. Color is true to picture may be a little more blue in it but still comparable. I would recommend this Fitbit.
review_title: The Fitbit has a great battery life and has held up well

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really like my Fitbit Flex.  Have had it for about a month.  Here are some pros and cons:Pros:It really does help to motivate activity when you are tracking itIt has a sleep tracker, which may not be super reliable for medical purposes, but it is consistent.It is very comfortable, and much harder to lose than the pedometer I wore on my belt.It syncs to the online fitness tracker my company is usingYou can change the color of the band to match what you're wearingThe buzzer when you get to your goal is pretty cool and kind of funThe alarm function is pretty useful - it doesn't really wake me up, but if I'm thinking about getting up and just not moving, it reminds me that it's time to get upCons:I wish it had a watchI wish it gave the actual steps, instead of dots that tell me that I am somewhere in a range of 2,000 steps.The charger is proprietary.  When I lose it, I'm going to have to buy another one, but it would be preferable to be able to use my phone charger.It would be good if it could go longer without needing to be chargedIt will not sync to my smartphone (it's an older smartphone).  I have to have the dongle and a computer with an internet connection to read my steps.  One day, I logged 9,990 steps.  If I'd have known, I'd have gotten to 10,000 that day!Fitbit needs to come out with a "formal" band that would look right on more formal occasions, or at work.Overall, it's well worth the price and I am glad I bought one.  Hoping for some of the above-listed improvements in a future offering from Fitbit.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought the fitbit to track my cardio activity and sleep.  As far as activity it is supposed to measure intense workouts.  I do 40 minutes of cardio and 30 minutes of weight training for 4 days a week.  It does not measure very active minutes.  At most it credits me for 3 minutes of very active exercise.  I wrote to the company and they said you have to have forward movement.  Even on bike rides or hikes which have forward movement it doesn't track.  You have to manually override it.  Others I work with have encountered the same.  As for sleep it is really interesting to find the actual time spent sleeping vs restless and awake times with the fitbit.  I have insomnia and have had sleep issues for years.  I find it to be accurate with this tracking.  As for steps it is a great and more accurate pedometer than pedometers.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I did not like this at all and returned it for the fitbit charge and I am so happy that I made that decision. First of all, I don't know if I was just unlucky and got a fitbit that was not functioning properly but it was so confusing at first. I didn't know why the lights would randomly show up on the screen. I didn't like that the screen only shows the progress lights. I wish there was a watch or progress stats. Because there was no screen, to check stats, you have to go on your phone or computer and log into the fitbit app which was sort of obnoxious. With the fitbit charge I am able to see all my stats right on my wristband. Another think I disliked about the flex was that you had to manually put it into sleep mode. I was never able to do this when I was actually trying to go to sleep but if I was messing around with it during the day, it would work with no problem. Truthfully it was just a hassle and I am so glad I got the charge instead because it automatically senses when I have fallen asleep.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is a great entry point for getting into exercise tracking. It's simple, it's not imposing looking. It does the basic job.If you want more features like the ability to kick out a GPS path of where you ran or that kind of thing, you'll want to spend more on a higher end device.  But if you just want to track your daily number of steps, how far you traveled, how many kcals you burned, this is perfectly sufficient.Via the software you can also enter/track your food & water intake and manage your weight goals.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very bummed... I wear a Garmen Forerunner when I walk as well and it tracks my mileage as well.  I walk about 4 miles (4.2 today) and the Fitbit a Flex only recorded 3.2.  I have noticed when I connect to my iPad that the Fitbit doesn't even update the steps I am doing as I walk around.  It seems hit or miss so it is very frustrating.  My Fitbit One tracked better but I can't wear it on my wrist so I bought this one.  I hope to get a replacement from Fitbit when I contact them.  Very disappointed because my steps are the main thing I focus on.  I do like the features of keeping track of calories and sleep though.
review_title: This one is "hit or miss" in counting steps.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Early ReviewDay 2Short answer - Awesome...Early ovservationsPros> The Flex was easy to set up and use.> It syncs well with my PC and the Fitbit Dashboard easily synced to Myfittnesspal.> I did measure my stride and adjust that in the settings as my early readings were a bit off. After the adjustment I would say the accuracy is around 95%.> No issues putting in or bringing it out of sleep mode.> Also I have no idea why people complain about the wristband being difficult to use, mine went off and on easily.Cons... well more points of note really.> I'm not quite sure how accurate the sleep mode is. There were some.. "Nocturnal activities" I was woken up for after I set it to sleep mode which may account for the inaccuracies. I will update this in a later review.> If you want to sync directly to your phone or tablet make sure you know which devices are capable. I was well aware that my phone (Samsung Galaxy S2) and my table (Surface RT) would not sync. As I plan to replace my phone with the S4 which is capable, I am not that upset. I simply sync with my PC when I return home. To those that might complain about the supported phone sync issue there is a very good reason for this. May I suggest you research what (BLE) Bluetooth 4.0 Low energy protocol is. As for the lack of support with the Surface RT... well I blame fitbit on this one, RT is app driven so the setup program will not run on this OS.> In case you do not know, this is not a heart rate monitor. No one ever said it was.> In an aerobic exercise eg. P90X program it will track some movement but obviously not all of your caloric burn will be accounted for. If that is what you are looking for invest in a heart rate monitor. ...... ( See statement above )More to come...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had a flex for a couple of years and it was fine until it slowly stopped charging.  Cleaning the contacts worked for a while, but eventually it just stopped taking a charge altogether.  Disappointing, but at least I got a couple years out of it.  I ordered another one a few weeks ago.  There was enough of a charge on it to set it up, so I did that.  Then I plugged it into the charging cable.  The lights flashed, then nothing.  It won't charge.  Pressing on it so that it makes better contact with the cable helps, but I can't really do that all day while it charges.  Googling shows that this is a common problem and simply poor product design.  The compartment to hold the fitbit is too big to maintain pressure against the contacts.  Most people seem to deal with this by jamming a paper clip into the end of the adapter to apply enough pressure to keep the fitbit connected to the contacts so it charges. (There are plenty of YouTube videos demonstrating this.) That seems to work, but that's an unacceptable fix for a product just minutes out of the box.  It has apparently been a problem for years, but there don't seem to be any plans to fix it.  Very disappointing.
review_title: Charging problems right out of the box.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had 2 Fitbit flexes.  The first was replaced with no problem because it was under warranty.  The second (replacement) flex ended up getting broken by the app update. I updated the app on my phone and went to sync the flex and the next thing I know, the flex won't sync and it runs in a loop of a light moving up and down the strip. I tried to contact fitbit on four occasions.  The first was an email, to which I received a reply and gave a screenshot of my issue and all the troubleshooting I did.  I sent that back on Jan 12.  It's now the 24th and have yet to hear back from them.  Then, I called.  After dealing with someone who had no clue what they were talking about (just wanted to go from a script on troubleshooting steps), I explained I have done everything for troubleshooting and the flex is still not working,  I asked for a replacement.  I was offered 25% off another. I said no.  I want a replacement. Finally, she said ok.  That was on the 14th. When I didn't receive the email she promised or the replacement, I sent a chat request.  I spoke with 2 people in the chat, a lot of back and forth.  Basically I was told its not covered under warranty anymore, so I don't get a replacement.  I said that the flex was broken by their app update, it is not a warranty issue. They should cover it since their app is what broke my flex.  No go.  I asked for another manager to speak with. I was told that it would be a few days.  Worst customer service experience ever.** Flex-- the flex itself worked just fine but when it's broken, there's not much you can do to fix it.
review_title: Worst. Customer Service experience ever. Flex is ok, but once its done, its done.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Warning in case you didn't realize it, but this fitbit does not have a display on the band itself. It has lights to give you an indication of how close (or far) you are from your goals, but there is nothing to read on the piece itself. To see your actual progress, you have to have a smartphone that's compatible with the device, and then sync through it to see your progress. I had a fitbit ultra, so I assumed that the flex would have a display since the lower end model did. Even the zip has a display. I was surprised that anyone would really want an activity tracker that doesn't let you track your activity without syncing. The fitbit one is much better, and the force was even better since it did have a display...hope they bring it back after the nickle thing is fixed.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This gave me the push I needed to start losing weight and maintaining an active healthy lifestyle. It  is a fun and simple way to keep on track. Programming in my calorie intake took a bit of getting use to but became easier as I progressed. That is a MUST to do in the beginning at least until you become aware of your intake and requirements to reach your goal. I don't have to enter that anymore because I already developed a sense of portion and calorie control. If I find myself backsliding into bad habits, I will start entering everything again.My wife and I both have one and had no issues with them yet. I wear mine everywhere including the shower and it has held up without problems. I only take it off about once a week at night to charge.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased Fitbit flex on 5/8 and just missed the return window by 1 day after - should have done so the day my wife complained it did not work instead of giving it "another chance" to see if it would work.First of all, Fitbit Flex failed to track movements other than walking/running, such as cardio works.  She took a cross training class on 6/5 for an hour, it did not detect it at all: did not add active minutes or calorie counts. We thought it might be a one time glitch and decided to give it another shot.  She took another fitness barre class - came back panting and sweating.  But according to FitBit, nothing happened - no steps, no active minutes, and no calories.  That renders this product almost useless for most of the fitness activities that she does.Another incident happened earlier.  The active minutes tracking was not working on 6/1 after she ran a half marathon relay.  She opened a case.  After several days, it seems to start updating the active minutes - though no explanation was provided under the case at all after 2 weeks of "Our engineering team is investigating the root cause of this issue, and we are working on this matter to get solved as soon as we can."Needless to say, I am extremely disappointed with this product.  If I could give it no star, I would.  Guys, save yourself the trouble of buying this as a gift - unless you look forward to having troubles.
review_title: Not working - please do NOT buy this as a gift for your loved one, I have warned you!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This bracelet has exceeded my expectations! I LOVE it!! It keeps track of your steps, tells you how many steps and how that translates into miles, tells you how many calories burned, monitors your sleep, telling you how much you stir or wake in the night (I have discovered I am a restless sleeper!) There are so many features to this you would have to get one to see. The fun part is you can have it on your computer or your phone and monitor it wherever you are, Plus! friends who have it can be on your list and you can monitor their progress and have a friendly competition...making you want to do more! (always good to have someone to be accountable to!) I really recommend this to anyone who is thinking about getting just a regular pedometer...this goes above and beyond!
review_title: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Co-Worker had one and I was interested.  I bought mine and love it.  The ability to set a silent alarm that goes off on my wrist and actually wakes me up is pretty cool!  I have alarms set for during the day to go outside for recess duty!!  It is spot on with the times.  I generally go 3 days between charges even with my 7 daily alarms.  I have joined our 100 mile club at school and blew that out of the water in the first 25 days.  I have challenged myself with 100 miles or better every month.  So far in two months of wearing my Fitbit I have logged more that 250 miles.  The sleep tracking function is awesome!!  I can tell when the teenagers sneek into the house without having to really wake up.  I stir when they get home, and in the morning, I tell them I know they got home at 12:37 am.  They are soooo amazed that I can do that!!  My wishes for the Fitbit - Wish the watch (visible time) was available when I purchased it.  Wish I could create my own badges to celebrate my personal goals.  Other than those two things...can't say enough good about it.  I will be asking Santa for the Fitbit Force to make one of my wishes come true!!
review_title: You will be amazed at the # of steps you really do in a day!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got this while being skeptical with all the recent reviews and uploaded photos of this product . But I decided to get one too see what's the big deal.Upon getting it , there's just this little paper that tells you go on.But unfortunately , for me I had no idea what to do so I just look it up on YouTube to set mine up step by step and it works and still works from the time that I received it.I figure that if you're interested in this, just go for it.  Then from there you decide if you want to upgrade . So it's best to start with this if the others are way out your price budget.
review_title: Just look up in Youtube to get started with your fitbit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Sad to report this fitbit stopped working after only 5 months. So frustrating. Started flashing and not charging out of the blue. I emailed the seller but heard nothing back. I would not recommend buying this one unless you plan on purchasing at least 2 a year. Disappointed with the seller not returning my email inquiry. I don't know if I just got a dud or they all break after a few months. I had my last one for 7 months and the band broke and I lost it (not from this seller).
review_title: So far so good but I had one just like it before which ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It is a good gadget to get you motivated. It is accurate with the step counter. It is light weight and I barely notice it I even wear it in the shower. The only drawback really is that you have to remember to log your food and sometimes you aren't able to find the food that you are eating or maybe you aren't sure on the portion size so you might have to guess how many calories or if you are at work and don't have time to get on your phone to log the food you can go back and log it later but sometimes I forget. Another thing I didn't like is that the wrist bands aren't very durable, but they do sell replacement ones online. For me the band only lasted a month, but then again I am a mechanic so that is fairly understandable. If you are serious about getting into shape get one of these.Some of the really cool features are the sleep monitor,You can also set alarms.  It isn't bulky so you don't have to worry about unwanted attention from other people who ask a million questions(you know the type if you're an introvert like me but you could just get the one that tells time and say its a watch.) I like how the app is an easy way to track your weight and other stats and it recommends how many calories to take in if you want to meet your goals. It is easy to log your water,  the app has user friendly charts, and there are lots of support groups online. Another neat feature is that you can tell it to map your walk. there's a lot more you can tell it to do but that's what I do with it.Something that needs to be fixed is on the windows 8 app I wish there were a way to move around the icons. Like they have a huge emphasis on competing with your friends and it'll say like hey you are number one among your friends! and I'm like Hey that's great too bad I don't have any ftibit friends! or same deal when it tells you that you can lose more weight by competing with people. I'm considering friending people that I dont know but im skeptical......I also wish my fitbit flex monitered my heart rate but that doesnt really matter.
review_title: If you are serious about making a lifestyle change this is for you

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like being able to track my steps, calories and what time of day the activities occurred, the tracking of my sleep is not correct and sometimes switching from normal use to sleeping by tapping twice can be confusing. Not always sure if the Flex is actually in the sleep mode and tracking my sleep. Last night I went to bed at 11:00 p.m. and then woke up at 1:11 am, I did not get back to sleep until 4:48 am and then awoke again at 6:37 a.m.,then I fell back to sleep at 7:00 am and awoke again at 7:30am., when I Synced the wristband and logged on to my dashboard, after putting in that I went to bed at 11:00 p.m. and awoke 7:30 am, my Dashboard said I got 7 hours and 37 minutes sleep! In fact it was actually more 4+ hours of total sleep. So that is the only down side that I can see!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: First, this is a great tracking device idea.  Second, there may be other products out there that are better... I didn't do any research.  Having said that, it was promoted at my work so I thought I'd try it.  I had some credits in my Amazon account so I used them.  I love the calorie counting in vs. out according to my level of exercise.  The sleep tracking is cool too, but I'm not sure how accurate... But good enough.  Really like the alarm function; nice way to wake up.  For my third point, I must say I was highly disappointed when the battery didn't charge properly after only 3 weeks.  I contacted support through email and I was very impressed with response time and the suggestions leading up to reset.  Final analysis was: return it-it's not working.  When I learned all my data would be lost if I didn't sync the Flex within 24 hours, I panicked. I went to Best Buy as they extend a warranty for 2 years for an extra 15 bucks.  That was very acceptable for me as that way I could sync a new flex to my account and not lose data.  I'm wearing the new one and no problems so far... But it's only been 6 days.  No matter, I am sold on the product and am thinking about buying the scale FitBit offers.  I think I will, only with extended warranty, however.  Love my Fitbit!!  By the way, I just received my credit in Amazon... They gave me 30 days from date of purchase and with some extra speed and cost it arrived on exactly on the 30th day.  I'm satisfied with both Amazon and Fitbit... And Best Buy!
review_title: Fitbit Flex rocks... Why did I only give it 3 stars?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Faulty device and customer service was less than helpful. They sent me a charger after I specifically requested a replacement. Cheap company...Tried to fix my device for two weeks with these people. If you stick a pin in it to reset it device and the device still doesn't work...hello? Sleep tracker stopped working, then started working but did not store any data. Step tracker did the same, only the data was incorrect: steps, distance, and active times way off. Save a lot of time and frustration and buy another fitness device!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex is a pretty good activity tacker.  My beef is with the band which lasted less than a week.  When I bought a bunch of replacements they didn't last much longer.  I mean really, how good can the device be if you can't keep it on your wrist more than a week without having to buy a new band?  My second beef, is the sleep tracking which is inconvenient to record everyday, and even harder to correct  if you make an entry error (as far as I can tell after spending a fair amount of time trying to find the controls to do this).  Also, after collecting all that data you are presented with a chart you can barely see detail on.  Why not give the user a little more ability to analyse the data that is available???
review_title: poorly designed band, lousy sleep tracking

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: !I love my Fitbit!  It really helps to keep you motivated.  I find that I am always checking my steps for the day.  They have a great site where you can find others that will help give you that extra push and encouragement. I don't have a problem with the charge I can usually charge it once a week.  The sleep mode is pretty cool.  It shows you sleep pattern ie how many times you wake during the night.  It's nothing you can change but it's cool to see how well you are sleeping. There is also a place where you can keep track of the food you eat.  If you are looking to lose weight you can set a weight goal and it will calculate how many calories you can eat daily, you can log in the food and the calories adjust accordingly.  I would recommend it any one who wants help in keeping active and motivated!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit! It has made my weight loss efforts so much more fun. I work at Medieval Times Dallas and I can walk laps around the arena (inside the building where it is climate controlled.) About 9.5 laps is a mile. It is so nice because you put it on and forget about it. You can basically keep it on all the time - so it is no effort to keep up with your steps during the day. I also use the My Fitness Pal app and it syncs with it - so the exercise transfers straight into the dashboard of My Fitness Pal. It tracks steps, miles, energy level, number of minutes, and more. It also tracks how many hours you sleep at night and whether you sleep soundly or if you awaken or are restless during the night.It is worth every penny.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really liked my ONE fitbit but I lost it in a move. Many people at work have the flex so I thought I would try it. The first night, the band came off and was in my bed. Luckily my husband found it. The 2nd night, it came off while I was sleeping and unfortunately, my dog found it. It was chewed to heck. The strap is a poor design. It doesn't stay secure. I purchased a ONE again.
review_title: I really liked my ONE fitbit but I lost it in a ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So I have been wanting a device like this for a long time but I was skeptical that it would even work.  I bought this Fitbit and LOVE it!  I have been working on toning up and needed an extra push, this Fitbit gave it to me.  I never realized that I was so competitive.  I played sports growing up and loved being on a team, this Fitbit brought that fire back.  I compete with myself everyday on beating my steps from the day before and making my goal.  I am able to track what I eat, drink, and my activities.  The most interesting and eye opening thing is the sleep log.  I can see how many times I wake up and how long I slept.  That was a real eye opener!  This sure beats using a journal or an app.  I am so obsessed with this that my boyfriend became interested.  I bought him one for a gift and now we compete with each other.  If you are a person who logs your activities, a competitive person, or goal oriented this device is for you.I can't wait to get the Aria scale, I know that will help motivate me even more.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have mixed feelings about this.... first of all, my tracker worked reasonably well for 7 months. I stay reasonably well because you have to do a lot of resets and I had some connection issues with my bluetooth periodically. About month 7, my tractor started losing charge within the day, and within a couple of days it wouldn't last more than about an hour on a full charge. Definitely not worth $100 I paid for it. However, I contacted Fitbit customer support with this issue and they had me do a firmware update and were very responsive to my problems. The fitbit year warranty WILL be honored if purchaced and shipped through Amazon. (they are an authorized dealer) After the firmware update didn't resolve my issue, Fitbit sent me a brand new tracker free of charge. A+ customer service but but no way I'd repurchase. There is definitely a defect with this models battery life.
review_title: NOTE: Must be bought and shipped through Amazon for fitbit warranty to be valid.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The bad news: I bought one fitbit flex, it didn't work. I returned it and got a second, it worked fine but the clasp was difficult to close and it fell off my wrist within a week after I bought it. I bought a third flex. It works fine. Because the clasp is so difficult to close properly I rarely unclasp it. Several people have told me that their fitbits fail shortly after the return period. When you email customer service they try to be helpful but can't do too much. When you call customer service, although you speak with someone in a faraway land, they have been helpful. The good news: it's a great product when it works and motivates you to walk and walk and walk. If the one I currently have lasts long enough so that it's worth the $95 plus or minus, I would buy another when it conks out.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the fitbit as a general activity tracker.  I've been very pleased with the accuracy of the device and find that it has helped shaped healthier behaviors (2,000 steps short of my goal?  Better take a 15 min walk.). The accompanying software allows you to track activity over time,  quality of sleep, calories eaten vs. calories burned, etc.  I couldn't be happier with these aspects of the device.The wristband, on the other hand, is poorly designed.  It has fallen off multiple times and, because of its design, you don't really notice that it happened.  Fortunately someone else noticed that it happened in each case and brought my wayward device back to me.  That said, I keep the device in my pocket most of the time now which probably affects its accuracy.The primary problem with the wristband design, IMO, is that it doesn't have a positive locking mechanism.  Essentially it is "fastened" with a pressure fitting (you push two tabs through rubberized holes).  As a result, it doesn't take much pressure to pop these tabs out of their holes.  I see where some people have "Magyvered" solutions for this with a silicon plumbing washer...but frankly, I'm disappointed that such a solution is necessary.In summary...Software and functionality of the fitbit...4.5 stars (entering foods could be simplified)Wristband...0 starsGet one of the other non-wristband devices from fitbit.
review_title: Love the functionality but the wristband needs a complete redesign

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have found this to be a great motivational tool.  I enjoy the ability to join in challenges with others' it makes exercising fun.  I have used it every day to monitor my calorie intake, activity and weight loss.  When I bought it  March 10th it was $99, here it is June 21 and it no longer works.  I charged it overnight and it still won't sync.  I unpaired and went through the steps to pair but at the final step it will not respond to the tapping to make it vibrate,  IT IS DEAD!I called Fitbit customer service and they were very helpful.  They suggested I restart my charger and charge the tracker for 3-4 hours.  I tried this and it didn't work so I tried it another time before letting them know.  They are replacing my Fitbit Flex without any hassles!Great Customer Service!
review_title: I have found this to be a great motivational tool

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I thought this was ok at first. I thought being able to see my progress right on my wrist was inspiring me to move a little bit more. Boy was I wrong. This thing tracked everything I typed. No wonder I was getting 6-8k steps a day. My search continues.I do think it would be good (decent?) for those who do not have a desk job. If you naturally walk a lot if might track somewhat closely. But I would think they should be able to program it to know the difference between a step and a shake.
review_title: Maybe it would work well for a workout but not for daily activity use.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for my wife at Christmas and I also received one as a present as well.  My wife had lots of problems with hers.  It continually went into sleep mode, sometimes just by clapping her hands.  It stopped working altogether In Feb.I asked Amazon for a replacement, but I was outside of the 30 electronic return period.  To Amazon's credit, they sent me a new one and allowed me to return the un-functioning one.  Thanks Amazon!Yesterday, the fitbit I received as a present just up and died.  No lights, unable to connect to my account.  Nothing.  Not happy.  I did like it when it was working and may get a different model.  I wish it was more reliable for the price.  Too expensive for only 4 months of use.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have my FitBit Flex since March 2014. It quickly sparked my interest, as I am a competitive nature. I thought I was exercising a lot. Sure enough, when I started tracking what I was doing,  it did not look all that impressive- about 8,000 steps a day.I started pushing myself to 10K steps a day. Then I discovered the groups on the FitBit online platform- either city-based or interest-based, I joined a few and started competing with them. Before you know it, I was doing anywhere from 10K to 18-20K daily. On certain superactive days, such as shore boardwalk days, hikes etc I would get 30K+. Fun. Without focusing on any weight change, I lost about 12-13 lbs, without eating any differently, just from the increased exercise.I like the battery time of about 5 days and the fact that it's water resistant.I did not use the sleep tracking capabilities, as I sleep like a log most nights.The bad: poor quality. It breaks down without me doing anything to it. As of today, Jan 2015, I am on my 3rd FitBit in less than 1 year.The customer service always sent me the free replacement. The dialogue with them is rather slow, it takes them 2 days to respond to any kind of message.In case your are competing in any group, or doing a challenge, having the FitBit crash is a major inconvenience and a total downer. Your numbers will not be right and now you have to wait for the new month to compete again.To end on a positive note, it made a great impact on my fitness level and my health. I wish the product would stop breaking down.Apparently there is  no perfect product out there to do the job.So, good luck to you, maybe yours will be from a better batch.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my FitBit! It's super comfortable and after a few days I didn't even know I was wearing it. The interface for food tracking it easy. They app for the phone is easy to use. It's accurate and a great too to help you get fit or stay fit.I ordered the large band, and by the measurements on the website I thought it would be too small (8") or really cutting it close. When I got the FitBit, I was pleasantly surprised that the large band fit very comfortably on the second notch. (My wrist measured 8" when I got my FitBit) So the bands are really very comfortable and have a bit more to them than it appears by the measurements.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: In April 2016 I purchased this as a gift for my husband. Received it on time and it worked perfectly for about three months and then he had a difficulty charging it. He would charge for hours (24 hours at times) just to get 2 hours of usage which was very frustrating. Now it has stopped working, it has been dead for the past  5 months and it has not been a full year since I purchased it. I recently saw another relative with hers and it seems to be working for now. Just disapointed that the one I bought was a complete waste of my money and a disasterous gift for my husband.
review_title: Very disapointed. Worst gift I have ever given.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I loved it initially, including the on line tracking system to monitor your activity.  I was hooked! Checked my steps, my sleep patterns, etc and then after about 3 weeks it stopped going into sleep mode. Initially I blamed myself thinking I messed something up. The 2nd time I blamed it on battery level, even though it still showed enough.  After the 4th nite of messing up and following the on-line tips I found, I decided to return it to be within the allotted time.  My daughter has one, has had it much longer and no problems, so maybe it was just a bad unit...but I haven't re-ordered it. The  Fitbit response was for me to buy my next one from them instead of Amazon to get a longer return trial period.  Their support system for trouble shooting is not the best.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've used fitbit for about 4 years now, this is my 3rd one.  I've had the One, Ultra & now the flex & I'll never get the flex again!  I like the One & Ultra much more because you can just look at it & it tells you all your counts.  I don't like that I have to go to my computer every time I want to know how I'm doing for the day with the flex. The strap that came with it is very cheap, it tore very quickly.  If you pay almost $100.00 for something, it should come with better accessories.  Also, the charge doesn't last more that a day & 1/2.  I got it 7/15 & in the beginning, the charge lasted 5 days, now, 10/15, it doesn't last more that a day & 1/2.  I do NOT recommend it at all.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Rated this 3 stars but really its a 2 1/2.  software great but number of annoying problems with fitbit flex.  Look at the new line of fitbits.  I wouldn't recommend this one unless the price drops 50%.Pros:Time Zone - if you have a smart phone use the Bluetooth to sync up and time to get set. see alarms.Alarms - Wake up alarm works and mild vibrations.  not sure how well it works with sound sleepers or carpal tunnel.Vibrates when you meet your goal in steps.CONS:Clasp in 3 weeks it came loose 5 times. Almost lost it once.Battery life sucks! lucky to get a week at best.You need to have Bluetooth on to see battery level is low.  I really don't notice the vibration the battery is low.Read out of the dots to show your progress not so great.
review_title: software great but number of annoying problems with fitbit flex

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is nice.  From a person who had no clue about how much food I was consuming.  This put everything into perspective.  The alarm has a nice touch for waking you.  I can log on my Ipad 2 but I cannot sync the fibit, I have to use my computer.  Before you purchase this item make sure you have the device that is needed.  However they have indicated that they are trying to get more devices ready for this product.  Go to fitbit.com and look at the available devices.  You can shower, bath be caught in the rain and it will not have a problem.  For my height my legs are longer the usual so the step tracker was indicating less steps than I was doing.  I would walk 4 miles and it would show 3.09 miles.  You can personalize your stride now it clicks right.  Easy to use.  Love it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It took me several days to review this item because I wanted to include every aspect of it. I ordered it 12/27/13 afternoon to night ( Friday ) and paid for standard shipping. ( 3-5 business days ) I checked on the shipping status that night. I was thrilled that it said i'd get it Saturday, instead of Wednesday ( 1/2/14 ) Just like Amazon said, it came Saturday afternoon. I guess I lucked out on shipping because Amazon's warehouse was one hour away from me. In order to view the stats of the Fitbit, you need to use the app or website, so for that reason, I'll review it. The app ( For IOS ) is confusing in the beginning. However, on the other hand, the version for Android is very simple, and appears, to me anyway, cleaner and more updated. They are both copies of each other but some of the layout is different. The Fitbit website is also very complex and is taking me awhile to get used to. Now, for signing up for Fitbit. When I first made my account I tried to enter my correct age, however, for some reason, you need to be 18. I am not over eighteen, so in order to make the account I had to change my age to a incorrect one. On the app I can then go and change my age to the correct one. To the actual Fitbit Flex. Once it arrived, I charged it and set it up with my account, which was all extremely easy. But it took quite a-while to get to five lights. I thought maybe they had changed it to only four lights to mean fully charged. Be patient, it will eventually finish. I've heard many different views about it being Water proof or not. Some say they won't even take it in the shower, some say they take it swimming. For $100 I rather keep it out of water until Fitbit personally says it is safe to take it in the water. The alarm and all that are very cool add-ons, but for $100?In the end, it comes down to a matter of opinion and the amount of money you have. Would I buy another? No. Nothing is wrong with it, but I rather go for a more solid tracker, like a Nike Sports band. I am keeping it, but I'm not buying another anytime in the future.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm rewriting my review after owning this for 1.5 years.  I bought this to keep track of my steps and calories burned.  For the past 1.5 years, I've been carefully and diligently recording everything I eat. I don't believe that the calories burned function is altogether accurate.  I still managed to gain 8 pounds in the past year.  However, to be fair, I have hypothyroid.  This would be much better if there were algorithms you could enter into your profile to account for metabolic and other physical issues that affect your calorie burn.  I do enjoy competing in the challenges, and the step counter motivates me to get more active.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the convenience of wearing the Fitbit Flex, I don't have to think about putting it on.  I like the wireless updating.  I have only forgotten to charge it once since I have gotten it.  Now if I am going to be sitting at my desk or watching TV for any length of time I charge it.  It tracks activity pretty well, for spin classes I strap it to my shoe for more accurate results.  I like tracking my sleep, it would be nice if tracked quality of sleep like the Jawbone UP.  I did have to return the first one I ordered - it is advertised as water resistent so I did wear it in the shower.  After about 2 days, one of the lights wouldn't turn off, drained the battery in less than 8 hours.  Now I don't wear it in the shower  :).  Overall I really like it, tracking quality of sleep would make it awesome.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: We both had the original fit bit and loved what they did, however due to it being small and constantly falling out of its clip, we ended up losing one of them. We thought that this would of been even better now that it was in a wrist band, but the product was very disappointing. This does not display the number of steps, or anything else for that matter. It will vibrate when it reaches 10,000 steps, and that is it. All of the data is online, so now you have to log in to see your progress for the day.It also does not track stairs climbed. Personally, I think this product is a huge step backwards from their original product. I was disappointed, and embarrassed to give this as a gift for a replacement of the original fit bit.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This device is pretty inaccurate in step-counts. Unless I'm running (and therefore swinging my arms), it will significantly undercount your steps unless you make a conscious effort to swing your arms. I also wear a accelerometer/pedometer on my waist to check the accuracy of the step-count. This fitbit flex is my second one. I lost the original one when it unlatched, probably when I was carrying my gym bag. This second one also came unlatched when I was carrying my gymbag and the strap on the bag must have rub agains the Fitbit flex. So in addition to improving the accuracy, this device also needs an improvement on the latch on the flex. I'm going to return this one and hopefully amazon refund my money so I can get the Fitbit One.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have enjoyed owning the Fitbit and connecting with friends who also use them.  Have experienced a few glitches where it will suddenly stop working.  Followed directions on website and was able to remedy.  Unfortunately I would have given the product a better rating if the band had not split.  I can still wear it but need to notify the company.  Being very careful because I am a little worried that I could conceivably lose the tracker.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The concept of the FitBit is a great one -- an easy to wear item that tracks steps and sleep.  Unfortunately, the hardware issue they have is a significant one and one that is causing me to return for refund my FitBit Flex.The Flex tracker should plug into the charging cable (like any other electronic device) and simply charge.  Plug it, leave it, come back to charged tracker.  Unfortunately for the Flex tracker I was sent, that never happened for me.  I followed all the suggestions they have on their site (which indicates they are well aware of the charging issues).  The only thing that (occasionally) worked was to put the tracker in the charging cable and manuever a paperclip to make it even more secure.  That would work only sometimes and not ever for a full charge.The Flex tracker just does not charge properly.Upon my third inquiry to FitBit on this (and realize they do not have phone or chat support -- email support ONLY), they said my tracer's battery voltage was not working properly but because I was outside the 45 day purchase window they would not refund.Thus, 2 stars is being generous for what the FitBit can do (if/when it is charged), but the hardware itself is fatally flawed (hopefully for them on the manufacturing side and not design side) and their support is quite lacking.  One should look to a competitor and not FitBit.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this without fully researching it. I just assumed that it would have some sort of display besides flashing lights. It's pretty bulky to not do anything except flash lights in response to taps. I have small wrists and though the Flex came with a band that fit, I found it too bulky and uncomfortable to want to wear it all the time. The Force has a display but is even bulkier as I understand. I exchanged the Flex for the One, which I absolutely love. The One is small and easily fits onto your bra or in a pocket. My old One accidentally went into the wash and it still works great! The One has a display that shows the time, steps, floors climbed, etc. So I'd recommend the One over the Flex. I have friends who prefer the Flex and friends who prefer the One, so it's just a matter of taste.
review_title: Works fine but style may not suit everyone

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The many functions of the fitbit were great. However, it all needed to be done on line (computer and/or phone).  I found this cumbersome. I would wear the band, but couldn't find out how I was doing unless I checked on my phone.  I did like finding out how far I walked, etc., but did not like having to pull it up.  I guess I expected instant gratification and to somehow know my numbers by looking at the band. When I looked into the calorie counting part, it too was time consuming.  The calories used part was great.  All in all, it was not as easy to use as I had hoped so I returned it.
review_title: Fitbit is not as flexible as I wished.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I would like to inform prospective buyers of some of the persistent issues with  Fitbit I noted since buying it in late August 2014 through Amazon:1. It persistently does not accurately detect when I do HIIT exercises. For example, while doing a P90X3 workout, it only calculates that I've burned 10-15 calories for the whole 30 mins workout. Based on my heart rate, it should have detected ~300 calories burned.2. It also on daily basis tells me incorrect number calories I still have to consume. For example, I have set a 500 calorie deficit under my goals (+/- 50 cal as per Fitbit calculations). By 4 PM, I would burn about 1800 calories and consume 900-1000 calories. Instead of saying I have another ~400 calories remaining to consume, Fitbit would say I can consume another 1400 calories. I stopped believing any Fitbit recommendations due to these gross and constant miscalculations.I want to be frank, the only useful feature in my Fitbit is the step counter. This feature is not worth $99 I spent on this product. I expect a full refund considering these issues with the product.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Doesn't have some of the advertised features on the website, directions on the website are unclear.  This is not a good product for people with very narrow wrists, the stiff part is the full width of my wrist so even the small band doesn't help, making it very uncomfortable to wear.  Hopefully they'll make a women's/kid's version soon (not in pink please!). That said, it's the best choice in the product line & in comparable products for people with small wrists. Initial setup was fairly easy.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Pros:The price is very reasonable for a exercise tracker.Very lightweight.  I don't feel the "weight" of the tracker on my wrist.The app for your smartphone gives you a lot of information related to your day.Tracks your sleep and the quality of your sleep.Cons:The battery only lasts around 5 days.Doesn't show your heart rate.A couple of times, the tracker has fallen off while I was asleep.Summary:If you want an inexpensive tracker and don't care what your heart rate is, this is the tracker for you.
review_title: Pros: The price is very reasonable for a exercise ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this for my fiancee because she wanted one. She likes it a lot so far! She wears it pretty frequently, even if she's not going to the gym or anything. She's pretty active at work so it's cool to see how many steps she's taken during a shift. Also, the design is slim and not gross looking so a girl can wear it with any outfit and it'll go well, especially if it's black. Also, it's motivated her to get her steps in and even motivated her to go to the gym more often, so win win win for everywin! I mean, everyone!
review_title: Helpin my fiancee get a bit more fit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have been pleased with the amount of information provided with very little required of me (other than to exercise!).  The goal setting has been particularly helpful to encourage me to do better.  With the help of the Fitbit, I have already lost over 20 pounds in 3 months just by being more conscious of my exercising.It doesn't have to be on your wrist ... at times, I have placed the whole band in my pocket.  There was no discernible difference in the accuracy.  There have also been no issues with wearing it in the shower or while swimming.The only downside is they could have made the arrow that shows the orientation after charging a little larger and brighter.  I tore up my first band because I put the Fitbit in backwards.
review_title: Great Weightloss Aid ... Over 20 lbs in 3 Mos!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've been searching for a gadget to keep me stay motivated, my choices were between nike+ vs. fitbit. I spoke to one of my patient and was told fitbit would be the one to go with. So I gave it a try! Here is how this product in my opinion:Pros:- slick design, light, comfortable- easy to set up with fitbit iOS app- Come with small and large bracelets (kind of helpful)- Love the vibrate alarm (my wife does not have to deal with my morning alarm noise)Cons:- INACCURATE DATA COLLECTION (the reason I want to use this item for tracking)1. STEPS: you have the option to get to dominant or non-dominant hand, I had it set on dominant hand. According to my patient, she said it was really accurate and she tested it. IT WAS NOT!! I guess this device use some kind of accelerometer to measure your ARM SWING vs. actual steps. I took a quick walk around the living room and the steps counted were +/- 2, then I was sitting on the chair, swinging my arm, it still counting my steps. Within 15 minutes playing with my son, I've reached my sample goal of 5000 steps per day - this was accomplished without moving my legs.2. DISTANCE - of course, it uses STEPS to calculate the distance I moved, this number is definitely incorrect. According to its data, I was moving 1.12 miles while play with my son3. CALORIES BURNED: how does this calculate? I burned 1052 calories in 30 mins playing with my son! Wow...I guess I can start packing all my burgers wherever I go to keep my body working since I can burn calories that quick.4. WEIGHT LOSS: I was playing with my son for 30 minutes. The stats show: 5 minutes active, 5000+ steps, 1052 calories burned, BUT I LOST 0.1lbs - I can't figure out the proper formula/equation to fit all these numbers together.5. SLEEP TIME: From 11:40pm to 3:41pm, I was awake 96minutes, restless 192minutes, and slept for the rest. Which I can tell you, I was not sleep over 5 hours during this period.Can I count on this little thing to tracking my work-out? hmm...NOOOOOOOOOThat's my spill...I might have different experiences with this device vs. other users. I think I might stay with Nike+ watch with Tomtom plus Heart Rate monitor sensor for HR tracking which can be use to calculate calories burned. Good luck with this device if you decide to get one. I tested it after seeing all the good reviews people had submitted.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've only had my fitbit for three days and am already completely obsessed.Some features I really like are the fact that it tracks your sleep and can show you the patterns via a graph. It shows when you a restless or even awake in the middle of the night and for how long.I also love the food database that you can use to enter your food to help track your calories. There are so many entries already available to help you count your calories that it makes tracking really simple.I am really pleased with mine and would recommend it to anyone who has an interest in becoming healthier or tracking their health.I even bought two more as gifts because I love mine so much

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I "upgraded" from the zip to the flex and am horribly disappointed. I can not believe that this device actually made it through product testing and is as popular as these reviews profess.First off, you should know that I'm not an athlete in any sense of the word. I am a busy SAHM trying to incorporate more fitness into her life. That being said this is where the Flex is a dismal failure. Walking or chasing after the kids? It works awesome. Pushing a shopping cart through Costco? Useless. Brushing my teeth? Man, do I rack up some major "steps." Riding my bike in the park? Not a single number changed. Using the treadmill at the gym where I tend to hold onto the bar more than I should? (I know, I know. I'm working on it but on a treadmill I'm focusing on speed not distance.) Well, my last 2-mile racked up a measly 800 steps. That included the walk to and from my car. In other words, this device just bombs out. Really, you should see my numbers jump when I scratch my leg.This $100 gimmick is just a gimmick. If it motivates you to get moving then it's worth it but if you want it for accuracy then try something else.
review_title: Just not practical for real life.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The order came on time. However, after wearing the fitbit for a couple of weeks and charging the bit come to find out all of a sudden all of my "steps" were wiped clean. I would like to return this, but it appears it's outside the "return time frame." I even tried to contact the fitbit people and they offered no resolution, but to keep giving the gadget a try. So very disappointed. Come to find out, my other friends had the same problems. I would NOT recommend this.
review_title: I would like to return this

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was so excited to get my fit bit that I charged it right away and then put it on. I have had pedometers in the past and they were ok, so I was waiting to see what the fuss was all about. Now I know! Let me start by saying I am a bartender and I am always on my feet, sometimes over 12 hours a day. The fitbit keeps track of my steps and sleep pretty accurately. I was worried that all my hand movements would effect the readings but they don't seem to set it off my much. I love tracking my steps and even better for me is the sleep log. It tells me how many hours I actually slept and how many times I woke up within the night.Some of my concerns when debating over this tracker verses others were the display, accuracy and water proof. So accuracy I covered earlier, that seems right on. Not having a fully digital display was different. They did make up for it in lights. When you get close to your goal the indicator lights light up. If you are behind in the day it will have a special light display as if to say hurry up. I found that didn't even bother me as much as I thought it would. And if that's a concern you can download it to your phone to display your progress. The next is waterproof- which it is! I went to the water park with it and it held up great!  I would say go for it! It's so much fun to see how much I walk and what times I walk the most. I also love love love the sleep log!! 5 stars for me! The only thing I would like to see in the future is setting multiple goals on it.
review_title: How have I gone so long without it!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love it. The color is super different not a lot of people have it so being different is always great. I do have to say the silent sleeper and sleeping activity is great. It allows you to see where in the night your awake or moving around ! And I don't have set my annoying alarm anymore the soft vibrations ( although it scared me at first ) is great and doesn't wake my boyfriend up wich is always a plus . If your going to buy a fit bit to start out the flex is the way to go and the battery last for what seems forever I received my on a Tuesday its now Friday and haven't charged it yet and it's still at full strength

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have purchased two of these Fitbits off of Amazon. The first one didn't charge, so I had to return it. This second one the battery lasts about a day and takes half of a day to recharge. I have to reset it about every 3 days. Very disappointed. I asked someone else if they had problems and they said no, they said neither had their coworker. She asked me if I bought it directly from a store, I said no, off of Amazon. She then told me that many people have complained about their purchase off of Amazon. May be a good product, but I HIGHLY suggest if you buy one, buy it from an electronics store and not off of Amazon!
review_title: Very disappointed. I asked someone else if they had problems ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I absolutely LOVE the FitBit Flex!  It can sync to my computer OR phone so I can get updates throughout the day which really help to motivate me to get up and get some more steps in.  Even the little visual which has 1 dot = 20% of my goal helps me see how I'm doing!My old device had to be plugged into my pc to sync and gave absolutely no indication of where I was at during the day.It is easy to wear, waterproof, the battery life seems good.  I also like that I can get other color bands if I want.And most important to me was that there is no additional fee to keep the software (my old device charged a monthly subscription fee).The only thing it doesn't do that my old device did is log my sleep for me.  I can absolutely live with that given all the other positives of the FitBit Flex.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this on July 29 and have already had tons of issues with it. It's not been syncing to the app right and sometimes not even at all. When I look back at my steps for the day and the days before I know they are wayyyyy off. One moment it will say I made 3,000 and something steps the day before then just a few minutes later 4,000 and something steps the day before. And on days I'm just at home relaxing it will have me making over 2,000 steps but a day I'm out in town all day just 900 steps. I went through all the trouble shooting and advice from others who had them I found online then after reading reviews I see others have had the same issues and talking to other people who have fitbits they say they too have had many issues. I wanted the Fitbit charge HR but now I'm kinda glad I didn't spend all that money on it. And am very much debating on even trying it after the issues I've had with this one already. And hearing the issues others I know have had our if their Fitbits and not just the flex. I did call the company and they are replacing this flex but it's not even 3 months old yet and shouldn't need replaced already.... And what happens when it does it again and when warranty is up? Kinda wishing I had went with a different brand now. Do your research first!!
review_title: Do your research before getting a Fitbit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit flex.  The ability to track and monitor my results from my smart phone is very convenient. The fact that you can buy different colored bracelets to customize with my outfits is also a plus.  I use the sleep monitor to see how I've been sleeping through the night and I love the silent alarm feature.  The only negative I have and the reason for only 4 stars is that it also counts steps if you are moving your hand too much.  I know you can expect that with wrist trackers, but I wish they could make it a little less sensitive.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my fitbit flex.  However, This is the second one I purchased.  I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because of the band it comes with.  I wish it had a clasp to secure it.  I only had my first one for about a week before the the band unclasped and it got flushed down the toilet.  I have ordered another type of wristband to avoid losing this one too.  Not happy with the band but extremely happy with the actual fitbit.
review_title: Love the fitbit but not the band it comes with

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was a wonderful tool, it was very encouraging to have a way to track my distance and set goals, it really helped me to keep up with healthier habits. But unfortunately, they are not infallible. I have had my fitbit for over a year now, and it has started to glitch, it will turn itself off shortly after being taken out of the charger, sometimes a day later, sometimes almost as soon as it comes out. Tried rebooting it, tried updating, it works for  a bit, then shuts off. I would buy another it they weren't so expensive.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Pros: It makes you want to achieve your set goal, records seamlessly by syncing via bluetooth to its app, the biggest perk of all was the alarms which were so useful and a nice way to wake up via a vibration on your wrist, I was actually more active when I had it kind of sad but true, and it records your sleep activity (how much you move in your sleep, when you were in deep sleep and not, etc.) which was pretty cool. Cons: the design is weird on your arm but you get used to it, the battery has to be charged by taking the little piece out of the band and putting it into a dock (battery life isn't too bad, when I had it I charged it maybe like once or twice a week depending on how often I tapped it to check my status) it was a bit annoying having to take the piece out of the band though as it wears down the band because you kind of bend it a bit to take it out, the securing mechanism it has is really s**** literally like buttoning a button, I actually lost mine because it fell off at a concert, that being said its a little pricey to want to replace, so I am without one currently. 3 stars because the design of the locking mechanism isn't secure enough so it'd fall off sometimes, and finally it was lost in a sea of people.
review_title: I lost mine due to the locking mechanism being really poor quality.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Out of 4 FITBIT products, this is the simplest and the one that did not suffer any defects. We also bought 2 CHARGE units, 1 CHARGE HR. After less than a year, each of those were already defective, not charging and we were able to replace them. But the replacement units for 1 CHARGE and 1 CHARGE HR was defective again so after 6 months. I wouldn't recommend fitbit, the exception would be the FLEX but it is a very simple unit with no tracking of heartrate and no display. The rest is not worth it.
review_title: THE ONLY FITBIT UNIT WE PURCHASED THAT DID NOT SUFFER DEFECTS

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the Fitbit in general.  It's easy to use.  But it definitely doesn't have anywhere near 5 days of battery life.  More like 24-36 from a full charge.  That can be frustrating if I want to use it to track sleep as well as activity.  UPDATE:  I turned off the setting for All-Day Synch, and that made a world of difference.  Now the charge lasts the advertised time.
review_title: I like the Fitbit in general

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The fitbit flex does more than i expected. very easy to setup, use and get useful data from the resultsBattery life is very good, recharge once per week, comfortable to wear  and Synchronizing with serve is automaticthe we site provides good basic information, and even has a section for comparing insulin use, with blood sugar  etc.what i don't like it the extreme costs for premium features 49 $  per year. way too much money for what they call premium. if they lowered the price and raised the length 25$ for 5 years or life it may be worth it, with the price of the device  49$ is way to high an asking price.I had an issue with the wristband, both broke within a week, Fitbit Customer support was very responsive and helpful in resolving the issue

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the Flex back in January 2014.  It worked great until the end of May, then it went on the fritz (it stopped charging and tracking steps).  I emailed the FitBit support folks and they told me they had to send me a new one.  I've now had my new one almost two months and in the last week I found it wasn't tracking steps too well.  I know I didn't wear it for a few days, but I did wear it for 4 days and it only said I did 3,000 total in those 4 days.  Put it back on yesterday, did a lot of walking at work, even went out for a 1 mile loop around some of the buildings, checked my phone app and it only just started counting steps when I went into the app.  I am very disappointed at this point.
review_title: It's great, when it decides it wants to work.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fitbit!! It has definitely motivated me to move a LOT more. The only reason I did not give it a 5 star rating was because I wish I had upgraded to be able to check my progress right on the fitbit rather than going to the computer (no smart phone for me). I use the alarm to gently wake me each morning. I get in 10k - 15k steps a day now, and monitor my food ointake. I highly recommend this item.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my Fitbit Flex! I workout every day w/a heart rate monitor, but I wasn't sure if I was one of those people who works out, but is sitting on my rear the rest of the time. What do they call that, a fit couch potato? This was exactly what I needed. Have owned it for  6 months. The flex is so easy to wear, I never have to remember to put it on, I don't lose it. It doesn't give me a rash. When I haven't been as active I should be, it tells me and motivates me to do more. I didn't think I'd use the sleep tracking originally when I bought it, but now I do every night and just keeping track has helped motivate me to go to bed earlier and ensure I get a better night sleep. Battery life is good. Love the website and the reporting.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had a fitbit before.  I lost it twice.  It kept falling off my pocket.  The second time I lost the fitbit, I purchased the fitbit flex.  Bottom line...It motivates me to move more.  I'm not thrilled with how hard it is to close the bracelet, but it seems to connect better w/wifi and although this model doesn't track stairs climbed, neither did the other one lol.  The original fitbit said it tracked stairs, but it never gave me an accurate count.So...have I lost weight?  Not a lot, but it makes me get up off my butt and walk a little more.  When I sync up and see I've walked for instance, 2500 steps...I make sure I get over the 3k mark.  It's easy to set up and use.  I'd recommend as one of the top fitness trackers.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The idea behind an activity tracker is a great one! Unfortunately, it lacks accuracy as I tested it. I walked the same distance, for 2 weeks, and each time I got a different distance traveled, and amount of steps taken (the variance was roughly 200 steps). One thing it did do well, was get me off the couch! The sleep tracker was a mystery as it really only told you how many times you moved in your sleep (as far as I could tell), but the issue was also that it would go into "sleep mode" on its own way too often (you hit the display repeatedly to put it into sleep mode, but I found that moving your hand around rapidly would also do this, so it would go into sleep mode when brushing your teeth, shaking a drink, playing a video game, etc..). Overall, I like the idea of an activity tracker, but it did not perform the way I would have liked it to.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The flex has given me the answer to always being tired. It tracks how long it takes for you to go to sleep(Not my problem...asleep in three to five minutes)how many times I wake up (16 to 18 times a night when I thought I slept all night)and then when I am fully awake in the morning. No wonder I am tired, I am getting no REM sleep. This alone is worth the price.The dashboard tracks a variety of other things including how many steps you take in a day. I find myself being more active because my activity is being tracked!One small complaint...The band is very hard to fasten and mine has developed a split where it connects to the tracker compartment. I am unable to find any info to contact he company to replace it. I could buy a new band but I don't think I should have to, just three weeks into owning it.
review_title: WOW! Had no idea I was sleeping so poorly!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Been using it to mostly track my sleep as I have trouble getting a good night.  Can definitely tell a difference when I clear 4hrs of "restful sleep" on sensitive.  That said, it's been consistently good, with the only real issues being band durability (~6mo for me), water resistance (don't wear it in shower or swimming and it's sensitive from the two I've had) and the charging is temperamental in that I need to have it lined up exactly right or it won't charge.
review_title: At $99, it's too much, but it's better than a lot of others I've tried.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am so in love with my Fitbit Flex!!  It stays on me nearly 24/7.  I love that it encourages me to get my 10,000 steps everyday.  I love that it keeps track of how much sleep I'm getting!  I love that it has a silent alarm, that wakes me up, but not my husband!  Often, I'll get to evening, and realize I still need another 500 or 1000 steps, so I'm able to take a quick walk, or jog around my kitchen table (if it's too dark out for me to want to go outside.)  It's always so exciting to me when my wrist starts to buzz, because I know that I've just gotten the exercise my body really needs for the day (it's not unusual for me to do a bit of a happy dance at that point.)  I've never had any other device to compare this to, but for a first timer, I think this is almost perfect!  Love it!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had it for awhile now. It does exactly what is advertised to do. It is a little complicated setting it up. It is also a little confusing when trying to figure out the settings. It is comfortable, just like a watch. I've tapped it a few times by accident and I don't know what it is doing when all the little lights are flashing. Over all, for the price it's not bad.Well this the newest update. My fitbit hasn't work in over 3 weeks now. At first I thought I was doing something wrong, but then I discovered it just wouldn't sync anymore. Also, the band is so hard to close and makes me sweat under it. I don't like the rubbery feel.
review_title: I wouldn't buy another one like this.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love it. Works very well. After reading other reviews I can say that most of the problems people have can be prevented. First off, it says it is water resistant but water does he trapped in the band if it gets wet.
