Make sure to take it out of the band and clean and dry it whenever it gets wet. second is about the syncing issues people have. If it even won't sync anymore but still has a full charge there is a reset process. Plug it into the charger and there is a small reset button on the back of the charger, press and hold the button (with the end of a paperclip) for 6 seconds. Then re-sync with your phone.
review_title: I love it. Works very well

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this Fitbit about two months ago and guess where it is.... NO ONE KNOWS BECAUSE IT FELL OFF WHILE I WAS WALKING AROUND. I wasn't even putting a jacket on or doing anything that would result in extra straining on the damn thing. It just fell off and now I'm down $100 and I'm pissed off. Everyone said this would happen but I was naive and thought I would be different. Just get one that actually buckles or something. The design is the only flaw but it's one of the biggest problems with a wearable fitness tracker.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It's amazing how much walking I do now. The Fitbit can definitely be improved (like securing the clasp so it does not come loose and also improving the accuracy in determining what is walking and what is simply moving your arm back and forth. It's worth noting that rocking on a rocking chair increases steps so cheating is a very big possibility. Using my smartphone, I can see the steps increasing as I sit on my rocking chair. That's bad.Ok so why then did I give this thing 5 stars? Not because of the technology but because of what it did to motivate me into walking more. I love the fact that you can "compete" with friends. That alone is worth the price of admission.
review_title: It's amazing how much walking I do now

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I received the flex as a Christmas gift from my wife. After a few months the band was pretty torn up. Fitbit replaced it under warranty. After a couple of more months it stopped holding a charge. They sent me a new tracker under warranty. After another several months the replacement band is torn and the tracker no longer holds a charge. Fitbit only cares about you and the $100 you spent on their faulty equipment for 1 year. So now I'm stuck with a useless product that isn't even heavy enough to be a paper weight. A quick search will show that this is a very common problem with the flex, but fitbit couldn't care less because they've already got my money. In throwing my flex in the trash along with my Aria scale (which does still work but I want nothing to do with). There are much better products out there. If you are considering this one save your money and start counting your steps by yourself. You will have saved $100 and probably have a more accurate count of your daily steps. I am personally done with fitbit and will personally host a large scale celebration of they ever go out of business.
review_title: Your money is better spent elsewhere.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I can't argue with the fact that, because I had it, I lost ten pounds in a month. Logging your food and water intake into your app and having updates about step counts and active minutes is great positive reinforcement. The app really does the work, but I enjoy being able to check my sleep and see how many times it's actually broken up. That said, points off for the annoying closure system (try fitting it in the dark while getting ready) and for the five dot display. They may as well have programmed in Morse Code for how meaningful the display on this is.If you get it, really you're investing in yourself and hopefully making a commitment to get the app and log your food/water. That's what's going to get it done. It's just part of your overall approach.
review_title: Generally pretty great and a positive reinforcement tool

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love the fitbit flex, it has been very helpful in tracking my daily activities and sleep habits. The silicone wrist band is comfortable to wear all the time and the orange is a fun choice in color. The ONLY issue I have is, when I'm pushing a shopping cart or our stroller the fitbit switches over to sleep tracking mode from the vibrations so I'm constantly tapping it to put it back in regular mode. It only does this while walking with the regular stroller or a shopping cart but while jogging with the jogging stroller (which has shocks to absorb the vibration) it stays on active mode the entire time.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex has been excellent. It tracks my activity and sleep well.  Battery lasts for days.  The size, feel, and fit makes it comfortable and effortless to wear for long periods and while sleeping. Contrary to what other reviewers say, the wrist band clasp is snug and secure, with no tendency to come loose.  The band itself is made of a stretchy rubber. It comes with both a small and a large wrist band.
review_title: Wrist band and clasp is snug and secure

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this Fitbit Flex on 2/26/16 and it started acting up about a week or two ago. It would go dead after it had been charged that mornings or it would disconnect from the app and then not sync because it would be dead.Now today, just short of 5 months, the bracelet cracked right where the orange window meets the rubber bracelet on the back where you put the device into the bracelet.These things were meant to be worn everyday and night, so why did it break already? Now I can just hope it's still under warranty so I can get a replacement.
review_title: Not even 6 months old and it broke.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is just OK.  I had to return the first one I bought because it froze after a week.  The return was easy but they made me wait for a new one until they received the old one.  In most cases that is understandable, however, they determined that it was DOA remotely.I also wish the battery would last longer between charges.  It also took  awhile to sync the steps and distance, there was a great deal of trial end error.  I used the formula they provided but it didn't work

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like it--but there are times when I can tell it isn't monitoring steps correctly.  I was doing a rhythmic motion giving someone a back massage, and I had the app open, just to see, and it was counting steps.  Also--I have had it for a little more than a week and the band is already coming apart.  I shouldn't have to buy new bands this early.  I emailed FitBit customer support, got an auto reply back immediately saying I would hear back in next 24 to 48 hours, and that was about 6 days ago, and I have heard nothing.  Bad support from them.  If they can fix these things, overall I say it's a great product, but maybe this got too big too soon and they cannot handle the load?  No idea--but I want answers and some support.
review_title: Good--but some major red flags with company handling issues.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my fitbit flex!! Love the sleep feature. It shows the quality of sleep I am getting each night. Also like to keep track of my steps and activity. If your looking into increasing your activity and performance. This is definitely the product that you want to be wearing. Also like how it comes with 2 bands. This way you will know going forward as well when ordering additional bands what size you need.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: From: James CappyMy wife, Annette gave me the Fitbit as a gift and I was thrilled to get it and could not wait to use it.  I have read and reread and reread the directions: they are confusing, unclear, and poorly written. I have downloaded the software three times in the hope its performance might improve.HOWEVER, it has not worked since day one. The silent alarm goes off at random times. The light display does not always match the desired function. The battery does not always charge and may take several attempts. The sleep mode readouts are funky and inconsistent: today, I learned that I slept 19 hours and 50 minutes?  I don't trust the sleep outcomes.Where is the science behind that function? You have not demonstrated any methodology. Was this item ever tested? If so, why don't you share the testing results. Water gets in the Fitbit pocket when I take a shower and stays there: that can't be good even though you assure me it is OK. The clasp for the band is very sexy but very difficult to use. $100 was far too much to pay for something that has performed so poorly. On the plus side, it is a good idea and I appreciate the emails concerning my progress.Taking the long view, Microsoft set a modern manufacturing trend that only gets worse as time passes. They put out software that did not work and they knew it. Operative policy: Pay full price for an inadequate product, we promise it will get better. Quality standards have continued to be compromised for profit motive. The Fitbit falls into this pattern quite comfortably, it seems. Good idea, too expensive, poor performance, and no recourse for resolution.Look up the meaning of, "a pig in a poke".  Your design and manufacturing story goes back to the dark ages when a bag was filled with rats and cats and sold as a pig.  I don't eat rats and cats.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've owned two FitBit flex devices and have been  pretty satisfied with functionality, BUT the wristband clasp is very inadequate.I lost my first one during a work-based team building sailing expedition (somewhat competitive and risk-prone!). Fine. I saw that as my problem. This past weekend, I Iooked down and saw a missing wristband with no possible explanation. (I hadn't done anything other than get up, take a shower and get in a car for a weekend trip. It's probably buried somewhere and will emerge after I have become enamored with the replacement gadget.)I liked my FitBit, but after two band failures, I am done and will be ordering something else tonight. Bummer.An update: I bit the bullet and ordered a third FitBit after saying I wouldn't and now I've lost my third, again due to the clasp letting go.This really was the last one. :-(
review_title: I've owned two FitBit flex devices and have been pretty satisfied with functionality

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fitbit! This little guy is great for tracking my daily movement and even my sleep. I've always wanted to know how restless I am at night and this does that by tracking your movement when in sleep mode. The only thing I don't like about it is that it doesn't track your heart rate and therefore during workouts when I'm doing movements such as push-ups or mountain climbers, i.e., movements where my arms aren't moving, it can't detect that and therefore won't count it. However, on the app you can log your activities and if you enter in the amount of calories burned, it will then compensate for that on your activity log. Speaking of the activity log, you can also track your food consumption which is amazing. When it comes to diet and exercise my biggest downfall is the diet and with this it tells me how many calories I've consumed/how many more can consume and tracks consumption of protein, fiber, sodium, etc. All in all I give this little tracker a 4 out of 5. One final recommendation is that you purchase an extra band; one for daily wear and another for working out. This way you can let the exercise band air-out between uses.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for my husband after I got one for Christmas (of course I gave him my black bands and I use the pink ones).  We enjoy these very much!  I definitely would like to upgrade to one that displays the time because I often find myself looking at it like it is a watch and I also would like to get one that tracks your heart rate and floor counts!  My husband and I love the challenges.  This has helped us become more aware of our activity levels so we can get ourselves back to a healthy weight post children.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought the FLEX to replace my Zip.I thought the FLEX would help me. I frequently forget to take the Zip and sometimes the Zip pops out of the holder if squeezed by accident.I spent a week with the FLEX after REPLACING my Zip with the fitbit app. The week was a disaster. When I brought up the fitbit app on my iPhone it was constantly "syncing". The steps would eventually appear after restarting the app, restarting the phone, etc.The next day all the steps would disappear! I am left with 'calories' but 0 steps. So I lost around 35,000 steps last week. The fitbit people tell me to 'reset' the FLEX blah, blah, blah. It should just work! I went back to the Zip which works fine and costs less than 1/2.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: These fitness trackers have worked great for myself and my wife. They have 2 bands that come in the package, a small and large. These are fine for most people's wrists but not my own. However, if you call/email Fitbit and tell them you need a XL band they will ship one for free (Takes a couple weeks also only comes in black/gray). They stay charged for around 5 days with my average use and syncing with the phone. No issues with the strap irritating my skin as I leave it on morning and night (the silent alarm is great).Hope this helps you with your purchase decision!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was wary of this product at first- it is basically a glorified pedometer which most smartphones already have. I was pleasantly surprised, however, at the information one can get from the device. I am able to track steps, sleep, water intake, and calories all from either the convenient app or online dashboard.Another cool feature is the communities. There are hundreds (if not thousands) of communities that you can join to compare progress or use their built-in forums.I only have a couple complaints. First, I think the food database needs some work. I used Lose It previously and was incredibly satisfied. Fortunately, Fitbit integrates with Lose It so I can continue to use that service, but I would prefer Fitbit to simply bolster their offering. Second, I think Fitbit missed the boat on the Badges system. For the Flex there are really only two badges that you can earn in increasing amounts- badges for steps and miles traveled. Gamification isn't exactly a new concept and many competitors implement it better.Overall I am incredibly satisfied with my purchase. When I had an issue with my Flex, Fitbit support took care of my issue within hours. I look forward to upgrading to the Force when I can justify it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Inaccurate readings and uncomfortable to wear. I wanted it mostly for the sleep tracker, but it is terrible for that. It's also incredibly bulky and uncomfortable to wear during the day, much less to sleep in. It's exorbitantly priced for what it does, how unsightly it is, and considering how poorly it functions.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It started out great... I was really happy with my Fitbit Flex. I bought it in March 2017. I’m not a fitness fanatic, but I liked knowing how many steps I took each day. The sleep function was also great. I never got it wet and took good care of it. By July it would only stay chargd for three days. By September it would only stay charged for a few hours. I went on the help forum and tried all the suggestions. Nothing worked.  I’m highly disappointed and won’t buy another one.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Sometimes it gets a little sweaty, but I'm noticing that less and less. There are prettier bands on the market, but be careful about sizing and performance. There is not interference with the name brand band, but the off brands aren't always allowing that little nugget to function inside. The only other drawback I saw was the tendency to need more charges than they said it would need, and losing that darn charger.The online materials are part of what makes this worth the purchase. I would recommend it as a good gym companion. Lots of positives, very light on the negative.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The fitbit is a good system to track your activities and such. The online daily log is handy to manually add other things such as your weight, water and food intake. You can track other friends progress as well. The bad things is the band it comes with. Mine repeatedly tore and I kept super gluing it together. Finally I bought a third party band here on Amazon.Amababa(TM) 2pcs Replacement Bands with Metal Clasps for Fitbit Flex / Wireless Activity Bracelet Sport Wristband / Fitbit Flex Bracelet Sport Arm Band (No tracker, Replacement Bands Only) (2PCS Black, Large)
review_title: The fitbit is a good system to track your activities and such

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: As I recover from surgery and anticipate Physical Therapy, I started to record my meager steps and have watched as the numbers grow every day. Proof of my recovery trajectory.  The Wristband is surprisingly comfortable, but it is difficult to snap it closed, which has to be done every time the battery is charged.  I found it difficult to learn when I was in or out of sleep mode and find that the sleep program is less than perfect.  However, it is a tremendous aide in monitoring, understanding and controlling my sleep patterns.  The Fitbit has become a cornerstone of my fitness program.  I would buy it again and recommend it to anyone who is serious about their health.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I enjoyed using this product--while I had it, all of 6 months. The clasp system stinks. It worked itself loose and fell off. I was wearing sleeves, so was unaware of the fact that it was missing until too late to find it. Not sure if I'll replace it as the clasp system on the new ones is the same. It was reasonably accurate and synced well with My Fitness Pal, but...can't keep spending that kind of money only to have it fall off and get lost. This was not the first time this happened. I was just lucky enought he other times to find it, either because it fell off in the house or because it hasn't completely fallen off yet. This is a serious defect. Wish they would fix it.
review_title: I enjoyed using this product--while I had it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had my fitbit for almost a year and I really liked it but I have lost it twice.  The first time, I found it after an hour of retracing my steps.  I lost it again this week and never found it.  The clasp just isn't good enough.  If you lift something, there's a good chance that whatever you are lifting will pop open the band.  I was able to see online that the last time the fitbit synced was at 11:23 AM and I know exactly where I was at that time (at the bank) but no one turned it in.  A real disappointment because a new one is expensive.  I think I will switch to a brand that has a watchband-type closure.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The first fitbit flex was a birthday gift and I absolutely loved it.  The bluetooth sync with the ios app is great.  However, it was only about 5-6 months before the fitbit would no longer charge.  It was very frustrating.  It just didn't seem to be connecting to the charger properly for some reason.  Assuming that it was a just a glitch or an anomaly, I ordered another fitbit flex.  To my disappointment, this one stopped charging after only 2 1/2 months.  After reading many help forums and talking to friends, this seems to be pretty common.  There are all kinds of suggestions out there from using a rubber band to probing it with a paperclip.  I don't think I should have to do that for a $100 fitness tracker.  The fitbit flex is a little too expensive to be considered a disposable item after three months of use.  My advice - either buy a warranty or keep the original packaging...you are going to need it.UPDATE: I called customer service and they were AWESOME!  They diagnosed what they believe caused my fitbit to stop working both times - I was charging it for too long.  They recommended not leaving it in the charger overnight, but instead - charging just 1-2 hours.  The representative immediately ordered a replacement for me and I received confirmation that it was shipped the same day.  I changed my rating from 2 stars to 5.  They have ridiculously good service.  YAY!
review_title: Great Tracker, but Won't Last Long - REVISED

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this for my wife for Christmas and she was very disappointed in it. First of all, the band is very hard to put on, very hard to clasp. Secondly, it's advertised as tracking sleep activity which was one of her main reasons for wanting it. Well the Flex doesn't go by heart rate, it goes in sleep mode by movement. So you can be laying wide awake for hrs, and if you don't move, it says your sleeping. Also, she wore a pedometer along with it to see if the steps were accurate and they werent. It was adding 30 to 50 steps per 30 mins...she knows her pedometer is accurate cause she tracked her walking path with a car...returned this item..overpriced, inaccurate pedometer is what it amounts to

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had the Fitbit for 10 months now and have really liked it and the information I can get from it. The weak point is the charger (and the plastic wristband, which has broken from taking the unit in and out for charging). Over the past couple of months I've had to fiddle with it to get it to charge, using rubbing alcohol to clean the charging parts and wiggling it this way and that. It has gotten to the point where it will not get a good enough fit to charge, so I've reluctantly given up on it. I had thought I would buy another until Apple revealed their watch with the health features, so I'll just wait until they release that and see if I can fit it into my budget.
review_title: ... the Fitbit for 10 months now and have really liked it and the information I can get from it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for both my girlfriend and me (to get her fired up about fitness and/or beating me). We both enjoy the device immensely despite our differing operating systems (she's on iPhone and I'm on Android). I did a lot of research before investing in Fitbit, but I felt like I made the right choice.Pros:Customer service is GREAT. My ladyfriend lost her Fitibt twice, and they've replaced both free of charge.The bands are way more subtle than UP's or Fuelband's.While simple, the device allows you to see how far along you are with the day's step goal.Tracks my steps accurately (and in real-time).Has several syncing options. Comes with dongle that lets you sync to your computer, too.Web dashboard is nice.Cons:The bands do break from wear-and-tear. And once they do, there goes your device.The calorie tracking software is a bit of a pain to use, if you're into that.
review_title: Loving both the Flex and Fitbit's customer service!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had it 2 weeks and the band broke at the "seam."  Very disapointed about that.It's been interesting seeing how active I am during the day (and night, too).Update: Fitbit sent me a new band.Update: Fitbit Flex stopped charging after 6 weeks.  Company sent me a complimentary replacement.  About 2 mos. later, that one stopped charging.  I gave up.  Original Flex ordered March 2014.  Replacement sent June 2014.  Now May 2015, my doctor encouraged me to contact them again, so I did.  It is out of warranty (they can see when it was last used, though), so they are offering me a 25% discount on a new one.  Not so sure I want to spend money on another Fitbit product, though.
review_title: I like what the Fitbit does, but the band is inferior

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought a pair of these for my parents-in-law and they now wear it everyday to monitor their health more closely. These fitbits not only monitor the number of steps you walk, but also the quality of your sleep. You can even set up a workout target or a dietary goal to achieve per day! My in-laws seemed to really like them and find them useful. Might be a great idea to buy more color bands to match with different outfits. Not so sure about the 2-year warranties though; they didn't even bother to email them to me for weeks after the fitbits arrived, although they eventually did after I opened a case with customer service.
review_title: Great gifts for the health-conscious! Monitors physical and rest activities alike! Set and achieve weight loss goals!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had my Flex for about 2 weeks and so far, I'm liking it very much. A couple of drawbacks -#1 - I have to tape the unit into the charger to get the full charge. It kept falling out and I found that tip on the Flex community section where a lot of people report similar problems.#2 - It took me awhile to figure out how to put it into sleep mode and sometimes it takes a couple of attempts to come and out of sleep mode.#3 - It is advertised that you can wear it in the shower but others reported issues with that so I take if off.#4 - I wish all the applications were the same. I get different options and a different layout between the laptop, the iphone, and the kindle. A bit confusing.Overall, I like how it tracks and how it notifies me when I'm close to 10,000. I like being able to monitor my progress from my iphone and log my food.So far, happy with my purchase.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was so excited to purchase a Fitbit after using a step app on my iPhone. I used it for several weeks and I don't use it at all anymore. The tracker is so inaccurate. A short trip to the bathroom = almost 80 steps? I think not.My iPhone app is 100% more accurate than this. Overall, this is great if it motivates you to move more, but if you're looking for something that can accurately tell you how many steps you've taken and how many calories you've burned - don't buy this.I'm really disappointed in the product because I paid almost 100 dollars for junk. Note: I'm aware that no pedometer is accurate, but the Fitbit is HIGHLY inaccurate which defeats the whole purpose of having it in the first place.  Those who gave this 5 stars probably doesn't realize that the readings are all wrong. It tells you that you burn thousands of calories and thousands of steps even if you've been sedentary at the office for 10 hours. My advice? Don't buy this until the manufacturer has perfected this tech.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have purchased a bunch of these for family. Now, the first one broke, just outside of the 45 day deadline for a no question return, although I suspect they would be as evasive as they have been on their warranty. I have spent 10 days with them, going back and forth as they tried to find a reason to invalidate their warranty. At last they did, and I am stuck with a chunk of junk. They may have won on this one but I will not buy another fitbit product nor will I recommend it as I had been doing until the damn thing died after 47 days, I am contemplating returning all the ones I have purchased for family that are within the 45 day deadline before they can die too. Buyer beware!
review_title: Breaks and company doesn't stand behind their product.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The product will not come on when I tap on it but will always say it is fully charged. We contacted somebody from Fitbit and they told us it sounded like it was not charged. We tried to charge it again and had the same thing. It would not turn on. I tried to return it but we ordered it to long ago. We would greatly appreciate our money back Amazon! I know fitbit is a nice brand and this is a nice product but I do not recommend this offer.
review_title: We contacted somebody from Fitbit and they told us it sounded like it was not charged

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It worked well and I really liked it......too bad it quit working 65 days later for no reason.  It would not charge.  Returns are accepted by Fit Bit up to 45 days.  Amazon's return period was exceeded so I will see if the credit card will provide some reimbursement.  If I am successful I will update this review. With that said it is still doesn't work and I'm out the purchase price.  Also don't forget that some people get a rash if it is worn too long - check the web site.  I suggest you consider another product.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My Fitbit has been a great addition to my lifestyle. I used to wear it 24-7 including in the shower. Just not swimming or in the tub. My Fitbit did stop working after almost a year. However, I give still give it a 5star review because their customer service has been great on multiple issues including sending me a new Fitbit when it didn't work anymore. They also helped me when I misread the directions and told me the correct way to use it. I no longer wear it in the shower so we will see how long this one lasts!
review_title: My Fitbit has been a great addition to my lifestyle

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm really happy with the app and tracking and look. The description didn't list that the clasp includes nickel, which I'm allergic to. In addition, I've owned it for almost two months with daily wear, but the reverse side of the band is already cracking from taking out the tracker to charge.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is my second Fitbit flex. My first was two years ago and the only reason I'm replacing it is due to a failing battery. I've used it daily for two whole years.Fitbit flex is simplistic and easy to use. It lacks a few features that the more expensive fitbits have, but for what this is, it's perfect.Step counter, water intake, food intake, weight and exercise tracker are great. Sleep tracker hasn't ever been really helpful for me.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I received my fitbit approximately three months ago.  Up until two days ago, I was in LOVE my flex.  It was holding me accountable, it was very accurate, and overall a very reliable product.  Fast forward 90 days.... I was so comfortable and so sure about the flex that this was my soley alarm to wake up in the morning.  I didn't get woken up the other morning... saw that my fitbit was dead, chalked it up to my fault.  I gave it a full charge, and seven hours later... my fitbit was dead.  Gave it ANOTHER full charge, took it off of the charger, now it doesn't work AT ALL.  I have tried to contact Fitbit customer service with no resolution.  VERY dissapointed in the product longevity and their lack of customer service to resolve issues such as these.  I will be ordering the Jawbone if I do not get a resolution or answer from Fitbit soon.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for my husband to replace an old Fitbit he had broken. He has stated, that've really misses having a display that indicates his step count and floors as well as the time. I didn't think the lack of a display would be a big deal because he has a smart phone that syncs with his Fitbit. He clarified that he doesn't want to have to pull out his phone and swipe a few swipes to get to the information.  The one improvement is the wristband. It is hard to get one but once it is snapped on, it stays. The monitor popping out of the holder is not an issue. He wears it in the shower mostly due to the difficulty in getting it on and off.  It's okay but I'd buy him a Fitbit 1 next time around.
review_title: Okay, but I like Fitbit One better.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So it worked for six months and then the battery stopped working. The company replaced it without a lot of grief. Six months later, the battery stopped again. The company offered 25% off, but they can't guarantee that it won't stop working again after six months. The app is great the device works great, but the battery sucks. If they could guarantee their battery I would take them up on the 25% off.... but as it sits today, I won't even buy it again at a discount... sad.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I LOVE my FITBIT. It works really well tracking both my activity and sleep. The band is a little difficult to clip on and off because you just press it on and if you like it to fit tighter, then you have to press against your wrist. It holds a charge for a few days so you don't have to charge it daily. The app allows you to challenge friends which keeps you motivated and keeps things interesting. I recommend one for anyone who wants to get active. It really helps motivate you to get moving.
review_title: Works well, gets you motivated to MOVE!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This just died after 4 months of working.I really fell in love with it too. It was very good for me to be monitored like it does.I learned that even though I THOUGHT I was getting sleep, I wasn't really!I also increased my exercise when I realized how far behind I really was.But unfortunately, just as some of the other reviewers report, it just dies.Not even six months!! It's a waste of $99 as far as I can see.I'll wait for them to work out the bugs and maybe try again.After all I also bought several extra wristbands!:-(
review_title: Would be nice if it lasted more than 4 months

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I picked the Flex because you can switch out the bands (which you can't do with the Charge HR). This does everything it says it should. I will say that the sleep tracker on it sucks, because you have to manually tell it you are going to sleep by tapping it, and then do the same thing when you wake up. I have 2 (young) kids, so I never really know if I'm falling asleep when I get into bed and can't remember to tap it when I wake up. I just don't use that function, so it doesn't bother me. However, if you want the automatic sleep tracking, you should pay the extra $$ for the HR.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I absolutely love my Fitbit. It connects to my fitness pal which I use for calorie counting. It counts all my movement for me and judges the calories I've burned. It tracks my sleep, which I find very helpful. This is a very simple model that is easy to manage and not too over complicated. I would have preferred to have one with the heart rate monitor as well, but this one covered all of my necessities perfectly without unnecessary things I wouldn't use. The band is rubber so it can get a little dirty and hard to clean, but a new band can always be purchased so that doesn't bother me. I truly love it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Good and bad.  It does take a bit of work/logging on your part to get it to really be accurate, but nothing can be totally accurate. Worst part is that it doesn't sync with Apple Health so I had to get ANOTHER app that it does sync with, Microsoft HealthVault, so I can store my BP, sugar, and other vitals. It's also not very accurate.  It picks up my motorcycle as walking, so I get 1k steps just driving to work, and friends got tons of stairs by riding a quad for the day. To bad you can't set a schedule so it knows when to ignore stuff and when to actually count. It does have a great battery though, I get a week easy.  But I love it despite the problems and will keep using it for a long time.
review_title: Great for helping with diet plans, if you want to log a bunch.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I use this device everyday the fitbit flex wrist tracker. I have been having a hard time to fall asleep and stay asleep.  Now i just proved this to my husband that I am not sleeping as much as he thought I was.  I wake up a lot and can't fall back to sleep actually I am very restless.  I can now track my steps and they are more accurate than the other trackers I have been using.  I have been using the Sportline trackers and they have not been very accurate at all.  I still carry one in my pocket just to see the difference and it does not track anything like the fitbit tracker.  I love the alerts that light up on the Fitbit to let me know when I have reached my 10,000 steps. I haven't set up the alarm to wake me up in the morning but will get to it soon.
review_title: The best invented activity tracker I ever had.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Wearing the Fitbit really motivates you to do more. Being able to see your steps in real time, and also participating in challenges with your other friends who have fitbits makes being more active fun and stimulates a little friendly competition. I also love that it tracks my sleep and how often I wake up during the night. I feel as though my overall health has improved since I bought this around the beginning of the year.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love it. My favorite part of this device is the dashboard that comes with it on my phone. I can see how many steps I take a day/converted into miles. The device emails you when you reach a total "marathon" distance (all miles combined). Another piece of the dashboard I like is the weight loss. You can set a goal weight you want to reach. As you lose weight and update it in on your dashboard, your AP tells you how many more pounds need you to lose to hit your goal. It's exciting to see it go down. Recommend this devise to all my friends who are interested in getting fit.
review_title: Love it. My favorite part of this device is ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I didn't want to spend the money, but the steps are WAY more accurate than my app on my phone and the battery lasts about 4 days.  The vibrating feature when you reach your step goal is a nice touch.  It's like a little "good job!"Updated 12/28/15:My flex stopped charging so I contacted Fitbit Customer Service through the app.  They gave me suggestions to see if it would charge and when it didn't, they made getting a replacement painless!  I had two positive customer service experiences in a row.  I hardly knew what to do with myself!
review_title: The vibrating feature when you reach your step goal is a nice touch. It's like a little "good job

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Flex does not count steps so much as jarrings. It overcounts my steps by quite a bit. There is no systematic way to fix this for restless people such as me. It is not always easy to communicate with the flex via tapping: for example, you must wait for an alarm to finish vibrating before you can respond to the alarm to turn it off. The one-to-two seconds of tapping to change the sleep mode is somewhat arbitrary in its response.The other thing is that it is only as good as the software system that backs it up. The software estimates my calories burned at significantly higher than my weight loss every week despite my keeping a thorough food diary. The software never introduces a factor to make the feedback from the Flex and the food diary line up. It cannot 'learn' over time.
review_title: It performs, but does not excel.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have used the Weight Watchers Activity Link, multiple pedometers and the apps such as Map My Walk -- the Fitbit Flex is the one solution that seems to work for all my needs.First, I am not going to lose it or put it in the laundry or forget to wear it -- it's on my wrist 24/7, even in the shower.Second, it tells me how long and how well I'm sleeping. That's something I never had help with before, and it's a revelation!Third, the Fitbit Dashboard and Log put all the important metrics right in one place - steps, sleep, calorie counting, food log and even a journal. And there is an app for my Droid that gives me the key info any time, any place.Fourth, I love the buzzer,  progress-tracking lights, email alert when the battery is low, silent morning wake-up alarm and the general coolness of how it looks.Finally, it's one of the only ways to track the walking I do on my treadmill desk - averaging 1.0 to 1.5 mph. I can keep that pace up for hours while I work on the computer, talk on the phone and manage my business. This has accelerated my weight loss, fitness and general sense of well-being immensely. Other pedometers don't catch the slow-walking very well, if at all.This is the best $100 I have spent on myself in years!
review_title: It totally keeps me on track!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Couldn't get the damn gizmo on by myself (and not wanting scolding glances asking husband) I thought about how can I get the plastic catch, to CATCH. A thin ruler slipped behind my wrist, gave the right amount of solid something to push the catch on. It works.I'll review more as time passes but wanted to share my trick (at least). The plastic catch is tricky. As I had to take from the large band, to put on the small, I knew that. But there is a way. And like many "skills" I imagine I'll get better at it over time.As for set up. Not totally intuitive, but close. As soon as I put in the dongle into the PC it began to run. So isn't too hard and there is a product guide online for anal types like me, who like to read at least parts of them.
review_title: Early days, but got a trick to put it on

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Purchased the flex a month a go and have been using it daily since. I have been happy with it until today. First, I have been trying to lose weight and with the information this provides, it has helped me to be more concious of what I eat and how active I am.First off, this is not magic device that will guarantee you lose weight. It provides information and the motivation, the determination comes from you.It tracks your activity level (number of steps - not stairsteps climbed though) to a reasonable degree of accuracy. I took a short walk with phone in one hand and the fitbit flex on the other. The counter increased for every step I took, walking, running and jogging. I'm sure its not 100% accurate but maybe with 5% margin for error.You can interact with the fitbit by taps or a bluetooth smart phone (Apple or Android) or through your PC via the included USB dongle.Two taps on the flex activates up to 5 white led lights to show how much of the goal you set has been achieved for the day, 20% per led light. This can be set to display goals through the app - calories burned, steps taken, distance traveled etc.  The flex vibrates when you achieve a daily goal.By steadily tapping it 5x, the lights flash to indicate it is starting to track your sleep pattern (you can initiate this through your phone too). Although I keep forgetting to do this and I am not really interested in tracking my sleep. The few times i tried it though, I got data about my restless times and time I woke up during the night. Don't know what to make of it or what use it is for though.One of the features I love is the vibrating alarm. Set it on your phone and the flex will vibrate at the correct time to wake you and not the person beside you. Great for couples who have to be up at different times and an alarm clock/phone is an unwelcome intrusion into your partner's sleep.  For the guys who had to get up earlier than their girlfriends, the fitbit is worth it if just for saving you from a sleep deprived PMS induced rage a couple of times a month.There is a meal tracker built in the app and it has a pretty extensive database plus the ability to input custom food. Input what you eat from there so the app can compare your calories eaten and burned - the flex tracks the burned calories and is synced to your phone. I have been targeting a calorie deficit of around 1000 calories a day. It is still a hit and miss affair - I love to eat and I can't believe how many calories there are in a pizza. But with this info i have shed 10 lbs since I started using this.Now the bad part, I obviously love my flex but the strap broke after a month. The transparent window for the fitbit flex lights separated from the rubber/silicone strap. I am not an overly active person. I used it in the gym once - to track the distance traveled it measured vs the treadmill (it was within 1/10 over a 3km run). And I took the fitbit device out maybe 4 or 5 times for charging. So I am a little pissed it's broken. The thing that grinds my gears though is the replacement straps are on back order on the fitbit.com website, 8-10 weeks and some jerk is selling them at USD100 for a 3pack here at amazon vs USD30ish for 3 from fitbit.I hope instead of sending me a large AND small strap with the flex (i ordered large) they should have sent me 2 large straps. At least I can still use it while waiting for the back ordered replacements.UPDATE: Fitbit emailed me after I placed my order in their website for the replacement straps to confirm it in line with their security policies.  i requested them to cancel it since the 8-10 week waiting period is too long for me as I have located a local seller carrying the strap and I sent them photos of my damaged strap just to show them the issue and hopefully address it in future versions of the product.  They offered to replace the strap without me requesting, demanding or even hinting for it.  Kudos to Kate and the rest of fitbit.com's support team.  I am adding another star for the hassle free interaction with fitbit support.  Hopefully the other star will be added if and when the future straps holds up to daily use.4 stars for functionality but I am taking off 2 stars due to durability issues and difficulty in getting replacements. I updated the review to 3 stars to give credit to the fast response by the fitbit.com support team.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The description made this product sound too good to be true and I was really excited.....then super super disappointed when I realized all it is, is a fanciful disguised pedometer. The description pretty much makes it sound like it is also a heart rate monitor. But it is not, you track your exercise online, and its based on a data bank, not actually how hard or how little you were working. But you can do this on your own, you don't need the fit bit.I guess if walking lots of steps a day was your goal (and you didn't) want to see the number as you progressed this would be fine. (It also tracks you waving your arms around as steps), if your into that. But for people actual trying to access the intensity of their workout, making sure they are elevating their heart rate to a fitness level, and tracking calories much more accurately this is not what you are looking for.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I absolutely love my fitbit flex!  I was so happy when I found out it would track my sleep patterns.  I knew I woke a lot during the night but was amazed when I seen just how much.  I love that it's waterproof and the battery lasts a really long time so it doesn't require constant charging.  The alarm feature is great too as it calmly brings you out of sleep instead of an annoying alarm clock that scares you out of sleep.  Definitely recommend!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It knows if I am sleeping.  It knows if I'm awake.  And it certainly knows if I've been bad or good!  I've had the Fitbit for a few months and I've lost 10 pounds.  This may not sound like a lot, but once I hit menopause, my weight only went up, not down.  The support staff at Fitbit are, well, I'll be polite and say, interesting.  If you have a question about the Flex, I found better answers on Facebook than from support.  As for ordering the Fitbit, don't order from them directly.  You might need Amazon's very cool return policy.  I bought the scale directly from Fitbit. The first one malfunctioned immediately.  Took a lot of persuasion to get Fitbit to send me a new one.  But at $9 a pound for my weight loss so far, it's worth it.
review_title: I call this my Santa Claus bracelet.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I lost my first Flex, and got this one but the charge doesn't seem to last as long on this new one, and it has trouble staying connected to the bluetooth which was not a problem with my first Flex.  It works, but is more trouble than my first one.
review_title: I lost my first Flex, and got this one ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: These units have a one-year warranty, and it's no coincidence. Just a month outside of warranty range, my Flex stopped turning on once I took it out of the charging cradle. Called up Fitbit support, and they won't replace it, but hey, they'll give me a 25% off coupon for a new one! Oh good! That's exactly what I want to do, spend more money on your defective products!When I spend $100 on a product, I expect it to last longer than 1 year. I also expect more than a discount on future products if it completely craps out just outside of the warranty period.DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT unless you only need it to last a year.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I impressed myself with how much distance I do at work in an airport. To double check myself I wore this in my pocket a few times and still go really close to the same results. My concern was the unit used my hand motions to calculate my steps. In my pocket it shouldn't do that and so it was pretty close to same results. It has minor issues when I try to set it for my sleep time since it doesn't always seem to register. I like being able to track my calories, fluids etc and all the information on my web page it gives you. I also like the email booster alerts when you do really good with your goals. Luckily, my unit was the model that had the wrist band issues. Pretty much wear mine 24/7.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: After 3 months the charging started to fail. You had to hold the unit in the charger or tape it in to get it to charge. If you follow the detailed instructions on their website on how to clean the unit you can get it working again temporarily. It then started to fail after fully charging requiring several resets. I think the charging cable is designed poorly, there are hundreds of charging complaints on their website and Customer Service is now assisting me but I think they are overwhelmed. I will update based on their response, going on 3 days with no tracking.FitBit responded and are sending a new FitBit!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love this! It works great! It works best when used in conjunction with the FitBit app, so that you can keep track of your steps in real time. I also use it in conjunction with the My Fitness Pal app, as they work together, so that when you get more steps in, my fitness pal will adjust your calorie limits for the day. Several on my friends also have fitbits, and we "compete" with each other for most steps in a day, week, etc.  They all love it.  I also really like tracking my sleep. Can't say enough good things about this, I recommend it to everyone!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had the Fitbit for about 4 months now, and I was suprised how accurate it is.  I am not in the best of shape and my job entails a lot of sitting.  Having the fit bit on my wrist reminds me to get up and walk around to reach my goal of 10,000 steps a day.  I love the fact that you can link your MyfitnessPal app into it to track you food intake against calories burnt.As for Cons, it is starting to have problems syncing with my iPhone to update.  When I bought it it synced pretty fast. I may contact Fitbit to see if there is a fix to this or a faulty tracker.  Some nights when I set it to track sleep, I try to upload results in the morning and they are missing. Outside of these random cons I enjoy my device and I am sure as new versions come out it will only get better.
review_title: Not a perfect but great motivator to move around in a seditary world.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love this thing.  It tracks your paces and sleep patterns and helps you keep track of how much you move (or don't) on a 24 hour basis.  It is very motivating.  You set your goal for the day and its little lights light up at each fifth of the way there.  It then buzzes when you've reached your goal.  You can also set alarms and i use it to wake up in the morning.  Traveling?  No problem.  You can reset the time zone on your Iphone (or other device - read the website to find out which ones.)  I prefer the band but there are also a couple of clip models.  The charge lasts me 4-5 days but it is quick to recharge with a little gadget that has plugs into a USB port.I strongly recommend this for getting off the sofa and moving!  It also motivates me to walk at my half hour lunch, not sit at the computer and work through it.  You won't regret this purchase!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Well, I liked it at first. But after several days of using it, I had issues with it syncing to my iPhone and computer. I reset it, and it worked. Then just a couple days later it stopped syncing again. Now it won't sync at all, even after doing all the troubleshooting Fitbit says to do. Now it's useless. I found out there are many in the Fitbit community having this same problem. I'd like to know when Fitbit will fix the Flex for all of us who gave them hundreds of dollars (some people buying multiples), all for nothing.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I spend a ton on Amazon and I rarely write reviews.  I love this product, easy to use, great app, great silent alerts, great battery life (at the beginning).  But there is something seriously wrong with it.  I used Nike fuel for 3 years and every year they would pack up and I would have to buy a new one, but at least I got a year.As an aside I read recently 80% of fitness bands end up unused within a month of purchase!  I don't fit the profile I use my bands.Anyway in about 6 months I have been through 3 fitbits I'm on my 4th today, I have only had to buy one and Amazon or Fitbit just replace them for free.  But that's really bad right?  They get the great reviews while people have them as novelties, but their failure rate is huge!!!I do 10k to 15k steps a day nothing excessive at all.I just ordered the purple charge HR, I hope it's better!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Really liking my Flex so far. I've had it for about 3 weeks now, and I have no complaints! I've used it daily for the alarm and sleep mode, and its been really neat to see how many steps I take in a day. For days when I'm barely hitting 5000, it encourages me to get outside and at least go for a walk. I do a lot of ice skating as well, so it's cool to see the distance around the lake, and I try to beat my time around each lap.My only complaint is that the teal band gets dirty really quickly, I think just from stuffing my hands into the pocket of my black jacket. I'll probably end up purchasing a darker band. But as for the device itself, its pretty great.I also ordered this from Western Canada, and it arrived really quickly, just over a week.
review_title: so it's cool to see the distance around the lake

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I very much like my Fitbit.  It doesn't do all of the things that some of the more recent styles do, but it's perfect for me.  I've had it a few years now and at first I tracked my food intake, but found that too time consuming for me. HOWEVER, what I originally and still do want it for is tracking my sleep and weight. It works well for me and I am very happy with that. Occasionally I have some difficulty getting it to sync, but then I try it at a different time of the day and it syncs. To some it's a glorified pedometer, but I am very happy with it!
review_title: Not high tech, but great for me!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have been using it for about 1 week now.  Overall, it's ok.Pros:  I like it from the perspective that it is a wristband.  It is small, sporty and looks like a bracelet.  It is slim-lined and not bulky like other activity monitors.  It syncs to my iPhone, iPad and my pc easily and WIRELESSLY (love this function).  The dashboard is easy to read and understand.  You can enter in any activity to the dashboard that the Flex does not monitor (which really is anything other than walking/running).  Provides good information on your sleep patterns.Cons: In regards to "Active" minutes...it only tracks walking/running. And it all honestly, not that accurately.  (I have noticed that I will be doing cardio for 40 minutes at the same intensity and it will only log 32 minutes...not sure where the fall off is to this problem.)It does not track biking, climbing stairs (which we all know is much more intense than just walking quickly), not swimming,  (even though the Flex is submersible to 10m) and not weight training.  This is where I am disappointed. It really is an electronic pedometer.  This is where Body Media beats the Flex.  I don't love the bulkiness of the Body Media unit but when it comes to my activities and burning calories, etc. I want to see how hard I am working and getting accurate reads.I haven't really used the food log portion of the dashboard, but I do like the sleep information.  Again, Body Media provides the same.  I read reviews of the UP and wasn't convinced it was any better than the Flex, so...back to the drawing board.  I suppose I might just use my Body Media when I am working out to get an accurate read of my workouts.**If you do decide to purchase the Flex, the armband is NOT difficult to close as reported on other reviews.____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________Latest update:Charge seems to be holding after a 12+ hour charge.  * at least that is what it seemed like a day ago. Back down to 1/2 again.I am still not impressed with the Active minutes tracking.  My husband and I rode bikes for 3 hours on and off over the weekend...how many active minutes it logged?  0.  I even attached it to my shoe to see if it would register, but it did not.  I did do Zumba yesterday and it did log my steps and activity accurately.Update:  So now I have charged it for the first time and although the lights on the device showed fully charged, when I sync it shows as 1/2 charged.  I saw another review that stated that after a week it wouldn't hold a full charge.  I am going to try to charge a full 12 or more hours and see if it becomes fully charged and lasts for 5 days.  I will update again with the results.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very disappointed in my Fitbit Flex. I was really enjoying it until it just stopped working less than two weeks after I bought it. My suspicion is that these devices are not as waterproof as they claim to be as it broke right after I washed my dog in the sink. $100 is a lot of money to put down on a faulty device. I'm just lucky that it happened before the Amazon return policy was up.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This has proven to be a great aid on reaching my goals for weight loss. I have not reached my goal as of yet as I writing this review but I've certainly made progress. If the FitBit is used in the intent it’s meant for and combined with other measure devices there is no way it won't help. I use it along with My Fitness Pal app which I use to monitor and log my eating habits. The two programs are able to link and share information with each other in order improve the accuracy of measurement. To get a better more accurate reading on your step counter you will need to adjust the settings and set it to be used on your dominate hand, but place the bracelet on your non-dominate hand. Doing this will give you a better count to the amount of steps and activity for the day. There is no easy way around weight loss and we can all use every tool available to help us get it done. This is one of those tools. It’s not going to drop the weight for you by putting it on. But if you use it honestly you will see the improvements come.
review_title: Great tool to use in your prosuit of weight loss

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm only giving this four stars for one reason, the FitBit Flex with its wrist band seems to count extra steps.  It seems a bit inaccurate and doesn't reflect my actual steps taking or walking.  See my review on a FitBit Flex accessory for using this with your shoe.  I like the sleep tracking feature (which you do need the wrist band for) and the phone app and tracking with FitBit online makes this a nice activity tracker.  I think the battery needs a bit of work.  I have to recharge this about every 4 days.  If it would go for a week or 2 weeks at a time, would be much better.
review_title: I like the sleep tracking feature (which you do need the ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fitbit flex. It can be worn in the shower or swimming. The battery can last 4-5 days. Recharging is quick too. One of the great features of the fitbit is challenging other fitbit users. It can really up your game. The sleeping feature is cool too. You do not have to set it sleep mode. It will actually detect when there is inactivity and begin registering sleep mode. I bought another band for a more feminine look.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had my fitbit since Christmas and my daughter who lives miles from me is one of my fitbit buddies. We bought this one for my sister (her Aunt) for her birthday in June and she's already become one of our most challenging competitors. Great quality. No problems whatsoever since I got mine in December (except a little struggle with loading the software on my older Android Smartphone). Works great on my new Droid Turbo. The motivation, if you use it the way it is designed, is incredible. I have never felt better (I turned 60 in Feb) and it keeps me in contact with my family. Love it.
review_title: I Just Love My Fitbit Flex!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have really mixed feelings right now about my fitbit flex. It worked great for a long time but now it charges but seldom syncs. When it syncs it tells me I haven't done anything which is further from the truth.I am now frustrated beyond belief as now, not only is it not tracking my activity; it is not charging. Fitbit.com keeps telling me to push the reset button on the dongle, but there isn't one - my feelings have gone from a stellar 5 to about to wish there was a negative.I also owned two of the Ultra's - one I lost, one went through the wash so I have been a Fitbit user for quite some time.
review_title: Fitbit flex is now not only not working but not charging.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had my Flex over 9 months  now and continue to be impressed by it. For me, it's a more accurate way to track my daily activity as well as a way to motivate myself. It is not a flawless way to track your steps or your sleep, but it is fairly accurate and is a vast improvement to my previous lifestyle where I had no idea how much activity I was really getting in a day. The app and computer dashboard are easy to navigate and simple to put in new goals and data and it syncs well to both the wireless dongle and to my phone. What I really love is that even if I am without internet access for a few days it still stores all of my activity data and syncs once I return to a computer or bluetooth range.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have really enjoyed my Fitbit.  It has become my personal challenge to get to get in my 10,000 steps each day.  I have also been good about logging my food.  I like how it automatically calculates proteins, carbs & fat.  It has encouraged me to eat better and move more.  It does not sync with my iphone because I still have a iPhone 4, so I just sync on my computer, which is fine.  There have been a couple of times when it did not track my exercise miles correctly but that could be because my cell phone does not have a good GPS signal.  The sleep monitor is interesting.  Very comfortable and I wear it all the time.
review_title: I have really enjoyed my Fitbit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fitbit!  I love the simplicity of it...you set up your account with your goals and periodically tap it throughout the day to check your progress.  It's comfortable to wear and it keeps me focused on meeting my fitness goals.  There are other devices that may be more accurate because you wear a heart rate monitor...but I sure didn't want to wear one of those all day.  This seems accurate and consistent with my daily activities.  I did have a problem with charging it after a couple months (I've had it since December) and I emailed the customer service and they are a great company that stands by their product...they had a new one in the mail to me within a week!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am immensely frustrated with my Fitbit. Most people on here at least got a month or so of function out of theirs, I got a whopping one charge before the same exactly problems with the battery started happening. It won't hold a charge for longer than a few hours tops - often times I have to charge it multiple times in a day just to get the data it provides. I love the information it has the capability to provide to you - however with it being so absolutely nonfunctional most of the time the data I get pretty much doesn't exist. I have already cleaned the contact points and switching the USB port it is charging in only added about 3 hours onto its life. I have yet to reset but I fully intend to when I can - but I already see the pattern that has formed and will never again purchase a Fitbit flex.
review_title: Battery's slow and agonizing death started after 1 charge.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex Wristband is an ideal product that has many features. It can track fitness goals, calorie intake and outtake, sleep patterns, or amount of steps taken during a day. The Fitbit Flex is durable, water resistant, convenient, and comfortable to wear.DurabilityThe Fitbit Flex wristband is made of a rubber material, which works well for the people who move around and may be using their hands a lot. The rubber material also helps protect against water damage, so after a sweaty workout or at the end of day when you are ready to shower, you don’t have to worry about wasting time and taking the Fitbit off. It would be useful for working out in the rain as well.ConvenienceFitbit has an app that can be downloaded on any smartphone or can be accessed through a computer. If you are not able to access the app, don’t worry because you can just tap the wristband and LED lights will blink to let you know how your daily progress is going. The Fitbit comes with two different bands that you can change as often as you would like. There are also several colors you can choose if you would like to match the wristband with your clothing.ComfortWearing the Fitbit Flex wristband is very comfortable. The rubber material is soft and it moves as your body moves. This product is breathable and lightweight. It’s also not a wide wristband so it will not take up a lot of space around your wrist and it allows you to wear it comfortably while you sleep. The Fitbit Flex is equipped with a silent alarm that can be set for any time. It silently vibrates to wake you up comfortably and it will not disturb anyone else that may be around.The snaps on the wristband do unsnap sometimes causing it to fall off sometimes. Overall, this product is a great buy for a fair price that includes many features.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I ended up returning this fit bit for personal reasons. It didn't make sense to me to just have a tracker that literally just counts your steps and really wasn't making a difference in my personal life. If you're the type of person who gets motivated by small goals are just constant reminders and this is definitely for you. I don't want to give this product a bad review just because it wasn't for me. The one thing that I am going to miss about it that I thought was really cool was that it kind of has this simple vibration that I wasn't expecting and it was really nice because you can set an alarm to wake you up with it. Like I said not a bad product just not for me. What I cannot say enough about is how fast the shipping was. I ordered this product in a probably around one and literally had it delivered to me the next day by noon. Great shipping.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought mine 11 months ago, August 2014.  I started having issues with it locking up needing to be reset regularly a few weeks ago.  Then I would get an alert that the battery was nearly dead, but when I would put it in the charger, it would have nearly a full charge.  To date, the device itself is fairly accurate.  But today, it's completely dead.  If you purchase one, keep in mind that this is disposable tech.  I doubt I will buy a new one or a more advanced one as the novelty has worn off.
review_title: I bought mine 11 months ago, August 2014. ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got a FitBit as a gift a few months ago and so far am pretty pleased with the device. I work in a job that involves a lot of sitting and this was definately a wake up call in terms of how little moving around / exercise I was getting during the day. Since getting the FitBit, I've definately increased my level of physical activity. Having the "friends" feature also helps you stay motivated since you can track your progress against your friend group - don't want to be the last one every week :)The setup is pretty simple and it's nice to be able to do a quick track on the band itself while also being able to get more detailed stats via the app or the website.Overall a good product to keep yourself accountable in terms of working out / physical activity.The only con I can think of right now is that it is not ideal for tracking all types of activity. One of my big workouts for the week is spinning which is not captured on the band since your hands are not moving. If the majority of your physical activity does not involve walking or running (e.g. bycycling, weights, etc) then perhaps this isn't the best monitoring tool.Caveat: I don't have experiences with other competitors e.g. Jawbone, etc so I can't comment on how it compares.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My daughters gave me my flex for Father's Day 2014, and I would be lost without it- Logging my sleep is the first thing I do in the morning, and checking my steps for the day is the last evolution at night.  I appreciate the weekly summaries and the periodic awards- My last was the Great Barrier Reef award for 1600 cumulative miles.  It's a great silent motivator to keep moving.  I walk the dog  enthusiastically now. Most days.A very nice feature for me is the way my Fitbit lets me know how the everyday evolutions of life add up to a lot of steps. After all, isn't that what life is all about?
review_title: Change your life one step at a time.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fitbit has phased out this flex so they are not supporting tracker replacement. This unit has to be charged every night. Though I don't want to since I have invested in a lot of different bracelet tracker holders (won't be usable with the flex 2), I'll need another fitness tracker. Going to look at other companies as totally disgusted and frustrated by this situation. Not a friend of Fitbit any longer.
review_title: Going to look at other companies as totally disgusted and frustrated by this situation

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Wear it all day, and love it.  Never knew how much I (didn't) walk until I started monitoring.  Challenge with friend keeps me at my goal of 10,000 steps a day - sometimes a bit more.  I don't wear it at night, since sometimes my arm is itchy from all the sweating I do during the day and think it is better to take it off at night. Hate to have it off when I walk!  Wish I could track swimming and other things but this is great - and maybe - if I keep it up, I will even upgrade to one with a heart monitor.  It really keeps you going!
review_title: and love it. Never knew how much I (didn't) walk ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really love my Fitbit.It fits comfortably on my wristThe screens with the stats are easy to understandI love the silent alarmThe downside is that the Fitbit comes off your wrist easily. It fell off my wrist with the first 7 days of wearing it. I eventually obtained an O ring and placed it on wrist wear the two ends come together. it worked great for a couple weeks. This week, my Fitbit fell off my wrist 3 times. I fortunate enough to find it nearby. A family member was not so lucky. Her's came off in a heavily traffic area. She could not find it.
review_title: Review of the Fitbit Flex Wireless

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've been using this for a couple of weeks now and I'm really liking it. It's lightweight, I can shower in it and I think the numbers are accurate.The thing I like the MOST about this is the SLEEP feature! I wanted to know what my sleep habits were, and this has given me a snapshot of how HORRIBLE I sleep! This confirmed what I suspected: I'm restless and not getting enough sleep.Overall I give it four stars. I would give it a FIVE if this device could tell me the TIME. Other than that, it's doing exactly what I bought it for.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought two of these on Father's Day and we jumped right in to getting more fit. The charger for them is bit "big" so you need to make sure it's in there good. The wristbands are a bit on the fragile side so don't rip the tracker out of them caveman style. (Don't bend it!) Do it carefully. Clean your charger and tracker with alcohol wipes to keep them working properly. Mine completely stopped charging and I cleaned it with alcohol wipes and BOOM! Fixed. Take care of your stuff and you should have no problems. Had ours over a year already and they changed our lives.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I received my Fitbit and the first few days were wonderful. I charged it once and never wore it in the shower but it started having trouble syncing to my phone and my computer. I followed instruction via the product website and reset it. It hasn't worked since. I was skeptical about spending over $80 because of the mixed reviews and I wish I would have listened to my gut. The idea is a great one but the quality of the product does not match the idea. I will try again but this time with a different brand.
review_title: Idea is great but quality not so much

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've been struggling with trying to get into shape. I just couldn't find the incentive to get into shape. Well, Fitbit Flex gave me that incentive. Who would think getting a happy face :) because I made my step goal, or my mile goal, or my exercise goal for the day! I actually will walk up and down my drive if I haven't reached my 12,000 steps for the day...I know, it isn't logical but it works. I don't always keep track of sleep, but it is a nice feature when I'm having trouble sleeping...sort of gets me in a "lets figure this out" mood. I love the Fitbit, and 4 of my friends now have one. We'll all be so fit in a few months, woo hoo!
review_title: Great if you need something to give you incentive

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great product. Great customer service. Very satisfied with the product. Now the product sync to most newer android platform which is great for me. My fitbit battery was getting bad and won't charge up probably. I cleaned the charging tip with cotton swap and toothpick. I contacted the customer service when the online support help was exhausted. They checked my account and immediately sent a replacement out. Great product to track activities, sleep and simple to use. I seldom have to worry about syncing the device. Between fitbit apps on my phone and the wireless in my desktop, it sync automatically. Integrates to myfitnesspal.com

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The product was a pain to charge once a week and you have to remember to put it into sleep mode when you go to sleep or it does not record it. It should do this automatically.  But my biggest complaint is that it quit working after 1 year and 1 week (ya, one week out of warranty) and their customer service was absolutely horrible.
