You would think that they would stand by their product but they did not.  I received it for my birthday from my two little girls and a few days after my next birthday it stopped working.  I will NEVER buy a Fitbit product after dealing with the customer service person that I dealt with!!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This saddens me to write a bad review because the actual technology behind this product is really great.  But the band is awful.  I bought my first one in June and sometime in September on a day that I wasn't doing anything special it fell of my wrist - I took that one as my fault and decided maybe I didn't clasp it correctly.  I ordered a new one and had it for about 2 weeks before it also disappeared this weekend while I was raking leaves - that's exactly the type of activity I need this thing to monitor.  That's $200 down the drain.  I've also had a fuelband and while I didn't like the way it tracked as much there was NO WAY that thing was coming off unless I took it off.  DO NOT order this product unless they fix the bands or you duct tape it on.Pros - The technology is great.  Loved tracking my food and calories with my activity.  I especially loved the vibrating alarm because it allowed me to set an alarm without waking up my husband.  I also liked adding my friends with bands and the competition.Cons - The bands stink.  They are hard to get on at first but then just not secure enough so I lost TWO of them.  Also related to the band - you take the bit in and out so I wore one of them out in less than 2 months and had to get a new one (customer service was great about it - but 2 months?  That's crazy)  Given the advanced technology and cost of this I feel like it's like putting a diamond in a aluminum setting - it's cheap and your going to lose your gem.
review_title: Don't buy until they fix the band - I've LOST TWO of them

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!I started having problems with it charging at 6 months. Now it won't charge at all. Contacted FitBit and they got me to try a few other things. I ended up buying a fitness tracker from another maker which charges just fine. I've tried cleaning contacts, but it totally quit charging about a month ago. It was cool while it worked, but I wouldn't recommend my worst enemy spend money to get it! Spending this money for about 9-10 months use, and having to fight the charger constantly is a waste of money!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had my Flex since mid-December and my biggest complaint is that there doesn't seem to be any "how to" instructions easily found and some of the pre-packaged questions/answers are way more complicated than most of us need.  My step goal is different depending on which screen I'm viewing and I have just finished another email to customer support.  They fortunately are pretty easy to work with.  My other issue would be the band is always loose on my wrist and flops and spins when I am trying to do something with my left hand. The band is the smaller one that came with the device and is as tight as it can be. I think the problem is the module and display is wider than my wrist, but no matter how high it starts out it falls right down the first time I put my arm down.All in all though it is a lot better than most of the pedometers I've tried and I do find myself checking my progress thru the day and entering my sleep log every morning.
review_title: ... there doesn't seem to be any "how to" instructions easily found and some of the pre-packaged questions/answers are way ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the Fitbit Flex mainly for tracking my sleep. I have a lot of pain issues and wanted to have something to be able to show my doctor on how i thought my pain was affecting my sleep. This is exactly what my Fitbit has let me do.It is also something I can use to keep me on track with eating healthy.My own complaint is not being able to wear in the pool to track my exercise there. This is the only type of exercise I am allowed to do and it would be nice to have an accurate report on what I am doing.Overall I am very happy with my purchase.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love/like this little contraption. I just wish that it was a buckle clasp, it's fallen off at least 10 times and I lost it once at a concert. Luckly it was turned in! I also wish it was waterproof....otherwise, it tracks my activity & sleep. Fitbit has a great APP for tracking food as well for weight loss goals. I purchased the Fitbit scale which is synced to my Fitbit Flex. Yesterday I decided to up my "game" and purchased the Fitbit Surge, it's waterproof and won't fall off my wrist...among other great features.
review_title: Fitbit has a great APP for tracking food as well for weight loss ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought Fitbit Flex on Amazon back in June to replace the one I lost. I like it but the reason I only gave it three stars is because it does not track sleep. This bothers me so I'm going to have to get a different Fitbit. Maybe Flex 2.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I liked the Fitbit at first but then it stopped charging. I wrote to the company and it took them so long to get back to me. Then it just started to work again on it's own but that only lasted for about 3 weeks before it stopped charging again. It has never worked since then! Worst $100 ever spent; don't buy this crap! I had it for less than 3 months!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fitbit! As a nurse who uses both arms a TON I did find that it overcounted for me even though placed on my non-dominant wrist. I countered that by changing the setting to 'dominant' while leaving on the non-dominant side. This seems to have worked well. I have counted steps to the tune of 5-600 and found it highly accurate most of the time. Yes, in that 600 count trek it missed a handful of steps, the lighter steps at the start/stop points but given that it picks up heavy arm movements I'm ok with that. Besides, those heavy arm movements are likely lifting a 100k patient so credit for that is legit!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: -Bad wristband design. Bought two of these one was lost in the first 2 weeks. Wrist band comes loose. Need to buy after market bands to avoid  this from happening.-The second stopped working 5 weeks after purchase. Just did not come up again.-When talking to CS rep. My packaging box clearly specifies flex is water resistant and you can shower with tracker. That's not correct, she indicated new packaging does not indicate this and they don't recommend this.-Granted they will send me a new one, pretty much will have to keep their CS number on speed dial product is sooooo bad!!!! Do yourself a favor look at Garmin or Jawbone or Apple watch or Microsoft band.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit!  This is the second one I have purchased because my son swiped my original!  This item is perfect whether you have a little weight to lose, alot, want to maintain, or just want to keep track of your steps.  I bought my first Fitbit Flex 2 months ago.  Since I have had it, I have lost 27 lb!  It allows me to track the foods I eat, set goals, and track my sleep.  This has been a very powerful tool in my weight loss journey so far!  I still have a ways to go, but my Fitbit Flex makes the journey easier and more enjoyable!  I ordered this in teal, and it is a gorgeous, vibrant color!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I lost two of them in 6 months, 6 months!  I'm not irresponsible, I am just a very active person.  It's the design of the wristband.  The clasp is not a clasp.  There is no locking mechanism to keep it on, you're just hoping for the best. I can't tell you how many times the band just popped off for no specific reason. My bad, I was breathing, of course it would pop off.  If they fixed this, I'd give it 3 stars.  If they fixed the buggy software, I'd give it 4.5 stars.I must also mention that I had to get a replacement since there was an issue with the battery.  It just stopped charging. FitBit just needs to get thier act together and improve these core things about the device. The fact that they can't manage to make a functional band should be enough to stay away from the flex for now...if you can.On a positive note, I loved the fact that I could sync it with my Virgin Pulse account.  I also loved the idea of it, just throw it on and forget it.  I never took it off. You could get it wet and not even worry about it. Again the biggest problem was it took itself off....twice!!!Like a dummy, I will again pony up the $100 to get another one.  I need the flex to track my steps per day for Virgin Pulse.  Ironically I will use the $100 I get quarterly from Virgin Pulse to buy it.  I did notice that there are now locking mechanisms (not by fitbit) that you can purchase to hold the clasp on.  For anyone who is considering this device, purchase that lock!
review_title: I love it, yet I REALLY hate it too.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Unfortunately, there was not a single thing that this product did correctly. First off it is VERY difficult to get on. This is a poor product design which requires either soap or lotion to snap on your wrist. That was alright, I could deal with that so I set an alarm and went to bed. I was awoken by my backup phone alarm after my Fitbit silent alarm did not work (it was synced up properly prior to bed time). After looking at my phone app, I realized that my sleep cycle was not actually mapped so I had to take the time to research how to map it out myself. When I did, It said that I slept the entire eight hours and never woke up when in reality I woke up a minimum of three times. Finally, I wore the fitbit flex for seven hours while walking continuously at my job as a technician at an emergency veterinary clinic and only one hour before my eight hour shift ended did it register that I had walked 10,000 steps. For reference, that is the suggested number of steps everyone takes daily. There is no way that anyone is walking seven plus hours a day. Long story short, this product is a disappointment and none of its features work correctly. Get a one dollar pedometer and the free MyFitnessPal app and you will save 79 dollars and your time.
review_title: None of the Features Work Correctly

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is a great activity and sleep tracker. Once you properly set up your Flex, including stride length, the step counter is very accurate. The sleep tracking seems to be right on with what I actually remember from the night before, plus it tracks unconscious movement. I got my wife one also, and her sleep tracking is also right on with what she remembers from the night before. It also tracks my naps without having to turn on sleep tracking. There is a review saying you no longer need to turn on sleep tracking mode anymore, the Flex automatically knows when you are asleep. But I have not tried that at night.There are also a lot of bad reviews concerning Fitbit customer service, basically they suck at customer service, but as I have had the Flex for about a week, I have not contacted them... yet. I will update this review periodically.The app that you need to use with the Fitbit Flex is an awesome app. It's full of very useful info, and can keep you busy while you research your own activity and sleep. It's also safe. Almost every other app I've looked at, is based out of China, and asks for way to many permissions.  The only reason this does not get 5 stars, is the form of communication between your Flex and your phone, I'm talking about Bluetooth. I am a network engineer and know a significant amount about wireless security. Bluetooth is the most open form of wireless communication. In other words, it is extremely easy to hack. Less experienced hackers will just be able to see all of your fitness tracking and name. But the more experienced will be able to take control of your phone, not to mention see everything you have on your phone. Now it's important to say that newer phones have some form of protection from Bluetooth hackers, but leaving your Bluetooth on everywhere you go is still a little dangerous. There is nothing you can do about the signal coming from your Flex, but that is just your activity info. If you are going to be leaving your Bluetooth on your phone on, then you need to encrypt your phone. This can be done in the security section of your phone's settings menu. Also, make sure your Bluetooth discovery is turned off. The Bluetooth signal coming from your Flex, is a bubble about 20 feet in every direction around you, including through most walls. Keeping these things in mind will help, but always also keep in mind that any wireless communication can be hacked. Don't be paranoid about it because chances are you're not important or rich enough to be a target. But don't put it completely out of your mind either.  But overall, the Flex does exactly what it says it does. It is a great little tracker.
review_title: Great Tracker. Just keep in mind that it has Bluetooth. Encrypt your phone!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: After my gym membership, this is the most positive investment I have made in my health.  It tells me how many calories I burn in a day, so I can simply eat less than I burn.  I have lost 18 pounds in 6 months, solid progress in the right direction.  My goal is 12 more pounds by the end of the year and then keeping it off.  I know I can do this with the help of the Fitbit.  The only thing I would change is to make it waterproof.  If you can't make up your mind-get the Charge HR. Now that I see what a great gadget this is, I'm sorry I didn't .

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I wanted one of these little things for a long time and finally made the purchase a couple of weeks ago.  I bought one for myself and my wife.The Positives: Love the sleep tracking(It doesn't really track sleep but the time that you are motionless).  I find it to be pretty darn accurate.  When i feel like I've tossed and turned all night, it shows that but what I love is that it shows me that even though I woke up 14x, I was motionless for 7.5 hours which makes me feel better about my day.  It is motivating.  I find myself getting up and moving more just so numbers will look better.The Negative (reason for 4/5 Star Review): My wife's bracelet came off at some point while she was walking our dog and her fitbit was lost after 3 days so be sure that you check the clasp often.The good news for Fitbit, she was so disappointed about its loss, I bought her another.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was sooo jazzed to get my fitbit last year.When all I did was walk around the house & monitor my sleep, fitbit was a fun toy. Since I became slightly more serious about working out, I've been disappointed. The most difficult aspect is the accuracy of the steps/distance. Make sure that you nail your stride perfectly when you enter it into your fitbit profile on the website. Even then, their stated accuracy is 90%--WHICH I ABSOLUTELY CAN LIVE WITH--except I'm not seeing that kind of accuracy. All I want to see is the level of accuracy that they sold me on. After I questioned the functionality of my first fitbit and took the step test, they happily replaced it and the experience was very professional. I'm on my 2nd fitbit and it isn't much better.Lets look at the math (which I've reviewed with numerous reps at fitbit): 1 mile = 5280 feet. My pace is 2.25 feet per "step". This means that my fitbit should record roughly 2,346 "steps" per mile (5280/2.25). So my 3.5 mile workout should yield roughly 7,350 "steps" (5280*3.5=18,480; 18,480/2.25= 8,213 @ 90% =7,392) yet I'm always recording somewhere in the neighborhood of 6,500 steps.Today it recorded 6,142 steps and 2.92 miles for a 3.5 mile jaunt. I'm not doing any serious training so I've just accepted the gross inaccuracy and eventually I quit bothering fitbit customer service. I must say that they are very patient in customer service, although they don't always seem to be able to track customer history. If you don't mind purchasing an activity tracker that doesn't accurately measure your activity, I'm sure that you will enjoy the fitbit.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Other than the fact that this does NOT work, and is impossible to close on one's wrist, it is attractive.  Literature claims device will sync with computer within 20 feet; it won't even sync within 20 inches!  The bracelet must be placed within 1-2 inches of the USB port on your computer, which holds the device dongle, in order to sync.  Wish I had read the Forum on the Fitbit website before buying; many, many complaints about failure to sync!  Do not buy this device!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got a fitbit flex as a gift. I wanted to use it to track my steps and sleep.  A positive side effect was that it inspired me to move a bit more and make sure I got my zzzz's.I'm a busy working mother to an active needy toddler.Within a day of wearing my flex, the clasp kept coming undone.  I made sure to 'click' it into place, but it would still come loose.  It even came loose while sleeping a couple times. I've read raters blame users for the clasp coming undone, but I took extra special care to make sure it was secure.  It's still had a habit of coming undone.  This is a huge negative because I really don't have the time to constantly fiddle with the clasp to make sure it's secure when it frequently comes undone.The product is supposed to be designed encourage activity.Today, I was a rare day where I was able to run errands without my little one.  I loved the product because it hardly notice that it's there while I'm using it, but this time, I wish I noticed it more.Somewhere between errands, the clasp came undone and the flex fell off.  I'm so disappointed.  It was a gift, but so frustrating to use with the faulty clasp.I'm not sure I'd recommend it.
review_title: Product is great, IF it will stay clasped.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this as a birthday gift for my wife. She didn't want the more expensive Charge HR, and this one had the colored band option. However, it doesn't track bicycling unless she wears it on her ankle, it doesn't tell her anything unless she's carrying her phone, and overall, I think I blew it by not buying her the more expensive one like mine.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Summary: Don't but it. Stick with your smartphone.Cons:- Cheap plastic band easily breaks/deteriorates. This means you lose your device!- Battery life is too short, usually 2 days for me.- Inconvenient charger/charging process. They need to do wireless charging.Pros:- Sleek iOS app with simple graphs, and neat add-ons like counting water consumption.- Minimalistic design which only tells you what you need to know, "did you reach your steps today?"- Comfortable and light on wrist, barely noticeable.Detailed Summary:It's not worth it. The tipping point is the terrible band. Two of them have broken on me. I'm not buying or using another Fitbit Flex. I received the first one from work and I bought the second one as a replacement. I then bought another band from Etsy. That band broke too. Just use your smartphone. There's a bunch of free apps and even some apps integrated with the operating systems. Yes it will drain some battery but stop wasting money on a toy.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This fit bit is great I've had it for years I've never had any problems with it at all

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I admit that I am addicted.  I love checking out other people's numbers.  I love seeing how I have progressed in a few short weeks.  AND finally, after breaking nine bones in my foot, including four metatarsals almost two years ago, I am seeing some weight loss.  I am also regaining some flexibility. article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this when my Nike Fuel band developed (a few months out of warranty) a tear in the cover and Nike told me (1) they don't have repair capability and (2) it's toast buy another. article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very satisfied with my Fitbit Flex, unfortunately after six weeks of daily wear its battery died. So I am really missing out on the daily fitness reports that help me stay on track.On the negative side, Amazon no longer covered a return/replacement. But joyfully, after contacting Fitbit directly, Fitbit is replacing it free of charge, sadly I won't get the replacement for at least 10 days, wish they could have shipped as quickly as Amazon Prime.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black

I have had great luck and enjoy the tracking stats I get, but just about everyone else I bought one for had issues with either syncing or tracking accurate steps and have had to have there's replaced. Fortunately, customer service is pretty good. You have to wait a couple weeks for replacements, but they do come and they don't give you too much grief. review_title: I have had great luck and enjoy the tracking stats I get

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: was leery of dropping $100 on this but after reading some reviews and exactly what it does, decided to bite the bullet.  it's easy to set-up and sync the first time and every time thereafter.  the stats for steps, active minutes, calories burned are fairly accurate.  you have to input your food intake and be honest about the calories to gain any true benefit from the calories burned/calories taken in function.  the sleep function takes a little getting used (last night it said i slept for 34 minutes total after going to bed at 11:30pm and getting up at 5:15) as it tracks restlessness and times awakened, not quite sure how it knows but i do have it on the most sensitive setting and tend to toss and turn....other than that, the only downside is that if you use arc trainers at the gym or home (they're a combination stair stepper and eliptical) it won't track steps, active minutes or calories burned since your arms are stationary.  but you can input the time and calories burned so it's a wash in my opinion.if you're looking for just basic stuff this is the band to get and used in conjunction with mapmyrun, you can get quite a bit out of it.  if you're looking for more stats, gps tracking, etc.  go with nike or samsung but you'll pay a bit more.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: ....well......another reason to not blindly purchase "The Emperor's New Tech Gadget".....just because everyone seems to think this is "the best thing ever" does NOT MEAN YOU SHOULD BUY IT!!Apart form the fact that it is a VERY out-moded model of this type of product, battery is UNRELIABLE AND UNPREDICTABLE.I have spent many a mountain hike post-evaluation attempt, as well as level ground power-walk, only to find that my steps and distance travelled were NOT RECORDED......the unit only "syncs" sporadically, and, of course, does NOT take into account stairs and other inclines.There are many products of this type.....Don't do what I did and buy the first one you hear talked about....RESEARCH all companies and models!!....I should have known better.....
review_title: COMPARE ALL MAKES/MODELS BEFORE BUYING THIS PRODUCT!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The battery lasts from 4 days to a week usually. I keep my phone on continious updates so I think that drains the battery faster. It keeps track of everything pretty easily. The app is easy to use at some points and annoying at others. Overall the app is good though. I took off 1 star for the app being annoying when entering workouts, foods, etc. I took off another star because my band is breaking already. The back, where you put the sensor, has ripped on both sides.That said I still wear it every day and enjoy the "vibrate dance" the fitbit does when I hit 10k steps a day.
review_title: It keeps track of everything pretty easily. The app is easy to use at ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had my Fitbit Flex for about a week.  At first, I was fairly impressed when I actually counted my steps and compared it to the Fitbit calculations.  However, it can be very quirky and inaccurate under certain circumstances.  I have mine on my right wrist, and I am right-handed, so I made sure to set it to the "Dominant" wrist setting.  But, to get truly accurate readings, your arm really needs to be at your side.  If I'm carrying things around the house, I don't get an accurate count.  If I'm walking through the store, pushing a grocery cart, I don't get an accurate count.  It seriously under counts my steps.  I'd like to send it back and exchange it for the Fitbit One, which I have since heard is more accurate.  However, I didn't realize that Amazon only takes returns on unopened items, and otherwise charges a restocking fee.  And, I'm not sure this is defective.  I think it's just not accurate.  Should have bought this from a Brick & Mortar store.Edited 4/1/2014...Ok, I've been using my Fitbit for a few more days.  Today I was out for several hours and my step count was still really low as, described previously, I don't walk with my hands down at my side.  I'm usually busy doing other things.  I had contacted Fitbit regarding the problem, but the only thing they could say was that it compared to other wrist-trackers on the market....which isn't saying a lot.  I'd really like to return or exchange this thing, but can't.  When I got home this afternoon, and saw that my step count was again very low, I decided to try taking the Flex unit out of the wrist band and I put it in my pocket.  So far, that seems to give me a better step count.  Not sure how it will work that way with the other functions.  But, frankly, after using the Flex for over a week, I'm not confident in the accuracy of the other functions and will probably never use them.  There is an Omron brand clip-on that gets rave reviews.  Check that one out before you decide to buy the Flex.Edited 4/3/2014...I pursued my issues with Fitbit customer service, and this is what they said:  " Flex will count your steps when you're walking with your arms stationary, as we do want to give you credit for this activity. This includes walking while pushing a stroller or shopping cart, or holding on to a treadmill.  However, because your hands are not moving, your step count may be a bit lower during this activity."So, they have finally admitted the count is not accurate unless your arms are down at your side.  I do dispute the fact that it is a "bit lower."  My steps are hardly being counted at all, unless my arm is down at my side.  So, for this reason, I have now lowered my rating to two stars.  I did contact Amazon customer service and explained what was going on.  They are allowing me to return it, without restocking charges, because it is not working as intended.  THANKS AMAZON!!!
review_title: Doesn't work unless your arm is down at your side.....

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had this for over a year and had no issues with it. I love it and it keeps me motivated to get those extra steps and stay healthy. Highly recommended if you need that extra motivation. You can link up with your friends who have fitbits and encourage each other and participate in weekly challenges with them.It s sleek design makes it easy to wear all day, every day. I looked into other models/brands that had the displays but  I am so glad I opted for this version. It is simple and easy to use the fit bit app on my Iphone. LOVE< LOVE<LOVE

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have not been able to sync for over a month and I just bought this in September. Troubleshooting did not work, really bummed, I only used it for a little over a month. UPDATE 1-5-2016: I will say that for the time it did work it was awesome. However, my phone security kept warning me that Fitbit had access to my messages and contacts and I could not undo that option. Since my last post Fitbit support has contacted me and provided additional troubleshooting methods. But, I've already tried everything recommended on FAQs and, frankly, I'm tired of trying. I downloaded a fitness app to use for tracking so for now all is good. In their defense, they did offer to replace it but they wanted my contact information, address (which I provided) and phone no. (which I did not want to provide), and that's the last I heard. I am not sure if my not providing my phone no. will cause them to withdraw their offer. Hope this helps.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Disappointed in fitbit.  I couldnt believe I was actually getting the steps it was telling me and after awhile I learned I wasnt.  The technology is based on wrist movement, not steps.  For instance after sitting on a lawnmower for 5 hrs. I got 14,000 steps.  I got steps swinging in a hammock, packing boxes, fishing ...  Well, you get the picture.  I still gave it three stars as if you do the challenges,  it encourages you to move more.  Just keep in mind that its counting more than footsteps.  I dont know why they dont make them to go around your ankle.  Seems to me that would be more reliable.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Comes with absolutely NO instructions.  Gives you a website where you can access the manual.  But you need the name of the fitbit you purchased, which was anywhere on the material it came with just fitbit wireless activity, which phrase is included with several fitbits.  Why can't they send manual or some instructions.  Sorry I got this.  You really need to be computer  smart.  Now I got to find a kid to help me. .

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Generally speaking, I like the Fitbit Flex. It's comfortable to wear, waterproof, and seems to give an accurate account of your daily activity. However there is one serious flaw. It seems like they gave the design of the clasp mechanism over to a room full of 3rd graders, and asked them to design something sure to fail. I have to admit, I lost my first Flex somewhere in the airport in Las Vegas, and was naïve enough to order a second. I've had to recover it 5 times in the last week, as it's come unclasped. This is not a throw-away item, but they provided a throw-away grade clasp. What were you thinking, Fitbit? I would love to see them offer replacement bands with a clasp that's secure.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I log my data on my laptop every other day.  I charge the device once a week.  It has worked perfectly since it arrived.  I have lost 55 pounds by using the Flex to log my activity.  I check my progress at about 7 PM each night to see how much more I need to walk to reach my daily goal of 10,000 steps and 10 flights of stairs.  I excise more until I reach my daily goals.  The Flex lights up and vibrates when I hit my goals.  The dashboard on the web page for Fitbit takes my data and draws graphs which help me understand my daily workout. I recommended the Flex.
review_title: I wear the Flex all of the time, including the times when I take a shower and when I sleep.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is a terrible product and FitBit knows it. Both of the items I received were defective. They would not charge properly. I went online for more information, and there are people everywhere having the same issue.Additionally, it does not function in an intuitive way. There is no button on the device for off and on, you are supposed to press on it in a certain place. Many times it does not respond. A light doesnt stay on to tell you it is on. It is just a big mystery.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got this for my birthday. I'm a fluffy chick, and I use this to see exactly how active/inactive I truly am, and more importantly, the level and quality of sleep. After initially having some difficulties trying to figure out how to use it (I mean, do I tap gently? Do I bang it on th wall?), it's like second nature to use.  I wear it 24/7.Things I've learned: Working nights, I sleep like crap during the day. I also sit on my butt a lot.It gives me a light to show me where I'm at with my activity goals. My happiest day was getting 4/5 of my light lit up. Yay.
review_title: Put the fun back in functional.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: First, it's a very expensive step counter and that's about all it is, really. Tracking food is a pain unless you only buy and consume ready-made or restaurant made items. And if you are working in your health goals, chances are you are trying to eat actual food.  Second, the band is extremely difficult to work and to get on. It's really frustrating and it's not well-made. I lost mine within two weeks if purchase because the fastener came loose. There goes $75. I would not buy this again.
review_title: First, it's a very expensive step counter and that's ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm very competitive, especially with myself, so the Fitbit Flex's charts and graphs are a great way for me to get an up-to-the-minute assessment of how I'm doing with my daily goals. The wristband itself is very comfortable and I have had no problem with the clasp (although I did take the advice I read from others and clasped and unclasped it several times before putting it on my wrist for the first time). On my first day of use, I mistakenly thought that the lights would come on and stay on as I achieved new levels throughout the day but I quickly figured out that the light display requires a double tap. Not a big deal and much less distracting than lights that stay on constantly, but the pictures always show it with the lights lit up so that's what I expected. I recently bought the accessory set of three wristbands in different colors so I can swap them out to go with different outfits because I don't intend to be without this thing!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got one for Christmas, liked it so well I bought one for my husband's birthday.  We're both hooked and wear them constantly. Really has helped me be aware of my steps. Now I park farther from the doors, and make extra trips around the house to run up my score. I've actually lost weight just paying attention to my daily activities. Prefer this version to the nicer one with the watch function as I can get it wet so don't even need to remove it when I bathe or swim. Although a watch function would be nice. I still glance at it occasionally expecting to see the time!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So far so good.I have had fitbit flex for  a month now .I do walk alot and starting to get back into the gym for more cardo type exercises, since just trying to burn off fat more then build mass.I do like the fact that I can sync it with my android phone(Moto X). Hopefully they can keep adding more phones to the list.It can be sync with your computer as well but I find it more user friendly being able to sync it anytime which my phone is always with me and my computer is not.  As far as the functions they are working as expected so far no issues with the device its performing great !It usually last about 5 days before I need to recharge it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had 3 black fitbit bands break... and of course... to purchase a new one --- which is ridiculous to have to spend more money, more shipping and handling on something that has broken THREE times! -- If you don't have a dark color band - like black or navy...your band will look fairly unsavory fairly soon .. AND there seem to be no way to clean it such that it actually looks clean.  So...while the idea is great - between that plastic tab to close the unit - which looks to be worth ...maybe about .79 - but last time I checked actually cost 5.00! and the band flaw as described above.... I am no looking for another(not Fitbit) unit...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So far so good. I had issues updating the software at first but now everything is working great. There was a little issue with snapping onto my wrist but now its closing just fine. The plastic needs to stretch a bit before the clasp connects easily. I haven't had any issues with it being pulled open or snagging on anything like others have mentioned.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: ORIGINAL REVIEW 1 STAR 09/09/14: I bought my FitBit at the end of July 2014...I was loving it - syncing everyday & interested in the sleep stats but about six weeks later my band has totally snapped in half and it's not even like I'm not even a hardcore exercise person.  WTF?!?  The charger has totally sucked from the get go but it is to the point that I haven't even been able to charge it for the last few days...but what's the point when the band has broken anyways & it's not like I'm going to shell out the money for replacements on either!!!  For something that cost nearly $100 I might have well wiped my @ss with a Ben Franklin.  That is all.UPDATE BUMPED UP TO 3 STARS 09/22/14:  Like many people who have reviewed FitBit with one star, I received an email immediately from the manufacturer apologizing and recommending that I contact customer service (I kinda feel bad for whoever got stuck with this job since there seems to be A LOT of people in my position!)...I figured nothing to lose so I did via the website email on 9/9/14.  Upon submission, I received an automatic acknowledgement that my inquiry had been received within 24 hours (9/10/14).  I didn't hear back from them until a week later (9/16/14) with a request for a copy of my receipt (easy since I purchased it on Amazon) and a few other informational items and let me know that my case would be evaluated and they "may provide a replacement as a measure of good will".  The following day (9/17/14) I received an email thanking me for providing the requested information and was notified that a new FitBit was being processed...and I just received my replacement today (9/22/14)!!!I have seen a lot of reviews that have complained about the customer service.  While I think the initial response back asking for additonal information took a week and it was still a total bummer that my original one lasted 6 weeks - I don't have any complaints with my overall customer service experience.  I definitely think that that less than two weeks to receive a replacement is pretty awesome!!!  So I bumped my review up to 3 stars because I loved my FitBit before it broke...that being said I have yet to try my new FitBit out but recommend that anyone with an issue should most definitely contact FitBit customer service (especially since the Amazon return policy is only 30 days).  Hope this one isn't a LEMON too...crossing fingers!!!
review_title: Ok so my first one was a P.O.S. - but just got a replacement & crossing fingers!!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The fitbit flex works very well. However, the band is very poorly designed. It is extremely difficult to align the prongs into the slots and press into place while on your wrist. I have spent as long is 15 minutes trying to get it on myself and finally had to have someone to help. I assumed it would be easier to put on as the band stretched, but that's not the case. Ridiculous to pay this much money for a product that you need assistance to put on.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have really enjoyed my Fitbit - once I got it set up. (Tip: Set up the computer application BEFORE you set up the app on your phone. Saves a lot of headaches! - Fitbit: would be REALLY nice to have a short how-to rather than your current setup page. I spent waaaay too much time trying to figure it all out!)I find myself recording everything I eat or drink - great database of foods - almost everything I've searched for is already in there, including favorite restaurants.I also keep an eye on steps and activity throughout the day and pushing to meet the next milestone.If you want to move more and record what you eat - get the fitbit!
review_title: Makes you WANT to move more!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought the fitbit flex on a recommendation from a total stranger. Don't even know the woman who told me about it. But I looked it up and figured 'why not'. I have been going to the gym for years and had hit a plateau, trying to find motivation to keep going because I was honestly just really bored. The flex and the fitbit app that comes with it were exactly the motivation I needed. You can track EVERYTHING from your steps, to exercises, to food, to sleep. I love it. It motivates me to do 10.000 steps or 5 miles of walking a day, and I feel awesome when I hit my goals. It helps me see progress where I didn't before, which is really what I needed. I have used it in the shower and during particularly hard and sweaty workouts and it has given me no problems. All in all its a pretty good product. The only thing that it needs is a bigger database for foods, but I assume that it will grow as more people use the app itself.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was very excited about this purchase and the claims pertaining to its tracking abilities. I'm terribly disappointed! I have had my Flex for months and have contacted FitBit numerous times asking WHY they can't connect the data manually entered with the total miles/steps per day. No answers as of yet.If you use an elliptical, you will have to manually enter your data, which I'm perfectly fine with; the problem is that the data you take the time to enter, does not reflect in your daily steps. Makes no sense.Also unsure why there is such a discrepancy when using the elliptical. The arms are moving, just as if I was running. But the mileage discrepancy is so off. I do 2.5 miles and it shows less than 3/4 miles.
review_title: I'm terribly disappointed! I have had my Flex for months ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This has been a huge disappointment.  I began having problems after a couple of weeks.  It wouldn't sync and/orhold a charge.  I've tried all the tips on the web site and nothing works.  So it is now a worthless piece of plastic.  I sent an email to Fit Bit customer support but have not received a reply.  I called the customer report phone number.  I get a recording that they are unable to answer at the moment and suggest that I call back.  After many attempts, I have yet to find a moment when they can answer.  I missed the Amazon return window by 4 days.  That's a 100 bucks that I wish I hadn't spent.MY Advice ...Do Not Buy any FIT BIT of any kind.UPDATE:  I contacted Amazon Customer Service about this problem.  Even though it was beyond the regular return period. the rep made arrangements for a replacement.  I just hope that the replacement is trouble free.  Amazon gets 5 stars - Fit bit still just one star for now.
review_title: This has been a huge disappointment. i began having problems after a couple of ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Complete and utter waste of money, IMO. I purchased this in December 2015 and had  lost it twice within three or four weeks, the second time apparently  for good.  The wristband would not remain latched even after I purchased an add on  product to help keep it secure.  Why hasn't Fitbit resolved this obvious design issue?  Why sell a product that is fairly expensive to replace knowing that many customers have this issue?I had a Fit Bit 1 for years before I lost it in airport security.  It seems to be accurate and was more comfortable to wear.  The flex was a big disappointment that I really regret purchasing.  I see from other reviews that some people are happy with it, but I would recommend careful thought before plunking down $80 to $100 for this model
review_title: Complete and utter waste of money

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: $100 for a piece of junk. The first three days it seemed to guesstimate steps ok. On the fourth day, after I'd been up and about for two hours, it showed zero steps and 453 calories. Really? Might have to re-gift this to someone who wants to wear it as a bracelet.Update: The flex spent the week on the kitchen counter. Today I got a weekly summary from fitbit via email -- 21,914 steps, 9.45 miles, 9,083 calories and average sleep of 8 hrs 17 mins. So ridiculous one has to laugh.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: When I purchased it did what it claimed. In June 2014 it had a software update that with a better Food Log and Calorie help it was suppose to be a better tracker of your Activity. Sounded cool with GPS tracking and telling your Pace for each mile, but it is does not work.  Using the Exercise Tab I start the GPS tracking and hit "Finish"  when done, it show that I have walked 3 miles in 52 minutes and shows me my Pace for each mile, but as you scroll down that screen it gives strange results, different every time, an example would be 3 of 12 Active Minutes. I start with No Active Minutes.  Then go to the Dashboard and it has the Steps and Miles but Active Minutes and Calories Burned do not correspond with the Exercise Tab for that walk. I have contacted support and the give all kinds of excuse about sensors in my phone calculating distance, steps and Active Minutes.Because it does not keep accurate track of Active Minutes the Calories Burned is also not accurate, what else is not accurate? If you can not trust part of it how can you depend on any of it to do what it was designed for, to track your Fitness.
review_title: Does not track Active Minutes and Calories Burned properly using the GPS feature

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Pro:easy to wearaccurate on stepsbuzzing and flashing when major goal reached.Con:Software no longer works when you are changing time zones manually. (I am off the grid four days a week, and change my time zones two or three times during this span.)Hard to remember to take it in and out of sleep mode.  This should be an automatic feature. After 10,000 steps it really should beable to figure out that you are not asleep.I had ordered the new fit ban, but canceled the order deciding that it just is to aggravating, that it has to be on wireless all the time.
review_title: It will do, until one comes out that can operate off the grid, or until the apple watch comes out.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Purchased the "cheapest" fitbit knowing that I don't always follow through with my healthy plans.  3 months later I'm still with it and the flex hasn't let me know.  It certainly encourages me.  I like the app that provides all the information I need and even provides challenges.  Now wishing I had purchased a better version that displays the information,

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I use the Fitbit everyday and I love competing and challenges against my friends. It does track my sleep automatically which is a new function since I got it because they did some kind of software update in it, and I like the slim size on my wrist. I have small wrists and hands so it doesn't look too big and bulky. I have also enjoyed being able to wear bands in different colors. It has really motivated me to get active and my health insurance has an app that connects to it so I even earn gift cards through that! Bonus!
review_title: I use the Fitbit everyday and I love competing and challenges against my friends

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit is a great device for todays generation of fitness bands. The band is very comfortable, as well as the actual device being a slick and highly portable device. The only reason I have not given this a five star is that it seems that there is one major flaw. This may not be a flaw distinctly for fitbit but to the entire generation of fitness products. There seems to be a issue with accurately tracking the amount of steps or calories being burned. If you have it on your right hand for example and are typing all day long, or reaching your hand across to grab something from your desk, the movement actually tricks the device into thinking you took another step. Putting this flaw aside, this device exactly does what its original intention is. This is an excellent product for motivation, you will be motivated to move more than you have before, giving you a measurable aspect of your daily life, making it something to improve.
review_title: The Fitbit is a great device for todays generation of fitness bands

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: As a frequent long distance runner I think this product isn't too bad, but has some major flaws to it. First thing that I hate most about it is the fact that if you shake, move, or basically anything that will make it THINK that you're walking, it'll count it as steps. For example typing, writing, and jerking your hand. I Sat all day one day on the computer, ended the day telling me I walked 2-3 miles...uhh I certainly didn't. For this problem I personally keep it in my pocket and only put it on my wrist when I run,but it's a wristband, that's the whole point, I shouldn't be putting it in my pocket! Second, when tracking sleep you CAN'T just go to bed and  automatically know you're sleeping, you have to go on the Fitbit app to start tracking sleep, not to mention you also have to tell your phone when you wake up or it'll keep tracking it as "restless sleep". Third, when you want to track and log  your runs or exercise sessions, SAME with the sleeping. CAN'T just go off for a run and expect it to know you were running. You have to inform that you're going to exercise with your phone. YES you can go running without the phone, it'll just increase your steps and active minutes. you CAN log in exercise manually and "guess" how long or far you ran. If you want  more accurate log you have to have your phone for that. It CAN track with GPS where you start and end, how many miles, pace, and mile splits, BUT you have to have run with you're phone. To track all that it needs cellar data to know where you start, it WILL keep tracking if you run somewhere with no connection and still know where you ran, but it only will if you start somewhere with cellar data. Tracking how much you eat is pretty accurate, but can be a bit of a pain to log every time you eat. I don't want to make this too long, so I'll end by saying that overall it's all about the Fitbit app, while there's a small tracker that is placed in a piece of plastic. As a runner who runs 6-7 days a week....It's ok, personally for ME the Fitbit Zip is WAY BETTERUPDATE!!!! STOPPED CHARGING AND IT'S ONLY SEPTEMBER!!!! only LASTED me ~FIVE WEEKs!! NO DON'T BUY
review_title: I wouldn't get it if you're a serious runner (READ BEFORE BUYING) 9/17/14 UPDATE!!!!!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was so excited to get this and start my new program but disappointed in its performance.  It is not accurate.  It recorded 5000 steps on a day I sat at my desk all day.  My guess, is it recorded all my keystrokes as steps. When i used it just for walking, it was pretty accurate.  So, if you work in an office...keep that in mind.Design is good.  Personally, for me, having to update it and log in on the computer was a pain.  The sleep pattern feature was interesting but not sure I trust the accuracy.  I am going back to my pedometer. This was a novelty that quickly wore off.
review_title: I am going back to my pedometer

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: When I first got it it was great, then just over two MONTHS in it just stopped working. Amazon is no help (sadly, the amount of money I spend here) and the FitBit site is about worthless. Save your money, this is an official POS!UPDATE! Fitbit was kind enough to respond to this negative review so  I followed their advice, it took them 10 days to respond to me and all I got was "Thank you" and "we will pass your suggestions on to our engineering team" not a word about a warranty or any indication they are inclined to help. I stand with my original statement and this company should be ashamed. If you are thinking of throwing your money away, find a charity, at least you will feel better.
review_title: When I first got it it was great, then just over two MONTHS in it just ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this based on a "try before you buy" program on TV.  Sounded like a great way to monitor my activity on my Android phone.  First problem is it will not monitor my bike riding activity.  Second and more important problem is it will not connect by blue tooth to my Motorola Razor Max phone.  If you dig deep in the Fitbit site it even says they are having issues with Motorola phones,  I spent about an hour with Verizon to try and make it work but no luck.  It is an interesting gimmick but I will be sending it back.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this just before I left for 2 weeks at the Biggest Loser Resort.  I used it on hikes with my Map My Walk and both were very close on mileage.  During classes I wore it swimming, tread milling and such and it was pretty darned accurate on calories.  I input everything I eat and it keeps me on track.  I've used it for 8+ weeks, haven't cheated on myself, and lost 18 pounds and increased my cardio a lot.  I'm sticking with it and highly recommend it if you are willing to use all the tools...including keeping track of your sleep.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Overall, this is a great product. I had some issues with accidentally letting the battery run too low, then the device resetting. I did have to return the device once which is keeping this from a 5 star.Pros:Water resistantSyncs up easy to computer/smart phoneSeems to be accurate with steps/movementLightweight, comfortable to wearConsDoesn't notify you when you are low on battery.Snug fit for "larger" people, traps dirt and sweat easily.Odd observation: Seems like a natural fit for the display to show time, but instead you have dots of progress. Not sure about the call on that one design-wise. The force had the time display, but had issues..so I guess it's a trade off.Overall I enjoy the flex and I'd recommend it for a fitness tracker.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Update, I know have gone through 2 more fitbits--including the one I bought for my husband. All are dead and I am going to get something else! A lot of wasted money!I have had 2 fitbit flex units. The original one just stopped charging and would not connect after 5 months. I called the company and they replaced my fitbit quickly. This one worked for about 6 months...same result. I tried to call the company several times. no response. I pulled out my original fitbit, charged it  and it suddenly started connecting and tracking again. I was able to use that for about 3 months before it died again. I repeated this process with success on the second fitbit and it to worked for a few months. Now both are dead, never to be resurrected. I want to get a new one but am worried about the same result.
review_title: Quits working after a few months

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is the first time I ever felt compelled to review an item purchased through Amazon. I bought the fitbit and enjoyed it for a week. The only issue I had with the fitbit was that the bracelet fell off my wrist several times the week I had it. Then it fell of my wrist while I was out of town on vacation and it got lost. I found out from a friend later on that she had purchased a lock band for her fitbit so she wouldn't worry about it falling off. I was upset to learn this as I didn't know that other people were having issues with the fitbit falling off their wrists. I feel deceived for it should have been mentioned in the fitbit manual about the high probability of the wristband coming off. If I had received a lock band with my fitbit, I wouldn't have lost such an expensive purchase :(

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had the fitbit for 2.5 months.  I've liked using it, though I wish the software was more flexible in letting you input the calories for what you eat (it wants to enter specific purchased foods, and I usually eat meals I prepare at home).  However, 2 weeks ago it started to not retain a charge and I haven't figured out how to remedy that.  A full fresh charge only lasts a few minutes or hours - rather than the 5 days or so it originally lasted.  And that makes the fitbit useless.  The warranty for replacement has expired, so I'm stuck.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I loved my fitbit flex, I have had one since they originally came out. This is my second after my first had an unfortunate fate. The second one the quality has gone down significantly, the device is no longer completely flush and even making it smooth. The band also broke in two months where as my old original band is still going strong after a year. This coupled with their announcement for not supporting health kit and keeping our fitness data for them selves makes me more likely to look else where for an alternative. The Jawbone fitness tracker is likely my next replacement if something happens to this one.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought two of these items in July 2014 plus an aria scale. I stopped using it like a month ago (September 2014) for no good reason really. It was fine when I stopped using it and I stored it away in its box. Now that I want to start using it again (after one month stored) IT'S DEAD. IT WON'T CHARGE AND IT'S JUST PLAIN DEAD. The one my husband is using is fine but after a month of not using mine it's done! Today I saw the commercial of 3 new HR fitbit devices and got exited! Wanted to buy them, guess that after my flex is dead I will definitely refrain from that move...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Setting up the FitBit was the worse ever and I am very comfortable with setups normally.  Instructions were very vague and unnecessarily complicated.  The install wasn't too bad but left much to the imagination.  However, I had to find message boards, help sites and YouTube to get the synching and linking to work.  The main confusion surrounded the 'dongle' and when and how to get the FitBit charged and the order in which to plug everything in.  I am sure this will be a wonderful product, but I think it was unnecessarily confusing to set up and has left a bad impression

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the fit and feel of the fitbit on my wrist.  The program is nice and it is a motivating tool.  The downsides of this product, as compared to the body media fit are:  having to put fitbit in sleep mode, and details about calorie burn.  The body media fit automatically reads when you are sleeping, so no need to fuss with taps to engage or disengage mode. Also, bumpy rides or burping a baby (haha) confused my fitbit several times.  I found myself in "sleep mode" when I was doing these activities.
review_title: I like the fit and feel of the fitbit on my ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It does make me move more and I have had great Fitbit corporate customer service cause 2 of my trackers died and they promptly replaced them.  If it is not working, I have gotten great phone support.  Buy the little bands to put over your fitbit so it does not accidentally fall off.  Do not use in shower.  If it gets wet--use a qtip quickly to dry unit and inside of band.
review_title: Company very good to work with problems, good product.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got a defective Fitbit Flex. I contacted the company a couple of times, once to troubleshoot, then again when it stopped working completely. Fitbit sent me a replacement. Guess what? It stopped working too! I had to go through rigamarole with customer service a few more times, reset things, etc. Then it just crapped out completely. Fitbit offered to send a replacement if I could just return it to them in the original packaging. They do not refund, only replace. At this point, I don't really want another one of these things. A hundred dollars seems like a lot for what's essentially a pedometer with an app.It's way too much to pay for a pedometer that only lasts about 2 or 3 months before ceasing to function.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have bought two fitbits so far - a simple fitbit zip for me and fitbit flex for my fiancee.It was a Father` day present for him, and he was very glad to get it. But just a month later he went on the business trip and apparently the wristband opened up somewhere in transit -  he was very disappointed to see that fitbit is missing after he boarded the plane.I agree with all the other reviewers that say the wristband is crap. I still have mine because I wear it in my pocket, but the whole  idea to get fit together got defeated.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love it.  I am amazed to discover how little I really do sleep.  This managed make me realize that I needed to seek a doctors consult to correct.  I purchased it about 6 months ago and have not removed it since.  There are two negatives....1. Does not do a good job of recording actual stairs climbed.  My house is nothing but stairs yet I am lucky to see 9-10 daily.2. Band is a bit difficult to get on and snapped in, I sure wish a better easier system was worked out.
review_title: Love it. I am amazed to discover how little ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The best of it, is that its small enough to carry on without bugging you while your on the computer or writing. The other nice features are the synchronization through bluetooth. Would be nicer if it didn't need the dongle to synchronize and just do it through the cell phone, laptop, bluetooth compatible device. In case you want to constantly synchronize your stats with your dashboard, your going to have to purchase at least 2 or more bluetooth dongles (for your office, for your laptop and for your desktop). Other things  I thought it  would do, was to register stats of the heartbeats per seconds on heavy work and when "relaxed". And it doesn't. The 5-7 day battery life is fine.
review_title: It nice, but could be better

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got my Fitbit almost one year ago. Since then I have worn it every day. It's truly (for me) an impetus to get up and move and achieve the daily goals I've set. The app is easy to use, and gives all the information I need on the dashboard screen. I know there is no way I would have walked 15,000 steps almost every day for the past year without the commitment I made by wearing the Fitbit.  The band is comfortable, the device holds a charge for several days, and I am so used to it now that it feels odd not to have it on.  I'd recommend Fitbit Flex to anyone who's looking for that extra bit of encouragement to get up and move.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I initially had a Fitbit Force, which I loved, but returned for the refund when they had their recall.  I then turned around and replaced it with a Flex.  I miss my Force.  I really liked the watch function and the fact that you can't pop the sensor in and out.I like the Flex because you can wear it in the shower (unlike the Force), but the annoying thing is that you have to pop the sensor out to dry it off and dry out the inside of the band, otherwise it'll stink.  After a month of doing this, the little pocket where the sensor is held started to tear.  This really irritated me.  A pack of 3 replacement bands is $30.  Yeah, no thanks.Other than that, I love it!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Sorry but for what you pay the band should not be this cheap.  The snaps on the band do not hold securely at all. If you buy one I would buy some of those extra band loops to help hold it in place.  My wife lost hers within about 4 days.UPDATE: As an update after fitbit reached out to us about our fitbit getting lost. They have replaced my wife fitbit  it has the same band to go around her wrist so I also purchased some aftermarket fastener rings to help prevent it from falling off. So I raised the stars rating to 3 because of their customer service.
review_title: Cheap unsecure band beware. GOOD Customer Support

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love this product. The app works great and the website is easy to use. I have not had the problems with the wrist band coming undone that others have had. I have been using the product for over a month now and have lost weight. I think by far the best feature is being able to set a weight loss goal and have the app show me as my day progresses how many calories I have left for that day in order to achieve that goal. For example, if I have a super active day then I will have more calories to eat, but if I have a lazy day it adjusts my calories lower as the day goes on. This is so effective because it does not make sense to eat the same calories every day if one day you are a couch potato and the next you do not sit down for 12 hours. My husband has one as well and he loves it too. This is a must have weight loss tool in my opinion and if I lost it I would replace it in a heart beat.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: LOVE LOVE LOVE my Fitbit. I was iffy at first if I would like it or not, but it's by far the best thing I have ever bought! It comes in handy for the multitude of steps I take at work ( I was curious. Standard day at work is usually around 15,000 was slightly surprised). I have started to drink more water and am able to track it on my device. The alarm feature is awesome. Great way to track my breaks and to remind myself to do things. Five stars. Would recommend to all my friends.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My Fitbit Flex was a blast while it worked, which lasted maybe 4 months. The simple interface -- no readout, no specific number of steps -- actually was a pleasant kind of partial ignorance. It was nice to simply know where I was relative to my goal for the day, and nothing more. Still didn't stop me from occasionally, peevishly syncing my Flex with my phone to get the exact number, but that wasn't Fitbit's fault, that's just me being antsy. So I loved this thing but it stopped working. The charger cradle was finicky at its best -- so I'd occasionally leave it charging only to come back hours later and find it hadn't charged it all. Over time the charges didn't keep as long, and eventually it stopped syncing or recognizing the dock. Hopefully Fitbit has some kind of warranty. Otherwise $100 for something that lasts less than 4 months under medium-intensive use is a pretty crappy deal.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had the Fitbit zip for over 2 years, and wanted to start tracking sleep as well, so I upgraded to a flex.  Unfortunately, it wasn't really an upgrade.  I like the sleep tracking, but it only works about 1/2 the time as it will start mid-day without realizing it, so when I think I'm turning it on at night, I'm actually turning it off.  you can't read your actual step count (like the zip), you have to go by blinking dots, which can be anywhere within 1000 steps.  Not as accurate as I'd like.  I think I will be returning this, and sticking with my zip.
review_title: Not as good as I had hoped

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Before I got the Fitbit Flex I was manually tracking my steps & daily exercise activity. As an avid runner & road racer, it is important to have an automated way to track these & the Fitbit Flex is wonderful. It was user-friendly to download the app required to set it up and to sync with the app on my iPhone. It's easy to navigate your goal set-up and quickly check your progress day-to-day; but the best part are the challenges. I was pleasantly surprised a few days after using it when I received an email with my first badge! Overall, it's comfortable to wear, is great for motivation and accurately tracking my walking/running from day-to-day and comparing that to other weeks.
review_title: Automation of my Running Progress - So Easy!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This Fitbit is great!!! I found it so easy to start. I was able to download the app on my phone really easy. I had no issues with the blue tooth connection. I have been using this every day for the last six months. I enjoy this one much better than the other larger ones. This has a small black "brain" that is able to be taken out of the back and can slide into pants pocket, sock or bra. It is very nice to be able to take it off if you want to look more professional or if it just does not fit the occasion. I have also put it in my beach bag when only in a swim suit and cover up. It tracked my steps all the way. There is lights on the top that will alert you to how close you are to your daily step goal. There is also a sleep tracking option. You double tap it as you fall asleep and double tap when you wake up. It tells you how many times you tossed and turned. It lets you know in a graph the times you got good quality of sleep, your night of sleep and how long the increments were that you I also like that for very good price you can get ten packs of different colored bracelets that will match many different outfits. On with the app itself it tracks weight, water intake and calorie intake. It helps you set goals and lets you know how close you are to reaching your goal. I love that I can track my exercise. It will map out the route you ran and tell you the amount of miles you went and how long it took you. I pretty much love everything about the app. It is user friendly and you do not have to be a genius to be comfortable with this. I would recommend this product to anyone.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love everything about it: lightweight (hardly know I have it on), easy to sync with the iPhone app, the app connects well with other apps for tracking food intake, love the sleep tracking and the ability to look at trends in all of the categories across days, weeks, months and years.  I have syncing always on and check it by 'tapping' to see progress dots several times a day, yet I still only need to recharge the tracker every 7-8 days and it only takes maybe an hour or two for a full recharge; pretty nice.  But I particularly like the fact it is submergible.  The write up on Amazon says it is not submergible, just splash proof basically but if you got to the actual fitbit website and read the specs on the Flex under  "Environmental Requirements," it clearly states under "water resistant" that it is able to be submerged upto 10 meters (32 feet).The only con I've found is that it can be hard to snap back on after removing the band to charge the tracker.  The little clip you have to push through the holes in the wristband is a little cumbersome.  I have small fingers and acrylic nails so I can really get in there and push it with little problem but my other family members have more difficulty.Other than that, it's damn-near perfect.  Wasn't sure it was accurate in steps since I wear it on my wrist and I tend to gesticulate a lot (so I feared getting excess steps, distance, activity, etc from waving my hands around versus true movement/exercise) but one day my husband and I went everywhere together and at the end our "distance" for the day was nearly identical but I had more steps (which make sense since I am short and he is 6', thus his stride is longer than mine so I take more 'steps' to travel the same 'distance;' I was pretty impressed with that level accuracy).
review_title: Lightweight, easy to use & sync w/ iPhone app, love the sleep monitoring feature & that it's submersible for swimming

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: really cool - love it - the only concern is that the darn thing comes undone and falls off the wrist and you don't feel it fall off. I found it on the kitchen floor the other day and had no idea it had fallen off. I'm afraid to wear it until I can come up with something that either holds it firmly or that can be felt when it slips off the wrist. cool software with it allows you to personalize it as much or as little as you want. It does much more than count footsteps or calories burned - it's a great fitness tool in that it helps you keep track ad set goals etc.
review_title: great but falls off your wrist - hence 3 stars

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I wanted to walk more, so I bought the Flex, hoping it would encourage me to do so. It has often encouraged me to walk instead of driving my car, which is great! The thing that I have enjoyed the most about it is competing with my friends. The app allows you to "friend" other people with Fitbit trackers and compete with them. It's been a blast and my friends and I talk about it a lot, cheering each other on and harassing each other when we don't walk much. The setup was easy, and I've only ever had one problem with it, which restarting and re-setting it up resolved. I highly recommend this as a fun tool to get yourself a little bit more active!
review_title: Great for tracking walking and sleep

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was my third fitbit purchase. The rubber bracelet started coming apart after 2 weeks. The charger would only work sometimes, after much wiggling. I ordered another charger and had the same problem. I didn't like that you couldn't see how many steps you walked, only if you are between 0-20%, 20-40%, 40-60%, 60-80%, 80-100%. It also doesn't track stairs. After having intermittent charging issues, it just stopped working after a couple of months. I got the fitbit charge, and I love it. Pass on this one and get the Charge- so much better.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My wife has probably 30 wrist straps for the Fitbit Flex and likes how it works with her iPhone, so I was glad it was still available. Since all the data is easily looked at on her iPhone, the more modern Fitbits would be an option if you didn't already have bands to match every dress or shirt.
review_title: Great to see it is still available for all the wrist straps out there

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have ordered and installed myriad electronics and never have I been so frustrated with trying to install simple software in order to make a product work.  I will NEVER buy this product again. I am hoping that I can return it because this is absolutely ridiculous that I have to spend hours searching for FAQs and other troubleshooting "help" sites to try and get this thing to work.  It is complete crap. I should have listened to the Apple store and ordered the Nike version.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bough my Flex in October 2014. The band broke down two times and the actual unit one time. Each time I contacted Fitbit support and I was provided with replacement parts. This week the replacement unit broke down after 6 months of use so I contacted Fitbit support once again.I was denied of getting the unit replaced even though I had used it only for 6 months. The reason given was that I had bought the original Flex more than a year ago (1.5 years ago). As a compensation I was offered 25% discount promo code if I go to fitbit.com and buy a new Fitbit tracker within 30 days. Given the poor quality of Flex I would be more interested in changing to the newer Alta model but after the 25% discount it would still cost the same amount than what I paid for the Flex in 2014.So my experience with Fitbit is that you have to buy a new one every 1.5 years and in the mean time every 4-6 months you'll be contacting their support for replacement parts. I would not recommend buying Fitbit.I do like the concept of an activity tracker. Time to look for another vendor.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My Fitbit Flex stopped working 10 days after the warranty expired.  I tried to contact the company directly only to find out they won't support their failed product design. My reason for calling it a failed product design is due to the high number of similar complaints logged on their Facebook page.In addition to the poor life span, I wasn't real happy with the product due to the fact that I'm an active person and the Flex doesn't seem to keep up when you are active.  It does fine for counting steps during "normal" activities but not during active time periods.  For example, I ran for 15 minutes on a treadmill and it counted for 2 "very active" minutes.My advice, save your cash.
review_title: Lasts just as long as the warranty

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love the Fitbit - HATED the bracelet.
