Luckily, I found an alternative (the ribbon one) to use, which is much more comfortable.But the fitbit itself has proven to be very useful in my day-to-day activities.  It gives me a goal to meet - like 10,000 steps a day, and I feel accomplished when I meet certain goals.And the website and iphone app are great - they sync automatically and seeing your progress each day is inspiring.  I would recommend this product.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My husband bought me this for Christmas and I use it full time. I love it. I love the way it monitors and tracks all of my steps, my sleep patterns and quality, and even allows me to input goals and caloric and water consumption. It also links me to others that are in my network and allows me to see their accomplishments as a motivational tool. easy to use, comfortable to wear and is water resistant. Cant say enough good stuff about my fitbit.
review_title: I love it. I love the way it monitors and ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bad a$$...I love this thing, it really has gotten me moving, I paired it with My Fitness Pal to track calories and all nutritional info.  This product works great, no issues, I recently ordered the new FitBit Surge to get even better, more accurate fitness stats, still waiting on that order to come in, you will not be disappointed.  No BS, I have lost 7 lbs since 12/15 when I started using this thing, and that's through the holidays...I did of course start eating a bit better, but using the F-Factor diet, book I purchased from Amazon...Good luck!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had this product for 2 weeks and it works GREAT! The plastic band was a tad stiff at first and hard to clasp, but quickly softened and is more comfortable and easy to use. What I love is that it tracks steps, distance, and calories burned. I don't really use it for sleep (I use Sleep Cycle on my iphone), but I have looked at the data and it seems accurate.My favorite thing is the App! So regardless of the Fitbit product, the device will sync with the app. I use MyFitnessPal to find most of my food calories (I think FitBit's database is still growing), and input my calories eaten. The app will tell me how many calories I have left to eat for the day. As someone who needs to lose weight and works an office job, this app and device make me walk more and eat less.The friend challenges are fun, too. Daily and weekly challenges and the app encourages you to cheer for your friends.Great motivation!! Highly recommend.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this as a gift for my brother and almost didn't give it to him, I liked it so much. The band is very comfortable. It is a little hard to get the snaps in, but it seems to stay on well once you snap them in. After counting my steps and comparing, it counts mostly accurately, usually about 2-4% off from my actual steps. I like the alerts but I found that the alarm just didn't work for me. I'm not sure if I just learned to tap it off in my sleep or it stopped working, but either way, I wasn't waking up.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Its such a cool concept but because its electronics, my unit was not accurate right out of the box.  After a week, it was evident that it was not reporting my steps correctly.  My friends devices were working great.  Trying to get help from Fitbit was frustrating too.  They tell you to do what you have already done to trouble shoot it.  If you get a dud, I would suggest returning it like I plan to do.  Overall, its a gamble whether you get a good device or not.  There are a lot of compaints out there!!
review_title: Its a gamble whether you get a good device or a dud!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fitbit has themselves a fantastic idea that just doesn't work out in practice. The idea of being able to track your progress throughout the day is fantastic to see caloric burn but the science the Fitbit Flex uses is just not there to back up the idea at this point. I ordered two, one for my wife and one for myself and I would outpace her in steps even though she has a more active job. It just isn't accurate enough to justify the cost so I returned it but should Fitbit work out the kinks and somehow make this technology more accurate I would love to repurchase because the device is just great in theory.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very upset with Amazon and the seller of this product. I tried it for a good month to see if it helped me with logging my sleep patterns. More than half the time when you thought you had it set for sleep, it wasn't. On top of that, I had read a lot of reviews that the band gave a lot of users rashes. Because of that, I made sure my band wasn't on to tight and that air could circulate around the skin. I now have black looking skin breakdown on my wrist, that isn't discoloration, Because of this suspicious area,  I now have to spend even more money to go see my dermatologist.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This little gadget is great! I have learned so much about my lifestyle and activity level and sleep that has really helped me determine how to lose that extra weight.  I am very pleased with this.  I also love that there is an iPhone app.  I use the app LoseIt to track my food and personally I'm not a fan of the Fitbit food tracker, but LoseIt syncs with the Fitbit so it's perfect!! I also used Endomondo for my running and biking so those sync right in too!!  This has been a worthwhile investment.  I hope they make one soon that has a heart rate monitor for more accurate calorie counting!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this for my wife as a gift.  She activated it in June 2013.  It never would charge fully no matter how long you left it attached.  I thought it might be the cord, so, bought another charge cord which did not change anything.  Also, the data is completely false.  It can read 19000+ steps setting on the counter and read nearly nothing when worn and active.  I have emailed fitbit customer service since they say they have a 365 day warranty for repair/replacement however haven't heard from them yet.
review_title: Questionable Reliability of a Product-may need recalled

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Absolutely LOVE this. I had a Misfit brand activity tracker and it was supposed to be water resistant, but I wore it in the saltwater pool at my gym ONCE and half of the lights went out and wouldn't come back on. The wristband also broke on me TWICE within 2 months before I returned it and bought this one. I've worn it at least 10 times in the pool, if not more, and have had zero problems from it. Feels much better around my wrist as well. The only complaint I had about this was that the band broke on me, but it was after a while of wear and tear.
review_title: Absolutely LOVE this. I had a Misfit brand activity tracker ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I absolutely love my Fitbit Flex, and it's kept me more motivated than I had expected. The social aspect of it is far more effective than I had thought, and I am far more proactive about seeking out opportunities to be active now than I was before I got it (and I'm no couch potato!). I've found the dashboard very useful, too, as it helps me actually keep on track drinking water, which is a big deal for me. I am looking forward to being able to sync via Bluetooth with more devices; which it's not the biggest deal to me, I'd prefer being able to do that than to have to always sync it with my computer. When that happens, my star rating will probably go up!
review_title: Love it but can't wait for better syncing

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great product I don't need a time feature my sister has the Garmin version it's nice too but I like simple it would be better if it was better compatible with the fire phone can't scan barcodes and it has everything from take out &restaurants which I rarely go to so it gets annoying when I have to add something like a cereal and I avant scan the barcode so I search through cereals I've never heard of when I type the name of mine in but I like my fitbit a lot they say they are working on the app but my guess is if the phone can't compete w the iPhone (which I left for the fire phone) they prob are going to fix anything lol
review_title: Great product I don't need a time feature my sister ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I loved this product.  I even convinced multiple people to buy it.  Had I known that in less than 5 months it would stop syncing sleep/food, not track steps correctly and never charge properly, I would never have bought it in the first place.  Despite having a stated warranty, customer service (which is only via email), keeps sending me lists of things to troubleshoot, all of which I've either already tried or tried and it still doesn't help.  My favorite was when I said it no longer synced to MyFitnessPal the answer was to try a different food tracking app... seriously - you sold me under the premise that it cooperates with MFP and then tell me I need a new app?  I just want decent customer service and a replacement so I can try to use this product again instead of go to another competitor.  Really a shame.
review_title: $100+ for less than 5 months of use?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I wanted simple to track my daily walking and was curious about my sleep. I sleep pretty good. Need to walk more😬 didn’t need all the bells and whistles. Even though it will document water, calories,and notes you want to put in.  and easily loaded on my iPhone.
review_title: Wanted to track steps and sleep pattern

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: An update - my biggest complaint is that the clasp design SUCKs and constantly falls off. I have replaced FOUR Flexes and I'M DONE! What really annoys me is how the Fitbit company just continues along DUM DEE DUM making this crappy clasp in spite of tons of complaints on social media. Frankly I think its a revenue generating strategy for them. They keep dropping off and we keep buying them. I'M DONE

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great product and application! Keeps track of my steps and logs my sleep. The band itself can get a little dirty, so I suggest cleaning it or getting a different color like grey or black. The lighter color bands tend to stain or turn darker around the edges with heavy use. Overall, I'm very satisfied with my product! Just be sure to buy the silicone fasteners; the metal fastener tends to become loose over time. My mother lost hers twice already, but I got her the silicone fasteners and we've not had an incident yet!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Had trouble getting started; no instructions come with the unit; have to pretty much figure it out on your own.  Program did not download to my home Windows 7 laptop, so have to sync at work which is a pain since I really do not have the time during the day. Cannot tell when battery is low.  Unit keeps track of steps but does not register bicycling as an activity.  Think I should have gone for the more pricier model.  Not convinced that the sleep function is that accurate, although pretty close.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Well it arrived and appears to be functioning fine.  I received two small bands and no Wi-Fi dongle.  The box was sealed but either I should get $26/refunded to me for the missing part I paid for or a replacement at no cost to me.  I'd give it 5 stars if I got what I paid for right out of the box.  Ap set up worked fine for my Droid 2 Turbo.  I contacted Fitbit directly to let them know of the parts issue.  I'll follow up once this is resolved to my satisfaction.
review_title: Who is running their quality control?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am saddened to write this review. I have had the Fitbit for 2 years. I loved it!! When it worked. But for about 1.5 years of the time that I have had it, it didn't. The first time it broke, I wrote into the manufacture who sent me a new one right away. Then, about 6 months later, it stopped working all together. The saddest part is, I bought three all together. None of the three work anymore. $300 down the drain. I should have listened to the reviews I read about it's quality. Overall, it is great if it decides to work, but most likely it won't last you long.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Sending it back because it wouldn't program properly in the set up phase. My impressions before that were: Horrible packaging! I had to rip the whole package apart to get the Fitbit out of the box! Not frustration free packaging, for sure. The wristband really is an issue. Very hard to snap shut...wondered if it would fall off and I'd lose it eventually. Seemed like a cool idea so I'm researching other products. Ha! Funny I'm returning it the day it goes public on the stock market! Obviously it's popular.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've really enjoyed this.  I wish it had a watch with it, but that's coming out next year so I may upgrade.  But the step counter is accurate and I really like the alarm function.  I can be rushing around and lose track of time but then the alarm goes off and I know exactly what time it is and I get back on track.  Lots of options to go along with the free app.  The most helpful is the water tracker.  You record it and it keeps track for you.  A good reminder to make sure you're getting enough water.  Very pleased and wear it daily.  Battery is pretty decent too.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got this for my mother for Christmas and helped her figure out how to use it.  Everyone I know who's had one says they're great, but from my limited experience with it, it seems like it just counts your steps, can wake you with a vibrating silent alarm and that's about it.  I hope I'm wrong and it does a lot more than that (and my mom is actually using it!)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was a pretty nice little device while it lasted, but the way the band works makes it really easy to lose. And I did lose mine after a couple of weeks only, on a plane. I didn't feel the need to get another (from Fitbit or another brand).-- UpdateA friend suggested that I get in touch with Fitbit to get it replaced. Their customer service was extremely friendly and efficient, and sent me a replacement within days. Added an extra star. Fitbit folks, if you could make the clasp a little harder to detach itself, you wouldn't need to deal with replacing so many of them :-)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit is fun to own for a little bit. You may realize how active/inactive you are and see spurts of activity. You can also see how restful or interrupted your sleep is but it's not exactly a sleep tracker bc you have to tap it so it knows you're sleeping and then tell it when you awaken. It doesn't wake you up at the optimal time like competitor wrist bands do.I'm just sad I cannot return this item. It is DEAD! Only about 3 months of pretty regular use, no abuse, and it's dead. I'll see if I can contact the manufacturer but it's very unfortunate and I actually would just rather have my $ back versus get another flimsy item!
review_title: Received in June, defunct in late August.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fitbits come with a 1 year warranty.  14 months after starting to use my Fitbit, the rubber started peeling away.  I contacted Fitbit and they said that the rubber bands can't be replaced.  Because it was outside the warranty period, there was nothing to be done, but because I'm a great customer they would give me 25% off a new Fitbit purchase.Is it a coincidence that my Fitbit broke just after the warranty period?  Maybe, maybe not.  Am I going to spend more money on a new Fitbit that might break right after the warranty period.  Nope.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love this thing! Mind you, the fitbit will not get you healthier on its own. It's big benefit is that it makes you more aware of your daily activities, if you take advantage of its applications. My husband and I bought these less than two months ago and we've already lost a combined 70+ lbs between the two of us (me 30, him 40+). We've done this by utilizing the activity monitor, steps monitor, sleep tracker, water tracker, and, most importantly, the food journal/calorie tracker. We love it because of the awareness, but if you don't use the app for all its advantages then it might end up becoming a worthless paper weight or pointless bracelet for you.
review_title: Take Advantage of All the App Features!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I originally had a Fitbit One. Being a contractor and no good place to put the One, I lost it rather quickly. Then I bought the Fitbit Flex. Now I've been wearing a watch since I was knee high to a grasshopper and have never lost one. This Fitbit Flex has the WORST band you can imagine for a working man like myself. If you sit in an office all day and sit on you couch all weekend, this is probably for. However, if you do some "real work" once in a while you will hate this thing! Why couldn't they use a good old watch band instead of some p o s ?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I think the charts are great--5 stars for that. But it takes me at least 5 minutes to put the fitbit wristband on. I've got a fairly small wrist and have a really hard time getting the teeth aligned to close it. 1 star for that--surely there must be a better way to close this thing. And I haven't been able to figure out the sleep mode. There appears to be some sort of toggle but there is not way to tell how the toggle is set. Two separated lights on (or off) and two lights off (or on) just don't cut it as some sort of user interface. 0 stars for that. Frankly I'm not even sure how accurate this is. But it is a great motivator.
review_title: So difficult to get the wristband clasped.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've only had this a few days, so I'll update as the time passes but I thought I'd give a quick review just the same. So far, I really like the Fitbit Flex. It was an EYE-OPENER about how much I'm NOT moving. It's a great reminder to get up and GO. I've walked and walked and walked the past few days. One thing that it doesn't do that I wish it DID, was to show the number of steps on the band itself. It does show lights as you progress, but it would be nice not to have to check my phone or computer to know. I will suggest that if you have one download the app on your phone. It is simple to use and (mine) syncs better than the computer.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had to return my fitbit Flex after 2 weeks. The reason was that:1. It seemed that it did not count my steps accurately. in fact my phone was sometimes more accurate!2. The sleep monitoring did not detect when I went to sleep or woke up accurately. And by not accurate i'm talking about mistakes of up to an hour. I was awake at 6am but it was detecting me as sleep until 7am!!3. The battery life was not 5 days but 2.5-3 days. It did not give me any alarms when it was running out of battery and also it was draining my cell phone battery as well.Final point does not have anything to do with the product but for returning the product I had to pay for post as well as the seller deducting 10% of the price. Since I'm coming from Germany this was a surprise. We could return stuff for a lot longer time free of charge. Keep in mind the problems with the device and I should have been reimbursed all the price up to two years from the purchase date.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: A great motivational tool - tracks your steps, then buzzes and the lights flash when you reach your daily goal.  Fairly easy to track calories online, a little tricky to figure out the set-up.  I wouldn't recommend the pink color as it became grungy looking pretty fast.  I get just over 2 full days on a battery charge, wish the battery lasted a little longer...... I usually charge it at night while I'm sleeping, but then I can't monitor my sleep on those nights.  Fun and inspiring, it's gotten me on my feet and moving, allows me to be accountable for what I'm eating, my water consumption and how much I'm walking, love it!!  I also bought one for my sister who lives 120 miles away and we email through the app to inspire each other!!
review_title: A great motivational tool - tracks your steps

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the Fitbit Flex over Jawbone up24 mainly based on the basis that my friends owned a Fitbit product and we would be able to compete against each other being a part of the Fitbit community. Jawbone up24 didn't have support for Android kitkat at the time I purchased this band so that influenced my decision as well. I would have preferred the Jawbone though as I find the app UI so much cleaner and useful than Fitbit's app for Android. I now have a Moto 360 which I purchased recently so honestly I haven't charged my fitbit since. The Moto 360 counts my steps as well and I don't think I need to have more than one wearable that essentially have similar uses.
review_title: Slightly expensive over-glorified pedometer, competetive community aspect was a plus though...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My Flex battery started acting up just a few months after my initial purchase in October 2015. I contacted customer support and was sent a replacement tracker in February 2016. Now, in November 2016, the tracker is acting up again - refusing to sync (essentially "going dead" and causing me to reset every time I want to sync the tracker - and, it goes without saying, not tracking my steps, which is the reason I purchased it) and battery life is draining. Of course, it's conveniently under a month out of warranty - note that your warranty is for the original product, rather than for any replacement products issued by Fitbit. Customer service is underwhelming, but I've had enough problems with this brand that I'm going with a different activity band.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have NEVER been so disappointed with a product.  I wanted it to work SO much but the charger would not work for me.  I tried all of the solutions and worked with support .  But I would have to spend at least ten minutes to get it seated just right so that it would charge...I figured i could probably live with that until it stopped charging all together after I spent 45 minutes trying to get it seated so that LED lights would show that it was charging.  It didnt work and now the 45 day return limit has run out.  All that money wasted!!!!!! I cant afford to get another one.  I can't express how disappointed in this product.
review_title: Doesn't charge I have never been so disappointed!!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit has been a real motivator because it helps me keep track of the things I do normally every day, and essentially gives me objective credit for them.  It helps me keep track of the activity level of things I do specifically for fitness, and that's helpful, but by knowing the extent of my daily normal activities helps me plan a fitness program that is realistic.  A wonderful tool!  I've had almost no problems with its administration...so well worth the 90 or so dollars for a handy, helpful fitness tool!  I live in a retirement community and I am preparing a class on FITBIT and its use.  I know of at least a score of folks who are using FITBIT now.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my FitBit Flex!  I have found it to be an excellent motivator, especially since I am always glued to my phone.  When I am bored, I go to the app, and I get motivated by my daily steps.  If I am close to a goal, it inspires me to walk around the house and get moving.  If I am lazy, same thing.  The calories required to be eaten are misleading.  The calories adjust as you move, so if you only move 3,000 steps --- you're like... asked to only eat 800 calories, which is not healthy at all.  Other than that, no complaints.  I'm loving it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great idea, and very cool interface!  But, I cannot give it more than 3 stars because the cheaply made wristbands keep falling apart. I've have had one for almost a year and I've gone through 2 1/2 bands already (the one I'm wearing now is on its last leg).  I like the Fitbit and interface and would recommend if you are prepared to spend $$$ on replacement bands through its lifespan.  In less than a year I'm in $40+Haven't switched to Jawbone yet as I want to use the rest of the wristbands before I switch over.
review_title: Elroy Blues to Fitbit - "We gotta get the band together!"

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My husband's connected to his iPhone right away, however, mine never would.  I attempted to contact the company and never received a response (yes, I checked junk mail). Email was the only option since I couldn't find a phone number.  He finds the app to be limited and some of the more advanced features are difficult to figure out.  Fitbit Flex looks cool and is fairly comfortable (he says) although I don't like bumping into it in bed. It is proving helpful and motivating while he's recovering from surgery and tracking his steps.  The sleep function seems to work only margin.  I returned mine and will hold out for something better.
review_title: I'm not a big fan. Husband says it OK.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This has just been my best purchase of 2014.  I feel that it counts accurately, and it links really well with my computer.  What I love most about this tracker is the app that links with your Fitbit.  It is the most useful thing ever!  It tracks steps, calories in/out levels of activity, sleep, diet, recommends any changes, sets nice alarms to  keep me moving, etc.  This is the whole package, and I love it.  The only thing that would be nice is to see how many steps I have left on the fitbit itself, instead of checking my  phone.  But it isn't a huge deal since I always have my phone on me.
review_title: This has just been my best purchase of 2014

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My daughter asked for a Fitbit Force for her birthday but when I went to order it, I found out that they had just pulled the Fitbit Force from the market because the band caused a bad rash in some people. My daughter and I talked it over and she decided the Fitbit Flex would be fine so that's what I bought for her. It has been several weeks since her birthday and she tells me that she really likes it and wears it every day. I don't know what she likes most about it, but she tells me she is much more conscious of her activity now, and is making better choices for her health. What more could I ask for?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got this as a gift for my wife--she really loves it.  Hard to believe the amount of information provided from such a small thing.  Only needs charging about eery 5 days and takes very little time.  She plays golf about 4 days a week and easily reaches the 10,000 step goal.  On the days that she doesn't play golf, she makes an added effort to reach the 10,000 step goal that she otherwise would not have.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Was working ok for a few months until the band split and the transmitter bud inside fell out while I was running. I was disappointed to return home after my run to find it gone. I threw the band away and  purchased the larger and more expensive Charge 2 as a replacement.
review_title: I was disappointed to return home after my run to find it ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this for my wife for Christmas, her request as I would never buy her anything to imply the need to work out without her express written request since I value my life. She loves it. Surprisingly enough, I liked it too and bought myself one too. She uses it to track her daily activity, workouts, calories burned and sleep. There is a reason these are so popular, it's because they are good at what they do. I highly recommend it if you are in the market for one.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have owned by Fitbit for exactly 8 days and in that time, have had it replaced once already due to poor design.  In particular, the band has peeled away from the hard plastic piece.  When I contacted Amazon.com about this defect, they sent me a replacement.  However, the replacement did the exact same thing within 12 hours of my putting it on.I really enjoy using this product, but it is extremely frustrating to have it fall apart within days, or even hours of use.  I just don't understand why it's falling apart - I am not using it any differently than it is supposed to be used.At this time, I am not replacing the band yet again - the Amazon.com rep said they are starting a product investigation about this design flaw based on my report that the band broke twice in exactly the same way..

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have a Fitbit flex that was given to me as a gift. There are three problems I have with it that would prohibit me from recommending this to anyone to purchase. First it is almost impossible to recharge. I followed Fitbit's recommendationTo clean the contacts and I still need to spend ten or so minutes for the blinking bar to remain on.Second, it does not register steps while used on a treadmill. article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Awesome!!!  This has helped me change my life.  Easy to use to log your food and water intake.  I really do not understand the calorie intake, but I know how many calories I am using. article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Once you figure it out, it's okay which is why I'm giving it more than one star. review_body: I bought this at the end of July 2014.  I wanted to track what I was eating, loose about 15 pounds, and increase my general fitness.  I will be 60 years old in May. review_body: I bought the Fitbit Flex for my son for Christmas.  I was very excited about the gift, since he's a college student, and recently become enthusiastic about fitness.  Unfortunately, my son was never able to connect the Fitbit to the Internet. None of my other questions, suggestions or comments were answered.  How could we know whether the FitBit is the right fit for us, when we've never been able to try the product?!?Finally, in the last week, three times I've asked to be contacted by a company manager, but have gotten no response yet. I also wanted management to know that their agents are telling people to "return the item," instead of working to fix the problem.Fitbit has no customer service telephone number which is a big mistake, if their representatives are not giving managers messages to contact a customer.  Or maybe they are giving the messages, but the manager doesn't care?  Seems I'm unlikely to find out... I'm not getting in touch with anyone!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: A friend recommended this product so I purchased it and have been very disappointed for a couple of reasons.  First it  is inaccurate - I sit in a rocking chair every evening and I believe it is counting the rocking as steps.  For example a couple days ago I walked 2 miles in the morning and went grocery shopping and at the end of the  day it logged over 40,000 steps which couldn't be correct.  In fact I got an alert in the evening that I reached 35,000 steps and then when I went to bed it said I had 40,000 and I did nothing in between but sit on rocking chair and watch TV and logged 5,000 miles in a couple hours.  Secondly, the actual wrist band pulled apart near where the the lights after less than 3 weeks and can't be fixed. I then started using the smaller one and can see it pulling apart already as well.  I have stopped wearing at this point since it is inaccurate and 2nd wristband is about to break.  I want to return but am 12 days past return policy so now I am stuck with $100 item  that doesn't work properly.  Save the money and just buy a cheap pedometer if you want to track your steps and this was definite waste of money

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The fitbit flex is great for tracking normal, everyday activity as long as you are moving forward...Positives: I love the bracelet look and feel because I don't think I could use a clip very effectively. The band is comfortable and fits well around my wrist. I haven't had an issue putting it on myself or having it fall off during use. You just need to make sure it's securely snapped. The charging has been simple and quick and the battery lasts about 4 days, the amount advertised. The app is pretty awesome. I am someone who likes to see immediate results and this definitely gives me that option.The tracking while outside walking or running does seem to be accurate and it makes it fun to try and beat your daily goal. I find myself making more of an effort to get up and move around more, which is exactly what I wanted from the fitbit flex.Negatives: The tracking on a treadmill or while on a stationary machine is non-existent. I typically run on a treadmill and not outside and the fitbit flex does not track any type of stationary movement, despite arm movement or steps taken. The 3D spatial tracking device needs forward movement to properly track your movement so a 3 mile run was tracked as a 1.2 mile run with about 2,000 steps. The way around this is to manually go back into the dashboard and add an activity and input the information about the activity tracked on the machine and the fitbit will make the changes. While this workout is sufficient to solve the problem, it does not seem to jive with the passive tracking nature of the device. I have also found that the app and the dashboard track calories differently. The dashboard will display the correct number of calories burned and the app seems to show more calories or "projected calories". The difference isn't huge but when you are tracking your food as well, it makes it difficult to gauge the number of calories you have left to consume if you're just using the app. Also, if you just stand still and swing your arm in a walking motion, the fitbit will track steps, so it does seem very sensitive to that motion.Overall: This is a good device for someone who wants the motivation to get more active throughout the day and just wants an idea of how many calories they burn during a typical 24-hour period. If you're going to use it for running outside or walking, it is a great device to track your movements and get you up and moving. If you want to use it for stationary machines at the gym, I would recommend the fitbit one which clips on to your clothes. It tracks stationary movement more accurately and still gives you the motivation to get up and moving.
review_title: Great for forward motion but don't stand still!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had my fitbit for a few days now and I am absolutely in love! It's comfortable and has really helped me get motivated to eat healthier and walk more! Advice to anyone who buys one - be sure to set it to sleep mode when you go to bed tap it five times or more quickly in a row, lights will blink and it will vibrate to indicate it's in sleep mode.  When you wake in the morning, tap it again five times or more quickly in a row to wake up so it will accurately track your sleep and activity.  I would highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a fun, easy, user-friendly way to track activity, calories, and sleep activity!
