article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I cannot say enough good things about this gadget. I was a notorious couch-potato, binge-watching while stuffing my face and the only exercise I got was getting up to walk to the kitchen for more food! With Fitbit I'm on the move constantly, even at the office. The simple reward system of the flashing lights and vibrations when you meet your step goal is very clever. The sleep monitor function is also a big help. I work nights so sleeping well is always a challenge. My Fitbit syncs easily with my Mac and Ipod however it is having a little trouble handling my Android. The Fitbit.com dashboard is very helpful. Here you can see different charts and graphs pertaining to water consumed, calories burned, steps taken, distance traveled, hours slept, etc. Finally a gadget to jump-start my fitness routine.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love being able to be more conscious about getting my steps in as well as monitoring my sleep patterns. I hate that it's so sensitive that the motion of riding in vehicles registers as steps. We are on a big rig several days a week and it's nothing for it to say I've taken over 5000 steps when in actuality it's probably a third or less. That's not a deal breaker, though. I'd rather have it than not. I probably do actually burn the number of calories it says while we are delivering so it balances out. Love it!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So about Fitbit. It's not very accurate. Doesn't monitor my steps accurately as it interprets arm movements as steps. I am a waitress and hostess for a restaurant, so I know generally how much I'm moving around. It's definitely not 5 miles lol. With pedometers, I have gotten around 3 miles in my restaurant in a night. So that's frustrating, especially because a pedometer costs 5$ and this costs 100$ . The only thing I actually really like about this thing is the fact that it gets people motivated to exercise, which, lets face it- America really needs. One of the best (and only) features it offers besides being a glorified inaccurate pedometer is the ability to have a silent alarm. Really cool, and perhaps the only reason I would get one. My boyfriend and I have different schedules and this allows him to sleep while I go to school or vice versa. So if you need a silent alarm (buzzes on your arm instead of being a loud obnoxious ring tone) then get this. Otherwise, not so much. Hope this helped, especially because there is so much hype around these devices lately. Here is it what it really does.As a longtime Amazon customer, I rely on reviews from the Amazon community when making buying decisions. That being said, I only believe in giving honest and unbiased reviews. If this review was helpful to you in any way please click below.Thanks for reading!
review_title: Eh not the greatest thing ever.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I loved it when I got it and really enjoyed FitBit. Only lasted alittle over a month. It will not Charge or track anymore and it is to late to return. I have not gotten it wet or anything. Just wore it a night and during the day working in a Dr's office. I did mow my yard with it on  nothing rough. Not worth the 87$ I paid for it : Part 2 Changing my review! I called FitBit and they tried to help me reset it still did not work so they are replacing it for me and the Service was great!!!
review_title: Sad it did not last longer than a Month / part 2!!! The Customer service of Fit bit is Great!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Really liked a lot of things about my Fitbit, but that band just isn't secure enough. As I continued to wear it, it would fall off more and more. This weekend it fell off and I didn't realize until much later. Gone forever. So frustrating. I wouldn't  buy another one unless the band was improved. Will look at other brands and see if theirs appear any better.The tracking worked well for most things (but don't hold onto that treadmill) and it was a good reminder of when I was inactive. The sleep function doesn't  work well, but That wasn't a huge deal for me.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: You cannot see your numbers unless you sync with a phone or computer.  I need to see the nunmbers to motivate me.  I am not motivated having to sync with a computer or phone.  I gave this away and brought the cheaper fitbit clip on version that shows me the numbers all the time.  ALSO, the packaging, a small box with no mention of fitbit was used and it was torn, dirty and unsealed.  It looked 2nd hand!!!!!  I was not impressed for the money I spent.  I love fitbit and have used them in the past but this one was not a good fit for me.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The concept behind this is great, but I have had my flex for a few months now so I can give it a fair review. I have had a range of issues stemming from syncing issues, to every time I travel it doesn't work, the app on my phone can't find the flex even if its right next to the phone with the bluetooth on. The flex freezes and it doesn't charge properly. I am actually to the point of not using it any more and looking for something better. I can honestly say its not worth the money or the trouble. Also my bf has the one and he has issues with it as well.
review_title: Don't waste your time, unless you want to be fustrated

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Bluebooth does not work well for older version of Android. It can drain the Fitbit battery up in 1-2 days if the "Always Sync" is turned on in the Fitbit app. The customer service from Fitbit can be annoying while debugging the device since they can hardly understood what really happened based on the limited cloud data they collected. The sleep tracker is really hard to turn on using tapping. It is definitely wiser to buy the Charger HR instead.
review_title: Buy the Charger HR instead if you can afford it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was really stoked when I saw this product as I am participating in a million step challenge.Got the first and it seemed to be just what I was looking for...for about a week.  Then the battery wouldn't so I called Fitbit directly for help...they brushed me off and said that since it was less than 30 days old, go back to the retailer and exchange it.Got the second one...worked again for about a week and then the battery did the same thing...wouldn't charge, reset...nothing.In this case, it was two strikes and I am done with them.Beware...terrible product...even worse customer service.
review_title: Great concept...poor execution and customer service

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Your first and basic fitbit but certainly does the job.  This was a replacement to the first one that I had for over 2 yrs. Already had different bands for it so decided to continue with this particular model. If you don't need/want all the bells and whistles, this fitbit is the way to go at a reasonable price.
review_title: Your first and basic fitbit but certainly does the job ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is the greatest gadget of all time.  It keeps you mindful and lets you track as much or as little as you want to reach your health goals.  I now have clear, accurate data to share with my doctor and am already making strides to reach my goals.  I even have "fitbit friends"!  We encourage each other so it never feels like you are in it alone.  I can't believe the difference a bracelet can make.  I was really ready for this change in my life and the fitbit flex is supporting my work.  I love it so much I have ordered one for my husband.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had my fitbit flex for 3 months and I love it.  I have mine linked to mapmyrun and myfitnesspal (programs I was already using).  It was easy to set up and is great with pulling everything together to track everything I would want.  The information is interesting and it definitely helps to keep on a healthy lifestyle plan.  I do check my steps through out the day and try to get up and get moving more often.  It's a great system but it won't be helpful if you don't keep up with it.  I recommend this to help track exercise, sleep, and meals but you definitely need to put some effort into using it.
review_title: Love it but you have to keep up with it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: If I could give this a zero stars I would.  In the last 30 days I have had two FitBit Flex's die.  The company is more than happy to send another, but really junk is junk.  This product simply does not work consistently.  I have been using a FitBit Flex for more than three years.  In the last year, I have had four die on me.  My cut...the quality has gone out the window.  The customer service in the Philippines can offer two things:  a replacement or a 25% discount for another product.  Better yet, try getting them to understand your address.  They haven't even been trained to know that US zip codes have five digits.  If you are considering a product from FitBit, don't do it.  There are good alternatives now.  Skip the aggravation and  go with an alternative product.
review_title: The company is more than happy to send another

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my fit bit.  Wish it was more accurate - can't use other apps along with the Fit Bit or the flex will override the information from the other app as manual activity.  It also doesn't accurately track workouts - if I walk/run 4 miles I "might" get credit for 2.5.  Also the teal band is great, but if you wear it everyday it gets dirty quickly and it is hard to clean - wish I would have gotten black now....

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is my second Fidbit as I lost the first while traveling. I decided to switch to the wrist band and i love it. It buzzes when you meet your goal and the phone app is great to know if you are close to reaching your daily goal. I end up walking more because I can check it while I am walking home from work and keep walking if I am close. Less chance of losing the wrist band then the clip on.I also enjoy having the online competition with friends which is an extra motivatorFollow up review.I have owned for 3 months now and the band already broke. It started to break within the month. I have not been wearing it because I need to get a new band. I love that this helped me be motivated, but the band should not break so fast. Poor design.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was a little hesitant at first to buy this product especially with the grand price difference between the actually FitBit website and Amazon, but I did go ahead and call FitBit the actual company and got many of my questions answered. So Fitbit is actually registered with Amazon so it is safe buying it through this website, especially with the grand price difference which was amazing to get. I was also told that once the Fitbit is purchased that there is a one year warranty provided through actual Fitbit cooperations from the date of purchase. Which is amazing! I received the package shortly after within the week and was truly ecstatic to have gotten it. I have been using it ever since and have loved it, the application itself is very straightforward and simple to understand, especially the food option which calculates the calories and tells you how many you should be eating in a day in response to your weight and height. Overall this is an amazing product and I am supper happy to have this in my life. Like I said I was a little hesitant at first but after performing my research and getting all of my questions answered I went ahead and made the purchase, which might have been the best thing because it keeps me motivated as it is always there on my wrist but more so because in local stores this originally retails for $114.99, which is a steal for a deal. So a super big thumbs up<3

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This item is a pain to deal with.  As soon as I can replace, I will.  Constantly loose bluetooth connection, and then you have to struggle to get it back.  The band keeps opening up and falls off.  The battery will show half empty, but the bluetooth won't work, so you have to charge it.  You can leave it in the charger for a couple hours, app indicates the battery is full and the next morning it won't work - battery is dead.  Save you pennies and by something else.
review_title: This item is a pain to deal with. As ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Like the features of the fitbit, but I hate the bands. I'm an in-between size - the largest setting on the small or the smallest setting on the large band. Both were annoying and since i most wanted it t measure my sleep, i needed to find a solution as both bands were impossible to sleep with. I had to take it out and put it in other bands that feel like hair ties (Griffin Silver/Purple Ribbon Wristband 2-Pack for Fitbit and for Sony Fitness Trackers).

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My Flex will not stay charged.I've had it for less than a week.I charged it fully when it arrived,synced it to my phone and was ready to go.It is supposed to keep a charge for about five days.By noon of day 2 it wouldn't sync or record steps.It said battery was fully charged,but when I finally gave up and popped it in the charger it showed zip.I'm returning it.And probably won't bother with another tracker like this again.Too much work.I'm going back to my low tech step counting pedometer.
review_title: Won't hold charge.Waste of time and effort.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love the tracker - hate the bands.  It's a great motivator to do some serious walking,  However, I've had my flex for a little less than 3 months.  Both the large and small bands that came with the tracker have started coming apart.  I don't wear mine 24/7.  No showers.  Sometimes I put it in a loose pocket instead of wearing it because I keep checking it for time thinking it's a wristwatch.  I guess that's my problem.  Anyway, I had a hard time tracking down what to do about the poor quality of the wrists bands. The Fitbit website has a bunch of warranty policy info, but no phone number or return address.  I did finally find a Customer Support phone number online today after a little Internet searching - 877-623-4997.  The service rep said I should get replacement bands without having to send in the defective items.  Just had to supply some basic info via e-mail.  I guess I'll wait and see if they deliver.Follow up:  Never got the shipment confirmation mentioned in their e-mail message but did receive the replacement bands on 8/29/14. I'm happy they delivered as promised.
review_title: Love the tracker - hate the bands

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am a loyal fitbit customer, having owned the Charge and now the Alta, and I got this for my mother. It's helped her see her activity levels, get more active and has made her feel better about herself overall. Next I will be getting her one with a display, but for entry level users who aren't sure if a tracker is for them or those who won't be using a display too much this is perfect.
review_title: get more active and has made her feel better about herself overall

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The FitBit encourages me to keep walking so I hit my daily step goal.  I tried using it to record my sleep, but I didn't like wearing it while sleeping.  I found it to be a bit uncomfortable to me.  I like the little extras with the FitBit app such as being able to record my food and water intake.  Another great feature is being able to add friends who also have a FitBit.  It encourages friendly competition.  The reason it didn't earn five stars from me is because it has come off a couple of times.  For instance, I was pulling on a backpack and the FitBit popped off.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this as part of a company wide exercise program.  I had high hopes of tracking my exercise and sleep.  That went all down the drain when it fell off my wrist for the 3rd and final time never to be found again.  It must have had a bad fastening system.  I wrote fitbit months ago and did not even get a reply.  There advertisements show people doing very strenuous exercising.  I am 63 and out of shape defiantly not an issue with me.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: When my company's benefits provider switch wellness programs I bought this to track my activity and have it sync with the Wellness website. It is HIGHLY dependent on the swing of your arm ... you can run a marathon carrying a box and you won't get any activity registered on this thing. That I understood going in. But when it consistently failed to track my activity, even power walking without carrying anything, I returned it. I routinely walk during my lunch hour ... roughly the same pace along the same route. In a given week, several days I would have a full hour of activity, other days I would have 3/4 of an hour and still others would show just a half hour. And based on that inaccuracy, I never did try and sync it with the Wellness website/portal, so I don't know how that works. A couple coworkers have Fitbits and swear by them. They say they have no problems with accuracy/tracking, so who knows what I'm not doing "right" to get it to track correctly. But as an example, a I friend and I went hiking together, both with our Fitbits on. Neither of us had much activity before we started hiking. By the time we reached the half-way point, she had over 10,000 steps. I didn't reach that point until I was 3/4 of the way through the hike. I didn't expect us to reach 10,000 steps at the same time, but this was a significant gap ... over two miles. All I know is I went back to the old-fashioned way of keeping track ... look at my watch when I start. Look at my watch when I finish. Or if I want to track the actual number of steps, I put on my pedometer, which for me is much more accurate.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Worst company ever! Watches stop working, won’t even charge... after many calls to the company, they replaced it and the “new” one and IT also stopped working after 2 months... called Fitbit and there is “nothing they can do, but we are feel to purchase a new watch”  Really!?!? The same thing happened with my daughter’s Ionic AND my son’s Ace..... Fitbit has lost our family as customers and it is really sad because I was a very loyal fan for 10 years
review_title: Worst company ever.... go with Garmin or Apple... anything would be better

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this after much deliberation and comparison's to other similar products (I over-research everything). Things that I really like about the fitbit flex:1. its charge lasts a really long time. I wear it constantly and only have to charge it once a week or so, and it fully recharges quickly.2. you can change the band color easily - just swap the tracker out.3. you can hook up with friends who are also online and get healthy competition or encouragement going.Things that are just okay about the fitbit flex:1. the sleep tracker feature counts still movement as "restless sleep" even if you aren't asleep. so it says you slept longer than you actually did.2. if you ever work out on a treadmill, for some reason it doesn't count those steps accurately.  when i clock 5.0 miles on a treadmill (really fast walking pace), it says i took about 7-8k steps, when its more like 12-13k steps for me.3. i realized that it didn't have an altimeter (sp?) in it when i bought it, but didn't realize that after having a step tracker how much i would want that feature. When you're trying to gage the difference between 10k and 15k steps, its cool to know how many floors you've climbed/descended as well.4. the band shape creates an awkward fit on my wrist. Maybe that just means i have crazy shaped wrists, but i can't seem to get any setting to feel right - either way too tight or too loose.Overall good product, worth the money for basic purposes.
review_title: Fitbit Flex good, doesn't blow me away

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Have been able to lose around 50 lbs over 5 months based on keeping active and knowing where I stand with the FitBit app in terms of steps and approximate calories expended.Sleep tracking and calories-in tracking with the app are nice bonuses, but haven't proven to be as valuable to my weight loss journey and feeling better.If I lost the Flex today or it failed, I would say that I completely got my money's worth in 5 months.  I would either replace it in-kind or with one of the higher FitBit models.  Those hoping for years from a wearable gadget need to adjust their expectations somewhat.I'm not sure what people pay for personal trainers in an effort to lose weight, but used properly this is a great substitute for a whole lot less.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am so glad I made this purchase!!!!!! It has definitely made me more active and aware of what I'm eating- how active I am being - how much water I am drinking - how well I am sleeping.  It's motivational and fun to watch my steps add up. And when I realize I haven't been very active because my steps are low.. it gets me up and moving!I don't even notice the arm band.  It's very comfortable and I've had no issues with it.  It was easy to put on as well.  My roommate got a Jawbone UP and she had to return it because the arm band kept falling off.  She ended up purchasing a fitbit flex. :)I paired my fitness pal with the fitbit.. and my runkeeper app!
review_title: So glad I made this purchase.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It's basically an expensive alarm clock for me, but it's neat to see how much i walk in a day. My job is basically 5 jobs, shipping/receiving, warehouse/surplus inventory, PC deployment, picking up old equipment, and hardware repairs. I go between buildings and walk a over 5 miles a day on average.the tracker is independent from the phone once alarms and other settings are synced, so even if you party hard and your phone dies, your fitbit is still an alarm cause the battery lasts like 3 days.not bad, but not quite $100 worthy. Comes with a large and small wristband, but only one piece to clip it together. Charger is kinda goofy but charges it quick.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fitbit flex and wear it daily. It keeps me motivated and I love the fitbit community when it comes to encouraging each other and having challenges to keep 'stepping' up our game to become or keep fit!I also like the sleep tracker and how I can log my meals to ensure I'm not going over my daily allotment of calories in vs calories out.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: often goes off-line... bought this from amzn, despite the neg reviews (purchased Sept 9 2013) - already having battery issues.... just charged for an hour+ re-synced with my fitbit app on my iphone5, and it says battery is low.  sure enough, I set it up to charge again, and it shows 1 dot(or bar).  I loved the Fitbit One that I bought on amzn in 2011 - when it started to go at the end of its second year, I thought - two years of out the battery, no problem, "Now I can upgrade to the Fitbit FLEX.  And now here I am considering the competition.  loved the app & internet interface....

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: For two years now I have had an Omron pedometer that I carry in my pocket everyday.  I was intrigued by the FitBit Flex, especially the sleep function, so I got one for Christmas.  In the short time that I have had it I have noticed that the FitBit Flex is wildly inaccurate on the steps as compared to the Omron that I have because since the FitBit is worn on the wrist it evidently counts every movement of the arm which does not necessarily mean that an arm movement equals a step.  For example, yesterday my Omron showed that I had taken 747 steps at the end of the day which is about right since for the vast majority of the day I sat at the desk typing on personal and work stuff and at night watching a football game on TV.  As a comparison the FitBit Flex had me at almost 3,200 steps!!!!  747 steps vs. ~3,200 steps is quite a difference.  Those arm movements from typing, drinking, eating and some actual walking really raked up the steps!  I have a goal of 5,000 steps per day, so based on yesterday's results of Omron vs. FitBit Flex I need to reset my FitBit Flex goal to 21,500 steps per day (5,000 x 4.3).

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It works! Although I had a hard time synching it with my phone. But I was finally able to do it. And I really like using it. I just wished it was on sale when i bought it to save a few bucks lol! Also it came with an extra bracelet which will never be used. My other wish is that if I can buy an extra fitbit device only that would fit it that extra bracelet without having to buy a whole package (with the bracelets). I researched about it and searched online and so far there's none that is for sale. Bummer!
review_title: And I really like using it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Excellent buy. I love the small size and the band is comfortable enough. All of the features work well and it keeps me motivated. I enjoy the automatic syncing to my IPhone so I can check my progress throughout the day. The only cons I can think of is the nutrition portion of the app is not as comprehensive as MyFitnessPal (which I was able to sync up to use together easily) and the unclear information on whether I can use it during aquatics or not. I have stayed with caution and not worn it swimming.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Son developed a 3 inch puffy rash (allergic reaction) after wearing the flex for less than 24 hours.  I immediately asked him to remove it and contacted Fitbit.  Fitbit's response to me was to make sure that we kept it clean, give his wrist a break occasionally, and "continue to enjoy".  I made sure to let Fitbit know how dangerous that advice is.  If you have an allergic reaction to something you don't keep wearing it...not to mention that he had the Flex on for less than 24 hours.  Their policy is not to issue a refund for products purchased elsewhere..Thank God for Amazon.  This one is on the way back for a 100% refund.
review_title: Son developed a 3 inch puffy rash (allergic reaction) after ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Use it every day. Got it to measure quality of sleep, which it does well. Now I'm using it to measure exercise. I do biking, weight training, water aerobics, and indoor fitness for seniors. The Fitbit friends has helped me keep challenged and I'm finding I'm more active the more I get into it's functions.Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_title: Fitbit Flex is simple and easy to use.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Item was delivered as expected from the seller without any issues. My complaint comes with the product itself. There is almost nonexistant instructions with the Fitbit Flex. Could only learn how to run the device function after doing a google search and reading items. The band is very difficult to fasten. I would recommend either the Fitbix HR Charge or the Fitbit Surge. Will they both are more expensive, they are not only easier to use but also provide more information on overall health.
review_title: Decent Item But Fitbix Has Other Model Which are Better

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: As a first Fitbit tracker it was good.. but it never counted stairs.. also it used to fall out easily.. I lost mine that way.. so the clip is not very secure.. pay a little more and go for the charge, well worth the money
review_title: Clip is not secure, falls off

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm very disappointed with fitbit. I bought the flex just over a year ago.  Within 6 months, it stopped holding a charge.  They replaced it. The new one lasted about 6 months before it stopped charging altogether.  Fitbit won't replace this one because I'm 1 month outside of the warranty from when I bought the original.  I'm frustrated and really disappointed with fitbit.  I'll go with garmin next time I buy a tracker.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had a fitbit zip and loved it.  It tracked my steps and active minutes accurately.  I did not like the fact that I constantly lost it so the wristband was very appealing and my friend loves her flex so I purchased one. I purchased one and it only tracks about 80% of my steps and does not record active minutes at all (or barely).  I emailed support  and asked them why why my friend's flex tracked all of her minutes and mine did not (while we were walking together).  They kept insisting that I was "pausing" while walking when I know that I wasn't.  I emailed several times asking how I could fix it and they just stopped replying to my emails.  Most likely because their is a bug in some of their units and they cannot give an answer and don't want to have to replace it.  I would not recommend this product - it is too expensive for it to only "almost" work.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my fitbit!! The only complaint I have (which my husband does not have, so it may just be me) is that it falls off of my wrist more often than I'd like (comes unsnapped). However, the Fitbit support team is AWESOME and sent me a brand new one immediately when I lose mine (since my device was still connected to the network, but not in range, they could tell I had in fact lost it and not trying to scam them for a new one). That said, their customer support is awesome and when I thought my fitbit was gone forever (after only 2 weeks of having it) they totally brightened up my day :)
review_title: Love the Fitbit device; Love the customer support even more

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is my 4th Fitbit . I really like this one. I just wish the Band wasn't so hard to snap. If you don't get it snapped tight enough it will come undone and Fall off!!!! Clearly they have a Design Flaw and know it! I wish they would make them with the Buckle type band instead! As much as I've spent with them(4 Fitbits and the Scale) just would think they could send out the solution to the band problem for free!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have only had his less then a month. It will not charge any more and will not keep track of steps. when I try to sync it says "Not Found"It worked great for the first 2 weeks.. not happy with Amazon as they will not take return back. Brought it June 7/15 stopped working 1 month later.. will not buy again

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I decided I would lose 30 pounds from the start of last year until my son's wedding in October, 2014.  Coincidentally, I was given a Fitbit Flex for Christmas, so I decided to walk, setting a goal of 85,000 steps a week.  The feedback is tremendously helpful, as is the ability to have others whose progress you can observe and with whom you can compete if you wish.  The first Flex did have some problems with charging.  The cradle was not tight, and it often required using scotch tape to secure it properly.  It stopped working in about three months.I called customer service and suggest anyone call rather than making an on-line request.  The service was great, and I had a new Flex within three days.  It has been totally reliable over the past nine months, and I continue to be motivated to walk.  I am 72 years old, did lose the 30 pounds and walked just over 2,000 miles in 2014, or about 40 miles a week.  Most will not want to walk that much or be able to devote that much time to walking.  It has motivated me to now join a fitness club for more strength development, and energy levels are out the roof even though they were fine previously.  I also have the Fitbit scale and like the way it tracks weight on-line.  It is easy to fool yourself unless you keep a log, and it is helpful to know that you can splurge at times and not gain and to observe when your weight begins to creep up a pound or two.  The Flex does not do your walking, but it is an amiable and supporting partner that can be useful for people of all ages.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This tracker would work well for about a week or two, then would stop lighting up or syncing. It was difficult to take out of the band, and it stopped alerting me when the battery was low. It would just die with no warning. I tried resetting it multiple times, but this did not solve the issues. It would also stop syncing to the app, which was frustrating when trying to take advantage of the online friendly step competitions. Even after switching out to another electronic tracker for the same band, it was doing the same thing. I've heard good things about other models, but this one was not what I had hoped.
review_title: Try a different model or brand--skip this one

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I m cry pleased with my Fitbit and wear it everyday.  I have a problem sleeping and with this I can see every morning how much I slept, how many times I was restless bad how many times I was awake.  I can also see how many steps I take in a day and the total number in miles.  I recommend it to everyone.
review_title: I m cry pleased with my Fitbit and wear it everyday

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Not sure now if it is good deal. After first charge, ran for 7 days. Second full charge 4 days. This last charge now reads half empty on SECOND day. I still have time to return it within 30 days and will if battery dies this quickly.Update 6/13. Battery is bad, plus steps and calories burned are ridiculous. Shows me taking steps  while sitting down at the phone. Have asked Amazon to take back, and they have. That's why they are my go-to supplier first for everything.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The idea of this is great, and the tracking is fine, but the design is lousy.  It should have a watch-type clasp. The current securing system is just a pop in type of thing, and it falls off easily.  After one month of use, and VERY careful attention to making sure it doesn't fall off and get lost (it fell off plenty but I never lost it), it finally was lost tonight.  Literally one month to the day I started using it. Don't buy unless a watch clasp is developed eventually. Otherwise, you may as well throw $100 down the drain.  Better yet -- donate it.
review_title: The idea of this is great, and the tracking is fine

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for my boyfriend and he LOVES it! The free Android app does not work with his phone model (Droid Bionic) but he will be getting a new phone soon so that shouldn't be an issue. It syncs up flawlessly to his laptop using the USB dongle that is included. The wristband is very flexible and can accommodate MANY sizes of wrists. The app/website allow you to track your food intake as well, which gives you a more accurate plan couple with the Fitbit's tracking of sleep, calories burned and steps taken.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Wow!, an activity monitor? It's a pedometer plain and simple and a very expensive one at that. Sleep monitor? not really. It measures your movement at night and only if you remember to do the rapid-tap function prior to going to sleep.  And if you don't remember to rapid-tap again in the morning it continues to register your daily walking as a sleep occurance.  It also implies any movement at night as "restless", when shifting position during sleep is normal and necessary. The user interface of single tapping, double tapping and rapid tapping is ridiculous when bumping and vibration during work causes these functions to activate and deactivate spontaneously.  The wristband clasp is a challenge to attach often requiring a second set of hands. This wouldn't be a problem if you didn't have to remove the wristband every few days to charge the fitbit unit.  If you wear a watch on your non-dominate hand, forget about it; it was constantly pushing buttons on my digital watch whenever my wrist would bend.  There are relatively few mobile Phones that it will link with. It didn't sync with my Verizon 4g droid incredible.  I'm trying to think of a positive; it's a good pedometer and helps keep you aware of your activity.
review_title: just buy a 9.99 pedometer, because that's all this is

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I quickly became "addicted" to this. Easy to use, compact, comfortable, etc. BIG downside - I just lost the second one in 1 month! Apparently the clasp fails on me and they fall right off my wrist and I don't notice it until some random time later. Come to find out that they have replacement bands with a latch like a watch. I would definitely recommend getting a different, more secure band!
review_title: It's great...if you can keep it on your wrist

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Worn this little number since I first bought it. While it's nothing more than a pedometer, and I'm aware of that of course, it does spurn me on to "walk that extra mile" every day. I have relatives on Germany and friends around the Bay Area, and we challenge each other for weekend or workweek performances. It's a great way to get your ass in gear and keep it there. I don't need any more than what it offers; wouldn't want a bigger band or more features.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit bracelet  is very difficult to charge. Getting it out of the bracelet and into the charging holder hasn't gotten any easier. Attaching the bracelet is a challenge also. I can't close the clasp without help. The features are nice but more than I need. I upgraded from a Fit Zip which takes a battery. I think for me the battery was more convenient. Also the Zip clips on clothing which is easier.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My wife wanted one for her birthday. It causes a skin rash. It is extremely difficult for her to fasten. The band has too few adjustment options for her wrist--it's either too tight or too loose. And it's stopped recording her activity. She's not the most technically savvy person, and so she doesn't do much to research and try to figure out the problem. I have iPhone apps that do a better job recording workouts.
review_title: Not Impressed at All; The Hype is Just That--Hype

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I know it is a gimmick but it's one of the better ones.  The wrist band itself is comfortable to wear - had a little trouble fastening it the first couple of times.  The sleep function and alarm is great - and the information received can be set to meet your personal needs.  I am recovering from some health problems and the step tracking feature helps me to increase my steps each day - nothing like having a competitive spirit!!  The water intake tracking is good also.  I am thinking about adding the scale so the program is comlete.  I would certainly exdorse this product and recommend it to those of us who are private about our diet and exercise programs.  It is helping me with my confidence also.  Good all around product!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: There are LOTS of other reviews for this product, so I am not sure what I can add, other than that I have had this for a month now, and haven had any problems or glitches with it.  I have found that it really does motivate me to get up and move more during the day, and that makes it a bargain at any price.  Make sure you add friends and join challenges... if you are even just a bit competitive that will drive you to do more.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: After a month this stopped working properly and after 3 months I gave up on the constant care it required. When it's working it's great, but you have to remember to set it when you go to sleep & wake up.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had this for a month now, I have not had any problems pairing it with my Samsung S4 or my computer.  It seems to track fairly accurately.  it does not bother me at all and wears like a watch, almost wish at times it had the time on it :-).  I love the fact that you do not need to pay for the service and the online tools are awesome and keep me on track.  I have not had a problem with the metal clasp and the size small seems to fit perfectly.  I have charged it twice and seems to last approximately 7 days, changing it into sleep mode is a little confusing at first but once you get it down and remember to do it, it is super convenient!!
review_title: it does not bother me at all and wears like a watch

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: After receiving a fitbit with a defective battery, I was able to return it easily and without hassle. They immediately sent a new one and I've been using it ever since. I used to have a jawbone, and this is pretty comparable. I like the app for the jawbone slightly better as it tells you a little bit more about your sleep patterns. However, I like the social aspect of the fitbit app (specifically the challenges).
review_title: I was able to return it easily and without hassle

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: After less than 3 months this will not hold a charge and will not sync. Fitbit support is a joke, they just refer you to their web site and It's no longer eligible for a return on Amazon. The unit was not abused, never got wet, and has no reason to fail. Waste of $100 and I'm not too happy with Amazon's return policy either.UPDATE: I decided to contact FitBit directly and see if they could do anything for me. A couple of emails and a replacement is on the way. This is the way to do customer service. In all fairness I have to update the rating. Amazon's return window is still pretty short though.
review_title: Update: fitbit customer service is doing it right

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for my wife for Christmas.  Let me just start by saying I'm and engineer who LOVES gadgets and will really give them the benefit of the doubt when getting them up and running.  That said, the fitbit completely exhausted this capacity of mine.Let's start:-won't sync to either of our phones (both are relatively new but Bluetooth version is incompatible)-won't reliably sync to USB dongle-wristband snapped at the transparent joint after ONE DAY OF USE-during USB dongle syncing, the provided software routinely says this is a new device and tries to make us re-setup the device and Crete a new accountThis product is comprised of three basic parts: 1) the device, 2) the dongle; 3) the wristband.  All three of these were either effectively broken (not defective but by design) out of the box or broke after next to zero use.This is absolutely unacceptable and I would recommend 100% against buying this product or anything else from this company as they seem to have no problems releasing products that only work under very narrow (and virtually non-advertised) circumstances.
review_title: Fitbit - not worth the cost or hassle

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The fitbit flex is very rewarding. It answers a lot of questions (sleep hours,calories burnt,steps per day,etc.)  I ordered 5 units-1 didn't work. For problems, there is no live person to talk to. They reply through the internet. It solved the problems on the other units. There is different computer problems you will run into.  I wanted the 1 unit replaced. They wanted receipts etc. I ordered from Amazon. I live in Costa Rica. It is very difficult and expensive to return items.  It looks like I will eat the one unit.  I know nothing of the competition. I love the unit im using. Not real happy about the problems that occur. Not happy with the results of the 1 unit. I understand there position.  They have just contacted me--will replace the unit. I think that's pretty honorable of them.  Again I love the unit. Ive actually recommend to friends of mine.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I just received this product and have used it for 24 hours without ever even getting it wet (as the product says you can). It has already stopped working. I am not a strenuous workout person. I took it for a 2 mile walk today and it stopped syncing and now has completely stopped working.I immediately went to the help website and recharged and reset the device to no avail. It still doesn't work. fortunately I found a web forum with a customer service phone number to call and they have sent me an email saying they will replace the device but in the meantime my goals will not be tracked while I wait for the replacement.So that's horrible. I hope fitbit really rushes on the replacement of the faulty device.I hope the next one performs better. :/

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I  do not have any experience with any other brand of activity trackers, so my expectations of what it does and how it works falls short of the description. First, the bands do not hold up making it easy to loose the actual tracker. Replacement bands are sold in a three pack, powder blue, orange, and nave, no replacement black band. Second, the sleep tracker is hard to set, and you don't know if it is set until you sync it. Third, the battery only lasts three days. Other than that, it counts my steps, tells me how many calories I've burned and cheers me on with a little hooray.  The graphs and carts are very helpful on the dashboard, although I wish that weekly, monthly and annual graphs were easier to access.
review_title: the bands do not hold up making it easy to loose the actual tracker

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my flex - in fact I love it so much I am writing a review. I don't usually do that. It is easy to use and brainless which is a big help to me. It is interesting to see how well I sleep or not and it makes tracking my steps easy. The dashboard is easy to use and I like the notifications it sends to let me knowhow I did.Cons - synching with food diaries. Not the best. I use Spark and have to delete dual entries all the time.  Doesn't track stairs. Just steps. Battery can go dead if you don't keep an eye on it.Pros - can shower with it leave it on and forget it. Light weight and not intrusive. Can be synched with food diaries (see above for cons with that feature).Would I get another? You bet!! Much better than the clip on styles like the zip. I am not afraid I'll lose it and no one knows its there :-)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Counts you steps, sleep and any other health stuff you want to track.  My only problem is it does not keep track of your steps as well if you wear it on your wrist.  In your pocket keeps better tracking of your steps.
review_title: Good for keeping track of your day and night

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: i loved my fitbit for about a month, then honestly i just got tired of it.  a couple of times it wouldn't charge up correctly.  then i started to slack on reporting my caloric intake. next i dropped off from tracking my steps - because it wouldn't charge properly.  then i realized that the orange band had become kind of grubby with wear and i just fell out of love fairly quickly.  i'm going to try again because i think the consistency problem is clearly mine, not the product's, but it is annoying when it fails to charge.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had a BodyMedia Core for two years. I purchased a fit bit because i got tired of wearing the Core as an armband. Worst idea ever. I'm a runner and i measure my mileage. the fitbit grossly underestimates the miles I've run and walked, as well as calories burned. I've been wearing the body media and fit bit for a week and it looks like I'll be returning the fitbit and getting a new strap for my Body Media instead

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have been using my Fitbit Flex for about 2 months now. It does a great job at tracking most of my activities. I workout daily and have found that the Fitbit picks up my cardio exercise great, but does not always track my weighted activities accurately. When I spin I attach the Fitbit to my shoelaces to track my spinning (that works great).The Fitbit tracks sleep accurately and is right on target for the times I wake during the night.I would recommend the Fitbit to anyone that wants to track their fitness and sleep.
review_title: Great assest to my fitness routine

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I find this product to be fantastic, but it really depends on what you expect to get out of it.  For me, I only wanted a way to keep better track of my activity and sleep, but I wasn't asking for perfection.  The Flex does a good job, and I wouldn't wish it was any different.  It may be slightly inaccurate, but I didn't need pinpoint accuracy.  If you want to track every step, every calorie, every inch, then this product is not for you.  However, if you want to become more aware of your daily movement, approximate how many calories you burn, and keep better track of your sleep, then this is perfect.I have found it to be perfect.  I wanted a wristband, and the flex is small, unobtrusive, and comfortable.  The wristband is flexible, and the clasp holds well.  The device itself is amazingly tiny and light, and so far quite durable.  It has withstood sweat, sunscreen, seawater, poolwater, the shower, shampoo, etc.Syncing with Fitbit.com is easy, and charging is also easy.  I leave both the wireless dongle and the charging cable attached to my computer all the time.  The website is easy to use, and adaptable.  You can easily change your settings, track your food, input your weight, and modify your daily goals.  The silent alarm is silent and effective, but the only way to enable or disable it is from the computer, which is a little annoying.The star of the show is Fitbit.com's integration with other websites.  I have connected it to my MyFitnessPal account, and am constantly astonished at the seamlessness of the data sharing.  Fitbit shares my activity and calories with MyFitnessPal, and MyFitnessPal shares my food and weight inputs with Fitbit, all without me lifting a finger.  I could not be happier with this feature!The only thing I have found myself wishing was that there was a way to display the time on the Flex.  Even though the screen with the lights is tiny, it could be readable, and I often wish that I knew what time it was, and was wearing a watch as well as the Flex.  However, if adding this would make the Flex any larger, I wouldn't wish it.  Right now it is anything but bulky, but I wear it on the inside of my wrist and it could easily begin to knock on things as I move my arm or use my hand.Overall, it is a great product for me.  Could it be more accurate?  Sure!  Are the step counts sometimes off?  Yes, it's on your arm, not your leg!  Are the calories perfect?  Come on, it doesn't have a heart rate monitor, what are you expecting?  Right now it is pretty accurate, small, comfortable, easy to use, and cheap compared to the Nike Fuelband, more durable than the UP by Jawbone.  I am interested to see whether they can make the Flex more accurate without sacrificing anything, but for now... I think it's perfect, and will continue to wear it until it dies.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had my Fitbit Flex for about a year and a half.  It has really enabled me to become more active.  Last June I finally decided I needed to get in shape and lose the extra 40 pounds that I have been carrying around for the past three years.  Using the Fitbit to give me an accounting of my steps, the Lose it! app to keep me accountable for my caloric intake, and finding a form of exercise that was fun for me (Just Dance video games) were the key for me in losing the weight.  The combination of all three enabled me to lose the 40 pounds in five months and I have continued to use them in maintaining which I have done now for nine and a half months.  Back to the Fitbit Flex, I downloaded the app on my phone and also keep track on my computer.  I like that you can track not only your steps but also your sleep patterns, water intake, and caloric intake.  Luckily for me the Fitbit syncs with the Lose it! app so all the information I put in gets transferred between the apps.  I like that you can join in challenges with friends and that you get a little pat on the back in the form of a vibration when you reach your goal each day.  I thought seriously about upgrading to the Fitbit Charge but decided against it because I like that I can change the color and look of my band with the Fitbit Flex to coordinate with my outfit or my mood for the day.  Another thing that I really like about the Fitbit Flex is the fact that I can set an alarm.  I hate waking up to the sounds of beep-beep-beep...beep-beep-beep, you get the idea.  With the Fitbit Flex I can set an alarm to wake up in the morning and instead of waking up in a startling manner, I get a light vibration on my wrist which is a much nicer way to wake up in my opinion.  I love the Fitbit Flex and am very thankful for this product.  It has helped me to become more active.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit. I have competition going with coworker and sister to see who can get the most steps in each day.  The band started changing color around edges with a couple of months, but then I do wear it everyday, all day except when charging.Update:  Quit working after 8 months.  It will not charge and I have used 4 different usb ports on 2 different computers. I have cleaned the contact points and tried to restart as suggested on website and as instructed by customer service.
review_title: I did love it, until it quit working

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fitbit exceeded my expectations.  It was a Mother's Day Gift for my daughter who was constantly  gaining weight after giving birth to her first daughter.  It was very challenging trying to get her to realize that the weight she was gaining was not contributed by the pregnancy.  When she got the Fitbit Flex she became obsessed with it.  She set her weight goals and didn't deviate until they were meet.  The Fitbit held her accountable for her actions.  She didn't end her day until she meet each goal (even if she had to get up earlier or go to bed later) she planned her meals and began to exceed expectations.  She told me the Fitbit  Flex changed her life.  After 2 weeks the weight started dropping off and it hasn't stop.  She is excited each day about the Fitbit Flex and has introduced it to a lot of her friends.  After one month of using the Fitbit Flex she has lost all of the baby weight and is headed to being the size she was in high school.  She is also working out and she trains harder than she has every done in her life.  She told me that as a result of the Fitbit Flex she is obsessed with eating right and taking care of her physical self....because the Fitbit Flex holds her accountable when it comes to doing what's right and wrong (when it comes to fitness).  I would like to purchase one of more advanced ones for my self one day and purchase one for my other daughter as well.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Ihad such high hopes for this product it was working fine and I didn't even have it for a month and already does not work. After my fitbit was low on battery I left to charge for a good 5 hours and when I checked on it I was so dissapointed to see the battery on it was still low and i only had it for 3 weeks and I also took really good care of it for thr day I got it this product is a major let down tho it does its job its just too sensitive brittle and after only 3 weeks already will not charge im hoping customer service can do something about it after all it was $100

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am so disappointed! I had my Fitbit for a little more than a week.  It was great!  Tracked my steps, providing me with more motivation to go further and let me know the distance I went.  Tracked my sleep, which is really important to me because I had sleep problems in the past.  I was learning how to use the rest of the tracking features to the best advantage.  But not anymore.  My Fitbit is gone!The clasp on this thing wasn't too hard to do as I've read in other reviews.  The problem is that it is too easy to come UNDONE! The first time it popped off was day three while we were camping.  Must have snagged it while setting up my tent.  Next thing I know, my wrist was bare.  Fortunately I found it.  But today it must have popped off again, and this time I can't find it anywhere.  I guess it is gone, along with my $100.  If they expect you to wear it all the time, the least they could do is make a more secure clasp.Do yourself a favor, if you buy one, also get one of the clasp protectors I've seen online.  Of course, I didn't know I needed one until I lost mine.I will NOT be buying another one.  Who can afford to throw away $100 in a week?EDIT: Amazon is amazing!  Fitbit would not replace my Flex since I did not purchase it from them, however Amazon was willing to replace it.  I have only ever had to call Amazon customer service twice, and both times they were incredibly helpful.  This is why I love Amazon and will keep my Prime membership.  So worth it!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fitbit became unchargeable after only 3 months and has been replaced already. Maybe it will last another 3 months or more hopefully. review_title: Otherwise it does what it says and I've enjoyed using it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the computer program/dashboard that is included with the Flex. I was tracking the same info on a spread sheet and this makes it sooooo easy. It was easy to create my food list and I log everything I eat with a couple of clicks.  I read all the problems that people wrote about and they're all answered on the fitbit website. The start-up info is all there also. The dashboard was the extra help I needed - I've lost 6 pounds in 3 weeks and the sleep monitor has helped me make the adjustments I needed there.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had the Fitbit flex for a week now and enjoy it quite a bit. It's a convenient way to track my daily activity.  I've found that knowing how many steps I've taken in a day is a useful motivator if I'm being sedentary for some reason and am lagging behind my "goal" of 10,000 a day.In terms of usability, the Fitbit is great.  It is small, lightweight, and unobtrusive. It's comfortable to wear.  Initially I had some misgivings about the lack of information that the device itself can display.  The Nike FuelBand, for instance, can display steps taken and other metrics on the band itself. With Fitbit, this information is mostly displayed in the App or on the dashboard.  Since everyone has a smartphone these days, this really does not turn out to be a significant limitation.  After a few days I learned to just let the Fitbit count my activity and I check up on it in the app when I want.  The device has 5 LEDs that show progress toward 10,000 steps (each one represents 2,000 steps), and it turns out that's all the information you really need.The step counting appears fairly accurate.  There is an option to set the sensitivity of the Fitbit based on whether you're wearing it on your dominant hand, the theory being that you use your dominant hand more, so if you're wearing the Fitbit on that hand, it should be less sensitive. I wear mine on my non-dominant hand but have the dominant hand setting selected because I felt otherwise the Fitbit was overcounting my steps.  The calorie and distance estimations seem undercounted to me, but those aren't why you really would use this type of device.The most disappointing thing about the Fitbit to me is the sleep tracking function.  It doesn't seem particularly accurate.  Fitbit thinks I am pretty sound sleeper, but there are nights where I've slept terribly and the Fitbit doesn't seem to pick up on it. The sleep tracking display is also very binary (trinary?) - either you're "asleep," "awake," or "restless" - but other sleep measurement devices are better at detecting both these states and the varying gradations between them.Anyway, I love the Fitbit for what it does well, and hope that with software updates they can hone it further to do other stuff better!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I don't have the black band, however I do have the fitbit flex.It comes with two sizes of wrist bands, which is great that adjust to many different sizes, which is good, because I have small, almost child size wrists, and it fitsI love that it records my sleep and physical activity - it evens lets me know if my activity is considered 'intense.'The only thing I don't like is that it didn't work with Weight Watchers and I couldn't find how to convert data, finally came across fitwatchr and it works great!The module's power lasts a week and charges easily,Worth it?? Absolutely!!!
review_title: Worth the time, worth the money!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Best health and wellness purchase I have ever made. So easy to track activity, sleep patterns and calorie intake. The bar code scan for foods is a great feature and the search engine includes standard entrees for most of the major restaurants and fast food chains. The sync is easy. It is synced to my MacBook, iPad and iPhone and I did it all in a matter of minutes, which is a major accomplishment for a technologically challenged person like me. I think I am addicted to this device.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm giving it 3 stars cause its a great idea but that's all. I was very disappointed for the price and the hype that it would work better than it does.It records your sleep pattern ok, but walking it counts your steps every time you move your arm. In one day I walked over 3000 steps! And that day I was snowed in and was reading a book all day.And yes a adjusted and set my fitbit and had it on my less dominant wrist.I even had my husband try it out for a few days. article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Ordered on Black Friday and shipped quick from Amazon.  Charged if a full day and noticed that only 4 of the 5 lights were lighting up. I YouTubed and Googled this issue to see if there was a trouble shooting method, (which there was) and I reset it, but to no avail. Instructions are not to clear but a couple mins online and I figured out how to use properly.
