article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was never able to get the Fitbit in to sleep mode to monitor sleep, the LEDd indicated it was set properly hover it did not register with the iPhone App. Good quality construction, I really wanted it to work as it is the complete package, great band, charge lasted beyond the 7 days advertised but being able to track sleep is more important than the may other statistics ... this could have been a defect in software in FitBit or iPhone app.  I now have the Withings new Pulse on order, I don't like having to do what I'm going to have to do to monitor sleep but it does have a display so that I can verify that it is working!
review_title: Well made, confusing operation as there is now status on unit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The pluses of the Flex are that it is with you all the time and it does keep you conscious of your activities so that you are inclined to do more than normal.  it is small, convenient, and easy to use and the syncing is seamless with no effortThe negatives of the Flex out weigh the positives by a significant margin:  1.  It is inherently inaccurate.  there is no way to input the length of your step, and the calorie consumption calculation differs from others I consider more accurate  2. it significantly over counts on some occasions and under counts on other occasions.  I have counted stops with my pedometer and find that it is rarely off more than a few steps over s specific distance whereas the Flex rarely matches the count  3.  it is extremely difficult to fasten the catch on the bracelet.  A total lack of thought in its design  4. you need a magnifying glass to see the arrow on the back to see which way it goes into the bracelet--another lack of thought in its design  I agree with the reviewer who advises that you should wait until the next version is released.  this is way too expensive for this lack of quality and thoughtful design

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have so much fun with all the features fitbit offers.  I can connect with my friends and also with the Weighr Watchers program.  I have the fitbit flex.  If my wrist gets tired or my bracelet doesn't match what I'm wearing I just take the electronic piece out of the bracelet and put it in my pocket.  I also bought an off brand magnetic holder that clips on my belt loop.  It's fun for me to change things up.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Caution!  Ours, too, stopped working after barely more than 30 days -- won't charge.  Unable to return because it has been more than 30 days.  Suggest looking at other options.UPDATE:  Since I was beyond Amazon's return period, I contacted Fitbit directly and after unsuccessfully attempting to troubleshoot the issue of the Flex not charging, they promptly mailed me a new Flex. I'm not the user of the Flex as it was a gift, so I can't speak to the device itself, but I was impressed with Fitbit's customer service.  Hopefully, the new one will keep on ticking!
review_title: Stopped working after barely more than 30 days:-(

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This isn't the fanciest wearable activity tracker, but everything it does it does very well.  Battery lasts a super long time, and it syncs with no effort on my part whenever it sees my computer (I don't use the mobile app.)I was surprised at how much I responded to the stats it generates, and with the social media components ...  it gives me a cognitive awareness of my activity levels that I didn't have before.  Its really helping...
review_title: I was skeptical, but was won over!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Although the lowest price in the Fitbit lineup these were given as gifts for Christmas and became everyone's tech toy. Everyone wearing them comparing their stats. Only negative was setting up on iPhones was difficult because everyone's device was showing up trying to setup. If you have multiple Fitbits to setup, make sure to do one at a time, and take the other ones out of range of the one you are trying to setup.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love the product, hate the band.  The band catches on things and pops off.  I had to purchase little fastener rings (Getwow 15-in-1 Bundle includes (12) Mixed-Color Silicon Fastener Rings) to protect my Fitbit.  The actual Fitbit is a little unit not much longer than an inch which can be placed in other bands.  You have to be careful because not all bands are alike. I purchased the Innis 10pcs Small Wristband and they break apart.
review_title: Love the product, hate the band

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very disappointed. I was very gung-ho when I bought this, and the battery lasted on a full charge up to 3 days more often then not. Now the battery is barely lasting a day if that and I have no idea that the battery is dying because my app says I have a full battery. I had a full battery at 7 am today, barely checked my steps until this evening and the battery was too drained to sync.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I liked the device but the snap on band was terrible. It was constantly being ripped off my arm accidentally. I knew sooner or later I would probably lose it. That vision came true today after 3 months. There more expensive $140 model has a decent wrist band clasp (shocker I know). I would NOT recommend buying this model due to the poor wrist band design. Sooner or later you will fine it GONE with the money you spent.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I guess it's the price that bugs me most - Essentially $100 for something that tracks my steps, activity (not terribly well), and sleep (again not terribly well).Then we have the wrist band that is falling to pieces after less than two months - that's really annoying. I don't even wear it in the shower.The app is OK - I can track my exercise and it guesses about my calorie burn - overall I'm just not terribly impressed with a $100 thing that doesn't do any of it's functions very well...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I did not make my decision lightly.  I read all the reviews for the fitbit and other brands.  They were similar, but fitbit seemed slightly better  I love it.  It is very motivating.  Love getting to my 10,000 steps and have increased my goal. There would have been many days that I thought I walked enough - but now my fitbit keeps me honest.  I also love seeing how long I slept and how well I slept.  I appreciate that I can wear it in the shower.  I only take it off when I need to charge the battery.  You can incorporate your diet - to keep track of the energy you are taking in and the energy expended.  This is a great product.  I just bought one for my adult daughter.  She loves it too!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great product! Easy to use, light weight on the wrist and comes with the small and large band. This is the basic fitbit so you can only see your results on your phone. It just shows dots-each one represents how many thousands of steps you've walked. One lit up circle that blinks twice is 2thousand steps all the way to 5 dots that blink twice representing 10,000 your ultimate goal. It also tracks your sleep patterns too. Which from what I've noticed it pretty accurate.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Overall I like the Fitbit Flex.  I have had it since March.  It basically does what I expected it to do, however, it  has some quirks.  Sometimes it is unresponsive, sometimes it lags in the data sync even though it says it has synced.  It doesn't always capture the active periods accurately.  I love the pedometer and how it syncs with my Fitness Pal.  It gives me a general idea of my calorie burn and helps me make sure I eat enough to support my activity level. I love the silent alarm, however this has recently stopped working?  It no longer vibrates AT ALL.  And the wristband has broken.  I had to steal my husbands small band.  FITBIT if your reading this please tell me how to make it vibrate again or send me a new one! You advertise that you never have to take it off which is what I basically do, but it doesn't seem to be durable enough to sustain continual, long term wear.  I expect it to last longer than a few months.In the future it would be great to have a heart rate monitor built in And add some CROSSFIT exercises to the pool of activities to select from.  It would be nice to have a decent idea of what I am burning at CROSSFIT.
review_title: I like it but mine has stopped vibrating and the strap broke...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Had the fitbit flex for just over a month during which time I enjoyed using it. Unfortunately the strap is not very robust as mine fell off during an afternoons play in Tongva Park with my toddler. Upon contacting customer service they confirmed the time when my fitbit last synced which I already knew, and suggested I return to the park with my phone, and then use the sync function to help locate my fitbit. Given the park is 6.2 acres and the fact that we covered most of it, trying to retrace our steps with a toddler whilst looking at my phone is not practical advice. I expected better in terms of quality of the product and customer service. (update) I was sent a replacement but unfortunately this only lasted 2 weeks before it broke and fell of my wrist whilst cycling. It seems I'm not the only one to have experienced issues with the quality of the strap https://www.facebook.com/fitbit/posts/599481163409405. The dashboard is great but unfortunately the product itself is not made to last.
review_title: Poor Quality wristband and customer service!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: If I could give this a 0 I would. My husband has the Jawbone UP3 and that blows this one out of the water. I do not like the features on this- this is the bottom of the line fitness tracker. I am returning it and just ordered a Jawbone. Pedometer is off- it is super sensitive every time it is bumped, and it turns on the sleep mode at random. Last night it said I slept from 4:23pm-4:20am. Wow, I don't feel that rested. I like the color selection I guess, but thats where it ends. It also doesn't always vibrate when giving alerts. It is not motivating like the Jawbone. Worst purchase ever.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Works well, used it for quite awhile before upgrading. Eventually the band, which is made of rubber, will start to rip until it separated completely. This is due to taking the battery out to recharge which you need to do every few days if you wear it all the time. Did last for about a year though and you could buy replacement bands which aren't too expensive.
review_title: Works well, used it for quite awhile before upgrading ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This fitbit flex fits nice on your wrist, but you need to synch it with your computer or phone to get the number of steps you have taken.  Not too much of a pain if you have your phone with you at all times, but not easy if you are on the go and want to see your progress.  I haven't figured out the sleep feature yet, but it seems like it can be manipulated by putting it on your nightstand.  I like the feature that lets some of your friends see your progress, and we tease and inspire each other in that way.  But if I buy another fitbit, I think I will move up to the Force (currently recalled because of skin irritation issues) or go back to the One (which un-clipped from my waist several times before it finally got lost forever).
review_title: Not as easy to lose, but not easy to read

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It didn't work for me. Just moving my hands, like when typing, registered steps. And riding in the car did the same thing. I returned it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is a great product if you are interested in only tracking your steps. I was disappointed to discover it didn't track flights of stairs(I'm up and down stairs most of the week). I do like the challenges with others. It keeps the motivation going. Would recommend getting the next level up... I'm already looking to upgrade.
review_title: This is a great product if you are interested in only tracking your ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I happily used a Fitbit Flex for 16 months. It worked well and I loved it. In Feb, 2017, it started going haywire -- not tracking on the iPhone app, showing inconsistent tracking and generally not working as it should. I thought it was the Flex hardware, so I replaced replaced it.  The one I purchased (this one) works 'sometimes'. I am now certain it is not the hardware; it is the Fitbit app software on my iPhone.  There have been multiple updates in recent months and the tracking does not improve.  It's too bad Fitbit decided to essentially kill this product by poor app engineering.
review_title: This used to be great until the app stopped working.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Comfortable and pretty stimulating for walks and hikes. Reliable info for steps and calories? Sorry, I think not.Funny part comes when I play piano and it counts fast pace. Also I talk like an Italian, use my hands to describe or to gesture something to my friends or family, fitbit counts my steps while I am sit down. Go figure.I wish it could recognize the difference, maybe we should wear it on our feet only :). Something to think about.
review_title: Comfortable and pretty stimulating for walks and hikes

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It was okay while it was working.  Tracked steps, in an approximate, rounded way.  Seemed a little inaccurate on the sleep monitoring - tracked general movement throughout the night.  Stopped tracking everything about 3 weeks ago...less than a year from purchase date.  Still lights up when connected to charger and says it's connected, but will not track. I can't say it was due to wear and tear, being that I forgot to wear it about half of the year that I owned it. :)  I tried troubleshooting and attempted to reset, as recommended, but it did not help.I would not recommend this product based on my personal experience with it, but it's possible I just got a bad unit.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Worked great for about a month. Then, the battery started acting up. Now, it may last 3 days, or it may last 12 hours. It only gives me notifications about half the time when the battery is low.  I wanted to love it so much. I'm so disappointed.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had the Nikeplus band for about a year and a half, and I have to say "I LOVE THIS Fitbit Flex!  It is amazing the things you can keep track of with this band that you couldn't with the Nike band.  The downside is that with the Flex, you can't just look at your wrist and see your progress.  You can track it on either your smartphone or your Computer...and this band works with most smartphones.  The Nike Fuel band only worked with Apple.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is not the one with a watch but it is all that we needed (order two of them)  All the family has one now and we compete.  It is simple and possibly inaccurate -- measuring movement of the arm -- but motivates us to walk etc.  Nice if it would record bike riding.  The sleep monitoring is interesting to see how much one moves about in the night.  Just need to turn it on which requires a few taps -- be careful during the day you can turn the sleep mode on by accident.  Battery lasts a long time -- four or five days.Bottomline -- good motivator.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Really nothing more than a glorified rubber band around your wrist to remind you not to be a fat ass.The first one I had came off my wrist within 3 days.  I hard wired the second one so I'm not relying on that worthless clasp.  Fitbit should be ashamed of themselves for such weak reliability.The good part is that you can keep track of your walks, runs, rides (no option to call it that) and the sleep monitor is interesting but there's nothing you can do with the information.  If the clasp wasn't completely worthless I would give it 4 stars.
review_title: The good part is that you can keep track of your ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Waited for several months after losing my Fitbit One for the new Flex to arrive. I found it a lot less useful and convenient than the tracker it replaced. It requires you to haul out your phone or check your computer every time you want to see your stats. It takes up two USB ports on your computer, one for the charger and one for the dongle. It's inconvenient to remove it from the wristband for charging all the time. The wristband is quite fugly, its clasp is difficult to work. If you also wear a watch (because, inexplicably, the Flex doesn't even have a clock), expect an uncomfortably cluttered wrist.My Flex quit working within a month. Unit wouldn't hold a charge. Was basically rebooting it daily until it went completely kaplooey. Then the wristband busted. Lucky me, customer service sent me a replacement after I produced a copy of my Amazon receipt. When I went to register it at the website, I discovered that they're coming out with a new model (the "Force") that seems to address several of the shortcomings of the Flex. This "Force" development was pretty irritating, since I'd already shelled out $100 for a flawed product that I only got a few weeks' use out of, only to discover that the model they should have released in the first place will now cost me $125. Based on the cruddy build quality of the Flex, I won't be buying the new model.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had no problem with the performance of this item.  The design of the bracelet leavea a lot to be desired.  I only had it two weeks when it fell off my wrist, and it is nowhere to be found!!  I might as well have pitched a hundred bucks out my car window.**********************UPDATE!!  I'm guessing the folks at Fitbit pay close attention to these review pages, because I was contacted by them and offered a replacement!  That is unheard of!!  I am excited to get another Fitbit as I had no problems with the one I purchased!  I will just be a little more aware of it. I really appreciate the excellent customer service!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: After 1 year it would no longer charge.  Emailed FitBit customer service who sent me a new one, it worked for about a month, now it won't charge either.  Just spend the extra $20 on the next model... or maybe I just got a bad "batch"? Not worth it to worry about anymore.It didn't really motivate me to move more, it just made me feel bad about myself when I could actually see how lazy I was/am!  :P

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got this for my husband for Christmas and he's become obsessed with how much he walks and moves during the day, ha!  At the end of the day if he meets his step count he sings a little song (I just want to celebrate... another day of living... haha!)Anyway- the only complaint that he has is that it gets in the way of sleeping. It would wake him up at night if he wore it to bed just because of the way it would rub on his wrist or against the pillow.  Other than that he loves it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my Fitbit. Can monitor so much. It gives me motivation to try and walk more, plus you can compete with friends who also have one. Love the sleep monitor. No wonder I'm so tired when I awake. It shows how much you are restless and awake during the night. Definitely recommend this product! It's very easy to set up and to use.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really like my Fitbit! It was so much more accurate than what I used before and pretty darn close to my calorie burn! I have been able to lose 7 pounds with my workout program and eating plan using the flex, whereas I was gaining weight on my old one because of incorrect calculations! I also LOVE the sleep feature! Helps so much and I feel is VERY accurate!I can also track my runs and workouts easier!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: What a amazing little piece of hardware, it has been great at keeping me motivated to get out from behind my desk and move, it syncs up with the myfittnesspal app  and together have helped me stay on my step goal, show me my calories burned vs eaten and have really opened my eyes to what I eat and what I do!
review_title: What a amazing little piece of hardware

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Awareness of level of activity is helpful to set goals and improve.  I know it is not precise, and I'm still trying to calibrate it so that my running steps match RunKeeper.  But it accomplishes the goals that I had for it--a relatively unobtrusive aid to encourage activity.  Cut 1 star because shortly after using it, the charger has to be positioned just right for it to actually charge.  It is also nice to see how other activity at a slow and steady pace--such as yard work--accumulates as many steps as a good long run.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the Fitbit Flex as an activity tracker but I can't give it the full 5 stars.  It seems to track my steps fairly accurately and it's an easy thing to wear.  The iPhone app is great.  However, the wristbands SUCK.  They fall apart and I've replaced TWO bands in the past 6 months.  Until recently, there weren't as many options for replacing the wristband and you had to buy a replacement band from Fitbit which cost WAY more than they are worth.  I also have not been able to get the sleep tracker to work for more than one night.
review_title: I love the Fitbit Flex as an activity tracker but I ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this and I've lost it twice, once getting off a flight and another when out to dinner.  I thought it was my fault for losing the first one, handling luggage and all... but I was extremely careful with my second fitbit!! I made sure I had it on periodically and was mindful of taking on/off my jacket but somehow it fell off my wrist! Sure... the activity tracking capabilities are useful but until they can figure out a way to lock it securely around my wrist I won't be purchasing another. I had the fitbits for 2 months total. Which is why I consider the product a failure, an expensive one at that!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this in May 2016 as a replacement for my prior Fitbit Flex which broke after about a year and a half of use. I am sorry to say that this one is now broken as well, after only 3 months!  I tried all of the suggestions on the website but this one will not hold a charge. I contacted Fitbit via email and have not heard back. Very disappointing! I got my whole family into Fitbit and never would have thought about looking at competitors, but it seems like I will have to now.
review_title: No longer holds a charge after only 3 months!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am very disappointed in it.When I go grocery shopping or pushing any kind of basket or even bumping it, it  does something to cause an error. It will blink on light 1 and 4 then light 2 and 5, then when I tap it it will do the error  again. I called the manufacturer and asked him if I had to take the charging port with me every time I went to the store just so I could reset it.Very disappointed!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: if you wear this in the shower, be warned that it will reduce the life of the band and also cause it to stink pretty badly.  I now take it off whenever I think i might get it wet.  Tried all sorts of things to clean it, but to no avail.band also broke after 3 months.  fitbit replaced the band, but took 4 weeks to so so and repeated email followups.  the activity tracking is fine and I like the bluetooth syncing.  It's too bad it doesn't sync to my android htc one s.  I have to sync using the included usb wireless dongle.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Item arrived on time. Packaged well. It IS a nice product at a fair price. Was a Christmas gift to son. Face dropped when opened. He had wanted(wished for)The Fitbit Charge.  When having to return product. Seller, Heart Rate MonitorsUSA, were less than pleasant. Returned item at my cost. Found they had issued me a Restocking Fee! Contacted Amazon. They made it right. All in all. Product good. Seller, not so much. Plenty to choose from when in the market for a fitbit flex.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: First the fitbit my husband bought me quit holding a charge. Now this one I bought him has quit holding a charge. At first it would work for about 5 days on a full charge. Now the battery dies overnight after being fully charged the morning before. He knows how to charge it correctly and how to maintain the battery connections. He learned that when mine quit charging last month and had to be replaced! Other than the charging issues he loves the thing and uses it every day. He has lost about 20 lbs. since I got it for him for Valentines. But they need to make them to last longer than four months. Frustrating........

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this mainly for the pedometer and the fact that it can track your sleep.I just got it today so this review I definitely will update in the future, but I just thought I would throw this out there.I work midnights at a desk job and the flex records restart at midnight. I have been sitting in a chair not moving and it has registered that I have walked almost 50 steps since then! It makes me a little concerned that the pedometer is not accurate, which then gives me doubts about the accuracy of all other functions.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It has been a pretty helpful tool in making sure I am getting my movement in each day and monitoring my sleep.  It won't pick up movement well when doing things like weight lifting or moves that don't have your arm freely moving like push ups or leg workouts, but overall it works well.  I bought this in April and towards the end of August, it quit holding a charge for more than a day.  I have contacted customer service and they are in process of sending me a new one, free of charge, so that is wonderful.
review_title: It has been a pretty helpful tool in making sure I am getting my ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit had battery issue where it would died and would not charge for a period of time until recently where it completely died and won't charge anymore. I tried all the suggestions from the Fitbit support but nothing worked. I did some research and some other people have similar issues but Fitbit would not do anything about it. I do not recommend buying this product as it's not a durable product, it only last me about a year and half and I used it at a desk job and to workout sometimes.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I just received my fitbit flex yesterday and I was excited because I've heard so many great things about it.  The package arrived super fast and the packaging was fine.  However, the product is not charging.  I think I got a lemon.  :-(  I've followed all of the instructions.  I even brought it to work as my coworker has the same one and it is not charging..  I will return and hope for a replacement fast!!!
review_title: ... and I was excited because I've heard so many great things about it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The concept of tracking your daily number of steps is great, but this base version of the fitbit is not worth it.  It's very difficult to fasten, but comes off easily when it gets caught on something.  The series of taps to access information is annoying.  The removal of the CPU to charge it is inconvenient and becomes loose over time.  There are upgraded models that cost more but are worth it.  Others that I know who have used it feel the same and have upgraded.  I will do the same.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: To start, it doesn't fit in the charger. I have to rig it in with a rubber band son it will charge.Next, charging is random. Sometimes when I charge it till all the lights are lit and it will die a couple hours later. I can even let it charge over night and it dies by noon. Other times it is fines and lasts a couple days. I never know which it will be though.It is great when it works however and I love it when it does.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Well, this was great at first.  It interfaced with Android very well, and My Fitness Pal.  And then a few months later, the band broke.  OK, so I bought another one.  And then, about a month after the warranty expired, the thing went kaput.  It held a charge for a day.  A half a day.  Then it wouldn't charge.  Then it would.Now it's completely useless.  So the way I figure it, with fitbit and extra band, working for a year, it cost me $120, or about $10 a month.  If I had known it had such a limited shelf life, I wouldn't have bought it.  Honestly, cell phones last longer.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: When the Flex worked, it was great. I liked tracking my steps and checking my sleep patterns. Ten months later, a software update rendered my Flex inoperable because it is a counterfeit. The vendor on Amazon (RC Liquidators) has, of course, closed up shop by now.My advice is to only buy from the FitBit store on Amazon. No one else here is an authorized seller.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This product was a gift to my wife on our anniversary. This product worked well ... for about a month.  It then stopped working.  My wife tried to contact the company while it was still under warranty, but they never responded.  She left messages, tried emails... nothing worked.  Basically, I pissed away about $100 and is by far the worst experience I have ever had with products I've ordered on Amazon (but to be clear, my complaint is not with Amazon but with Fitbit). The concept is great, but go to a company that stands behind its product!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got it yesterday and figured it out fairly easily. I am 68. Syncing is working but the computer says it isn't. Obviously a software glitch. Was concerned that it would drive me crazy like some watches do but it was very comfortable.  I dressed children, changed diapers, cooked, walked, cleaned and ran errands. Hardly noticed it. Clasp seems secure.  Will order some cute bands.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex works okay but has a few design flaws that need to be fixed.First, the clasp is in not very secure.  I have had the product for only a month and it has come unclasped and fallen off multiple times during work and other physical activities.  It could easily be lost if someone didn't notice it falling off.  I have noticed that some of Fitbit's more expensive models have a clasp that is similar to a watch.  I think they should redesign the flex with a similar clasp.Second, It often is knocked into sleep mode by vibrations such as operating power tools (I suspect using a lawnmower will cause the same problem).  Also it usually requires about 10 seconds of very forceful tapping to put it into or out of sleep mode.  I believe some of Fitbit's more expensive models automatically detect sleep and therefore do not require setting the sleep mode.Overall I think it is an innovative product that can encourage people to be more active, however it doesn't seem to be rugged enough to withstand the very physical activity that it encourages.
review_title: It could easily be lost if someone didn't notice it falling off

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This has been such a great tool to help me get back on track. I've been faithfully using it, exercising and recording my calories for around a month now and have already lost 12 lbs. It's motivating and gives the type of information that I need to keep myself active and honest.The iPhone app has a nice interface and is simple to use. One of my favorite features is the sleep tracker, it's quite accurate at determining when you are tossing and turning and when you are definitely up and awake. I also like "silent" alarm  which works by gently vibrating to wake you up in the morning.I would give it five stars if the wristband had been designed better. It's really difficult to get it to clasp correctly on your wrist, it's very awkward to put on. I've had it come off after getting hooked on something in my gym bag--I didn't even notice it at first--thankfully it fell into my bag and not on the street somewhere. I also think the food database on the app is confusing and odd at times. For example, I ate raw, fresh carrots so I type in "carrots" and 30 possibilities pop up ranging from "shoestring, frozen" to "Gerber Strained," to "peas & carrots, frozen," etc., etc., but nothing about just plain, raw, fresh carrots. Those things aside, I love it and have recommended it to everyone I know.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am addicted to wearing it and checking how far I walk each day!  I also like how it tracks my sleep - I know I'm restless during the night and this shows just how much.This company has wonderful customer service as well. I had mine for about 2 months and the band started coming apart. I took a picture and sent it to them and they shipped me a new band. I had it about 4 days after I contacted them.Two days after I got my new band, I was doing some volunteer work and it came off. We looked through trash cans and lots of bins, but couldn't find it. I contacted the company and they sent me a whole new kit!  I had it within a week.  You just don't find customer service like that anymore.  I'm so happy to have my new fitbit and keep track of my walking again!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this Janurary 6 and it stopped working 3 days ago (February 21st), 15 days after my ability to return it.  I was super excited to get this too!  I spent months doing research to find something that would do most of what I wanted.  It doesn't measure heart rate or oxygen based metrics.  It does measure sleep but it's ability to determine whether or restless or awake isn't accurate.  You can measure water consumption and your weight which is nice if you're trying to track or run metrics against it.  It tries to auto calculate your active minutes but again it doesn't do a good job at this either.  You can manually enter the metrics for this which is fine by me, but it brings the accuracy of what it does do automatically into question overall.  You have to pay extra for additional reporting features too.Overall, the only feature I found the most useful was the silent alarm.  It helps get me up in the morning when I don't want to wake up my partner and it tells me when my classes are finished.  lol  Very expensive alarm ;-)  I think that if you buy this just be wary that it has a chance to stop working after the 30 day return policy.  I'm going to see if this can be returned and use the money to buy something else to help me measure my activity.
review_title: Stopped working after 1 month and a half

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was not what I expected. There were not any instructions with it, and it ask me to go to the Internet and download an APP. I am one of the few people in America that doesn't like to use a cell phone. So after a day or two of trying to make it work, I mailed it to a relative. He loves it and had it working in a short time. So, I presume it was I that didn't have the patience to learn how to use it. Good product, inept customer.
review_title: Something for everyone, but not for me.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was so excited to purchase this to track my activity.  When I first got it, it was easy to set up and understand.  Motivated me to get moving more.  I loved it and wore it all the time.  The bad part...  lasted less than a year.  More like 6 months.  I sent a message to the seller to explain it had stopped working and have given them more than enough time to respond, but I have not heard back from them.  So now I have a device that does not work at all.  Very disappointing and would not purchase from them again.
review_title: it was easy to set up and understand

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am a 75 year old lady with lupus which has limited my activity and caused me to gain weight which I have tried to lose by reducing calories.  I purchased the Flex a few months ago and have been increasing my steps gradually and am now at 8,000 daily.  This requires much more activity than usual but I have lost 16  pounds so far with moderate walking daily.  It really helps to track food intake. I have found that the sleep tracker is accurate.  I spend time three days a week in the swimming pool and have not worn it there, but understand that it can be worn in water.  I have not used any similar products. I plan to continue using the FLex for as long as I am able to get up and go!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The main reason I bought Fitbit Flex was for sleep tracking and that it does very well. I have a security camera and when I compared it to Flex results it was quite accurate.Counting steps is a totally different matter: If you work with a computer all day like I do; you can achieve 10K steps by not even getting out of your chair! (I have played active vs. inactive arm & other settings but none of them helped). I was actually ready to live with this limitation (by removing it whenever I was working) but after approximately 2 weeks of use; the battery started dying after only 3 hours (Resetting it didn't help).I did create a ticket with their customer support but after 5 days of waiting I only got a canned response (According to the e-mail I got; they were receiving unusually high volumes of e-mail support requests!). At that point; I have returned the product back to Amazon; especially after reading that many others hit the same battery issue.I do hope that they fix their current issues as well as realizing 5 days wait time for a ticket is not reasonable; I would like to give them another shot then.
review_title: Not for everyone; terrible customer support

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have a love/hate relationship with my (former Fitbit) = 1 star/ 5 starsI loved the fact that it made me aware of my walking and movement.It pushed me to go more each day.What I absolutely hated was that it was impossible for me to snap on.I found tricks that others wrote to help me fasten it, but it was a challenge everyday.The snap design is very difficult for people with arthritis or not enough strength to snap it on.I contacted the Fitbit company for assistance, and they offered to sell me the next model up with a buckle band, but after putting out the money for the Flex, I didn't want to put out another $100 or so. I never had to make a decision, as it fell off my wrist and I lost it after 2 months.
review_title: ... my (former Fitbit) = 1 star/ 5 stars I loved the fact that it made me aware of my ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the Fitbit Flex and find that it has all of the features that I need, but I would not order this color again. After one month and daily cleaning with a cloth, the edges look dirty and worn. Plus, the teal doesn't really match everything so if you are concerned about matching, it's probably not the best color decision. I'll definitely be ordering a black one very soon. Other than that, the functionality of the Fitbit Flex gets two thumbs up from me!
review_title: Awesome Fitbit, Not So Awesome Color

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: We like the Fitbit flex alright, but I wish I would have waited to buy the Fitbit Alta during the Christmas shopping season.  It was quite a bit cheaper and after buying it for myself, this one was a gift, we like the Alta much better. The only real complaint that I have is that the batteries don't stay charged in these things for very long.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Was willing to take a chance despite other negative reviews.  Unfortunately for me I didn't even get a chance to try much of it out, as it refused to sync with my iphone.  Went through all the support steps on their website repeatedly with no success.  Worked ok with the direct connect to PC, but that is not what I want it for.  Without the ability to use the wireless app it is pretty much useless for me.  Sending back.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had my Fitbit Flex for about a week now. I'm very happy with all of the features.Since I started wearing it and checking my stats online, I've started monitoring my caloric intake (something that I've never done before). The "goals" feature also has me working harder to make sure that I meet my goal each day. I like that I only have to take it off every 5 days for a charge and can wear it in the shower and while washing dishes.If there were one thing I would add to the Fitbit Flex... it would be a heart rate monitor, or a pulse monitor... Other than that, I am very satisfied with my Fitbit Flex.I ordered the Slate color and like it alot... it goes with my dress clothes or my jeans. I plan to order a couple more color bands (band only) in the near future...I would recommend it to anyone looking to increase their physical activity. It will really help you monitor and increase your fitness level.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fitibt is a great idea, too bad the product doesn't work longer than 1 year.  I started having problems with this not charging, not functioning at 9 months.  Fitbit customer service is fine, they said I was within the warranty time and replaced the defective Flex... Unfortunately the replacement doesn't have a warranty and it hasn't lasted past 2 months without glitches.

review_body: got this for my partner for Christmas in 2013, and he has been loving its features. There is of course much discussion regarding whether the UP is thebetter option, and we had considered its app to be superior - has actually lost a bunch of weight. I'm getting ready to return it again, and have not yet decided whether it's worth the trouble of having yet another sent in only two months.
review_title: Would love to love it, but can't

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Increased to Three Stars:FitBit customer support did what they could do, about quickly as they could do it.  Although I was disappointed that the first one died for no apparent reason, they quickly verified that it was inoperative, offered a new one, and sent it to me. No hassle or expense on my end. I'm wearing it now, re-synced with my old account, and I'm back up and running.BTW, if I were to speculate about what happened to the first one, my guess is that these are not as waterproof as they're touted to be.  The behavior of my old, dead FitBit was that of a piece of electronics that was shorting out. Random lights staying on - sudden power losses etc.  It's a guess, anyway.  I wont be wearing this one in the shower.ORIGINAL REVIEW------------------------------------Like so many others, mine worked great for the first couple weeks. Charged quickly.  Seemed pretty accurate, and fun.But it's dead now.  No alarm this morning (was almost late for work).  Won't charge.  The light on the end came on, wouldn't turn off, and then apparently burned out. Not only was this a waste of money, but now there's big gaps in the activity logs I had been maintaining manually, but stopped, because the FitBit seemed to have it covered.
review_title: Revised and up-rated: An expensive junk toy

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Really liked it and used it regularly.  There is no debating that you could be more active when you have numbers staring you in the face telling you to get off your butt! After about 8 months though it stopped charging.  Tech support was wonderful about helping me trouble shoot but nothing worked.  They ended up sending a replacement.  Returned the replacement so I can upgrade and hoping the same problem doesn't occur.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I think my title explains how I feel about the Fitbit. :) I absolutely love it!  I have had it for over 4 weeks now and it is working wonderfully!  I am able to track my steps, calories burned, and miles  go each day (also, my weight loss and water intake) .  I have really started to push myself to move more and get more steps each day.  This product has really motivated me to get moving and I love that I am really only competing with myself.  I have it synced to MyFitnessPal so I can continue to use that app to track my calorie intake.  I also really love how the Fitbit is able to track my sleep.  I put it into sleep mode (which is super easy) and then I am able to look back and see how much sleep I am good and what quality it was.  The silent alarm is also awesome!  I can set it to wake me up and also to remind me when I need to be working-out.  And since it only vibrates it doesn't bother anyone...especially my husband.  :)  Again, this product has been really motivating to me to get moving and it really keeps me accountable for how active I am in a day.  I needed something to help me get a jump start my New Year's goal of getting healthy and losing weight and the Fitbit has done just that.  Simple put I love it and would recommend it to anyone!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is one of those products that I had to have and once I got it I have only wore it a couple of times, first I had a hard time getting the band on as the snaps would not fit, it was not until I did a google search on other who had the same issue and found that I had to put lotion on the silver buttons to allow the clips to fit into the slits. I did like how it would vibrate to wake me in the morning. I cannot say the product is bad this is the case of the user is the one that is bad. I plan to give it another go.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was on the fence as to which activity tracker to buy and settled on Fitbit after hearing several testimonials.  They were right!  It's super easy to setup and have the flexibility of tracking your stats on your computer or mobile device (I have an Android phone and an iPad Mini and the "on the go" access is terrific).  I had some issues getting the tracker installed in the rubber bracelet, but am getting the hang of it now with a little practice.  As the bracelet starts to break in, it's easier to clasp it as well.  Exactly what I was looking for!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my Fit Bit Flex! I had the Fit Bit Zip first because I wasn't sure I wanted to spend the all the money on the Fit Bit Flex. After having and using my Fit Bit Zip for a year I finally decided to upgrade to the Flex. I am so glad I did! I love that it tracks my sleep! It is so nice to see how much sleep I got and how restless I was. The Fit Bit app allows me to track everything for my health. I even splurged and bought the Tory Burch bracelet to go wear my fit bit in!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had the Fitbit Flex for three and a half weeks. Having owned other Fitbit products, I will say that it is my favorite thus far. I purchased this when I realized I had lost my Ultra after walking to a friends house. The wristband design solves this issue and makes it very difficult to lose the product while wearing it.Its sleep function is much more user friendly than the Ultra. A few repeated taps causes it to enter sleep tracking mode.  This is much simpler than the velcro wristband included with the ultra and requires hardly any thought.Let me address the concerns of some other reviewers.  Unlike the ultra the flex relies on five led lights to indicate progress towards your daily goal. The Ultra relies on a small screen with a readout.  This allows the Ultra to provide more information directly from the device, however, this information is limited and requires a sync to a computer to get more detailed info. The Flex is capable to syncing to a smart phone to provide real time data when desired. I found this much more convenient than the small screen on the Ultra.Also, some reviewer have complained that the wristband is difficult to close.  After wearing the wristband practically 24/7 (with exceptions for swimming, showering, and charging) I can say that the wristband becomes much easier to get on and off with time, yet doesn't show any sign of wear or tear.I mentioned charging above.  I have found that charging through the USB cable from completely dead to full takes less than the three hours listed in the instructions.  The claim of five days of batter life seems accurate.As some reviewers have mentioned, there is no altimeter for stairs. Sorry to tell those Ultra lovers out there, but the altimeter on the ultra wasn't accurate. I tested it walking the twelve flights of stairs to my floor in my office building.  Not once did it accurately record the correct number of floors. Really, the altimeter isn't a big loss.  It was simple "feature creep" on the ultra.In summary, the Flex is a great product for someone looking to get in shape. If you are a smartphone user, I would highly recommend it.  The function is simple, the wristband is slim (between a livestrong bracelet and a small watch), and it integrates well with apps like my fitness pal. I have been pleased with its performance.  It encourages me to make small additions to my fitness (taking the stairs instead of the elevator and walking a slightly longer but more scenic rout home), which is one of the main motivations for wearing a pedometer.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This device functioned fine for approximately eight weeks.  It simply stopped holding a charge. article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had previously owned a Fitibt, one of the original models, and lost it.  I forgot how useful it was while waiting for the Fitbit Flex.  I like the Flex, it's easy to wear (once you get the hang of clasping the wristband, it's no big deal), and you don't have to worry about losing it. I understand that they didn't include it with the Flex, but you should be able to remove that metric from your dashboard (get to it Fitbit!). review_title: The device is comfortable to wear and easy to use even for a ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Update 2: I've lowered my review from 2 to 1 starI'm on my fifth tracker, and it's now broken (2 of those 5 were dead on arrival). Not only is software QA poor, hardware QA is nonexistent. The Fitbit support team is abysmal. They don't actually read your support requests. They look at a couple key words, then send a cookie cutter response that may or may not have ANYTHING to do with whatever you asked about. It takes 4-5 back and forth emails until you happen to get someone who happens to read the right part of the message you send to understand why their cookie cutter emails don't actually address the problem you're having. Once that's done, they get about actually offering a replacement product. The only positive thing I can say is that they are so aware of how bad their hardware quality is, they replace the product no questions asked. I had to talk them into giving me a return shipping label for all my broken trackers. I wanted them to have some bad ones to look at so they can get to the bottom of their manufacturing and hardware problems.At least now I have a bunch of extra bands from all the replacement trackers.Update: I lowered my initial review from 4 stars to 2. Here's why:1. The band only lasts about 4 months. The rubber gets too soft, so the clasp stops staying as secure. the sides also start bulging out around the tracker from the tension on the wristband, and it eventually tore around the plastic part. Fitbit replaced the band, no questions asked, which leaves me wondering if this is a known problem or not. I doubt I'll get another replacement, but hopefully something better will come along by then. I definitely wouldn't trust the Force wristband.2. Software QA is poor. Their software has been getting progressively more buggy/less stable since September. The tracker no longer reliably syncs in the background, and I've been having issues with setting silent alarms, with the iOS software showing that silent alarms synced, when they actually didn't. The newest update stopped even pretending to work with silent alarms for me. I've tried restarting my phone, reinstalling the Fitbit app, and completely resetting my phone and the tracker.3. When you email support about software problems, they don't actually read the contents of your message. Having already taken, and having mentioned taking, all their "troubleshooting" steps, the CSR told me to do what I had already done. When I responded that I had already done those things and wanted to file a bug report, not ask for support, I got an entirely new person who told me to do the same thing.Original review:I've been wearing a fitbit flex for about a month. I initially purchased the fitbit to track sleep quality. As a geek, I like quantifiable data, and I have a sleeping disorder called "graduate school."I had some pairing issues, but they were due to my own impatience. Response from the fitbit to the smartphone and back is slow, give it time. I can't wear wristwatches because I find them itchy and uncomfortable, but haven't had any problems with the fitbit flex band. I only remove it when I need to charge the fitbit.For the most part, the device does what it promises. It tracks steps, records "highly active" time spent every day and notifies you when you hit your goal.Sleep tracking is ok as a relative comparison between nights, but doesn't mean much in the absolute sense. The regular mode is too insensitive and the high sensitivity mode is too sensitive. If you lie still while awake, you can "trick" it into thinking you are sleeping. Qualitatively, it tells you whether or not you are giving yourself enough time to sleep start-to-finish and how frequently you're waking up. The duration of awake periods, and how it calculates time spent asleep are a bit dubious.The fitbit software will also compare calories in to calories burned. Unfortunately, their system can only do weight loss or weight maintenance. If you're trying to gain weight, you'll need another tool. I currently use myfitnesspal for food logging because it has a much more comprehensive database and does allow for weight gain goals. I've probably gotten the most constructive feedback from this because it tells me exactly how much I'm under-eating by for my given activity level (2-3 hours/day of heavy activity, 18,000 steps/day average), and I have tried to adjust my lifestyle habits accordingly. In the same time period, I've managed to shave >15s/mile off my distance runs. I don't have enough data to attribute it to primarily diet, or regular training improvements, but giving a number is a good reminder to 1, eat, and 2, pick appropriate foods. I can't comment on the effectiveness of the fitbit Aria scale, but I'd like to pick one up eventually.My favorite feature is probably the silent alarm. It's very good at waking me up without being annoying like audible alarms.Things I'd like to see:The fitbit isn't designed for runners. There are two main issues. First, run logging is poor. The fitbit collects all this data, but when you log a run, it promptly ignores what it measured. The workaround I've found is to set an unnamed "activity" between a start and stop time. The fitbit app will pull steps from that. Logging a run any other way results in less real data being shown. One interesting thing to note is that calorie burn estimates between fitbit and runkeeper are extremely close.Distance estimate works reasonably well for walking and for running at the pace you calibrated it to. The distance estimate is close for steady state runs, but is off by as much as 20% for anything faster, like tempo runs or workouts. I haven't done too much research into this I'd like to see fitbit add some sort of multi-point stride length vs cadence model so it can estimate stride length better for runs. One strength the fitbit does have, however, is because it doesn't rely on GPS, it works much better than a smartphone+runkeeper at tracking distances on winding trail runs. My measured distance agreed with the official measurement for a 5 mile trail race within +/- 0.1 miles.The food and exercise database is not good. I use myfitnesspal to track food and activities, but I'd like to be able to use just one smartphone app.Reminders. Reminders to eat. Reminders to sleep. Reminders to move. Instead of just measuring things, I'd like to see the software make suggestions. The fitbit is only effective if you look at the data and attempt to make changes yourself.Fitbit premium (or at least a year of it) should come with the device.I'd like to see a flex with an altimeter like the new Force. I don't want a wider band and don't need a screen, but I'd like to be able to track run elevation.Either better running support or a reminders/suggestion system would take a good product and make it great.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Easy to use and very easy to set up and check if you have a smart phone.  A few questions tho, is that since I garden a lot I don't know if it's counting the movement of my hand or arm as steps.  Also the sleep function seems quite accurate, altho there've been a few times I thought it was off.  Overall, I got it to measure how far I walk on any given day and when hiking.  I'm glad to have it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The inaccuracies of this product are many and hard to look past.  After walking briskly (3.8MPH) for 70 min, it shows me I had 4 active mins and a total of 3.02 miles for the entire day.  It's very frustrating when trying to use this as a tool for weight loss when I work so hard and don't see any positive motiviation, and instead see false information.  The steps/tracking are very inaccurate.  A 4 mile walk results in 2.5 miles on the fitbit dasboard and usually only a few mins of active time. I've tried numerous things and I'm still very disappointed.  Wish I could return it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Not quite sure why there are so many complaints about this product. Especially the people complaining about how they lost theirs while walking/running and about how their bands are "so cheap" they ripped.I have had mine for over 3 weeks now and I love it. Tracks how far I have walked and how many steps I have taken. Also tracks my sleep which helps me a lot. The people complaining about how they lost their fitbit obviously don't put it on correctly.. and if yours has snapped in half then you are treating it incorrectly and too roughly.I recommend this product to anyone looking to track their exercise and sleep
review_title: I have had mine for over 3 weeks now and I love it. Tracks how far I have walked and ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very comfortable to wear, I barely notice it.  It was a little difficult to snap on the wristband initially, but after a month, I find it much easier.  Steps, miles and calories burned seem to be pretty accurate.  I like that it shows me the calories I need to burn for the day based on intake calories.  There are a few issues synching with my Sparkpeople account.  I would prefer it only synch my active minutes (I'm not quite sure where it gets the "minutes", they are much higher than the Active minutes). Also, if I delete a food from my SP tracker and replace it with something else, the Fitbit dashboard keeps the deleted food and adds the new so I have to manually delete it from Fitbit.  Minor issues for me, overall I'm happy with the purchase.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This little thing has helped me lose 32 lbs in 2 and a half months.  It pushes me to go the extra step. Increases my awareness of my accountability for my health. Losing weight is hard, but with a desire to make changes in your habits and a wonderful device like this, YOU CAN DO IT !!!! So thrilled my sister introduced me to it. Love the competition with friends.I Love the motivation we can give each other, even though we are miles apart.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The FitBit itself is a great product. The FitBit band is worthless. Less than one month after owning my FitBit, I was in an airport and happened to notice that my FitBit had vanished from my wrist. The "clasp" is very shoddy, and it fell off my wrist without my even noticing. (I retraced my steps in the airport but never found it.) I will not purchase another FitBit unless the band is more secure. Please make a better quality band!
review_title: FitBit band is no good - falls off easily

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Loved it until they stopped the blood pressure & journal!!!!!!!!!! How can a "fitness" product stop allowing you to log your blood pressure!!!!!!!!!! The journal was a real pleasure- allowed you to keep track of what you felt like, were doing, remember important occurences. Now I wish I had never bought one!!!!!!!!!!!
review_title: Dropped the Blood Pressure & Journal that was an important part of their program!!!!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex is the first 24/7 activity monitor that I've ever owned, and it's been a good experience overall.Pros:Web appMobile app (iDevice & Android)Partner app integrationCalories BurnedVery Active MinutesStepsDistanceSleepSilent AlarmsAdjustable goalsLED goal statusTracker syncing via BT, NFC or USB5-6days of battery lifeTech SupportCons:No altimeterWrist band is not as water proof as suggestedNo heart rate monitoringAbout as slim as a bulky wrist watchMy initial tracker had a bad battery and would not take a full charge.  Out of the box it was going 4-5days, and then over time that charge life dropped to 8hrs.  I opened a ticket with Fitbit, and within a day they sent me out a replacement tracker without any hassle.  Kudos to their support team.Ultimately for me, the question comes down to, Would I buy a Flex again?  Absolutely Yes.  While it does have it's quirks, it does seem to be the best rounded tracker; meaning the tracker itself has good functionality, but it's the supporting mobile app, website, and available partner apps integration makes it a solution that makes it shine.
review_title: Tracker is cool, but supporting apps make it shine.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I contacted fitbit support in regards to my fitbit flex no longer working. It was just purchased 3 months ago! I came to check the return possibility and see I am not eligible to return it. My message from fitbit support states, "We're sorry to hear that your Flex's display is no longer working.Thanks for troubleshooting the issue prior to contacting us. Upon checking on our tools, we see that there was a program malfunction that have occurred in the tracker and since that the restart did not resolve the issue, we confirmed that its already beyond the point of function." It was working great for me, and now, I have no tracker. Tears, because I really was enjoying seeing results.
review_title: disappointed on not being able to return a defective product!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this when I had back surgery and had to start doing a lot of walking in the recuperation process.  I started out counting my paces and soon decided that this wasn't going to work when it got to be more than a couple hundred paces.  This Fitbit works great for keeping me on schedule to walk more each day.  I recommend it.  It does a lot more than keep up with my mileage, but that's the main purpose I use it for.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had a Fitbit pretty much since they came out and I really like it. It does what I need it to do and the upgrades have been really good. My only complaint is that they DO wear out over time (sometimes prematurely) and I've had to buy several of them as they conk out. Fitbit replaces your first one or two-- which I appreciated it-- but I have to say their shelf life seems to be less and less. I am still a fan of Fitbit- just disappointed with how often I've had to replace them over the last couple of years.
review_title: Have been a faithful customer but....

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was very excited about purchasing this product, as I have gone from a job where I ran like a mad woman all day, to a job with not so much activity.  This seemed the answer to making sure that I did not become a couch potato!  However, while I will admit it was great while it lasted, it did not last.  At.  All.  It worked fine through the first charging cycle.  During the second charging cycle it seemed I was constantly asleep.  When I went to charge it again, nothing.  Zilch.  Nada.  It will simply not charge.  Dead in the water.So, for such a pricey product, it has an EXTREMELY short life.  Not worth nearly what you pay for it.  Way too expensive to be a throwaway purchase.I am very, very disappointed.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased my flex on August 9. It works great to keep me motivated to walk more. I use the wake up alarm when I need to get up early and not disturb my spouse. I wear it in the shower so it is on my wrist 24/7 (except when charging.) I have had no skin reaction wearing it. The only reason I deducted one star is because the tangerine color is wearing off on the edges after only 6 weeks of use. I preferred the bright color over the original black band. Under the tangerine is a gray base. Even after cleaning, the tangerine band looks dirty. Now I need to order a replacement band.
review_title: Fitbit flex works great, tangerine color gone in 6 weeks

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: 10,000 steps is a lot harder than you think it is.  I think I only came close yesterday as I was sprinting between three different meetings downtown which resulted in a big fat blister on my heel.  I even tried putting it on my short legged dog to rack up more steps since I am paired up with a friend to 'check on each other'.  It didn't give me more steps.  I like it and it works.  Never had a rash or anything but I am not sure it will ever MAKE me reach the 10,000 step goal unless there is a donut prize at the end.
review_title: So I can monitor my lack of 10,000

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got the One a couple of years ago, and when my mom got the Flex, I looked into getting a new model because I liked the wristband concept. I really love the convenience of it, and I leave it on all the time and don't have to keep track of it like I did the One (I washed the One in the laundry more than once).My only complaint is that I did like seeing my actual number on the display throughout the day; I have to sync the Flex to see what my exact steps and calories are. But that is outweighed by how much I love the fit and convenience!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm on a mission to lose weight and improve my health and this device has become an essential tool for me. It works great - it tracks my activity and sleep patterns so I can adjust accordingly, making sure I am steadily improving on all fronts. I've been at it for about 4 months and I've lost 20 pounds - about a pound a week - and my interest remains high.  I like it so well that I bought two more for two of dieting daughters - now we compete to see who gets the most steps in a day!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was my first Fitbit, and I was disappoint with how basic the features actually are. In addition, two of the LEDs stopped working after about 10 days so I returned it and upgraded to the Charge - with which I am very pleased.If you are looking for just the basics, the Flex is a fine choice. But for the additional features and display, other Fitbit devices may be a better option,
review_title: Very basic - I upgraded to the Charge

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had it already for a month, I have to say the application is very good. I would improve in the food chart to add the protein , carbs etc.. info.I was not pleased of the material of the braclett it started to have some scratches and what im very disappointed is that the CLASP was not so stable so I lost my bracelet while wearing it . so they could improve that.will not buy another one until they improve the clasp.
review_title: I have to say the application is very good. I would improve in the food chart to ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love this product. It is small, compact, and doesn't take up much room on my wrist. Another thing I enjoyed was that it doesn't tell time and is very simple. Charging this every three days is so nice and I leave it on me pretty much all the time besides when I shower. I enjoy having a step counter to keep me aware of my physical activity and to see when I am more active and to see my lazy days.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Have realistic expectations and you'll like it. It's a minimalist device that's small enough to resemble the recently popularized silicon wristbands. However, understand it's limitations: Unlike the regular fitbit, you wear this thing on your wrist--you're going to get some false steps if you flail your arms around and the like. I chose this over the original because I'm less likely to run it through the wash, and it's also fairly comfortable to sleep in (the silent alarm and sleep tracker are definitely useful for me).

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love that you can buy a new wristband for this product. Syncs to my Samsung Galaxy S3 like a charm. Is shower-going but I now take it off because I think that is what contributed to my first wristband wearing out (or perhaps it was summer sun?) But in any case, I used the 2nd band it came with and that one is still going strong. Looking forward to many more months with this product.I don't bother using it to track sleep, and frankly I don't miss the stair climbing count that much (had an Ultra previously).
review_title: Still better than the new version

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my FitBit Flex. I went from pretty sedentary to aiming for 5 miles a day. My only criticism is that it counts hand movements as steps. I get around that by keeping mine in the small pocket of my jeans so I don't feel like I'm cheating.About the company, my flex stopped charging after only 2 months of ownership. While I was seriously disappointed by that, the company was so fast to respond, I had a replacement in 5 days.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very disappointed in this product, I have had 2 of these in less than a month. The first one stopped working after a week, it would not sync with my phone or the blue tooth adapter that comes with it. I was not able to contact any one at FitBit because they do not have a phone number you can call to get customer support so Amazon exchanged it for me. The second one I received started having the same problem and the battery on the second one stopped holding a charge. You cannot call FitBit for customer support you can only send them an email; the emails seem to be computer generated and don’t answer any specific questions that you ask. If I could give it less than 1 star I would.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So far I love it!  It seems to be very accurate in counting steps and I really like tracking my sleep!  The only negative I have at this point is that it puts itself in sleep mode too often!  We live in the country and driving down gravel roads where it is bumpy puts it in sleep mode and I don't always catch it.  Very frustrating to realize an hour later it hasn't been tracking anything.  But it can't be perfect, and if this is the only flaw I can live with that!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: A wonderful way to keep you accountable to your fitness goals. The Fitbit Flex is a great basic model. It integates well with the other apps on my phone (e.g., MapMyRun, MyFitnessPal), and I find it to be very accurate at counting my steps. However, it does not recognize other exercise. For example, it does not know when I have been using the elliptical machine for 45 minutes, and will not register any of those calories burned.
review_title: A wonderful way to keep you accountable to your fitness goals

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought my Flex in March.  Started having problems with the battery holding a charge in November. So now in contact with Fitbit to resolve the issue. They have responded already.  Wish the android app synced better though. My boyfriend has the same Flex product and his syncs to his Apple5 phone app instantly whereas my app usually has to be rebooted or the phone completely rebooted before it will clear the app so it will sync. Frustrating. But the Flex does what it's designed to do. Count steps. Very basic.  Hope to get the battery issue resolved shortly.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Since my purchase of the Fitbit Flex I have been motivated daily to achieve my goal of 10,000 steps.  Because the Flex is synced with my iPad and cell phone, I am able to check my progress throughout the day.  I chose to connect with friends who also use the Fitbit, allowing us to monitor each other's progress and cheer, taunt, or send messages...fun and motivating!I find it convenient to wear the Flex rather than use the pocket version...a few taps on it and blinking dots give an approximate number of steps walked/run that day.  It doesn't give the exact number, which some of my friends prefer.  If you check the downloaded app on your cell phone, though, the number of steps are accurately displayed.  After purchasing the Flex, I realized it did not measure elevations (ex. steps climbed).  That is not particularly important to me, but some may prefer that. Onedownside of the Flex is securing the device on the wrist...I find it very difficult to snap the 2 prongs.  Once secured, it stays well-secured, though.The Flex has gotten me moving...I look forward to the daily "buzz" from my Flex when I reach my goal.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: While this Fitbit worked, I did like it, however, it stopped working 3 days past the last day I could have returned it.  I had it and used it 1 month.  Now, I have no idea how to resolve this issue.  $80 down the drain and I'm disinclined to purchase again, except I do like the motivation this device gives me to move and the satisfaction I felt when I met my daily goal and it did its little vibration dance on my wrist.  Any suggestions??

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love it, it is hard to clip on though...it's even got things I didn't know like scanning barcodes to track food and logging your water ... I love itUPDATE: it says it's dead you charge it, put it on it says it's dead but the charger says it's full and it takes an hour to be normal again. It barely works so I quit wearing it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My Fitbit just died 2 days ago, for no apparent reason at all.  It is about 2 months past my one year warranty date.  I think it's terrible to pay so much for something, follow all rules, and they still don't last.  I would not recommend it, unless you are willing to pay even more and get the extended warrenty, because it seems that they are only made to last one year.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This Fitbit mostly works as per their description, but does not meet my needs.  This unit tracks arm swings in lieu of steps, so if you are holding a bag (or purse) while walking, or pushing a cart around the store, or keeping your hands warm in your pockets, or walking on soft carpet, this unit design does not track your progress.  It's great if you are going for a hike, or a walk/jog around the block.
