I prefer my $20 pedometer, which is far more accurate at tracking my normal daily activity, but without the fancy online bells and whistles. By the way, my fitbit charger cable will often not make a stable connection for charging, requiring me to re-insert it into the USB charger between 5 and 20 times before it starts charging -- and then I can't bump it or it will stop again.  I am now only using it to track my sleep patterns, which it seems to do well.  I now have a nice history of how little sleep I get.
review_title: Good if you swing your arms while walking

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I feel like an idiot for wasting around $100 on this piece of crap. I had it not even a month and it's already having problems! It cheats me out of active minutes and has problems syncing even after following the trouble shooting tips on their website. Also it's super inaccurate. If you just flail your arms around it counts that as steps.Absolute crap. Do not buy.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This device is useful for what it does.The company should have a complete You Tube video on how to work the item and a website detailing the same. The manufacturer assumes we are all perfectly intuitive people and able to navigate the usefulness of the device without complete instructions that incidentally DO NOT come with the device.If you want to lose weight and depend on calorie count on the device to help you along in your assessments read on. The aspect of calorie count used by you and counted against your calorie burn and the logging in of your calories consumed is hard work. Essentially you do not know the caloric makeups of non-packaged food. So when you make your own meals the task of building up a meal from the scratch ingredients to come to a calorie value is a long slog that one gets tired of quickly. The company should have hundreds more standard home meals on their list of selections not just store purchased microwave dinners and the like. The company should open up up some recipe books like Real Simple and build a meal listing and the published calorie count associated with those meals, etc. and that would be a start.As an example you make a cup of coffee at home with non-dairy creamer and one teaspoon of sugar, this should be on a selection list rather than you having to construct this calorie count from scratch and then enter it. Another example would be 1-chicken breast cooked in olive oil with a side of spinach and medium baked potato.Other issues:I walk up and down steps in my home many times a day but the step count on the device indicates no steps taken. Does not work.One other aspect of this device that was unknown prior to purchase is that this item can provide more information for you about your activities if you want to have it at a cost. I don't remember what those extra information tidbits were at this moment of writing.However the cost is at an unacceptable steep monthly price. So my opinion if they substantially lowered the monthly cost I might subscribe to the "Extra information" but absent that price change, NO I would not!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I personally hate this make of the Fitbit and here are the reasons why:1.  the rubber wrist band that it fits into is hard to "snap" on with one hand.  The little grooves that it is suppose to "snap" into are so tight that it is almost impossible to do for us senior citizen folks.  And to top it off the band is rubber and it causes me to sweat and then itch afterwards.2.  not being able to actually see what progress that you are making unless you know how to sync it up with your computer or cell phone. Since all you get to see is a little flashing light there is no instant gratification and if you are not overly cell phone suave then knowing how to get it set up is a challenge and there is no real instructions that come with it to tell you how it works.3  with this model you are suppose to be able to "tap it" at night and get this little vibration to tell you that it is in sleep mode but I have had this for three weeks and I've only been able to get it to go into the sleep mode three times.  I "tap it" twice like it says and nothing happens, I then "tap it" a little harder and still nothing...it is just so not worth the energy.So if you are looking at getting this, just know these are things that you too could encounter.  The money put out for it, the value is sooo not there!
review_title: I personally hate this make of the Fitbit and here are the ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had my Fitbit for almost two weeks now and I LOVE it! I lost 3 pounds in my first week of use. I love how it helps motivate you to count your calories and move more. That little thing sitting on my wrist keeps me motivated like I never thought it could. And, yes, it helps to have a competitive nature and so it helps me to want to walk more to get more steps so that I can be atop the leader board.The battery life is good. Lasts almost a whole week.I highly recommend getting this one. I have not tried any others, but for the price this one can't be beat.
review_title: Helping Me Every Bit To Be Fit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This has been a great device for tracking fitness and my health in general.  I use this to track my steps and also use the in app features for nutrition and water intake.  The sleep feature on this is great as well.  I saw the comments from some other reviews about the band being difficult to put into sleep mode, etc. but I have not had problems yet.  I actually find that the more lightly you tap the unit to put into sleep mode, the better it works.  Overall, great product!
review_title: This has been a great device for tracking fitness and my health in general

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It was motivating at first, and still is, to a point. I felt the set up went well, charging, figuring it out, etc. I added the amazon 2nd year warranty when I purchased it 4 months ago after reading some of these reviews. Sure enough, my tracker "died" last week. I've spent the last three days trying various online remedies to no avail.  Basically, when I 'sync' it says "tracker not found".  I will give the online FitBit customer chat service 5 stars though. After telling her my problem and that I've tried all the suggestions, she asked for my receipt and promptly put in an order to send me a new one in 5-7 days.  Oh well, I'll give it another try, since it's under FitBit 1 year warranty and then Amazon 2nd year warranty.  I'll take any motivation I can get!
review_title: Enjoyed it for 4 months then it stopped working

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got the Fitbit Flex as soon as I could after it finally came out so I could replace the Fitbit One that I had accidentally run over with the car because it had fallen off (again). I really enjoyed the One and it was great for motivation. Because the One had a tendency to pop-off fro wherever I had it clipped on I was anxious to give the Flex a try - after several months with the Flex and despite the convenience in wearing it, I go back to the One if I could make a direct swap.The Flex's Pros - Convenience - the wristband is great and so is being able to wear it almost all the time; Tracking - it tracks almost as many things as the One; the Alarm - I get up to exercise early every morning and the vibrating alarm awakens me without disturbing my wife.The Flex's Cons - Compared to the One's screen information the display on the Flex is virtually worthless; where the One gives you steps, miles, time, recent activity intensity level, flights of stairs climbed and calories burned at the touch of a button, the Flex merely gives you five lights - each one representing 20% of your daily steps goal, and gives you no further indications of progress if you exceed your goal (you can check your Fitbit account's dashboard for detailed activity information). You can also get other data about your activity (expect for flights of stairs - no altimeter) from your dashboard, but that's not near as convenient as being able to spot check as you go.All-in-all the Flex is fine for tracking your activity - on the dashboard - but not real good for spot checking how you are doing as your day progresses. I'd love to see Fitbit develop a tracker that combined the best of both devices. If you need the convenience of an easily worn device that tracks and can report activity information to your Fitbit account; and aren't particularly interested in knowing how you're doing as the day goes along the Flex will serve you pretty well. If you're looking for a device to help keep you motivated to stay active throughout the day, the One is a much better choice.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It is really not too much of an overstatement to say that getting the FitBit Flex has changed my life. My husband and I got two of these as anniversary gifts for each other about two months ago, and we have totally rethought our approach to exercise and being sedentary.  I am FitBit "friends" with a few real-life friends and family members, and it is really fun to compete with them to see who gets more steps in a day or in a week - I will absolutely get up off the couch and go for one more walk in the evening just to beat someone!  (Who knew I was this competitive?)  My clothes fit better, my posture is better, and the dog is totally thrilled with all the extra walks he is getting.  Highly recommend this product if you want motivation to get moving!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This product has no instructions in the package. You have to go to the website for all info and what a lousy site it is! Not user friendly at all. There is no manual to guide you through everything. You have to look for individual help questions and then the answers you get may or may not help. Usually they just send you to another location. You go in circles without getting the help you are looking for. It doesn't sync with you pc as often as it says. The product itself is basically an over glorified pedometer and if you don't manually keep up with the logs, it's pretty worthless.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought my Fitbit Flex about 10 weeks ago and have lost about 20 pounds. It's made me much more attentive to diet and exercise, halving the former and doubling the latter--much like a life-coach on the wrist! It's a wonderful device and allows the user to keep track throughout the day of caloric intake and progress on exercise goals--this is a great encouragement. I couldn't recommend it more highly, and after using it for a month or two, it's changed my habits. In addition, it tracks sleep patterns and encourages the wearer to begin working on getting adequate sleep. Finally, the social network on Fitbit and on Facebook has allowed me to keep up with friends who're using it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got my fit bit in September - one month ago.  This morning it isn't charging, no devices can find it - despite doing the reset at they stated.  One month and it is dead.  I came on amazon to see if I was still within the return time - that expired 3 days ago.  3 days.  So now I have a useless $90 device.  I don't have the funds to afford something that only lasts for 1 month.  I am so terribly disappointed.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is my favorite fitness tracker thus far. The wristband is sleek and secure, I never have to worry about losing it. The features on the app are great, would definitely stick with this style.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I know a lot of people have complained about the wristband and clasp, but I haven't had any issues with it.It is a little awkward to put on, but once you hear the two clicks, you are good to go.  It has never fallen off, and I pretty much wear it 24 hours a day.  If I had to say one bad thing about it, it would be that it took a while for me to get used to wearing it. Sometimes it feels a little bulky.  Other than that, I really like it and I am glad I got it.  It is my 2nd Fitbit; first one (Fitbit One) went through the wash, which I knew was going to happen at some point.  The wristband is much more practical.  You get two wristbands; one is Large and the other is Small.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The clasp is not secure.  Any activity where you brush you're arm or wrist against something causes you to run the risk popping the clasp loose thereby causing the device to fall off.  And because the device is encased in rubber, it doesn't make a sound when it hits the floor.  I've had mine for 10 days and it's been 'lost' twice already.However, the fitness part of the device is wonderful.  It's already helped me change my activity habits and I'm staring to avg 10k per day even though I have a desk job.
review_title: Clasp is AWFUL but the device is fantastic

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Really accurate. I love with the new update you no longer have to put your tracker into sleep mode - it's now automatic. The app needs some work, and the band will have some wear and tear. I'm overall happy with this fitness tracker because it's smaller than the others so it's not an ugly bulky thing on my wrist, and it's really accurate. I also only need to recharge about once a week.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this for my wife as a gift because she had been wanting to try a tool like this for a while. She was initially excited, but quit using it within a few days. It seems sort of accurate as a pedometer for when you are not exercising, but that is about it. It did not seem to do a good job measuring fast walking or jogging, and doesn't work in any meaningful way for aerobics, cardio kickboxing, weight training, etc. If all you need is a pedometer, there are much cheaper options.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the fit bit flex from Amazon 2 weeks ago after having a fit-bit one that I killed after running it through the laundry.  I had initially ordered one from fit-bit.com, but after waiting 8 weeks and still not having it ship, I found it on Amazon (finally).  The wrist band is difficult to attach, the charge cable came apart after only the 2nd use and it requires about 3 hours to charge which means you either miss a bunch of your steps or you have to miss tracking your sleep one night.  The product doesn't track sleep well - you have to tap it rapidly for 2 seconds to get it to enter the sleep tracking and then again when you awake.  Although I have been doing that for the last week it only has picked up one night of sleep.  You have to sync up to see how many steps you have done, it will only give indicator lights until you get 10,000 steps.  Then you get a buzz. Just not really happy with the products  I would recommend getting the fit-bit one instead.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this for my daughters and I, so that while they were at college, we could send taunts or cheers to each other for achieving goals. Note that you have to enter all foods eaten into your iPhone to be affective. We will see how it works over time. I would recommend for the guys out there, that if you purchase for girlfriend, wife or daughter, you purchase for yourself as well so that it is more of a adventure together and not an insult.
review_title: You have to be a computer/cellphone and fitness nerd to like this.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for my Husband along with an extended warranty.  He enjoyed using it for a good 3 to 4 months before it stopped working but it's been a headache ever since.  For whatever reason it won't take or hold a charge and all of Fitbit's trouble shooting has not worked but they also refuse to replace the item.  You would think the extended 2 year warranty I paid for would have helped but we just keep getting the run around, for a $100 item we expect better performance than 3 months.My husband finally got fed up with Fitbit and Amazon's run around and he went and bought a Garmin Vivofit from REI which he loves.  At least if there's a problem with the Garmin piece he knows that REI will take care of him.  My bad for buying anything Outdoor at Amazon instead of REI - don't make the same mistake!
review_title: Great for 3 months but dead after that

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was my second Fitbit Flex purchase and I have been disappointed twice.  I LOVE the Fitbit itself, I enjoyed being able to keep track of my steps, sleep, activity, and compete in challenges with friends.  The problem is with the strap closure.  The two I have purchased have fallen off from my wrist, never to be seen again.  The two small plastic "nubs" are supposed to be pressed into the plastic holes on the other side of the band.  It is quite difficult to get them hooked together, that is why I was extra careful to be sure it was clasped.  When I shared my story with other Fitbit owners they said they have had the problem as well.  I cannot afford to continue purchasing Fitbits, I will have to look at alternative brands.
review_title: I cannot afford to continue purchasing Fitbits, I will have to look at alternative brands

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Of course this tracker does not change your life if you can't find the motivation in yourself to be active. However, it is very cool to see the steps, calories and the sleeping patterns. it can help you to understand how sedentary you can be working all day in front of your computer. so buy one of these but then remember to BE ACTIVE the only way to prevent diseases. (cardiovascular in particular but also diabetes, cancer etc.) and it is also good for the mood status, being active releases endorphins so JUST DO IT
review_title: Like it a lot, good tool to check your activities

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Came really quickly and looks cool but would not charge. Made numerous attempts but would not charge so this item was returned.
review_title: Would not charge and was returned

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had a flex for four years, and it is still going. I wear it swimming, in the sauna, everywhere. I have replaced two wrist bands, and it is still working great. I lost 20 pounds and love it.
review_title: and it is still working great. I lost 20 pounds and love it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Do not waste your money. It's a great concept... I loved tracking my activity and my sleeping patterns. However, my second one just died after only a few weeks of use. The first Flex was spotty in how well it worked. Amazon was fantastic to work with, and they sent me a replacement for free. I've had the replacement only a couple of weeks, and it just went totally dead. It was also spotty. When it worked, it worked fantastic and I loved it. When it doesn't work... it doesn't track a single step. And now, it doesn't even register, as if the battery is dead. Yet, it is fully charged.I would consider Fitbit again, just not this version, as I feel like I've wasted my money and now Amazon's money....

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Having problems call. 877-623-4997 and press 0 you get a real person .My problem was after 3 months it wouldn't chargeDid everything I could to get it going (no good)Liked it so much ordered anotherCame today used new charging cable old fitbit charged in 2 hoursI'll give new one to my wifeCalled to get bad cable replaced they are sending a new oneGreat product ,great customer service,  ( but take down above number it is hard to find)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I should have gotten the more expensive fitbit with the heart rate tracker, and the way you tell it to monitor your sleep is kind of sketchy. I thought it was monitoring my sleep last night, but it wasn't. The good news is, you can tell it what time you went to bed and got up, and it will provide the statistics for that time frame anyway.
review_title: Should have gotten the more expensive one.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I wanted to love this product and in some ways in really, really do.  The week I had the device it definitely encouraged me to increase my water consumption, decrease my food consumption, and increase my exercise. I loved, loved meeting my goals and seeing the graphs and looked forward to weighing each morning (I also purchased the aria fitbit scale to go with the fitbit flex and this made the whole process more fun (I know, imagine having fun weighing yourself).The problems though put a definite damper on the whole process.  One, the tracking devices were a tad inaccurate.  The app always under registered the time I exercised, and the steps I was taking.  This I could live with though, because after all, I was increasing the time and the steps and the device did definitely encourage me.  The real problem was the band on the device.  This band is extremely, extremely difficult  to attach.  I was having so much fun though that once I got it attached I left it on my wrist (holding my hand over the side of the tub so it wouldn't get wet, trying to wash dishes one handed, that's how difficult it was to get attached so that I didn't want to take it off because who knew how long it would take to get attached again).  Yes, this is ridiculous for a woman to do this with a $100 device. Fitbit really should have designed this better.  And then it came off when I was unaware and I have now lost it.  So $100 for a week's worth of fun.  Of course I did buy the insurance, but it doesn't cover a band that won't stay attached when you lose it.  So really about $125 once insurance and taxes are figured in. That rate is a little high for me.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love it - wear it every day.  My only problem was that although advertised as new, it came from the seller as used.  The seller said there was no place to show on amazon that it was used (hmmm - I've seen other things on amazon advertised as used). It came dirty, so I had to wash it, and I had to buy a new charger (didn't work well).  Usually when I buy something Prime, it's a little more expensive (not including shipping), so my brain didn't kick in as to why it was so much less expensive.  Live and learn.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex is amazing!! I love being able to track everything needed to help me lose weight.  It makes you very aware of your activity levels and food intake like nothing else I've tried.  I especially love the app. that lets me know exactly how much I am allowed to eat, based on my activity levels that day and the weight goal I am trying to reach.  The only thing that this product does not offer is "water proof".  With summer coming, I love to swim, but can't wear the Fitbit in the pool.  Please let me know if there is an upgrade on that!! :)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is my second Fitbit Flex.  The first one pooped out after a year-and-a-half and wasn't covered by warranty.  It suddenly stopped syncing with my phone and customer support couldn't help me to get it re-started. Even though I ordered the large wristband, it comes with both a large and a small size.  For a male, the small wristband is useless.  I'll end up giving it away to someone.  I guess this is Fitbit's way of making you buy more wristbands at $16 each.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I feel like two stars is generous. I loved the Flex when I first got it. I knew ahead of time there would be limitations and I wa just wanting to try it before buying the more expensive HR to see if I even liked a fitness tracker. Well, it worked great for about a week, then the panel on the top that is supposed to light up when you tap it quit working. I didn't let that bother me as I could check my phone to see an update on my steps and whatnot. Well three weeks into using my Flex, it randomly quit working altogether one morning. NOT happy at all. I'm sending it back to Amazon for a refund. I love the fitness trackers though... Thinking about upgrading to the Charge HR since I liked using it, and hoping it will last longer!
review_title: I feel like two stars is generous

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased my fitbit flex almost one year ago.  I was so excited to have this device and I did find that it helped me focus my exercise and activity...my goal was actually 15,000 for most days which I did tend to make.  However, within a few months of purchase, I started to struggle with getting my fitbit flex to charge.  Often, I had to hold the device into the charger or, if I managed to get it to charge on it's own, it would stop charging once I walked away leaving me with a dead fitbit within a day or two.  Well, just yesterday, I was having one of those struggles with getting it to charge.  After two hours of my life that I will never get back, the device literally stopped working...totally dead.  This saddens me as I had hoped for more time with my flex.  Sadly disappointed in this device and will not repurchase the flex.
review_title: Sadly disappointed in this device and will not repurchase the flex

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I recently purchased a FIT BIT Flex  I had the band 3 days when my dogs got it and chewed band and fit bit tracker up.  After only 3 days it was broken.  I contacted their support number, provided a few pictures of the chewed up items, copy of the invoice to see if there was anything they could do to fix my half eaten flex.  Well to my surprise they will not repair it but they are REPLACING it free of charge.  Just amazing, I could not be happier.  This is how companies should handle customer support.  I am now a LOYAL customer and will be recommending FIT BIT to all my friends.I am still waiting on replacement unit to arrive so I cannot review the product itself but as far as customer service, they have the best ever!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've been wearing the Fitbit Flex for one month now.  I have found it to be fairly accurate as far as steps go.  Having the data is very motivating to me, and I love the syncing with food tracking apps.  That was a bonus feature that I didn't know about when I ordered it, so I was very pleasantly surprised.There are two things that I don't like about it:1.  The wristband was hard to get on at first, but it loosened up and became easy.2.  The wristband has already cracked where the plastic display is.  Still wearable, though.The biggest thing is the smell...  I take it off when I shower or do anything extended with water, but not for simple hand washing.  Long story short:  water, sweat, lotion, whatever is near the wristband gets into it.  And if you don't clean it out every day, it will start to stink.  It's beyond nasty, plain and simple.  It's not something you can put on and forget about until battery charge.  You have to take it out daily and keep it clean.The first wristband I used is no longer usable after just 1 month.  It really smells that bad, no matter what I clean it with.  Thankfully I am ready to move down to the smaller size, but beware!  As long as you keep up on the cleaning, it will be fine.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm very unhappy with the way it counts my steps. I don't feel as if it is accurate at all. I had a fitbit zip before the flex, I switched because the zip only counted my steps accurately when I carried it in my pocket. Defeats the purpose of the clip. I like the idea of being able to wear it on my wrist. Unless I flail my arms like a crazy person when I walk, it sometimes fails to count my steps. I hope someday it actually works the way it claims in the ads
review_title: I like the idea of being able to wear it on ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The fitbit does meet my needs except for the fact that I have to ask some one to help me with the locking mechanism. The holes for the clamp don't make it easy to do it myself. Once I have it on it is like wearing nothing on my wrist. There needs to be something more for instructions as well because it comes with very little to none, because you need access to a computer and if you don't have that it isn't self explanatory.
review_title: The holes for the clamp don't make it easy to do it myself

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: i was pretty sketchy on the whole idea of a fitness band on your arm. How does it work? Is it accurate? will i become fitter? were the questions i was asking. I have only had it for about a month and it is my best purchase to date. I went on a run on a treadmill for 2kms to see if it had the same distance on the fitbit. it was actually spot on. Mind blown! The next test was a quick walk to my mate house. 1700 steps later i was there. 1700 steps on my fitbit were added bringing me that much closer to my daily goal. i was pretty impresed at this point and i had only had it for a few hours. the next test was doing push ups, and what a waste of a test, a total of 0 steps were taken while doing 20 pushups. My daily goal was not any closer. The sun was setting by this point and i was still 4000 steps from my goal. Dinner time was tense, i was constantly double tapping my fitbit watching the 5 leds light up and then flashing saying i had only done 60% of my daily steps. It was the first day I had it and i was going to let it down already. An after dinner walk with my dog brought me up to 8000 steps, 80% of my goal. It was dark now and it seemed that all hope was fading. I decided to do the dishes and ponder over the shame i will bring to myself if I do not complete my steps. my arm movement in the sink added a few hundred steps to the tally but that was not enough. the waterproofing of the band was an added bonus i almost forgot about. a quick walk around the block before i would go to sleep would surely push me over the edge by now. i was only a few hundred steps away from my goal and it was almost midnight. at 9800 steps i decided to call it quits. time for bed. halfway through brushing my teeth my arm starts to vibrate, a celebratory dance of flashing led lights and pleasing vibrations coming from my toothbrush arm signaled to me that i had won. 10000 steps had been done that day and i could go to bed with a smile on my face ready for the next day.the next day came out of nowhere. bzzzz bzzzz bzzzz startled me at 7:00 am. i looked over to my alarm clock to smack it on the head but no... the alarm was not on. bzzz bzzzz bzzzz again. coming to my senses at this point i realised the silent alarm function on my fitbit was working. the sheer joy of not being woken up by the shrill screach of the monotone alarm made me jump out of bed immediately. the running shoes were on by 7:10 and i was out the door with a banana in my stomach going on a run by 7:15. a few laps around the oval and back home by 7:45. i was buzzing with energy for the rest of the day. by dinner time i was getting push notification off my phone congratulating me for outdoing my daily goal by 2500 steps. i could go to bed smiling once again.while showing off my fitbit to the family the next day. they were so excited by the sleep log that they all wanted to try it out and have a go at seeing how they sleep.i am still trying to get them to buy one so i can compete against them and become the true alpha male of the household.i would consider buying a fit bit for sure if i did not have one already.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I wore this 24/7 for the first 4 months then switched to only at the gym, at night, and on weekends. The sensor works great and is fairly accurate with things like elliptical trainer (my primary source of cardio) and walking. Unfortunately, the band wore out on the wrist side where the plastic part is for the light. It seems like light wear to me and a fairly expensive investment to have the key component (wristband) wear out so quickly.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was so excited when I bought this.  It worked for about a month and that was it.  I charged it, got a new charging device and charged it some more, I tried resetting it. Nothing worked.  Luckily when I upgraded to my iPhone 6 Plus, I found it tracks my activity for me just fine.I also bought a second Fitbit for my husband through Best Buy -- it quit working too!I do not recommend purchasing this.
review_title: I found it tracks my activity for me just fine. I also bought a second Fitbit for my ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: They are interesting and useful to prove how much you really do walk around during the day and the app is interesting too. But, the clasp is pretty difficult to close fully and we lost two of them within a week. Bummer. The Fitbit company actually replaced them but I have not started using them again because I don't want to lose it. They are cool looking and good for a start and can share within a family.
review_title: I'm fit and I know it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I loved the fitbit, but a few months in the clasp ceased to function properly. It no longer remained latched and came off repeatedly. Sadly, it finally fell off while I was on the go and I was unable to find it this time around. The tracker and app are awesome, but without a wristband that stays attached this device is completely useless. I'm researching other brands and strongly encourage others to stay away from the fitbit flex unless they literally want to throw $100 down the drain.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the Fitbit Flex for many reasons. I love that I am now motivated to park as far away from a store as I can. I love that I am now motivated to use the restroom clear on the other side of the house. I love that it no longer bothers me when I have to back-track through the grocery store to pick up an item that I missed. I love seeing that one of my friends has met his/her daily goal and consequently deciding to get up and do another loop around the neighborhood to make my goal, too. I love checking online to see how many calories I have consumed and how many I have left. Maybe enough for a glass of wine? I love the customer service and support and the over-the-top solution provided when I ran into a bit of trouble - - once. I now walk a minimum of 10K per day - - even in the hottest triple digit summer days in Arizona (malls are great for these days). I feel better, went off of my blood pressure meds (with my physician's approval) and no longer have nagging hip and knee pain. I bought another color band just to mix it up, and plan to treat myself again when I reach another weight loss milestone. Terrific product.
review_title: Why I Love My Fitbit Flex

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my pink fitbit. It doesn't track stairs, monitors heart rate or show the time but I'd rather have this one than the next level. The next one is too masculine. I would never wear it.This is perfect for motivating yourself to get up and walk those extra steps at the end of the day. And if you don't motivate yourself, you can join friend challenges. This is what really helps me. It's a fun way to motivate each other.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Okay, it's partly my fault.  I'm on my FOURTH fitbit.  I had two Fitbit One units, and two Fitbit Flex units... the ones I just lost.  Then the two flexes were lost because the bracelets came apart after a few months of use - the last one just happened a few days ago.  It's always the rubber part of the wristband where it meets the black plastic window that shows you the indicator lights.  I usually catch this and replaced the rubber wristband twice... but the first time I didn't catch it... must have put my hand in my pocket, pulled it out, the band broke and it fell off... it's so light you won't notice it missing.  The second time, the same thing... I went through security at a courthouse, took it off, put it back on, noticed the hard plastic was just beginning to separate from the rubber and made a mental note to be careful (I had an extra band at home, so I could make it until then) and while walking around it fell off... I noticed in a period of about 15 minutes but by then it was gone.  Ran around the courthouse tracing every step and asking every officer, and it was long gone.Soooo... what would make this better? Rather than a rubber band to put the sensor INSIDE, why not just have the sensor have something you can put it in with two holes punched in the ends (think of a watch and watchband) where we could just attach any watchband we want?  Watchbands are very popular, there are millions of them, just make this backward compatible... plus a lot of people might end up buying this if they can use their expensive leather/gold/steel/alligator/whatever watch bands?I really hope someone from fitbit is reading this... I have the scale, and have bought 4 fitbits for myself and 1 for another person... would be great to have this replaced because it really was the broken band that caused this to become lost.  I actually love the products, love knowing my vitals as much as possible.  Again, it'd be awesome to have this replaced... I really do believe in the product, but this just gets me down.As a suggestion for the device itself:  perhaps learn waking patterns like movement... I don't mind telling the fitbit I'm going to sleep, but always forget to tell it I'm awake... if I'm moving around quite a bit, especially after a certain time, then just assume that I'm awake...
review_title: Argh - frustrating, but I keep paying for 'em.... on my FOURTH one...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: DO NOT BUY unless you are willing to LOSE it!  After purchasing and opening these a friend said she had lost two and two of her friends lost theirs as well in a very short time. The sleek snap closure is worthless!!!  My husband wore his for the first time today and it's already lost. I can't believe something as popular as this is continuing to be sold by the manufacturer without correcting this issue.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This Fitbit Flex is great!!  It's totally changed how I deal with down-time at work.  I am getting WAY more activity in my life, thanks to the Fitbit.  It also syncs effortlessly with My Fitness Pals, which makes a complete system for tracking calories and activity.One suggestion:  the wristband is a little hard to snap closed.  I chose to snap it closed so that it's loose enough to slip on and off my wrist without re-clasping.  This is a GREAT solution to the only problem I see with this device.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This product stopped working within seven months of having it and after contacting the company they wouldn't do anything to help because it was out of the 30 day return policy. The fit bit chip would not light up or charge. It was worn daily, but always taken off before a shower or any water activity. I wasn't trying to return it, I was trying to get it fixed or exchanged or something because it was less then a year old and already didn't work. I do not recommend buying a fit bit if it wont even last you a year. If you do buy one, I recommend using a company who will help you out past the 30 day return window when something isn't working.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: If you want to track your steps, sleep etc great! if you want to track elevation (climing stairs) it doesn't.  The battery lasts about 5 days. I haven't yet figured out if I like the app (was better before they changed it) but it integrates easily with other apps for calorie counting or exercise.  It is comfortable to wear, mostly.  It can be worn in the shower, but I don't.  Trying to determine if sensitive mode for sleep or regular is better for me.  Syncs easily with my Iphone 5, will not sync with an Iphone 4. I don't have a 4s.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Accuracy of step count is not calibrated right. Its giving me twice the steps that my pedometer does.  I bought it because the hip worn pedometer I've been using falls off easily and I wanted something I could wear continuously and was waterproof.  App design is great - clean and easy to use. Also like that I can sync it with Loseit app.  However, I'm disappointed because the main function I wanted it for is useless.  Regret purchase.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I started out with their model that was a step about this one. This one was not a watch and I truly miss that feature.The one feature I really dislike I have almost lost it several times because it comes unfastened easily. I contacted the company and they referred me to their video which I have followed but it still comes undone. I do like their sleep monitoring feature.I would buy from this company again if the rerelease their recalled monitor.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: At first, I was very excited to add this tool to my arsenal as I try to get my health back.  However, the "tap" interface is often confusing and I never know what "mode" it is in.  Twice now, I have connected it to the charger only to have it not charge because the charger housing is no longer snug.  The FitBit website is a fantastic compliment to the device and manages more date that the Flex itself.  Had I been more happy with the Flex I would have gladly paid the additional $50 for the "Pro" website version.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I order the violet Fitbit but I got the pink one instead of the one I wonted. It works great I am happy with it.I color is all right.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Purchased this almost a year ago.  It worked great at first, recording steps taken, sleep, and water intake as I recorded it.  Well, back in September it started having problems syncing.  And it wouldn't always charge.  When I did get it to sync, the information wasn't really accurate.  Haven't worn it now for almost 2 months. I wouldn't recommend this model.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My boyfriend wears this around everywhere! He even wore it when our phones didn't have any service in the mountains(you can't check your current status) but when we got back to the city it still synced what he had accomplished throughout the trip! Not fully waterproof though so don't wear it to the pool, you can in the shower with it though? Great product, love that you can switch the bands.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the idea of the fitbit and would like to continue using it.  The drawback I have found is the battery doesn't stay charged!  After a week or so it requires charging daily, which keeps me from tracking my sleep. I have sent two back and received a replacement that did the same thing.  It's frustrating when you just start tracking your progress and then have to return it, get another one, charge it and begin again.  If this replacement doesn't hold a charge I will be forced to ask for a refund and try something else.  Fingers crossed the new one will work!
review_title: I love the idea of the fitbit and would like to ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The device has been fully charged however once the tracker is inserted inside the wristband, it will not illuminate or light up.  Thinking to send it back. I have had 3 very technologically inclined people check it out to see what I was doing wrong even used YouTube.  It still will not work
review_title: The device has been fully charged however once the tracker ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am loving that the Fitbit Flex is easy to wear and causes no skin issue. I have tried the Bodymedia armband thing and it irritated my skin terribly. I have not explored all the functions yet but what I have tried has been easy to use.  I like that it vibrates when I have reached my 10000 steps.  A couple taps lets me see about where I'm at when I'm away from my computer.  I will update again once I have used it more.  For now I am very happy with it.  4 stars because it is a bit expensive.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I lover my Fitbit Flex. I've been much more conscious about my health all around as a v result of trying to keep up with my 10,000 steps a day. My only issue is that the bracelets are do small. My husband lost his Fitbit because the band was so tight that it popped off. I've had mine for about one year and my band is getting worn down. I'll have to buy another band. For the price of the Fitbit, it should come with sturdier bands that fit. See the pic. The latch is not as secure as it could be so it has the propensity to pop off if you're not careful.
review_title: Great Device. Bracelet/band -- not so much.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Really love the Fitbit flex! It tracked my sleep and steps accurately and it was a great motivational product. The app and website for all Fitbit products is amazing! I decided to return this after almost a months use because I think the Fitbit charge HR is more worth the money. As I saw in some reviews the bands were falling apart, I have to highly say to not pay attention to those reviews I used my Fitbit through a whole spartan race, besides mud getting all over it the Fitbit was tough and didn't even budge once though water, mud and rocks being constant rubbed against it. Great product for simple everyday activity tracking.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have been wearing my Fitbit for 3 weeks now and consider it just ok, not great. I am not totally convinced that the daily steps and miles are correct. I would say that both numbers are not true calculations of what the wearer is doing. I think the numbers are estimates which I guess is OK.  The big draw back is the tracking of daily calorie intake.  The need to manually enter ones caloric intake is time consuming and the information on the Fitbit app is not as user friendly as I think it could be. Since there is the need for manual entry of daily caloric consumption, an easier way to enter that information would be a great improvement.  One last thing, with the technology implanted in the device and all the advances in new technology, it would have been a real benefit to have some kind of a heart monitoring program in the Fitbit device.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this for my dad. He actively refused it for months before finally giving in and giving it a go. Now he won't take it off, he likes how well it organizes the information and lets him track his progress. Great product. Great echo system. It is comfortable. No irritation on wrists after months of use. Synch's easily with the phone.
review_title: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity and Sleep Wristband

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Surprised my husband and bought him one.  He was on the fence about it.  Glad I did.  He likes it, and it's keeping him motivated to keep on moving.  Like that we can do the challenges together and encourage each other.  Would be nice if there was an option to buy it with the arm bands being the same size.  Traded the smaller one to a friend who has the blue one, and my husband now has the large band that came with hers.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've been using it for 10 days now and absolutely love it.  It is a pretty simple device; tracks steps and sleep.  Just having it on my wrist reminds me to track my food on the website and to get up and move.  If I look down and only have one blinking dot it motivates me to get going and I take an extra trip around the office!  It is also motivating connecting with friends who also have fitbit.  I see where they are and it makes me want to keep moving.  100% recommend if you just need a little extra bump of motivation to get moving!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Flawless! Wouldn't call this teal, it's more of a seafoam green in the picture and in person, but it's great! Pristine package, ready to gift! Nice warranty add in as well.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: 12/15/15 - So very disappointed with this product. The bracelet fell off and it was lost after only two weeks of wearing it. Also, when trying to view sleep data in the mobile app would crash it every time. I had high hopes for the Flex after so many great reviews.12/16/15 - Review update! I contacted Fitbit regarding my issues with the bracelet and how it kept coming undone and was finally lost after only two weeks of wearing it. They are sending me a new, complimentary Flex full kit to replace my lost one. Still need to work on the problem with the mobile app. But they responded quickly to my email and the customer service representative was great. I changed my rating from one star to four because of this. Would have given them five if there wasn't an issue with the app.
review_title: Was disappointed - but Fitbit stepped up and made everything better!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had two of these.  They both came apart after a few months of wear.  Fitbit did, however, stand behind the product in both instances and replaced them or gave me credit towards the purchase of a different model.  They seem to work pretty well although I feel they overestimate the number of calories I burn on any given day.
review_title: They seem to work pretty well although I feel they overestimate the number of ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Purchased the Fitbit flex in May as a birthday give for my husband. As of Sept.10, it no longer works. It will not charge. Tried to charge in different locations and it made no difference. What a waste of money. Seller responded, that the return period expired. Amazon responded A-Z guarantee has expired. So, I highly recommend do not purchase this product, unless you want to throw away your money. Very dissatisfied.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this as a gift for my 14yo daughter. She seems to really love it and refuses to take it off other than to charge it or take a shower. She has it hooked to an app on her phone that gives her tons of information. We learned that she is restless 9-12 times on average in a night...which explains why no one has ever been able to share a bed with her
review_title: cool gift for anyone who always has their face in electronics

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: At first I was absolutely in love with my Fitbit.  Then over time it started giving me issues.  It randomly just stops working.  I'm not getting it wet, but it seems that it shorts out from standard levels of sweat on the skin.  I have to put it into a bowl of rice for a day to get it to work again every time.  Really frustrating from something you would wear while working out.  Then the band started to break just a few months in and I had to buy a pack of new ones on eBay.  Oddly enough the $1 each variety on eBay seem to be better made than the ones they ship.  This product could be so cool, but it's just not very well made.
review_title: At first I was absolutely in love with my Fitbit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I tried the Fitbit Flex while my Jawbone UP24 was being repaired.  I wasn't really happy with the way it kept steps a it didn't seem to be as accurate at the UP24.  I also found a big difference in the way it kept track of my sleep.  I guess overall, I like the UP24 for it mobile program and the way it keeps better track of my activities.  Some day I hope that one of these activity trackers will somehow be able to track my use of the treadmill as well.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Outdated, oversized, and lots of problems on first day.Despite not advising through checkout that it is non returnable, apparently that is the case. Worst buy I've made on Amazon.
review_title: Very poor product and non returnable

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This monitor is not very accurate in my opinion.  It counted hundreds of steps for me just taking a shower.  Also one of the main reasons I got this was for it to monitor my sleep.  Well that was not very accurate either.  I toss and turn a lot and wake up in the middle of the night some times.  One night I was tossing a lot and was awake for almost an hour and the fitbit did not register any of this.  IMO this monitor is just too inaccurate to warrant purchasing and wearing.  One positive note is the app is very easy to use and the fitbit was very easy to set up and was comfortable to wear.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had the fitbit for about a month and a half. It was working great.It's supposed to be waterproof and I wore it in the pool yesterday and it no longer works. It was charged and I did put it on the charger, showed it was fully charged, but now won't shine the lights to show me it's on.Soooooo now I have this item, 6 weeks in, supposedly waterproof and now it's dead.not happy about that at all.Waste of money

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Supposedly it tracks your steps while pushing a stroller or a grocery cart (according to the FAQ on the Fitbit site).  It DOES NOT!  I'm a stay at home mom and I am doing both of these often.  Set my phone on the stroller and watched no steps, had someone else pushed while I walked and steps started.  I love the idea of the flex, but having to put it in my pocket to get a count stinks!
review_title: Does Not work well with a stroller or cart

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am enjoying my fitbit, my employer initiated a fitness program, and I was able to sinc it to our system.  Therefore I don't have to manually update my steps everyday.  I simply sinc my phone with my fitbit, and it automatically updates on my employers fitness page. Love it!!!! I have worn it everyday since I got it, two months ago. Eventually I will upgrade to one with a watch, but for now its doing exactly what I want!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Probably a good device. Got this for my wife. I immediately didn't like the way you secured this. Why not have a watch type clasp? Well, my concerns were justified...came off on day 6 and is now MIA. If you happen to see a black Fitbit laying around, holler at me. Anybody wanna buy a Fitbit charger?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I loved my fitbit but after less than 3 months it stopped working.  I have contacted customer support and it has been over a week without any resolution.  I keep getting emails asking if my issue has been resolved and it hasn't. You can't talk to a person to resolve it. I would like to use it again if they would fix it.UpdateThey replaced my Fitbit.  I had other issues.  Since this time they now say it is water resistant and not waterproof.  My issues were due to using it in the water.
review_title: Fitbit Dead After Less than 3 Months

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: One of the best items I've purchased in a while. Very simple and easy to use. It's light weight and barely noticeable on my wrist. Wear it and use it everyday. It's definitely a great investment if you are looking for something to keep track of your daily activities and calorie intake/burned.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I would definitely recommend this product to other people who want to get more active and keep a measure of their daily habits.I love that it is water resistant and has long battery power life. The App on my android phone is also a great feature that assists me throughout the day in staying focused. I also enjoy the sleep tracking because I'm able to understand my sleeping habits now and this coincides with my fitness journey.Overall great product, great price, great benefits and support available.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought as gift for the GF. easy to set-up, easy to sync( i did it for her, less than 5 mins)My main issue with it is that the fastening system is flawed (and therefore the device) I had to help her get it on, it popped  off a couple times the first day. The pewter silver buckle/stud won't stay flush on the base without contortion or a partner to help you with it(similar to a woman's necklace)anyway,the good: inspires her to walk/move more in almost a competitive nature, I don't mind that part, great!the bad: seems expensive for just a basic device and simple program. The same can be and is done in an downloadable app for next to nothing....just walk with your phone.instead of a hard to get on bracelet.
review_title: Mmmm, Okay I guess, wouldn't buy again

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: TOO many unknowns...You have to memorize patterns for what you want to evaluate.  There were no INSTRUCTIONS for what the different patterns meant.  Even when I looked online for support only a couple of instructions were explained...not enough to operate the product for its full potential I am sure.  It is not simple nor user friendly.  I instead bought the Withings Activity band instead and LOVE it.  Simple to use and pairs easily with my Android!
review_title: I instead bought the Withings Activity band instead and LOVE it. Simple to use and pairs easily with ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: There was a lot of buzz when the FitBit Flex launched and even though I am not really a gadget person, I let myself get caught up in it. Now, it's mostly become a conversation piece and whenever someone asks I have lots of reasons to tell them it's not worth it.When I first got it, I was excited and started tracking. It was useful in helping me realize that even though I'm pretty active in general, I am nowhere near as active as I thought. So it prompted me think about ways to incorporate a little more walking into my day and to get a feel for what my commute should look like if I want to hit my 10,000 steps. After that, the value add was pretty minimal which was fine because about 2 weeks in, the band split in half and I wasn't able to use it. I did email Fitbit and after making me take and label photos, they promised to send a new one within 7-10 business days. Maybe I'm spoiled by Amazon Prime, but that seemed like a ridiculous amount of time to wait for a replacement.I do use RunKeeper to track my runs and was most inspired to get on the wait list for the Flex after seeing a post that said the two could be synced. And that's one of my biggest disappointments. You can pull FitBit data into RunKeeper, but not the other way around. So backwards if the idea is to track all of my activities in FitBit -- I don't want to track my every day steps in my running app.Another thing that missed the mark for me is activity and calorie tracking. They have placeholders for them, but there's no real integration with the actual tracker. I think it assumes I burn a certain number of calories just based on my height/weight so my log shows me burning the same amount for days I didn't even wear it. It might make slight adjustments based on my total steps, but it doesn't really account for any difference in steps when I'm walking or running. Any activity beyond walking and sleeping needs to be manually entered.I don't ever go to the website dashboard, but it seems (based on a few surveys I received) like they've put more energy into that than the mobile app, which is a shame. For a brief period, I was using the food and water tracker via the iOS app, but the food search gets a bit wonky and hard to use. I was interested in tracking my sleep and did find it somewhat interesting to see that information...if only they did a little more to help educate me on what is normal.I am currently not wearing it because it's stopped taking a charge. I don't miss it.
review_title: Novelty lasted almost as long as the band

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Interesting technology, great idea, but still a long ways to go. It counts fine, when it's charged. There is a problem that when it cannot locate your phone or network access point to communicate, it burns through the battery very quickly. Once dead, you may not realize it is no longer tracking anything.The 'bit' itself does not make good contact in the charger, so you will have to really work to allow it to properly charge. I have resorted to using rubberbands, etc. just to allow it to charge.All in all, I think it's a great idea, and it looks pretty good. Unfortunately the flaws I see and the price do not jive.
review_title: Probably not worth the money, yet.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: everyday I get a notice the battery is low so everyday I am charging the battery. The sleep tracker does not work unless I manually enter the time in and out of bed. I purchased this April 19th and now I cannot return it. It is incorrectly recording the amount of time for activity. It was great when it worked but now I have tossed away $105.00. not a happy shopper.
review_title: It was great when it worked but now I have tossed away ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This worked great for me for a couple of weeks. Then I started having problems with keeping a charge.I went through some of the trouble shooting processes but couldn't find a fix.  I had damaged the USB ports on my computer so I thought that might be an issue. When I got a new computer I was faced with the same problem. I've tried all of the trouble shooting ideas multiple times... I can barely get one night out of it.  It won't last a full day if I just leave it on the table.Time to contact customer support.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So, I've had the flex for 2 months.  In that time, both bands have split apart and apparently, the only thing I can do is send both bands back to Fitbit and pay for the shipping and then wait until I get the repaired/replaced bands back.  And any extra bands would cost me $30.00 but are ALL on backorder!  My husband has the Jawbone UP and I am thinking I made the mistake here.  But for the lack of bluetooth sync capability, the Jawbone would win this one on customer service alone.Fitbit needs to get way better on quality and customer service!
review_title: Quality of band is a problem

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit so much that I bought this one for my husband. Using the Fitbit I track my steps to find out how many calories I'm burning.  It keeps track of both the calories from exercise and the total calories you are burning based on you height and weight.  I have compared the steps that Fitbit is listing and what my phone is listing and it's very accurate.  I've recommended the Fitbit to many of my friends as well.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: People hear fitbit and they think it's this mystical, magical device. It's not. It's just a pedometer. This means it doesn't register anything but steps. No location sensing, no pulse monitoring - just steps.So if you're a bicyclist like me, this device is nearly pointless. All that hard work registers as a few steps after a two hour ride.To me, the price just doesn't justify the product.
review_title: It's just a pedometer - nothing more

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I liked the device but the strap keeps coming undone and it falls off.  I take it off before showering as others have commented so that bacteria won't build up in the strap.  the strap has a little rubber piece that fits through the holes in the band.  very flimsy.  the fact that it falls off so easily should be considered a defect which resulted in its loss (i.e. it is broken) but credit card insurance will not cover the loss.  company needs to fix this.  don't feel like buying a new device every few months.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: After a couple of good weeks, my Fitbit now needs to be charged a couple of times a day. I have read a few forums about how to reset the device, I'll see how that goes, but how does something of such poor quality get released in the first place? Are they using the consumer to sort out their defective batteries? It really sounds like there is a huge issue with quality here, and Fitbit's answer is to sell more devices instead of fixing the problem.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: As many have said, this is a fancy pedometer with a  sleep analysis function. When it works, it works great.The problem is that it doesn't always work. I've had this about seven months and it has stopped working several times. Sometimes it takes a simple reset while other times I can't find the reason as to why it's not working and just have to wait it out until it starts up again.Don't get me wrong, the technology is cool and I love the idea of being able to compete with friends, but this simply isn't ready for prime time.
review_title: it works great. The problem is that it doesn't always work

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased 12/27/15 at my fitbit at my doctor's suggestion, I am so happy I did! It's so easy (and fun) to track not only my activity, but what I eat throughout the day, but also my sleep patterns, the amount of water I drink daily and the calories I burn. I don't consider myself real tech savvy, but it was easy to follow the instructions and synch it to my laptop.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Didn't last long at all.  I bought this for a replacement of my old one that quit working after 4 years.  This one won't sync or pair with my phone.  Worked for 3 months then stopped working.  Don't know if I can get a  replacement, or if I'm out of luck.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love, Love, Love this item.  The Fitbit Flex is meant to motivate, and it truly has.  I have lost 20 pounds by linking my Fitbit Flex with the "myfitnesspal" app.  Utilizing the two together is the most beneficial weight loss program I've ever been on.  Tracking steps, calories burned, and sleep was super important to me and that's why I chose this model.The Fitbit Flex is very comfortable to wear...it's become an everyday accessory that I don't leave home without.  I've banged it, dropped it, scraped it against the door frame (by accident) and it has held up extremely well.  The only noticeable wear is from when I sprayed myself with mosquito repellent for an evening walk (mosquito's are horrible in my area right now).  The aerosol spray left small droplet marks on the wristband that will not come off.  So just a warning, make sure to take it off and put it in your pocket when you spray mosquito repellent on yourself.  Then put it back on and go for your walk!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So far so good. Arrived in original packaging. Well protected. Relatively easy to set up, outside of getting the computer piece in the band the right way. Fitbit needs a 'Quick reference' card that contains tapping information. I had to Google it because it isn't exactly easy to find on the app. This isn't the seller's fault, however. All was as advertised and super quick delivery!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had my fitbit for 6 months now. It is a really wonderful idea and when it works I love it. However lately it has been acting up. When I plug it into the charger it doesn't charge it and I have to reinsert it up to 10 times before it will connect. I also have issues with the app on my iPhone connecting correctly. I am going to contact the company because this is ridiculous that this product will only last 6 months.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really like this fitbit.  I've tried both the HR and the Alta and have sent both back and will stick with the basic flex.  It is very comfortable to wear, unlike the other 2 models which I found uncomfortable.  I've struggled with the clasp, but after a few weeks I'm starting to be able to close it on the first or second attempt.  Love the Dashboard where the stats are kept.  I've gotten several colored bands so cans easily switch to match my outfits.  I wish it held the charge a bit longer, but this can be said about most electronics.  I'm addicted to my flex.  It's so motivating to move more.  I'm averaging 15,000 steps a day....love it!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love this! Didn't realize how stationary my job was, this definitely helps me get up more and get my steps in. I noticed it does track certain things as steps, like when I'm rolling up my yoga mat, but then it won't count steps if I'm carrying something with both hands so I feel it all even outs. Love how it syncs with My Fitness Pal so you can see calories in vs calories out. Only reason it gets 4 stars and not 5 is that you have to charge the battery quite often.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this for my husband and he is really enjoying it. Setting challenges has helped him and actually motivated him to go for a walk after working a 10 hour shift at a hospital to meet his steps goal. I'd say it was a good investment. He says that it doesn't always track his sleep accurately but has had some success in seeing his sleep patterns.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am not able to access information  that I would like to have because there are no directions enabling me to do so. I can't figure out a way to check my heart rate, get an accurate reading of my sleep patterns, enter the calories (foods) I consume, and water I drink. I think all these actions are available, I just don't know how to access them. I check my steps everyday and I am happy with that aspect of the fitbit. My Android phone is not accurate, so I must check all data on my computer, which is not always convenient.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit - I especially love the challenges on the app - my coworkers and I are competitive and it makes me work out more!  When I want to dress up and wear a bracelet and not the black plastic band I just slip out the internal component and throw it in my pocket. Easy Peasy! The only problem I had was snapping the band closed but after about a week the holes loosened up and was easier to snap together. I just wish it was waterproof so I never have to take it off.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this product for everyone in my family. The only draw back is the lack of a user manual; we had to download from the Fitbit site. This product tracks activity, sleep, calories, water intake, goals, and much more. One fun thing this product does is allow you to track friends and family progress toward their goals. THIS PRODUCT DOES NOT WORK WITH IPHONE 4! Those with the wrong smart phone will have to synch to a computer and a computer synch is not as convenient. I would buy this product again.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The band on this is the worst design ever.  The thing does not want to connect or stay on.  I have contacted the company and they have great excuses. I bought this as a gift and my wife has already had it come off and refuses to wear it now until she can get a new band.  Pretty expensive for something that won't stay on.  I would highly recommend another brand that has a better attachment system than this Fitbit.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I do like the narrower size of this Fitbit. (For sizing reference, I have a 6 inch wrist and the small fits in the last one-third end of bracelet to properly clasp a little loose). I wear it 24/7 and have been surprised by how well it tracks activity and my sleep quality (which explains a lot ;). Only four stars due to short battery life and painfully slow to recharge.
review_title: Performs as advertised! Needs battery improvement

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Not working, will not link to cel phone, and does not light up when tapped like it supposed to.  My husband and friends have functional fitbit products.  I got the dud.  Lights up to 5 lights as a walk/run and use, but will not link with computer smart phone, "does not find device".  My husband surge linked immediately as did my friends.  Mine is plain broken, and does not light up when tapped as it should.Bugger:(
review_title: and does not light up when tapped like it supposed to

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Have had my Fitbit Fkex for just three days but I really am impressed with it. I love that it can track my consumption and exercise so easily.  The alarm on it wakes me in the morning so nicely and the tracking of my sleep is helpful in letting me know hoe many hours of deep sleep I am getting. The only thing I can think of on the negative side is that I did not order the one with the heart rate monitor. Love it love it love it!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit is great.  I got three for Christmas, one for an employee trying to get fit, one for my husband and one for me.  We all love comparing steps and having fun with the data and friendly competitions.  I did not do much research on other brands, but we all like this one a lot.  We are three months into wearing them, and they work great.  We all swim with them, my husband surfs, and they have held up very well so far.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: i am beyond pissed..do not buy this product. they fall off all the time..its ridiculous. they need to make a product that actually stays on an active person.You spend 80 dollars and the stupid thing falls off. I put bands on it . I tried a lot of different appraches but i am so active it just kept getting lost. its nothing I will ever buy again,. I AM MAD

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex only tracks step-based activities, and it doesn't really even do that.  If you're walking on a treadmill with your hands gripping the bar (going up a steep incline, for example) your steps don't register.  Nor do steps on the stairmaster.  So you have to keep track of your distance and calories on these activities separately, as well as circuit training, pilates, yoga. . .so what, exactly, is the point of having this technology that supposedly tells you how active you've been? I've found it to be an interesting diversion, but not really motivating or particularly informative. I did find it interesting that the two "most active" days I registered wearing it were days I didn't do any formal exercise.  I was in New York, walking many city blocks those days!  I wouldn't waste money on one of these until they develop something that really does track everything you do.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought the Flex when it first came out, and it works great, years later. In addition to tracking steps, I love the silent alarm, and sleep tracking. I have the Fitbit app on my Android phone, so I can track everything on it, when I am on the go, as well as via my laptop at home.
review_title: and it works great, years later

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Had I written this review in the first couple of months of owning the Fitbit Flex I would have given it five stars. I am now into my seventh month and at best I'd give it two stars. When I have to remember daily to charge a device I wear, it becomes a nuisance. When I have to spend $10 ever other month to wear said device, it becomes a waste.Good: software/app, accuracy, water resistance, following/competing with friends, link to employer's wellness programBad: I am on my fourth wristband; these things are complete junk and way too expensive, battery won't even last a day now; before it would last at least five days.
review_title: Wristbands are junk; battery fails after half a year

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This has got me moving! I went from walking about a mile a day to between 4.5 and 5 a day, just to get the little dancing light and wrist buzz reward each day. I love data and details-- and the online dashboard is full of this useful stuff.I also feel like I've joined a semi-secret club. It's amazing how many colleagues, friends and strangers notice my wristband and show me theirs.
