I have not used the competitive social-media features that you can use, but I do love it when someone asks me how many dots I've got so far that day.The sleep feature is great too. I've gained a much better understanding of my sleep, and how to improve it. I also love the wrist alarm so much that I've stopped using my noisy alarm clock to wake me up.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: If you purchase this you had better also purchase a 28 cent orings from your local hardware  store. The clasp is not dependable where as it is always coming off my wrist. If you do your homework you will see this is a very common problem. So for 28 cents you do not take the chance of losing your investment.  It is such a common problem you can purchase the protective covers from this site. Manufacturers of the product should be concerned enough to include with product.
review_title: If you purchase this you had better also purchase a 28 cent orings from your local ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really like the concept of the fitbit and the software interaction is great.  I have only had it 6 weeks and I have had trouble with synching to the software and now it will not hold a charge.  I have read many complaints from other fitbit flex users where holding a charge is a major issue to the point that it makes the device unusable.  Waiting to hear back from customer service as I write this.  As for customer service they tell you it can take up to 48 hours to respond to an email..................seriously?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my flex so much I had one before for a while until someone stole it but I just got Mine  today ! Also it says you shouldn't fully submerge your Fitbit in water , but I do all the time and it really does nothing so you should be fine .but if you do wet it, you should dry it as soon as possible thats probably why nothing bad ever happens to mineOne thing I can say though is that when I got it there was a finger print and slight marking on my large band but the small band was perfect! (I use the small anyways)  I'm wondering if this was a gift for someone and they sold it on Amazon or if it is refurbished but you should most definitely consider purchasing !

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Really great product, and the only one that I didn't throw away after a few months. I had two other fitness devices, but this one won. I wear it on my wrist constantly except for when I have to re-charge it. So far the Fitbit proved waterproof for me. It's also easy to clean with a cosmetic wipe when the rubber band gets dirty. The bit syncs well with the iPhone app and so far brought a lot of joy into my fitness life. I love it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Information provided not accurate, I made the experiment about sleeping hours, steps made and high level activity moment and 100% sure the information given by the fitbit is not close to reality.I work out every day at the gym and surely my level of activity is not close to reality.On the other hand many times I wok up and since the moment I sinc the bracelet to let it know that I am awake from the moment I am having breakfast I had more than 2000 steps and my house is not that big.The only moment I found accurate info is when is actually sinc with the cell phone and you have the app on when you are walking.really dissapointed, not helpfull and do not recomend itRegardsed
review_title: Can not be used as an accurate tool for activity

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the idea of the Bracelet, and it mostly works OK measuring distance and steps (I don't enter food or use it to track sleep), but, the closer is terrible. I was in Chile for a month and I lost it there because of the poor closure. Fortunately, the Company replaced it. Also, when the Fitbit was not charging properly, I got a replacement. The Service its mostly quite good.I did figure out how to get around the pro closure- I put a tennis/ golf wrist bracelet over it, so I no longer loose it. So, all in all, it is good.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love love love this tool for someone who needs to be aware of (in)activity and sleep patterns. Did not like the strap it came with -- too big for my small wrist so purchased a third-party, more feminine strap. Battery lasts about 4 days before needs to be recharged.
review_title: Love love love this tool for someone who needs to ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: DO.NOT.BUY!  I got the fit bit for Christmas on 12/25 and set it up on 12/27.  It fell off my wrist on 12/28, found it but then fell off my wrist on 12/29 at the mall and it is now gone.  What a waste of $100.  Fit bit  said it wasn't covered under the warranty.  I find it hard to believe that it is me because if you google fitbit flex falling off, tons of sites come up.  One sells an extra band to help it stay on or you can buy the app to help you locate it when it is lost. I think this is a MAJOR fit bit flex flaw.  Not Amazon's fault but I wanted to give a heads up to the consumer.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was given the FitBit Flex as a gift December 2014.  It worked for about 6 weeks, and then began discharging much more quickly (I was not using sleep mode or alarms, and rarely surpassed the 10,000 steps a day, so I had minimal vibrations that might drain the battery more quickly ).  Information became inaccurate (the iphone app would show that it was fully charged when it was almost fully discharged and steps became way off).  I contacted FitBit and they did send me a new one free of charge without hassle.  I'm hoping it will last longer, but feel a bit skeptical.  So I'm happy with customer service, but not super sure about the product.  I agree with other reviewers that this is best used as a pedometer for walking and running, and it won't count your steps if you are pushing a stroller or shopping cart.  I'm not sure how accurate it is if you placed it in a pocket, but will have to experiment.  I do find it motivating to have on my wrist as a reminder to move.  Will see if the replacement continues to work well and report back later.
review_title: Decent exercise motivator if it is working.  Customer Support was helpful.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I sure hope people are smarter than I am when ordering this fitbit..  I ordered the Flex and was shocked to find out that the info on the band is.... ZERO..!  Yes, you get no date or time, no step info, nothing!  You are walking around with a very expensive piece of plastic on your arm that occasionally lights up... Woot, woo.!  Take my advice and save your money on this worthless item and instead get a Fitbit Charge..  it actually tells you something...  date, time, steps walked, distance walked, stairs walked, etc...
review_title: Don't waste your money on this, does nothing!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got this Fitbit as a friend suggested it since I was getting serious about the weight loss and like it, however the band broke after 30 days of wearing it. Always made sure I took it off in the shower.  I guess hard plastic doesn't hold up long.  When I talked with my friend his band is standing strong.  So the electronic part syncs up and works fine, but you need the band on your wrist to pick up activity so it isn't doing me any good at this point.
review_title: Fitbit Works, but bands are a no go.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Done my research before purchasing it. Criteria used were (1) lightness/bulkiness , (2) time takes it to synchronize, (3) easiness of synchronization, (4) accuracy, (5) design, (6) price, (7) control through mobile & app interface, and (8) battery.I've compared it with Nike, UP and two other more devices, and found out that this slightly wins when compared to all.Unlike most of them, it synchs fast and wirelessly.It looks good and light. For me, I really want something minimum. I don't like wearing watches or bracelets or ring or anything, and Swatch Skin was my favorite only watch that I allow myself wearing. Nike was the bulkiest.It's app has calorie counting, sleep logging, steps & distance, heart beat and activity. Pretty much standard through all, and interface also matches the overall average of all other apps. I can say none of the other devices have an app that really stands out, they are all good.It is the most cost effective of them all.It is the most accurate in accordance to couple of bloggers that actually tested out all devices.I feel extremely satisfied with what I got.
review_title: Are you kidding! This this is awesome :D

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It won't track on treadmill.  It skips sync and doesn't track while walking.  It fell off in the middle of the night, so no sleep readings.  If it falls off in bed, then it's likely you'll lose it during the day.  So, why all the high ratings? They request a product review within one hour of setup.  I'm hopefully returning it in less than 24 hours. Omron pedometer is a good product.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have a cheap pocket pedometer that works better than Fitbit Flex.  Steps are not accurate.  And the sleep monitor doesn't really work at all.  You tap it when you are ready to go to sleep.  You tap it when you awake and that basically is the amount of sleep it records.  I woke up a 2 a.m. and read until 6 a.m. and it recorded that I got 7+ hours of restful sleep.  Would not recommend Fitbit to anyone.
review_title: I have a cheap pocket pedometer that works better than Fitbit Flex

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really like my Fitbit Flex. It has got me moving more then I was.  I  like the sleep pattern the most.  It tells you just how much sleep you get, how many times you were awake and how restless you were. The step part of it I would like to see more on just the steps I take.  It seems to measure every movement also. Like rocking in a rocking chair.  I guess I'm still moving, but not in a good and healthy way.  Otherwise I like all the features it offers. Makes you aware of what you are eating and how much water you are getting.  Well worth the cost.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is only about day 3 with my Fitbit Flex, but I love it so far! I love that it tracks my sleep, since I never know what kind of sleep I'm getting, but I know that it's not restful. It also makes it so much easier and way more accurate to try to figure out diet apps on your phone to figure out how many calories, exactly, that you're burning while walking or running or doing whatever. All-in-all, I love it!
review_title: If you're dieting, you definitely get your money worth!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I wish I had known about FitBit sooner. This made my activity levels go up by probably 1000%, no kidding. I used to take maybe 500 steps a day but this has completely motivated me to take 10k+ a day!It's very easy to use,  especially with a smart phone. Their website has lots of good FAQ if you're totally lost.If you don't know which fitness tracker to get, get anything by Fitbit.
review_title: The best thing I ever did for my body.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had the fitbit flex for about 4 days now.  It was really easy to set up and get started.  I really love all the data that it collects and I feel that it is super accurate on step counting.Here's for the bad.  Like I said, I have had this for about 4 days now.  I have been having trouble syncing this to my android device for about two days.  I had to forcestop my phone app, restart bluetooth and those didn't work.  Finally I was able to connect the wireless dongle into my pc and restart the fitbit and that did the trick...this was yesterday.  Today I am having trouble syncing it again to my android device.  It is beginning to become very frustrating.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love the tracking portion, but very unhappy with the poor fastening of the wristband.  Difficult to fasten securely on your own wrist (one-handed) and mine unfastened and fell off a few times until the last time - when it was lost for good.  I switched to the clip-on kind (for another $90.00) which I don't like as well, but at least it stays on.  What's wrong with a good old fashioned buckle? Or a stretch band?
review_title: Disappointed in the type of  band fastener.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Pros: works well, accurate step count, sleep alarm works well. no problem with the featured functionsCons: Have to refer to app on phone every time for info. Bluetooth takes time to calculate. Has frequent "cannot find tracker" issues. Still rated it this high as its durable and reliable for the most part.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I gave this Fitbit to my husband and he absolutely loves it.  It tracks his activity, sleep, calories and weight.  All of which he is interested in managing.  It is very easy to set up and input your information online.  He is using his laptop rather than his Smartphone, but either way is a great way to coordinate all your Fitbit info.  Great motivator for weight management!
review_title: It is very easy to set up and input your information online

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Simple but worked. There are better trackers out there, but if you want basic this is it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very expensive for what it is, but I like the software that you get to use with this product. I have no way to tell how accurate it is for steps or heart rate, but I think it is great for getting motivated. I like that I can wear it in the shower, and really like the silent/vibrate alarm function that it comes with.I probably should've done more research, but the advertising sort of made me think that this was able to actually monitor your heart rate and accurately track how many calories you've burned each day/each workout. Oh well.
review_title: Expensive, but great for motivation and estimating your daily burn.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the concept but it really is just terrible.  The band is very hard to clasp, almost impossible to do on your own.  Then you have to tap it every time you want it to sync, know that your going to bed....etc etc.  Very confusing.  I sent it back and got the Fitbit HR which is constructed much better.  The clasp is like a watch and it automatically does everything for you so no more tapping.  Definitely worth the extra money.
review_title: I love the concept but it really is just terrible

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Just OK. Had some issues with it not properly recording my steps for each day and did not account for my time spent on ellipticals. If you are an avid runner/joggers/walker this could be right for you but if you cycle enjoy the elliptical or swimming may not be the best one for you

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Both of us started wearing FitBit Flex in December.  We like the information, the phone connection is nice. The competition between us has been inspiring. The big problem has been the band. It is difficult to latch and has fallen off twice now. I am sure it is latched, but somehow it disappears without a trace. The first one lasted nearly month when it fell off and was never found. I purchased a second one since I like the push it gives me. That one fell off three days later. I don't know what to do now. I love the system, just have a problem with the band.
review_title: Love the tracker, Hate the band

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I ordered this as a birthday present for a family member and was happy that it arrived quickly and well packaged. She was very happy with it and told me it works great. She isn't great with technology but has had no problem figuring out how to use it. This has a lot of great functions and I will likely get myself one for my birthday.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It worked great for about 4 weeks.  I charged it today, sync done to get my data.  Finished my day and would not sync.  Totally dead.  No lights.  Would not charge.  Nothing.  Kind of expensive to work for only about a month.  This is my second Fitbit Flex.  The other lasted a year until it started to get issues.  I am back to using the older one.  Maybe time to try a different brand of tracker.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Not as accurate as the Ultra.  This doesn't pick up any steps where I'm holding my son's hand, carrying the baby or doing anything that involves my hands moving in any other fashion than normal walking.  On a recent walk it only tracked 1.5 mile and 3000 steps on a 2 mile trail.  So I would guess it's only about 75% accurate (when walking normally).  Definitely have to earn my steps.  But it's better than nothing

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The reason that I don't like it is, I don't have it any more.  Within a week after Christmas, it fell off my arm and was gone. Had just gotten it set up and was beginning to understand how it worked. I think I had a faulty catch or something. It shouldn't have fallen off so easily since I really don't get around much due to Rheumatoid Arthritis. It was for me to challenge myself to move more. Unfortunately, it is gone and Santa cannot bring me another one.
review_title: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: What I like best is that it is  durable.  I have had two, one for 3 years and the second for a year.  Wear it all the time, in the shower in the pool, never a problem, always keeps track of everything I want.  Never take it off except to charge it.  When notified, charge it about every 8 days.  I have had to replace the band probably once a year.
review_title: What I like best is that it is durable

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Keeps coming un-glued where it connects to the window.  If you need it to be secure, or waterproof, keep a couple bands on hand.  So far they have been replaced without charge.New 12/26/2014:  This was a gift to my wife last year, but it is deceased.  Seems the bands are designed to last a few weeks, the recording unit is designed to last a few months.  We need a replacement, or a refund from FitBit.  I cannot recommend spending any money on their products until they make something that will last more than nine months.  https://www.fitbit.com/flex

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm always looking for a "motivator" and this looked like it would be a good one.  That said, it's "pretty good" at reminding you to pay attention to your activity level, eating ,etc.  My biggest gripe is that it cannot tell the difference between walking and typing....so...you get artificially high "step" counts if you use a computer as part of your job.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have this product for 2 months now. I find its distance estimation quite accurate. I can't say the same about its sleep feature, but one can still observe her sleep patterns. Withstood salted water and numerous showers, no problems. Waking alarm feature is fine. Worked fine with iphone 5. Wrist band looks ok, though I have not removed it many times. I hope they'll feature extra bands soon, i'm not willing to pay an outrageous amount of money for some rubber strips.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I should preface this by we love what FitBit does.  This particular one though doesn't seem super robust:1st:  The band.  What a pile of poo.  After only a little wear it will barely stay on.2nd: The device.  Already going to have to replace it.  It just stopped working.So far FitBit is being good about RMA.  But we haven't actually got to the point of them replacing the broken device though.
review_title: Not Super Happy w/ The Flex

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I do like my Fitbit for tracking my steps and my sleep.  I have had a couple of times "tracker not found" when I go to check my stats but them it seems to be ok afterwards at some point. Because I have had it less than a month, I am not sure if it is me and something I am not doing or the Fitbit itself.  I have to use it further to find that out.  That is why only 4 stars and not 5.
review_title: I do like my Fitbit for tracking my steps and my sleep

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm required to enter that manually. Other functions that link other programs seem to work well, but it has taken me awhile to figure out the issues. For example, I can only enter food/exercise in myfitnesspal.com -- fit-bit entered exercise won't set up right. It also stopped tracking sleep for me correctly. I have to manually enter my "fall asleep/wake up" times, and that's the main reason I wanted it.In general, I'm disappointed, although I still use it periodically.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Works for steps but not for sleep.  I bought it primarily to track my sleeping but it says I am sleeping even when I am just lying there TRYING to sleep.  So it will say I got 8 hours sleep when I really only got 4, that kind of thing.  But do like the step tracker part of it.  Lets me know that I have not been kidding myself and I am indeed lazy.
review_title: But do like the step tracker part of it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought my flex in November ,it is now January and my flex will not track my steps or at least let me sync it.  Yes battery is fully charged I tried turning off and then on my Bluetooth that didn't help. Very disappointed before it stopped working I just loved it.. Guess it doesn't have a long enough life for me to buy another.  I just called support and we solved my problem over the phone!!!  I had to reset it life is good again
review_title: Doesn't last long, called support they were wonderful!!!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Simple and just shoes the dots so you know about where you are. To get exact steps you have to check your phone. I wanted as simple and sleek as I could get because I already wear a watch and I have no desire to get text messages, etc from this fitbit. It does the job well and battery lasts about 3 days. It's always sad to charge it and not get to count your steps!
review_title: It's always sad to charge it and not get to count your ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've purchased three of these. The first purchase was for myself. LOVE it! So much so, I purchased two more for friends. If you know of anyone who enjoys fitness, they will love this as a gift. The aspects I love the most are the sleep log & the daily food log. The daily food log breaks your food down by composition so keeping up with your daily intake of fats, carbs, & proteins is super easy. The fitbit is one of the most useful tools I've found to date.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is very comfortable to wear and the validation that comes from the lights flashing when you meet your goal and the encouraging emails that congratulate and motivate you really make a difference.  It is a simple way to make sure "desk jockeys" get up and move around a little!  I also thought I had lost my FitBit and the customer service was excellent as they helped me figure out how to find it and what to do if I couldn't find it.  I would recommend this product!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great little device. It does what it is intended to do, but life of the device is a guessing game. I've had multiple devices and 1 the strap broke, another the dingle quit charging, another the tracker stopped. Fit bit has been good about replacing, but still a pain and would expect more for the price. Opt for a quality more expensive version or another brand.
review_title: Gets the job done, but needs quality improvement

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm a runner so I don't pay so much attention to the steps count. I've found the mile tracker to be almost point on accuracy to the Nike running gps. Food database for the calorie counting is awesome, includes an abundance of brand named food items and serving sizes, so super useful. Love love love the silent/ vibrating alarm clock feature. I'm sure this product with become enhanced with fine tuning over time. Weekly emailed activity reports are automatic :)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm so impressed with Fitbit flex. I bought it for my wife for Xmas who's wanting one for years- we were just waiting for the price to come down. She loves this! It has so many more features than just step counting; such as sleep monitoring, calorie counting, water intake log, and exercise tracker. It does all this as well as track steps. I'm so please with this product and we will probably buy me one as well.
review_title: Wife loves it! Does SO much more than track steps! Great purchase!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This Fitbit records double the mileage that you really walk. It makes you think that your progress is very good but in reallity you progress is just mediocre. Very disappointed in this product.
review_title: It makes you think that your progress is very good but in reallity you progress is just mediocre

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had heard a lot of good things about Fitbit and thought that the Flex would be a good fit for me.  I didn't want something I wore on my belt and had to transfer to my arm for sleep monitoring.  Well the hardware has worked out just as I suspected but what I didn't realize is that the Fitbit web site would integrate with my other fitness routine so well.I was already tracking my food on MyFitnessPal.com and I found that the Fitbit website can be linked to MyFitnessPal.  In fact I would recommend that as MyFitnessPal has many more foods in their database and gives you a way to scan a bar code.  The summary information for your food will show up on Fitbit and give you a place to see your complete fitness picture.I also had a Withings scale and was worried that it would not work with Fitbit.  Nothing to worry about.  They make it obvious that Fitbit works with the Aria scale but the Fitbit site will also synchronize with the Withings site to get your weight and body fat measurements.In short I recommend the Fitbit Flex as an easy way to monitor your activity level and I highly recommend the Fitbit web site as a place to integrate your fitness tools.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Well I have to say this fitbit it great! It helps me want to walk and get up and move. I like knowing how many miles I walk a day, and how much sleep I have actually gotten. My favorite part of having this fitbit is that I can challenge my buddies. We all got them around the same time and have been doing a great job trying to get healthy and fit!
review_title: Just what i needed for motivation!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this a week ago and have lost it already. The reason why I lost it is because the piece that connects the bracelet would never make a good connect. the prongs were no long enough. I believe the company should refund my money or send me one in which the connector works correctly. I loved the idea of the device but am disappointed in the quality.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my fitbit the weekly challenges really get you moving if you are a competitive person.  The only thing I hate is having to charge it. The little charger gets lost easily. Also if you don't know to look for the wireless adapter it's easy to throw it away! It's crazy to see how many steps you actually take and realize it's not enough. I also love the sleep tracker to see my sleep habits.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm disappointed. I purchase this and fell in low with the device. I've used everyday and lost almost 8 lbs. On the flip side the item will not hold a charge nor sync to my cell phone. I returned and replace the first one because of syncing issues. I thought maybe wearing it in the shower did something. Anyways, my replacement fitbit is not sycning after 5 days. The new fitbit has never been near water.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this 2 months ago. At first I LOVED it. Great little gadget, loved using it. I've worn it every day since. About a little after a month I noticed it acting a little funky, not registering sleep mode taps, or the battery randomly dieing without warning. (It emails you as well as the app telling you when the battery is low.)Now the app tells me it's always at medium battery but I have found it dead on more than one occasion without notice. I'm upset I paid so much for something that lasted so little. I wish I had gone with another product or tried the higher model. Maybe it would have lasted longer.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I actually ended up buying another FitBit after losing this one, and love it. But, I have to be SO mindful of the clasp because it easily comes undone. I'm unsure why they just didn't make a watch-like band instead of a plastic snap band that comes off easily. Definitely a design flaw. For over $100, you would think the clasp design would be better than a glorified friendship bracelet. If you are really active, this might not be the device for you.
review_title: Lost the FitBit on 2nd Day-Why this rinky dink clasp?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Ordered this on amazon a few months ago. My first one wouldn't connect to my computer or mobile device to track activity. So I sent it back. They sent me a new one. This time it seemed to work ok at first. But the connection to the mobile device is still extremely variable - sometimes it works and other times it simply won't connect. And this is with a stable wifi connection so the fault is definitely with the product.To add to that, the actually bracelet actually tore into two parts after wearing for only 2 months. This was definitely a design flaw since it tore at a point right where the actually tracking mechanism is entered into the bracelet.A little picky here, but the device also does a terrible job at picking up activity outside of running/walking such as lifting, push ups, or ab exercises. It basically treats these activities as non-activity.Altogether I'd say I've had a terrible experience with this product. Don't buy!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: While the Fitbit Flex does do a good job of tracking your movement and sleep cycle, after wearing it for over 6 months it stopped connecting to my iPhone.The only water it came in contact with was the sweat produced from exercise. Your luck may vary but the device became essentially useless after only 6 months of use for me.
review_title: While the Fitbit Flex does do a good job of tracking your movement and sleep cycle

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I find this very useful when I am out and about. I not only can use it to decide what to order for lunch, but keep track of my walking and calories burned. The only negative I find is the way it is held on the wrist. The 'Little punch' clasp is a real loser. I've had the band come loose in bed 3 thimes in 4 days. I ordered the little holders, but cannot understand why the manufacturer does not include 1 in the box.
review_title: I find this very useful when I am out and about

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This product is worth nothing. Don't waste your money. I bought this in Oct 2014 and since then it works and it just doesn't work. I had called the support folks and they made me do reset etc and it worked for another day. It has been absolute waste of money, I am not sure how I can return this or get replacement. Even after 2 Miles walk in the morning the device shows 107 steps :) :) Nothing actually works. The App is sucks big time on Samsung Galaxy S4.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I think the Fitbit really gets your mind to trigger good habits.It quickly makes you aware of your diet, activity, etc... What a great visual and reminder.  It's almost like you are in a "Fitbit Club" as you will start noticing other people who are wearing it too.  You will find yourself looking at people's wrists. It's a great conversation starter.  You will definitely want to swap out stories on what you like or how you are doing.When you sync it to your computer/smart phone, you will record information on it like your food, liquid, or any additional activity (over and above what it already recorded as you wore the band.)There are little tiny lit up stars displayed the band that light up when you tap it and it displays 1,2,3,4, or depending if you had a really active day, 5 stars on the actual band.  It's quite addicting!  This is what helps you get into the habit of "checking in" on how healthy you are that day. Then, you will have to go check the computer/smartphone to add your food or liquid.I sent my back, only because I'm working with a very high end trainer (working on some neck injuries to build up muscle) and she wanted me to have a heart rate monitor watch.  I couldn't afford both, so I had to choose the heart rate monitor.I will probably buy the Fitbit again later on.
review_title: Great visual reminder!  I felt like I was in a Fitbit Club.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the Fitbit Flex for my wife as a gift.  Unfortunately we're waiting for our 2nd replacement unit to arrive in the Mail.  There's a known design flaw with the Fitbit Flex.  After a few months it will stop charging in the cradle.  I contacted Fitbit support for a second time and demanded my money back.  I was told the "warranty" period expired which is confusing since it's been less than a year and I contacted them after the first Fitbit stopped working.  I figured my warranty would "reset"  but I guess I was wrong.The one positive I can say is Fitbit has pretty good support.  Both times I've received a replacement, they've been easy to work with.  I would recommend Fitbit, but definitely not the Flex product.  It's got a design flaw and is pretty much useless.
review_title: Read this review before you purchase a Fitbit Flex - It won't charge after 3 months

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit was fun while it lasted. I had heard they had quality control issues so I had put off getting one - hoping they would fix them. I got one for my birthday April 2014 and just two days after I could have sent it back to Amazon - 4 weeks total - the Fitbit BROKE.Now I have to call Fitbit and see if I can get another.NOT WORTH IT ! Wait another two years.
review_title: worked for three weeks, then would not take a charge.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great wrist band tracker, I didn't know I toss and turn so much in my sleep until I got this Fitbit . I know realize I had to do something about it and now I'm actually changing my lifestyle with activities and diet to improve my sleep. Which is so important because if you don't have proper sleep you can't function well for the day.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am very glad I bought this activity band, it has a lot of information and help me stay motivated to make excercise. the sleep function is nice too, but it really does not give any help to you (I mean, there is nothing you can do about the quality of sleep you get).the only complaint (and the reason it gets only 4 stars and not 5) is that the sleep mode activates by itself when too much vibration occurs, maybe when I am driving in a road that is not well paved. also when i am riding my motorcycle it counts a lot of false steps.but for a normal day (and for well paved roads) it is great and I would buy another one.
review_title: I am very glad I bought this activity band

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I loved the fitbit until it kept falling off and strangers would hand it to me. Well 3 months after owning I lost it because of the horrible clasp technology Fitbit used and now I'm out $100. I also had purchased the extra color bands, and Fitbit does not sell the sensor alone to users. Its 2014 and a stupid plastic piece is whats holding the $100  device together??Save your money and wait till they fix their products and launch the new fitbit in the fall.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: For $100, I was expecting it to do a lot more than just track steps, distance, and sleep. I found it extremely difficult to keep an accurate log of meal calories. After a while, I just started guessing. And, it’s hard not to. Also, the sleep tracker is not completely accurate. It’s not really tracking the total number of hours you slept, but the total number of hours you’ve been in bed. You have to literally tell it “You’re sleeping” so it can start tracking.For average bees, I recommend saving the money for something else.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought the FitBit Flex as a Christmas present for my wife.  After charging the FitBit and syncing it to her iPhone it was good to go!  She has only had it for a couple weeks but she loves it.  She is continually tracking her steps and has started to use it to monitor her sleep.  She is for focused on her fitness and the FitBit has been a great tool for her to use!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Worked wonderfully for the first 59 days, then noticed that it didn't charge fully, then at all.  After reading previous reviews, seems this is a more than an occasional issue and customer service is slow on the uptake.  Just emailed them since it's the only venue of communication and we'll see how quickly they respond since it's not the first time their $100 product dies in less than 2 months.  Clearly this is a product issue and should be replaced.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My husband surprised me with this as an early Valentines Day gift. I'm a stay at home mom. So I've Been hinting for one for awhile to track my jogs, when I take my 10 month old in the stroller. & to really see how many steps I take during the day. I'm not sure how accurate it is on recording steps though. Since I've only had it for a day. But I wanted to help any really petite ladies out on the band size. As you can see my wrists are insanely tiny. And I'm wearing the small band, and I still have maybe 2 more notches to go. I was way excited when I found out that it actually fits and isn't really bulky on my wrist. Which is why I never really wear watches, or have tried any other fitness band. But ladies if you have as tiny wrists as I do. The small band will def work. I hope that helps someone out.
review_title: Slim, and not bulky at all!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the fitbit itself and the way the app on the phone that you can download. My one downside is their charger design sucks. It is extremely finicky to get the fitbit to actually charge. It will start charging and then stop. Fitbit's recommended solution is to use a piece of paper or a paperclip to hold the fitbit tight into the charger. How about you redesign your product so it actually works!? Other than that, I enjoy it and enjoy being able to compete with my friends on who gets the most steps every week.
review_title: I like the fitbit itself and the way the app on ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had odometers in the past, but the Fitbit is far better in tracking activity.  No problems with it.Update 4/9/15 - A few days ago, Fitbit changed the way they track activity.  Now, it's useless.  Starting April 3, I have ZERO active minutes.  That was the primary motivator for me.  I might as well go back to my pedometer.  VERY disappointed with Fitbit and no solution that I know of is on the horizon.
review_title: Nice product - Dashboard no longer shows activity - DISAPPOINTED

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex is a wonderful tool to monitor day-to-day activities and educate as to the value of a person's activities, whether eating or walking or sleeping .... anything.I had an issue with the first one that I ordered: it would not accept a charge. It was effortlessly and speedily replaced which impressed me as I was eager to get on with using my Fitbit Flex.All told, I recommend this product - hands down.
review_title: Fitbti Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had nothing but trouble with my Fitbit. It frequently failed to record my steps and sleep. I spoke with their customer service people countless times. They had me run through the same old routines every time (stick a paper clip into a hole in the Fitbit, remove the software and re-install, and on and on). The internet is awash with thousands of complaints from people who have experienced exactly the same problems I have.So bottom line: Do NOT buy this product.
review_title: Unreliable and impossible to get your money back

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Don't bother.  The wristband and app are a real PIA and don't give you enough information to really be any motivation or gain any information on exercise and diet.  You would be better off using a pedometer and an app like My fitness Pal to determine how many steps, how much exercise, and how many calories you have to burn off.  I had mine about 10 days, and had pretty much quit using the app, forgot about the band, and actually, it fell off and I lost it in REI.  Didn't look for it, didn't call, don't care.
review_title: You would be better off using a pedometer and an app like My ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I enjoy my Fitbit though the clasp was hard to do one handed at first. I find the app to be a bit wanting, it is often down for updates, and not everything I eat is on it and I just have to guess. But it is a decent tool. I do like the color of my band and it looks just like the picture. The setting up of the Fitbit was easy and quick. An OK took to use for counting steps and finding out how to be more active.
review_title: I enjoy my Fitbit though the clasp was hard to do ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was a nice exercise tracking device, unfortunately three knocks against it. First it only counts steps, not stairs or biking. Second, it does't do heart rate, which I thought I did;t care about, but wish it had. Third, the bracelet stinks - AFTER ONLY A MONTH THE CLASP DIDN'T HOLD AND I LOST IT. Nice device, its shame the clasp won't hold.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my FitBit! I typically only use the step counter, calorie counter, and sleep function, and those functions work very well. The only possible complaint I could have is that it sometimes seems really over-sensitive. I tried to fix that by putting the sensitivity at normal and changing the setting to my dominant wrist, even though I wear it on my non-dominant one, and that seemed to help a lot. I'm certianly getting my money's worth with this!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Not good. I bought one that never turned on. Then bought another one, it worked for a while then stopped charging. It did motivate me to move more while it lasted but even with careful monitoring of calorie intake I found my weight loss unpredictable. I don't blame the product for that, I just think there's more to it than steps and calories.
review_title: Not good. I bought one that never turned on

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Sorry but this purchase was returned because it was, well, a piece of crap!  Was on phone with technical support and I don't think any of them knew the product........never got it to work properly......even went to the Geek Squad even they say it is a crappy product and the design of the unit was a horrible conception.....nothing!  I do have to say the color is vibrant and pretty!Return process was amazing.....no hassles!
review_title: Don't buy it!  You have been warned!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit, but my complaint is with the watchband. The watchband is not very secure at all.  The company would be well served to exchange the current band with one that is more like a traditional watchband. The clasp on the Fitbit band easily comes lose and it could very easily come apart if it catches on something. The longer one wears it, the looser the connection pieces become.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My wrists are tiny, but this band was way too tight for my wrist.  I was disappointed that I couldn't find the proper fit easily.  It makes my Fitbit unusable which is very disappointing!
review_title: I was disappointed that I couldn't find the proper fit easily

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Works well, but I have encountered a couple problems. First, stopped charging so followed instructions on the Fitbit site on how to clean contacts. It worked. Second, it disconnected and again I followed instructions on how to reset. It worked.  I was concerned that I encountered these problems so quickly after I bought the Fitbit (approximately 4 weeks and 8 weeks, respectively). I don't shower with it on me.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: the band broke only after a few days but I did super glue it back together would suggest you plan on buying another band that is made of steel of the strap for sleeping
review_title: works good and no problems with working with my G7

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I lost the first Flex - so, when I purchased a new Flex I made sure to buy the silicon fastener rings to go around the band.  It's been over a year now and the rings work.  I participate in lots of challenges - they really help keep you on track with your goals.  I've lost weight, gained a lot of strength.  I love the Fitbit, can't be without it now  - which is a good thing.  Highly recommend.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my fitbit flex.  Been using it for 3 years now.  I have had to buy new bands which last just about a year.  Use it for counting steps and for tracking my sleep and something I could not be without is the alarm function.  Awesome silent alarm so do not wake up my spouse on those days we have to wake up at different times.
review_title: Fit Bit flex still going strong

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit. Using a Fitbit allows me to be more conscious of how little I am walking around and my inactivity throughout the day. The app is easy to install and syncing to my Fitbit was a breeze.  Another great feature that this Fitbit does and is keep track of my sleeping habits.  I apparently am sleeping more than I thought I was.  I would highly recommend a Fitbit for those who want to be more aware of their activity.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Interesting activity tracker but its seems to work better for runner. I do yoga, rock climb and mountain biking. Somehow the calories burn seems a little erratic. but its does tell give you an approximate idea of your daily activities. I just too lazy to turn on n off he sleep function each time I go to bed. I hope the newer Fitbit Charge will be more accurate.
review_title: Good Activity Tracker with Much Room for Improvement

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fitbit Aria Wi-Fi Smart Scale, Black and Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, BlackMy wife and I "love" our Fitbit Flex's and Aria Scale.  I have dropped 20 lbs in the 2.5 months that we have had the benefit of the Fitbit system tracking our exercise, sleep, weight and food consumption.I walk 11 km every morning with my dogs.  The distance has done wonders for the Bichon who I have nicknamed "Fitbit".With the website (and in my case the Endomondo app), it is a great way to nag yourself to do the right thing.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The only thing I wish about my fitbit flex was that it wasn't continuously trying to sync. I'd prefer if I could choose when to sync with my phone. I know for most people continuous syncing is desired, but I just don't like the idea of bluetooth signals constantly thumping into my arm. I keep the bluetooth on my phone off unless I want to check how many steps I've taken. Overall, I love the product, just my two cents.
review_title: but I just don't like the idea of bluetooth signals constantly thumping into my ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this tracker for my mom, and she loves it. She uses it everyday, and it really motivates her to walk a little more to get another light to come on. It's both comfortable and discrete, so she has no issues wearing it all the time. She did say she wished the battery lasted a little longer (usually has be recharged about every 5 days).I think it's a great gadget for tracking walking, i.e. a fancy pedometer, but I am not sure it how well it would work for tracking other activities. Suits her purposes perfectly though.Would highly recommend for anyone trying to be mindful of their daily activity levels.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this as my first Fitbit wristband, it worked well and kept itself up for about two years. After two years and some water damage the wristband finally died. I replaced it with the new Fitbit Charge HR. Overall this wristband is a great purchase and is perfect for anyone who wants to begin tracking light activity. If you wish to track heavier activities or monitor more things like floor levels, and heart rate you should look into their new Charge HR.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Beware the snap band that holds the device to your wrist. It frequently will come undone and as a result, you might lose the product altogether if you are not careful. Other than that, the product is as shown, works as advertised and is overall a great product. I didn't have any problems when it got wet and it was very easy to charge and sync to my phone. The rubber wristband is very comfortable and I wore it all the time. Wonderful product, I would rate it five stars if not for the wrist band.
review_title: works as advertised and is overall a great product. I didn't have any problems when it ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Was so excited about this, but ended up being very disappointed... Had a very hard time getting it even set up, it wouldn't connect to itself plugged into the computer...But I was most disappointed that the smallest arm movement would love 2-3 steps for you, even if you didn't move at all...And when I did take 5 steps it would log 8-10 if I did anything else with my hands...I know there needs to be some room for error as it is on your hand, but it was to much for me
review_title: but ended up being very disappointed..

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had my fitbit flex for less than 3 weeks and have generally enjoyed looking at my daily progress, but it is now holding a charge for 1 - 2 days max, so it doesn't allow for accurate ongoing tracking when you have to stop and charge for several hours every day or two.I am thinking to return in hopes that a different one won't have the same issue.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have used other similar devices.  All are somewhat the same.  I picked this device for its water resistance and size.  I have had it a few weeks and find it a very helpful device.  My one complaint is the battery.  It runs on a rechargable lithium ion battery.  Now it could be my unit is defective.  But seems that the battery cannot hold a charge past the mid week mark.  According to manufacturer specs should last a week to 10 days.  I will update further the longer I have used the device.Definitely would recommend this.
review_title: Great mnemonic for getting and staying fit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: not accurate.  Registered that I was taking steps when it was just sitting on my dresser.  Also registers steps when sleeping.  But it will give you an idea of your activity level.  As far as sleep reading, again it is a guideline.  There were times I was awake in bed but not moving so it didn't register that I was awake.  The band also broke 1 week after use.  So all in all it was interesting to use but I would not purchase again.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Generally like it as I primarily got it to give me an idea of how many miles I walk at work per day.  Was also interested in the Sleep function.It does some inexplicable things like give me lots of "active minutes" and "steps" when I ride my motorcycle... not sure why as that is a totally sedentary activity?  And on those days I can't really tell how many steps I've taken or whether I was anywhere close to my goal.  But other than that the device adds value to my overall health and workout regimen.
review_title: Generally like it as I primarily got it to give me ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Over all this is a great little product, however about the time i was approaching a week of wearing it, the wrist band snapped a part at the area that holds the chip.  I also found the band a little difficult to put on and snap. I am considering the clip style that us around $60.00. At this point, I can order more large wrist bands but not sure I want to get in this pattern every few weeks or so.
review_title: Had about a week and wrist band snapped

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It served it's purpose I guess, but I did not like that it didn't actually measure my inactivity. I had to "tell" it when I was going to sleep and when I was getting up. If you're going to invest in a Fitbit, purchase one that does more than act as a pedometer...a smart phone can do that. I grew tired of mine after only three months and sold it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I liked the tracking features of the app and how comfortable the Fitbit was to wear.  My biggest complaint is the flimsy clasp on it.  I lost mine because the band broke on it and I didn't realize it had broken.  Someone else found it and is now using it because I received an email stating they had taken 25,000 steps that day...  Makes me sad and and a bit irritated that now I am going to be forced to either purchase a new Fitbit or switch to another product that may not be as good as the Fitbit but has a more secure band on it.  It's not exactly a cheap product and I am not going to continually spend $90 to replace it.A more minor complaint was the short that developed in the charging cord but that doesn't even matter now since I no longer have one.
review_title: Loved it but lost it because of the flimsy clasp

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really like it. It encourages me to do more activity and awarenss on water and food intake. Dashboard is great in the app.  It gives you chance to include all the food you take in and give an idea (even it is approx) about how much you eat and what it means. You also get to see how much you can burn. It also gives you a good idea about the quality of your sleep.  You get to see why you wake up tired (shows you how many times you wake up at night and rates eficiency of your sleep etc). The only down side for me is that other activities you do say yoga, cycling, etc the wristband does not record. You will have to add them up yourself in the dashboard to see your daily activity and approx calorie calculation. And there is slight discomfort on the wrist when you sleep first a few days but I guess that depends on what position you prefer to sleep.  But after a few days, somehow you get adjusted to it, and  there is no discomfort.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the Flex and I waited for it to come in.  The only time it is off of my wrist is when it is charging.  I love it the silent alarm you can set to wake you up does it job for me.  I love how easy it is to set goals and change them from the dashboard when I am syncing these to the computer.  I am gradually increasing my steps and I love when the armband lets me know that I have reached my goal for the day.  I tried the bodymedia but I get Blisters on my arm from that

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: DO NOT GET IT WET! I've had mine since March '17 and it just crapped out on me. I would take it off for showers and dishes but didn't bother when washing my hands. Now it won't come on at all and I can't return it either. I bought it for a fitness class and began to enjoy tracking all that it does but now it's useless. Doesn't work well if you have a Android phone that it syncs to, have to force a sync and make it restart the bluetooth connection a lot.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My fitbit arrived 11 days ago. I followed all instructions, charged it before wearing. A week later, I lost at least one day's data and likely part of a second. Today, it started flashing four lights...two dots, a blank, and two dots. I googledthe problem and it looks like lots of people have had the same issue. So I tried to reset it as instructed. Now it seems to be completely dead. Been on the charger for three hours and no blinking at all. Returning tomorrow. Lame.
review_title: Broke in less than two weeks.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I want to love this product. Truly. When it works, it works well and I love competing with my friends and myself in tracking my steps. However, since purchasing this product in April, I have had to request 3 replacements. Each time, it was due to a battery issue, where after completed a full charge, the flex dies after a few minutes. Sometimes it comes back to life after a day or two, but then it dies again, then comes back to life...it's just inconsistent. The troubleshooting steps are of no help to me. So I have to keep contacting support to request a replacement, which they are quick in delivering so that's a plus. But considering this seems to be a well documented issue, it's a shame they haven't improved the product. I can't get a refund at this point so I'll keep using the replacements until I find something better.
review_title: When it works, it's great...when it works.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got the product and it was very easy to assemble. The hardest part is getting it snapped on your wrist.  Takes a few tries and then it does get easier.  Glad it came with both size bands because the larger band pulled apart at the connection so I am relying on the smaller band to get by until I can order the set of 3 bands.  Wish they would offer the pink band by itself but that wasn't an option.  And now they have the one with the watch included.  Day late and a dollar short. Oh well.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love this thing! I was looking for a simple cool way to be more active. Got to the point of being part of my life. If you are honest with the calorie intake and make adjustment to leave 500+ daily calories on deficit, will shed some pounds monthly. I'm 38 years old active, fit person. Train on regular basis, Yoga, Morning runs (trails) and so on. The most I was looking for was the sleep monitoring feauture. Itsn't that accurate but provide a clue of sleep patterns. Worked in my case. The first device... but it's just the first one.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: They have a software update that has to be updated after the update the battery will drain in less then 2 days I bought 2 and the same thing once the update does its thing it will drain in 2 days or less fitbit has no fix yet all they keep trying to do is just send out a replacement its there software save your money till they fix this issue
review_title: Bad software update drains the battery

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This thing is awesome. It tracks your steps, sleep, water intake, and more! Was easy to sync to my Samsung galaxy s5, just make sure to charge it overnight first. I also synced it to my MyFitnessPal app and it automatically transfers my calorie intake so I don't have to enter information twice!For anyone trying to get a jump start on fitness or weight loss this is a great, ready to use tool to hold you accountable. Would definitely recommend.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This gave me a lot of information and a good profile of my activity.  I am not someone who is good at charging things ina regular way so ran into some problems because of my own laziness about checking when the charge was fading.  Gota different one which has a battery that lasts a year.  I am better at replacing once a year than remembering to charge.
review_title: Not a good fit for my lifestyle.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was trying to get in better shape, so I bought a fitbit.  I absolutely LOVE it!  It shows me how I sleep at night, and it definitely shows me when I need to get up and be more active.  Also, you can add your friends, and compare steps. I am competitive so I love doing this, and trying to win with the most steps, which in turns helps me stay in better shape!  I got one, and I got my husband one as well!
review_title: I was trying to get in better shape, so I bought a fitbit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this fitbit flex on July 20th of this year. At first it worked great. Then as of last week it won't keep a charge for even a day. The band already ripped too. I'm very disappointed. Now I find out it can't be returned after August 24. What do I do now?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is the 3rd one that I have hand and I have to say that it is really a pain in the *** to use. Specifically with charging it. It seems like it will last for maybe 3-4 months and then I start having charging issues. It is either the device or the charging holder, I am really not sure, but it seems like the company could design a better way to charge this device. I am just about done with it and would not buy another one. I am looking for a better option.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really liked the Fitbit at first...I was able to track my daily and sleep activities.  Tracking my daily activity motivated me to exercise more, so I was really enjoying the product...Until it completely stopped working.  After only one month.  For $100, one would think the product would last a year, or more...I was hoping to return the Fitbit for a new one, but missed the "return window" by 4 days.  :-(Bottom Line:  Great concept...but I would recommend finding another product with better reliability...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Technology isn't really there yet (not for FitBit, not for Nike Fuel, not for Jawbone… not for any of them). But… if it gets me thinking about what I eat, how much I sleep, and how often I exercise, then… there's value. The app was recently improved, so… hopefully that will also make a difference.Logging all your food, activities other than walking, and such… it gets be a serious chore.
review_title: Nice, but a bit of a chore to log all your stuff

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love this thing. I was having some bad nights and waking up tired. using the fitbit tells me what my night was like so there is no question on why I need to take a nap during the day. its great for keeping track of everything including my glucose. The only thing I have a problem with is the basicly 50 bucks a year for premium. I dont think it does enough for that type of cost. I give this a 5 because the unit is worth it,  but not the premium from the company.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit is pretty good but it has some issues in my view.  One of the issues I have is putting on the band.  I find it hard to put on and clipping it is difficult, I wish they do something about the design.  As far as the software, it is good.  The one thing I am not too thrilled with is that you have to set it up before you go to bed so that it tracks your sleep, and I sometimes forget to do it or I do it and then forget to turn it on the next day.  I used to have a Jawbone before, and that one did it automatically.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I absolutely love this thing (unless you're referring to my discovering how poorly I sleep haha). The battery lasts almost exactly 7 days for me with one daily silent alarm and periodic goal checks to taunt my wife. I do not have background sync active because I don't see any benefit from it that would outweigh the hit to the life of the Fitbit or my phone. I got one for my wife since she's on her feet all day (preschool teacher) and  definitely considering making this my go-to Christmas gift.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my fit bit. It gets me moving when I normally wouldn't. I find myself taking extra steps just because I'm wearing it, taking the long way. The best part is the challenges you can do with people you know, it just gives you that little extra motivation to walk a little more. Shipping was fast it arrived in good shape. I recommend this product and have actually bought two more for my daughters.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my FitBit! Tracks my steps, my sleep and easy interface for water and food tracking. Simple way to be mindful of my movement.  I would advice buying a after market strap band with a latch. I lost my first Fitbit when it fell off in a movie theater. I ordered this one to replace it -along with a strap with latch.
review_title: Mindful of my movement, sleep and food & H2O

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: An awesome accessory. Love how it tracks my sleep too. I set it on the sensitive setting to really see when I'm restless or awake. especially since I lay away for a while reading before I fall asleep. It's sensitive enough that even as still as I am while reading it knows i'm not asleep. The pedometer seems pretty accurate and the online dashboard is handy for recording all sorts of information. Like mood, eating, drinking movement, etc
review_title: An awesome accessory. Love how it tracks my sleep too

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love this fitbit flex band.works very well.gives me all the information I need on my work out and sleep.easy to program,easy to charge and charge lasts almost a week.I got one for my wife also.,and she uses it all the time.A good product to maintain your health and well being.
review_title: I love fitbit flex is a good product to maintain your health.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got this to keep track of my steps during the day. I think it is very helpful to keep me on track. When I only have a couple hundred steps to go to make my goal, I feel guilty if I don't complete it.  I do use the sleep function. A couple of taps when I go to bed and a couple of taps when I wake up. It gives me an idea of how I'm doing during the day and night. Is it perfect?  Nope, but close enough for me.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fitbit has decided that I need to learn another language.  This is interesting, as I would like to learn another language.  I would like to be able to select that language, however.  After online chats with people who do not appear to speak English, emails in several languages and repeated suggestions for me to click on a box that does not function (to change the language to English), I have decided to learn the language Fitbit has chosen for me at least well enough to figure out the number of steps I have taken daily.  Seriously, for the money, the thing should let you pick the language you would like to work in, regardless of your location.  Very poor design and craptastic customer service.  The language function is grayed out, cannot be selected - please Fitbit, stop telling me to click here and just fix your lousy program.  Alles klar?
review_title: as I would like to learn another language

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this Fitbit Flex in May 2013. I had to wait a month for delivery because I was a late comer to this item.As my title says it is a great motivator for working out and eating healthy. I synced it to my phone and track my progress all day long. I downloaded the MyFitnessPal app and it syncs with the Fitbit app. The combination of the two apps is a great snapshot of your fitness/eating progress. The sleep tracking is also pretty good. On the phone app it will say 15X awakened but when you look at your fitbit snapshot online it will break it down to 2X awakened and 13X restless. The silent alarm function is also very good.I comapred the step counter to another one I have a Virgin Healthmiles Gozone. I have the GoZone in my pocket and the Fitbit on the wrist. The Fitbit registered about 1000 more steps. The Fitbit is comfortable to wear. I personally wear it on my non dominant arm.Okay, now to the reason I only gave it 4 stars. My wrist strap ripped after 2.5 weeks of use. I wore it everyday and only took it off to wipe the water out of the Fitbit holder. It ripped at the clear plastic and rubber junction. The second reason is sleep mode. The Fitbit can be very temperamental going into sleep mode. There are some nights that I have to constantly tap to put it in sleep mode. Then there are times when it goes into sleep mode quite easily. One instance I can remember was when I clapped at a choir performance and it vibrated and went into sleep mode just from clapping. It happened three times during that concert. The third reason is sometimes the Fitbit app sometimes will not update. As I write this review I updated the Fitbit app on my phone and it just gives me the updating symbol. If I restart the phone it usually fixes it.All in all this is a great product. I liked it so much that I purchased a second one for my girlfriend. She loves it too.
review_title: Encourages working out and eating better.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: We bought this as a gift for my mom. I have one too and love it. It monitors your steps (as long as you are holding your arm still). The ap is helpful and we love that we can "challenge" each other!I bought a different bracelet because my kids kept getting snagged and would rip it off my wrist. Now I have a clasp that keeps my fit bit from getting lost.
review_title: I have one too and love it. It monitors your steps (as long as ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had the fitbit for almost 4 months and now it has been 2 days since it is not counting my steps anymore and also not syncing .I tried everything and it's just not working,. This my second fitbit and I am extremely disappointed , specially because the first one broke after a few months as well.I would like my money back this time.
review_title: I want my money back please

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This little device has really encouraged me to be aware of my exercise through step count, sleep hours and to track what I eat through my phone...I take mine off when I shower or bathe and I like to wear mine loose on my wrist...especially when it is hot..  The main problem is the latch devise...it is hard to get on by yourself...I would like that to be different.  Some days it is doable but other times it seems impossible to get  latched.
review_title: I think it helps me be aware of my health...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: i am so disappointed.  i can't say there is anything wrong with my fitbit.....but, i was expecting something totally different.i read the description and never understood that this particular model only flashes lights when you reach your goals.i was expecting the one the tracked (AND SHOWED) the number of steps, heartbeat, etc.  can't say this is fitbits fault......buti don't think it was totally clear in the description.  feel like i REALLY wasted my money.
review_title: wasn't what i thought it was

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I just received this today. It comes with absolutely no instructions. The instructions on the website are confusing and you can't contact anyone. I walked around my house for 15 minutes and it said I took 18 steps. I don't feel it is accurate and I don't like that I just can't look at it at any time and see how many steps I've taken. I think this was a bad purchase for me. I'm very disappointed.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It motivates me to stay much more active. I don't think it's that accurate, though. My husband and I walk together sometimes. He is eleven inches taller, so my Fitbit should record slightly more steps since I'm keeping up with him. Mine always shows a thousand or so less. So either his is off or mine is. Maybe both. Still, a decent product for the price.
review_title: It motivates me to stay active.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The band isn't the quality it used to be. My husband and I both had a flex when it first came out and we did races and comps and extreme sports with it. We ordered this for our daughter and she barely wears it because it doesn't stay on and the clasp is not clasping. I have ordered replacement clasp and the sleeve and it still isn't worth the effort. So disappointed!
review_title: Quality has decreased since they first came out

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the fitbit flex - had one for two years but it "died"  so I ordered another one of the same kind - however, this one has just died as well.  There is a great guarantee so I will be able to get it replaced.  I'm sure it was just a fluke that the new one died so soon.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I honestly should have read up on this before buying it ( I got teal and my mother got navy ) when I got it in the mail, I was excited but it took me awhile to figure out its all mostly on the computer. I was really hoping to just use my iPad. The first day I wore it, I was upset that the tracker runs on gps, I walk/run on a treadmill so even though I was moving, it never sensed anything. But in the end, it became content with it, sense it still shows how may steps i took, how many hours, and cal. I burned. Pretty awesome gadget!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: hey, if you wonder if this will fit your larger sized wrist, quit wondering.  The large band that comes with this is large enough to very comfortably fit my 8 in wrist, with room to spare.  I would give 5 stars, the only thing I don't like is that the steps aren't as accurate as i'd like. If I'm walking slowly with hands on the shopping cart (due to pain, I use the cart to lean on sometimes) my steps are not counted.
review_title: The large band that comes with this is large enough to very comfortably fit my 8 in wrist

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had a lot of fun with my Fitbit for about 5 months. It was a very helpful training tool to become acquainted with daily steps, and realize I'm not getting enough physical activity with my daily routine. It was fun to see the stats on my phone. It is frustrating that it counts walking as more steps than running (if you run 3 miles, you'll get less steps than walking 3 miles). When all is said and done, it was just an expensive pedometer.
review_title: I had a lot of fun with my Fitbit for about 5 months

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
