review_body: I love my Flex but it is close to impossible to put on.  I have to slide something rigid under the band in order to press down on the latch so it snaps.  The directions for pressing between thumb and finger does not work.  Also - I'm having trouble navigating the website to find details about my calorie intake.  My Fitness Pal allows more calories than FitBit....but overall it's a great tool for tracking daily activity.
review_title: I love my Flex but it is close to impossible to ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Was perfect! Definitely already helping me to become more active. Does all the basics, tracks steps, activity monitor, and sleep. Allows you to record your food and water intake and set a weight loss goal and helps you stay within your calories in order to achieve weight loss in a certain time period.
review_title: Was perfect! Definitely already helping me to become more active

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this and wore it faithfully  - loved it and within 7 months it no longer works.  The original band did not last 4 months - but I was ok with that, bought another one.  I would have been happy buying a new band every couple of months but to have to pay another $100 for a new insert is ridiculous.  Wish I knew it had such a short life expectancy!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Easy to set up and keeps me motivated. It's easy to sit in front of the tv at night but when I see that my friends are just a few thousand steps ahead, it certainly motivates me to get off my butt and get moving. I had to turn off the auto sync though because it was killing my phone and fitbit batteries in less than a day. Worth every penny and much less bulky than the others (my reason for choosing the more basic flex).
review_title: Great motivator and not bulky like other models

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: without visible feedback on your wrist and clumsy connection to power and computer.  it makes it difficult to use consistently.  Didn't even last a month.  Now they have all new products, but they look like they have the same issues.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit! I have been using it for a couple of weeks now and find very little wrong with it. I had gotten it so that I could figure out why I would plateau after only a few pounds lost. Within one day, I had figured out the issue, adjusted my diet and exercise while continuing to hone the skills needed for weight loss.And it's working too! Since I've gotten the Fitbit, I've lost nearly 4 pounds and I couldn't be happier!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I loved it until it broke, under 3 months of buying it.  The band cracked and broke so the battery could not be inserted into it and at the same time when I went to charge the battery, the battery itself no longer functions or takes a charge.  I never wore it in the shower or bath, took good care and found the step and sleep tracking helpful.  There is no support on the fitbit site, only a community forum which seems like passing the buck.  No response from them to my e-mail and no way to handle or fix this from the fitbit company, and amazon has washed its hands of this too, as it is over the 30 day return period, so I'm stuck. I enjoyed being able to track my daily movement and sleep, wish there was a fix for this, I think it should be replaced.
review_title: I loved it until it broke

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was really looking forward to wearing this device and it keeping me motivated.  But all is causes is frustration!  I've had it for 60 days and what I've experienced is:  even on non-dominant wrist, if you gesture with your hands while talking it will count all of those as steps producing highly inaccurate data; if you wear it while pushing a stroller, it doesn't count the steps at all;  today I walked three miles on my treadmill and for some reason it didn't count any of the activity at all, even though the battery says it is fully charged.  I'm really disappointed and sorry that I bought this at all.  If I could return it, I would.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex works exactly as expected.  My issue with it is the clasp.  I've lost 2 because of it coming off of my arm and not noticing until it was too late.  It sucks, because I like tracking my activity.  I'm not buying another one.  I hope it's somewhere in my home, but I've walked around trying to sync with my phone, with no luck.  If I buy another wristband like this one, I'll make sure the clasp is secure.  I get so used to having it on that I don't notice that it isn't there.
review_title: Enjoyed it until I lost it (TWICE)!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was a good Fitbit. Of course I have upgraded since making this purchase but it did the job

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the Fitbit flex the only thing that I needed to get use to was the band they give you to put the Bit into. Very hard to press together while new.  Other than that..it's just what I thought it would be.  Be careful to always fasten this band correctly as it's can be deceiving and you think it's on but it's really not.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is device is amazing. I love the way the app works and I love how it track not only steps, but miles, active minutes, and sleep. I wish the sleep tracker worked 100%. There have been a few times when I remember waking up and getting up and checking the time only to find that the sleep tracker said I slept the whole time and didn't wake up during that time period. All in all though, it does work very well.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is a great product! Works just as expected and is a lot of fun. Everything works well and the shipping was fast. I bought myself one and then bought my mom one a week later for Mother's Day, she also loves it! We both got the black wristbands and ordered the 15 pack of colorful wristbands on Amazon and they are a fun colorful way to match your outfit, or to add a little color! I have and will continue to recommend this Fitbit to all my friends and family!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have an fitbit ultra and used it for over a year.  I beat it up pretty well and was frequently losing it. I like the flex because it stays put on my wrist. I have worn both at the same time and the steps were fairly comparable.  My first flex started losing its charge really quickly. The fitbit folks sent me another one without any hassle and rapidly.  It is not perfect and perhaps not accurate enough for sticklers; but it helps me and I love it.  I have not lost it once either.
review_title: I like it better than the ultra.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Ever since I got my fitbit I make it a point to walk more (and more). With my daily routine I usually walked about 7-8k steps. With fitbit, I want to walk that extra 2000 steps (approx 15-20 mins) to get a BUZZ (ftbit way of saying that I did a good job). I also do the challenges with a few friends, its a lot of fun cheering and sometimes taunting your friends. Highly recommend this!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Mine didn't work properly.  It always went to sleep mode for no reason whatsoever, so you couldn't count your steps at that point.  Had to return it; hated to spend more money, but did and got the apple watch.  The shipping was fast and the return was easy to do.  I assume I just got a bad egg with my Flex.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the Fitbit Flex to help motive me and to record my progress with some expectation of accuracy. It is not accurate when you log near 200 steps within 10 minutes and the entire time you were sitting at your desk. You can set Fitbit Flex for your dominate or non-dominate arm and it makes little difference. Turn a page while reading a book, talk on the phone and make a gesture, or drive in your car- Fitbit Flex log these activities as steps. Lastly- It is near impossible to snap the fasteners when putting the device on your arm without your fingers going numb trying to press the snaps in the holes on the wristband. You are better off buying a pedometer that you attach to your waist for more accurate leg movement.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Can't believe how this thing can motivate you to meet your goals.  Makes you obsessed with reaching the 10,000 steps per day and your active minutes too.  The only problem I seem to have is getting the sleep log to work correctly.  Found it easier to just log it in with my phone app through dashboard.  Interesting to see how restful/restless my night of sleep was.  Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to improve their health & keep track of daily activities/calories/sleep.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I loved my Fit bit, til 4 weeks later the product stopped working. Stopped charging stopped turning on. I regret buying it from Amazon since they don't stand behind any kind of warranty. There answer was that I was outside of my 30 day return policy and that they would make an exception for me this ONE time. I would understand a 30 day return policy if I didn't like the product but, it STOPPED WORKING COMPLETELY! I will never buy electronics from amazon again!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: When I first received my Fitbit Flex, I loved it.  I loved that you could not only track your steps, but your food and water intake, and it's pretty cool looking.  However, the battery life is nothing like advertised.  The fitbit is supposed to last 3-5 days before needing to be recharged.  My fitbit needs recharged once per day, sometimes twice.  It makes putting it on and dealing with it more of a hassle than anything.  It could be there is something wrong with it, but I doubt returns/exchanges will be honored.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was nervous that the rubber would constantly fidgeting with the wristband but I don't even notice it.  It synched quickly with my iPhone and is now tracking metrics.  Only downside (and this is my fault, so they keep all 5 stars) is that it DOES NOT monitor/track your pulse.It only "... tracks steps, distance, and calories burned and shows you how you’re stacking up against your daily goals."Again, my fault.  Great product.
review_title: Awesome.  I don't even know it's there.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this as a gift for my mother. She loves it. She likes how it tracks her activity throughout the day and she and my father compete to see who has more activity.  I think it is a great way for my parents to have immediate feedback on their day to day activity and to make sure they are getting enough exercise.
review_title: I think it is a great way for my parents to have immediate feedback on ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The activity monitor field is pretty crowded now, with Jawbone, Nike and others offering activity monitors.  And I've tried only the Fitbit Flex and One.  But that said, I'm very happy with the ease of use, reliability, accuracy, software, and customer support for the Flex.  Being able to just wear it and have it do it's measurement thing, and then update (and share) your Fitbit website is a wonder.  I don't miss the bigger screen of the One because my iPhone provides a BlueTooth link to the Flex, giving current and earlier days' stats.  Everything seems to "just work".  I took the Flex recently on a hiking trip to France, and after being apparently confused for about 1 day with the 8 hour time change, the Flex eventually sorted itself out.  I changed the timezone immediately after arriving in France.  The BlueTooth and "dongle" connections "just work", it seems to me.  I miss the barometric floor counter feature of the FItbit One, but gaining shower water resistance is a good tradeoff.  I recommended Fitbits to both my grown kids and my brother, and we've now all become somewhat competitive about our daily stats ... just as I had hoped.  It's a good product with good support, in my opinion.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I ordered the Fitbit Flex from Amazon a few months ago.  After only a couple uses, I began to have trouble charging it.  I have been unable make a good secure connection.  Now it is totally dead and there is nothing I can do to make it charge.  I tried putting the end of a staple into the small hole to reset it, but that didn't work either.  I have noticed other people have had this same problem and it doesn't seem to me that Fitbit cares to set things right with their customers.  This should last longer than 3 months!  How about some customer service?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This little band around the wrist somehow compels me to walk - maybe not miles at a time, but around the block when I have ten minutes to kill, which certainly happens several times a day.  I haven't made the 10,000 steps yet, but I have increased my stepping from around 3,000 on an inert day to an average of around 7,000 daily.  And in a month, without changing my diet, I 'm two pounds lighter.But I lost it.  I don't know what happened, but after wearing it for 3 or 4 straight days, it fell off my wrist.  I think I know where it happened, a restaurant, but nobody there found it.  So I wrote to the company to let them know that the clasp wasn't as secure as everybody says - and they sent me a new Flex.  I'm going to play with adding a piece of tape to fasten the band a bit more safely - and/or just pay greater attention to it.  I must say, you don't really feel it on your wrist.  I now think I cannot live without this.I would love to see a jewelry designer go at it and create something more attractive, not that it's ugly, but it's not very dressy.  I could imagine some sort of silver bangle bracelet, for example.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I wear this everywhere I go. It is great as a stay at home mom to see how many miles I walk just doing house work. It is fun to get into challenges with others. I have yet to use the alarm but I love to use sleep mode to track my sleep. I have been telling everyone to get this!
review_title: It is great as a stay at home mom to see how ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The device is ok.  Calories are way off no way I can loose weight if I eat 2500 calories a day.  Bracelets are trash.  I have had this item less than a month and am on my third bracelet/band.  I am not that active because of a medical condition and the band that came with the product has split where the device goes into the band.  The second one is one I purchased at Best Buy and is fitbit branded and the clasp broke in less than a week.  These things are pretty spendy at that rate.  The device works fine if I carry it in my pocket.  I just have to remember to take it out before the wash.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This has been great at motivating me to get moving each day. I don't feel it's always accurate in counting the steps and activity but I find that is ok as I know what I have truest done. I like the alarm features and the sleep monitoring. I suspected I wake up a lot and night and this verified it for me. I guess I should have a sleep study done! I wish it could monitor pulse and oxygen saturation. It was overall with the purchase.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: For the first 4 weeks, the FitBit worked great.  It synced up easily, tracked movement and sleep, and the battery only needed to be charged every few days.  After about 3 weeks, the battery needed to be charged every other day.  Then every day.  And now, that we passed the return day by 1 day, it won't even hold a charge for a day.  So the FitBit is great, the battery is absolute crap.  I would not recommend this product until the company fixes the battery issue.
review_title: Works Great Then Dies After Refund Date

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So there is no confusion, my 2 stars rating is because Amazon customer service is so good, the product is not.  Fitbit just quit charging after only 3 months of use, Fitbit's customer service is not helpful, they finally addressed my complaint by asking me if I tried all the things I had specifically told them I had done.  They also obviously did not read my account of the complaint because they addressed me as "Jim", my name is Linda.  Amazon replaced the Fitbit for free, although they are not obligated to do so.  If this new Fitbit also bites the dust, I will chalk it up as experience.
review_title: my 2 stars rating is because Amazon customer service is so good, the product is not

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fun way to track your activity. I wish I had waited just a little longer since they recently came out with a new one. Band is comfortable and I love that I can change the bands out and have a different color when I feel like it. Would be nice if it displayed the time, but I believe the newer version does that. This is a nice, no-frills fitness tracker. It's also cool to see your sleep patterns!
review_title: Fun way to track your activity

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm not sure of how many of these I've purchased...but they've always been good. No, they haven't been replacements, I bought them for family as gifts. Having the app and being able to compete in something daily is a lot of fun, especially if you are helping family members lose weight. Fitbits are awesome and these are top notch!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: We were so excited about this product & it worked great for about 2 months.  We bought 2 (one for my husband & myself) within 1 week of each other they stopped holding a charge.  If you put it on the charger it will show a full charge but once you place it in the wrist bands they no longer have any power.Oh & as for the wrist bands….. 3 out of the 4 that came with the product (1 small & 1 large each) came apart in less than 1 month & of course they were on backorder so we now have new bands for the Fitbits that no longer work……….Very disappointing.
review_title: Don't bother they work long enough for the "return window" to expire.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fitbit Flex addict & LOVING the lifestyle change this thing has afforded me. I was given a Surge, and it was just too bulky.. Not to mention it needs to be kept 2 to 3 finger widths above your wrist bone to be accurate.  I quickly went back to my Flex and splurged on a ton of cute accessories.  34 pounds down & counting!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this product on April 15, 2018 and less than 2 months later, it will not hold a charge for more than 12 hours. The charge should last for 3 days or so. I can’t even wear it for an entire day. Just when I think it is tracking my activity and check my status in the app, i find out it’s out of power. Waste of $60

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Ok first of all the expectations are:1)How much am I moving?2)How much uninterrupted sleep am I getting?3)When was the last time I "moved"?Keeping this as a basis for why I got the FitBit then yes it is worth the money. When I look at my stats at work (yes I sit at a desk in front of a computer) I can see what I deserve for lunch. Sometimes I'll do a 15 min walk to find a lunch spot.Every so now and then I'll take that stretch break and walk up the stairs 2 floors and across the floor then back down. you might think its not much but small changes to your normal static behavior is healthy for both body and mind.Do a double tap on the FitBit and you can see your progress for the day, thus making little games like parking your car at the far side of the parking lot more fun.If you are looking for something super pro then this is not the device for you.Even my girlfriend now asks "So how many calories was that walk?" When I say 200 or so the realization of fancy dinner plans changes to something realistic and simple.Footnote: Chasing after 2 young kids will get you to 10 000 steps in a day and 3K calories easily, who would have thought?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is an overpriced pedometer. The pros are it looks cool, dashboard feature is nice to use, alarm is a good one etc. The unit 9/10 times fail to sync with my phone, macbook air or my HP. I have to tap it to the dongle to  sync if that. I contacted fitbit support over 2-3 days ago, no response, no answer. I guess this product is good for 6 months and then $100 down the drain
review_title: The pros are it looks cool, dashboard feature is nice to use

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I enjoy the sleeping feature this offers, the soundless alarm was what attracted me to this to begin with.  I use it continually in conjunction with MyFitnessPal.  Unfortunately, my phone is not supported for this app.  I am also having slight issues with it, It can bounce to sleep mode if you hit it enough during exercise.  Also it has needed to be re-booted since it was not holding a charge and I wasted a day trying to re-charge it. I did not realize when I ordered the Flex that the Force would be coming out within several months and I am upset I couldn't by the up-grade. All in all it is OK for what it does.
review_title: I wish I had known that the Force was being released before I purchased the flex.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The flex works great, and the battery lasts 7 days at least, which is more than it says it will. My only dislike is that it doesn't show the exact steps. I thought it wouldn't bother me, but after a while it did when I couldn't tell if I had 8,001 or 9,999 steps, or something in between. The large gap of not knowing, without looking at my phone, eventually bothered me. I decided to switch it out for the Alta.
review_title: The flex works great, and the battery lasts 7 days at least

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: May be fine for others, but I found that it counted "steps" every time I moved my arm - which led to unreliable activity monitoring when I logged over 1,000 steps while just sitting at my computer moving the mouse. Very attractively made, though.
review_title: Attractive unit, but false step counting

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: After wearing my UP Band for a month, I got a Fitbit Flex to compare it to. With an app for the i -phone to go along with it, I have to say it is keeping good info and being an excellent companion to the UP Band. If I had bought the Fitbit first, I probably would have gotten the UP Band to compare it to as well. Both are performing as advertised and getting me motivated to MOVE. All in all, I'd say either is just the push one can use to get active.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was very excited to finally get my Fitbit, but unfortunately became very disappointed very fast. Once I set it up I put it on and went on with my day as normal. After a couple hours of running errands I looked down and noticed that the brand new Fitbit was no longer on my wrist. I had heard complaints before that the Flex falls off, so I had made sure that it was completely fastened on my wrist, but it still fell off! I called all of the stores and tried to located it, but unfortunately, no luck. I am now out almost $80 for two hours of use. Definitely not worth it. I can't imagine how this product would last during actual exercise if it can't even handle calm, everyday activities.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My husband has had the fit bit for almost a year and loves it.  He started a walking program in the Spring utilizing the fit bit.  He is logging about five miles per day and loves that it keeps track of his steps.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: At first I had difficulty getting the wristband to stay on my wrist. A lot of force was required to "click" the band to keep it in place. The silicone rubber seemed to get more elastic and now it is easy.I had returned a jawbone because it did not have a latch and easily came off my wrist. Almost lost it.More battery life is always desirable, and it is sometimes hard to get it to recognize sleep cycles.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was the first Fitbit that I purchased and I didn't really like it. The way that the band closed was such a pain in the butt for me and wasn't worth it for me. I returned this item so I could buy the Fitbit Charge instead which had a watch band style closure.-As a wife and as a mom of 3 kids, I spend a lot of time shopping for deals on the best products out there for my family. It's important to me that if we're spending our hard earned money that we get a top notch product in return. I often rely on the reviews and opinions of others when contemplating purchasing a new product that I haven't tried before myself. Because of that, any products that I buy (whether on Amazon or from a 3rd party) I always make sure to leave a detailed review of the product to help others when selecting items to purchase, as well. My family tests these products fully before forming a solid opinion and writing a review. When I write a review, I keep in mind that those reading are also looking for honesty about the product and want an unbiased opinion to go by. If my review has been helpful to you, please give me a "Yes" vote on my review. Thank you!
review_title: Don't like the way the band closes

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have used this for 7 months and I have found customer support helpful (I used them once early on) and it works well. I am fairly active, it has come off twice in a basketball game with a wayward swipe and once on my four wheeler.I have found this has helped me analyze my sleep more than anything. I didnt realize how much I tossed and turned (and my wife for that matter).Highly recomend, syncs to my iPhone and holds a charge for me STILL for close to 5 days most weeks. I charge at work on Monday and Fridays.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Meh. The data that it gave me and that was brought into the app was average. I saw how many steps, how many minutes active, etc. Great.Sleep tracker was annoying - I have to remember to tell the thing I'm awake in the morning? Some nights it didnt track sleep.Then it fell off one day and I lost it. There goes $100 I could have used on something else.
review_title: Data it provided was average and then I lost it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I gave the flex to my wife for Christmas , she loved it but it worked for less than a full month and now wont sync.  We tried all the many solutions they suggested to fix it and none work.  Dont buy this piece of junk.  You'll be losing a hundred dollars.  No customer service except email that doesnt work or time consuming.  Lots of bad reviews

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the Fitbit a couple of months ago.  I was so excited to get it, and for several weeks it worked great!But then the battery stopped charging and the strap broke - both too late for a refund from Amazon.I sent a letter to Fitbit's Customer Service and never heard a word.It seems I just threw a bunch of money out the window!I'm so disappointed with the product and customer service.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really like this Fitbit Flex.  It is comfortable to wear and not difficult to sync to my phone.  I learned to use the "Track My Exercise" feature to put in when I take a Spinning class to calculate my minutes and miles that I road on the bike as it does not track peddling in a seated position but does when I am standing on the bike in position 2 or 3.  There is no feature for Body Pump class so I put in "weights".  I think I exert more energy and activity than it records in this class exercise!Is it 100% accurate.  I don't think so but in learning to use it properly I am able to track my daily movements, calories burned, steps taken and 'very active' minutes.This Fitbit does not measure heart rate.  I knew that when I bought it but wish it did.
review_title: I really like this Fitbit Flex

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm about to get my THIRD FitBit in under two years- if you are serious about fitness and.  Food tracking this is not for you. Maybe one of the more expensive models would work – but this is not for you. For me to have replaced it this so often – not cool. So think a minute. You can't wear it in the shower. You can't wear it when you swim. You can't wear it when you wash the dishes. It's at best a motion detector. With software to help you track your food that is very good  but not the best. My fitness pal app tracks your food with equal commitment. I've had the misfit shine and thought it was great – you could wear and swimming – and in the shower – but I lost it quite quickly because the magnet is flimsy. The jawbone not reliable. This is my third kind of tracker  Which is why I bought the lowest and model – I think they're all basically junk – and if it's just a glorified motion detector you getting what you pay for. I don't need another watch. I don't need a bad heart rate monitor on my wrist – I need a fitness tracker. Maybe I need something the tech knowledge he can't provide yet – so maybe I do have to wait but if you're serious about fitness tracking this is not for you.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have not taken this thing off except to shower.  I love the features and the online software.  I hated all the pop-ups that showed up when I loaded the software...beware.  May have been how my lap-top is configured, but beware.  very easy to use.....the online software is easy to update compared to other online products I've used.  I also like to timer that wakes me up every morning.  very nice product.... nicely made

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought these for my wife and I. After about a week, I bought two for my parents. It works well and is excellent motivation to keep moving. I never have to take it off except to charge, so I can forget about it and just walk, run, whatever. The competition amongst friends/family keeps it interesting. I'm not sure how accurate it is compared to other bands/pedometers/reality, but in my observation it seems good and since we all use the same band its a level bar.Android support could be better but at least it's there and working. It looks like they're working on improving compatibility, and I was able to get it working on several android 4.3 devices (CM10.2, Nexus 7) that aren't specifically supported.App integration is strong and variedAll in all, we love it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is my second flex. I had my first for a year until I bought the Tori Burch silicone band which fell off within 3 hours, and I needed a new one. This one, while new, does not have the battery life of my old one and only periodically alerts me when the battery is about to die which is very frustrating. I also don't think it registers active minutes in the same way so I am wondering about consistency in calibration so overall as little disappointed. Previously was a raving fan because it was so motivating to get green smilies every day.
review_title: Motivating-but not as good as my first

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: There's no denying one's lack of commitment to healthy living when you use the Fitbit and it's accompanying smart phone app. I hate those days when I'm certain I met my goal and the report says I've fallen short :(However, by modifying the default goals you can get motivated by baby-steps of progress. I've yet to use all the features of the app (tracking my calorie intake, water intake, sleep, etc.) but like having the option to expand the use of my Fitbit.
review_title: The Device I Love to Hate

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have a lot of problems with this syncing with my droid phone.  It will work today and then not sync again for 3 days.  I have tried resetting it, uninstalling the app, tapping it and I think everything that everyone has told me to try.  Finally, my last resort was to take it off and forget about it.  That works.
review_title: Not a happy fit bit flex owner

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Loving the flex, very easy to use either on the PC or on mobile.  Pretty accurate and you can even change the sensitivity if you think it's not working like you think it is.  This is by far the best alarm I have ever had, no annoying music or blaring alarm.  Just a gentle vibration to walk me up in the morning!  Highly recommended!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It is very motivating to compare my Fitbit activity stats with those of my friends. The only thing I would change is to add a feature to calibrate distance walked with the length of my stride. Right now, as far as I know, the Fitbit just uses an average stride length to calculate how many miles you walk, but for me, it is off by 8% per mile and it claims I have walked too far, probably because my stride is a bit shorter than the average adult male's.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I  got my Fitbit just before Christmas.  I wanted it because it syncs to the Myfitness Pal app that I use.  I have had no problems with it.  I love how the two apps sync back and forth depending on where I enter the information.  I also like that the app can be used across devices.  I originally loaded the app to my I-pad mini but found that I could also use it on my phone and it would update the information on both.  I did see others complained about the clasp coming off so I decided to use the larger band and have had no problems.  I like the sleep activity feature but did I feel that it wasn't reflecting the times I felt I woke up but when I switched it to "sensitive" I think it was more accurate.  You do need to tap it several times at night to turn the sleep mode on and again in the morning it tell it you are awake but I find that no more difficult then setting my alarm each night and turning it off each morning. I also like how at the end of the week I receive an e-mail with a summary of the previous week.  Lastly, I have a Nike Plus shoes so I can monitor my walking and the flex was always very close to what the Nike Fuel said.  Many comment this is a glorified pedometer.  Is it? Maybe, but I enjoy seeing how many calories I have burned and the other items on the fitbit dashboard.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've been using my fitbit flex for 4 days now.  So far, as much as I want to be a fan of this product, I'm not impressed.Here are some of the issues I've had since using my fitbit flex: - Two of the four days, it quit tracking completely.  I couldn't get any response/no syncing, no LED lights.  I have to plug it in and remove it to get it to function properly again.  Not only that, but for the hours that it is not responsive, it doesn't not capture data, therefore useless.- I've tried the sleep mode by tapping several times on the band, and it worked, however when I woke up in the morning and took it off the sleep mode, it didn't capture any data.- I've tried to set the silent alarm twice.  It didn't go off either time.- Day 4 and my band is already splitting.In my opinion, their website troubleshooting section is not helpful, and the manual is not comprehensive of all that needs to be known for the user.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had the Flex for over 4 months. Recently I began seriously suspecting it's accuracy; like the other day, it decided I had walked over 300 steps while I was seated at dinner. Many other days I'm amazed to see I've walked the 10,000 steps they put as the goal. (By the way once you reach the 10,000 steps for the day, the flex stops counting - which in itself is pretty annoying). Recently, I decided to get the Fitbit Zip and compare its "steps" at the same time as the "flex." To start with I had to create a separate account/email for it since Fitbit can't handle more than one device per account. Today I wore both, from morning to night. Currently it shows I took 8,018 steps on my Flex and 6,650 steps on my Zip. There is absolutely NO QUESTION to me that the Flex has serious inaccuracies -- since I have watched it in real time count almost any significant hand movement (driving etc) as steps. Btw, I wear the Flex on my non-dominate hand as this was a suggestion to help with these errant movement counts. But it is still WAY off... I think there may be an inherent problem with wearing a device on your wrist that's meant to measure your steps. My Zip, which I had clipped to my waistband all day was certainly the more accurate. Shame, since the Flex is a lot of fun, the Fitbit interface is great, etc. But if Fitbit can't provide the fundamental point of their device -- ie. to measure the steps you've taken than all that other stuff seems kind of irrelevant...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really love my flex. Giving it four stars only because I feel like sometimes it does not correctly count my steps. I also had a bit of trouble with the original charger. It was not working at first.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So far, I like the device because it makes me pay attention to my food intake and activity level.  I am not so sure the steps function is very accurate.  I think it counts more steps than I have actually taken.  I bought another for my wife but she has not tried hers yet. I think as I get used to it, I may get the steps function more dialed in.  I really like the sleep and alarm function which works very well along with the food and calorie tracking.
review_title: A great tool to monitor your food and activity

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this mostly 'cause I kept dropping my pedometer. I like it, it's comfortable and with the apps I've downloaded I can track my exercise, steps, and even my sleep. I wasn't expecting anything majorly high tech, but it's the apps that are compatible with the Flex that give it more abilities. I haven't had any issues with it. Charging it isn't hard and it seems to keep a charge for several days.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had my Flex for just over a month and I love it!  It works great and I haven't had any problems with it.  I like being able to tap on the LED lights to see my progress throughout the day.  The bands fits nice and is comfortable.  The online site is easy to use and I find the dashboard very informative of my daily tasks.  I wasn't interested in the sleep tracker, but I think it works great and it's always interesting to see my sleep results in the morning.  My only dislike is how long it sometimes takes to charge the battery. I would recommend this product to anyone who is wanting a great activity band!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm very happy with my Fitbit Flex. I've linked mine with my accounts at My Fitness Pal and Walgreen's Balance Rewards, so it automatically logs everything for me. I like that it tracks my steps, calories, and sleep - and I don't mind having to manually put it into sleep mode. I specifically chose this model because I wanted an activity tracker with a thin band, so it suits my needs perfectly.
review_title: Great little activity tracker for steps, calories, & sleep!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've been wearing it every day for the past week. I love seeing where I'm at and encourages me to walk more. Love seeing my average time asleep as well as how many times I am restless. Has helped make me realize I need to go to sleep earlier to ensure a good nights rest.
review_title: I love seeing where I'm at and encourages me to walk ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Worked great for a year or two and then charger wouldn't work.  Charged with computer and then the strap broke.  Got a new strap and now I can't find the fitbit - LOL!
review_title: Worked great for a year or two and then charger wouldn't ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My wife bought this for me as a gift.  I've been wearing it consistently for a month, trying to get the hang of it.  It doesn't appear to be all that accurate, but could still function as a general reminder for getting exercise.  I'm really interested in having it keep track of my sleeping habits but it has been difficult to get to work.One thing I like a lot is that I can leave this on my wrist, never taking it off for showers or anything. I do take it off to charge it every four or five days. Not having to deal with it a lot works for me.Now however, after only a month of use, the band broke at the hinge.  It appears it is glued at this joint, and for some reason this failed.  Is it because I wear it in the shower?  The instructions say you can.  Fitbit says,"It is not a common problem due to it was tested to last for long time."  I don't know.  I do know that my last day to return it to Amazon was yesterday (!) and Fitbit's 45 day return for refund policy only applies if you buy directly from Fitbit.  Fitbit says, "At this point we will be happy to provide you with a complimentary replacement."  I wonder if I will have the same problem with the replacement band.  It does seem to be a weak spot.
review_title: The band broke and the 45 day return policy only applies if purchased directly from Fitbit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased a Fitbit Flex in late January 2015. It stopped working and would not charge in April 2015. I contacted the manufacturer to honor the one year warranty. They refused since I purchased it through Amazon. Amazon graciously agreed to let me return it for a refund through them, even though their return window had expired. I did not want a replacement, since Fitbit would not stand behind their product, and I have heard several people say they have had issues with defective Fitbit products. The Fitbit is an awesome idea, but who wants it it if the product quality is poor and the manufacturer won't honor their warranty? Thank you, Amazon!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was extremely disappointed when 10 days after getting my Fitbit the band on it broke. For $95 I would expect something a little more durable. I like the product and the app and the information it shows but the cheap, crappy band is a joke. I took good care of it and it fell apart right above where the dots show your daily progress. I gave this product 3 stars because the info is good. I almost gave it 1 star because a $95 anything should not break 10 days after you get it. Disappointed.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: There was some trouble syncing the fitbit and after many tech support sessions with that company it was decided that it was a defective unit.  I would have returned it (ordered a different unit from Fitbit) but......the wrist band is cheesy and opens and falls off easily and it fell off and got lost before I could.  i still plan to get the clip on style, had one before and it worked really well, but the wrist unit really stinks.
review_title: the wrist band is cheesy and opens and falls off easily and it fell off and got lost before I ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love it so much!!! It's been months and i still use it everyday. Life changer! Get a replacement band though, one with a watch buckle because mine kept falling off. I wear it in the shower everyday and I have had no problem.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm totally in love!!! I LOVE my Fitbit!! I love that it tracks my steps and active minutes. I was unexpectedly surprised that it tracks your sleep and how many times and how long you were restless during the night too! I just love this little thing. It's super easy to wear and I love the bright pink color!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Shortly after purchasing my Flex in March 2015, the Flex battery died without warning. I should have received a low battery warning via my Fitbit app and email, but this didn't occur. After it happened multiple times, I contacted Fitbit and they shipped me a replacement. I'm now on my third replacement Flex and am having the same issues. I don't think I have bad luck; instead I think they have some major quality control issues. I had the Fitbit One for a year without issue (but lost it off my waistband). Fitbit customer service has been easy to work with but I think I'll make the switch back to the One.I also agree with other reviewers that the accuracy feels off. When I push a stroller many steps are lost because there isn't enough wrist movement. This is another reason to go with the One since it's on your torso.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Extremely disappointed! My fitbit flex purchased through Amazon in early August 2014 is no longer working. Fitbit customer support has been worthless. This device is wonderful.....when it works. But, the initial problem I had was in getting the device to charge. The battery life is very short. Last night I fully charged the battery....but, this morning it would not track steps. It said it synced.....but it did not include steps or active minutes or distance. I reset the device as instructed on the web site but it did no good. I say again....customer support is a joke.
review_title: Great when it works.....but, that is mot for long!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: When buying Fitbit Flex, make sure your electronic device is compatible with synchronizing to your wristband (there is a list online of capable devices  [...]; generally mainstream devices like iPod and Galaxy etc. Setup will prompt you to create an online profile to keep track of your details on your computer (one-time action). And everything will work normal, but for live tracking while on-the-go, make sure your portable device can sync. If not, it will all work just fine because all the exercise information will remain stored onto wristband then will automatically upload to servers when you are 20 feet within range of internet source.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was really conflicted between the Fitbit Flex and the Jawbone Up but after researching and reading reviews, I decided to let the price be the overall breaker. Although it lacked directions, it was pretty easy to set up on my laptop and iPhone 4S. I love it and glad that I have purchased it. It has allowed me to understand my sleeping patterns (lack of it), eating habits (needs improvement) and  overall activity level. In addition, I have a few co-workers that have it as well and we use it to compete with each other regarding the number of steps. Finally, I have connected it to MyFitnessPal which really brings everything together. :) No more cheating...the data doesn't lie.If you are torn between the two like I did, you can't go wrong with either one....just choose what's best for you!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It was okay I Just thought that the band would share more info but instead you have to go to your App.  I definitely prefer the Charge HR over the fitbit flex because the amount of info you can see right on the watch. For someone who is just trying to make their goal and doesn't care about calories burned or actual steps you have gone this would be perfect.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this for my husband and I have one for myself. One of the biggest drawbacks I noted prior to buying this was that the clasp can come loose (according to online reviews). Sure enough, my husband lost his after owning it for about 3 months. The clasp is not secure. I've had mine fall off too but I found it before I left the area. My husband did like his though.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Not really thrilled with this device.  I lost it in my yard because the clasp made the wrist band pop off.  I had to download an app for $4.99 to find it and it did work.  Thanks for that.  The band is really hard to hook. Today after owning the Fitbit Flex for about three weeks it stopped syncing to the dongle and I had to uninstall and reinstall the software and then it did begin to work.  I am at the point that if anything else happens to this Flex then I will return it;.  It is really not worth the price.  You can get a cheap pedometer and a free calorie counter app that will do what this does and maybe better and is more reliableIn both upsetting  episodes I emailed the company did not get any one on one help.  They just texted my what was already on their website.
review_title: Sorry but its not that great

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought a Fitbit flex and loved it. Gave it to a friend and bought the Fitbit charge. I gave the fitbit charge to the friend and took the fitbit flex back. I like the fact that I can shower in it. I love the fact that it is simple and I can change bands to different colors. I m not into running a marathon. Just want to walk a little more and this is all you need.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I did a lot of research before I purchased this. However it did not live up to the hype.I could never get it to read my steps accurately, it was either too big or too small. Customer service could not help me and I gave up after I developed a rash. They finally agreed to refund my money after I told them I would post a negative review on Amazon. Therefore I am giving them 3 stars because they wound up helping me in the end.
review_title: Never read steps accurately, developed rash.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fit bit. I tried some of the cheaper ones but now have to return them since they don't even work. Save yourself the trouble and buy this instead. It's so fun and really encourages me to get out and walk, especially when I've only got a couple thousand steps left for the day. And definitely gives me and my two daughters some healthy competition. One of the best purchases I've ever made!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Disappointed. I have had mine for ~6 months now, and it won't respond to tapping (to see the lights for progress).  The Fitbit application on iOS also had issues, most notably with calorie tracking in/out; I actually gained a few pounds before I realized it wasn't working properly.  Fitbit issued a patch that was supposed to fix the issue, but I had already moved on to MyFitnessPal's food and exercise tracker.  The band is difficult to snap close and is unattractive (for women).  Getting something prettier costs a LOT more money as available band options are slim.  Lots of hype over this device, but I think that the same goals can be accomplished for less money and less frustration elsewhere.
review_title: Disappointed. I have had mine for ~6 months now

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this for my wife for her birthday. It's a neat gadget, it keeps track of lots of daily activities including sleep habits (which she especially liked since she has trouble sleeping). Works as advertised, slightly overpriced in my opinion (not just Amazon, but in general everywhere) but it will likely get cheaper once its around longer.
review_title: Works as advertised, keeps track of many things.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Not what I expected. Unless you have a smart phone to lug around, this is not a good way to track exercise. Also, when you go to the Web to enable it, you get a new Web Browser which takes over your search engines and is loaded with pure garbage content. I had to do a system restore to get rid of all the unwelcome crap!
review_title: Unless you have a smart phone to lug around

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The flex needs some improvements.1. BIG need - improve the durability of the band. Because of the way the band naturally folds around the wrist and how one must extract the battery unit for recharging - caused the wrist band to separate from the hard black plastic strip that has your LED readout. $99 wasted for 2 months because it eventually just fell off my wrist and I could not find it after that. Be careful if it begins to separate so you don't end up without one like I did.2. If you let the battery die, it will not save your past activities so you can lose about 5 days worth of walking around.
review_title: Not up to par after 2 months of use

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It does the job and Fitbit changed the sleep monitor so all you have to do is sleep!  I one negative is that is model needs charging and I haven't gotten into the habit of charging it regularly.  But if you have an online account, it sends you an alert to tell you the device needs charging.  I think I prefer a battery.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I didn't like that I was not able to quickly look at the band to see how I am progressing. It wasn't very motivating when I could not quickly see how I was doing for the day. Another thing I did not like was that it does not track stairs flights climbed. The sleeping tracker did not seem to track my sleep when doubble tapping so I had to enter my sleep time online. I felt like I took a few steps back from my previous fitbit ultra tracker.
review_title: Didn't care for it at all

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for my girlfriend as a gift because she was wanting to get into exercising more and boy did this help. The ability to track calories and steps taken is amazing especially when you can view it all from your smart phone. The sleep activity is also a sweet function with the graph on how you slept and movement.Great for if you need motivation or just wanting to know how many steps you do take in a day!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I liked the idea of the fitbit, I guess I didn't do enough research. This one doesn't have a display on the band. You have to go into your email to see your results. I also didn't like the clasp. I had a hard time closing it. really frustrating. I am still going to get one, just need to research more.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The bracelet is very difficult to get snapped.  I read in the instructions that I could carry it in my pocket for more accuracy and did so, losing it in the process.  My fault, for sure.  If you are going to carry one in your pocket leave it in the bracelet.  My take on it is, it is a gimick, a gadget.  If you want to exercise more, just keep a total of your time on your watch.
review_title: Another gadget which you will soon tire of.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: If I could give it zero I would. Folks - this absolutely does NOT work. And if you don't have anything to compare it to, or you are a novice at step counting, this will do *more harm than good* giving you the impression you're hitting your 10,000 steps/day goal. I am shocked and disappointed at the high marks this thing is getting.I'm an avid walker and I have tested a number of pedometers. I also **calibrate** mine by walking a 1/4 mile track. I am very familiar with steps and how many it takes to walk 1 mile - about 2000. So 10,000 means you've walked 5 miles.The first day I wore this, I put it on, jumped in my car, drove for *3 hours*, 2 short pits stops, got to my first destination and walked at most 1/4 mile, back in my car, to the hotel, walked up to the room and whammo!! congrats on your 10,000 steps. Walking as fast as I can, which is about 15 minute mile, I have to walk 1 hour and 15 minutes to walk 5 miles. I walked no more than 30 minutes that day. There was no way this could be right. The next day, same thing. It recorded 10,000 steps when I knew clearly I had not walked 5 miles that day. The third day, I got back in the car and drove home and same thing - recorded 10,000 steps when I knew I hadn't gone anywhere near that far.So then I tested the FitBit against my calibrated device. As soon as the FitBit rewarded me for going 10,000 steps, my real device had me at 2,500. Not even close.I cannot recommend this. And I caution anyone else who is serious about getting in their 10,000 - purchase a device that sits on your waist. Calibrate it at your local high school track. Don't waste your money on this scam.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Fitbits are great. No, I'm not some diehard exercise fiend. What I am is someone who likes making sure I'm active throughout the day, and this is a great way to keep track of that.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex is really neat when you first get it. You think that it will be the only tool you need to get healthy and lose weight. But then you realize that it is just a $100 pedometer. Sure it syncs to your phone and you get some neat statistics about your day, but unless that data is somehow critical to your weight loss program, you'd do just as well with a more affordable pedometer and a free online calorie counter.
review_title: Helpful gadget, but is it necessary?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am very disappointed in this purchase.  By chance one day I discovered that my Fitbit was not counting all my steps.  So I did several tests, counting my steps and checking my Fitbit. I walked 100, 300 & 500 steps, each multiple times, and found that I was being shorted on the Fitbit 30-40% consistently. If you purchase this, I suggest you check its accuracy. Internet research showed that others have had this same problem.  On the positive side, it is a great motivator to keep you moving. I need to have confidence in my tracker, though, and I don't in this one.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for my mom and she loves it so much I bought one for myself about a month later. I love that you can track food with the app so you can know how many calories you are eating/burning in a day. I will be upgrading to the Charge HR soon, but still love the Flex! It's a great starter fitbit or for someone who only would like to track steps/day.
review_title: I love that you can track food with the app so ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Used to love this item, more simple than others and all I need.  Ordered new one that arrived a few weeks ago and the new Fitbit Flex will not keep a charge for longer than 18-20 hours, instead of the 3-4 days they advertise and from what I experienced in the past.  Placed a call to Fitbit several days ago and have not heard a word back from them.  Very disappointed.
review_title: New Fitbit Flex arrived and was not working.  No word back from the manufacturer days after contacting them.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had mine for about 3 months now. I don't think it's amazing technologically and hardly track my steps or activity on it (not sure how accurate it is) BUT what I do like is the look of it and the psychological bit of having it on my wrist. You see it constantly and people always ask you about it which is subconsciously building this awareness of being an active person. For example, I definitely think that because of the fitbit I always take the stairs out of the subway. I probably wouldn't upgrade to the Force but I wouldn't return mine either.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I received the fitbit today and tried for two hours to set it up.  Two separate devices could not detect it.  Called fit bit support and they tried having me reset it, connect it to a computer, restart devices.  Finally determined it was defective.  I don't need something that doesn't work right out of the box.  They have lost my business.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got it after I accidentally drove over my zip. Love the product. Wish it had a real display on it and would count floors, but that's just something to look forward to in the next model!Sleep-tracking is great and really pushed me to start watching my sleeping habits (or lack there of).Charges quickly (I usually just do it while checking email) and maintains a charge for about a week unless you're constantly syncing it with your phone... Then it lasts about 2 days.No problems wearing it in the shower or during bad weather.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Mainly got this as all more and more of my co-workers / friends have them.  It's turned into a competitive game between everyone on how far / how many steps you can get in a day.  Having the tracking ability and phone app to see your daily status is fun to play with.  So far so good; haven't had problems with it other than forgetting to put it on in the morning a few times.
review_title: Having the tracking ability and phone app to see your daily status is fun to play with

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit! I like how it keeps track of my hours of sleep and that I was able to link my steps and active minutes to MyFitnessPal account. Fitbit helps me stay motivated to reach my 10,000 daily step goal and it helps in my weight loss goals! I have lost fifteen pounds and only have nine more to go. ;)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the action of the Fitbit where it counts my steps in my calories and my miles in my active minutes unfortunately it goes into sleep mode all the time if you are pushing a grocery cart you can be sure it's going to go into sleep mode the vibration is too much for the Fitbit therefore often times its not tracking anything this happens pretty much on a daily basis very frustrating wish I had never bought it
review_title: goes into sleep mode to easily

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I owned a Fitbit Force and loved it, but wasn't comfortable using it after it was recalled.  I used to use the Fitbit One, but had problems remembering to put it back on after changing out of my work clothes and into my bike clothes.  I lost myFitbit One after biking one day and decided to replace it with the Fitbit Force because I could wear it on my wrist.  I like using Fitbit and didn't want to have to change any of the software I currently use, so I bought the Flex to replace the Force I was using.  I find the Flex to be as easy to use as the Fitbit One, and I like the fact that it stays on my wrist.  The only negative issue I have with it is that I can't look at it and see my step count.  I can use an android app to view my step total, but I don't use my cell phone while at work and usually have to wait until after work to see where I'm at in terms of reaching my goal.  The lights help, but I'd rather see numbers.  I will replace this as soon as they come out with a replacement for the fitbit force, but I will keep this one to use as a backup device.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was so excited when I first received my Fitbit and used it for about a week . .I purchased one for my husband!  Well, within the next 8 days - mine stopped working,  It just wouldn't charge despite me charging at the office in a desktop USB port, cleaning with a toothpick, following the troubleshooting.  I sent it back to Amazon and I should be receiving my replacement tomorrow.  Now,,my husband's stopped working . . won't hold a charge and won't sync!  Unbelievable!  As a result - I am sending his back - and won't even be opening up my second Fitbit - I am just sending it back!  I think this technology needs to be worked on a bit (no pun intended) before folks shell out some good money for these!
review_title: Sent two back within a month!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had my fitbit for a year now and I absolutely love it.  It really makes you pay attention to how much moving around you do.  I bought this for my 8 year old granddaughter.  She loves watching me do the competitions and she pushes me to get more steps.  I average 25K steps a day.  It's hard to catch me sitting down!
