I would recomend this to anyone needing that extra push to get into the gym and better there self
review_title: this product is a great motivator. when you are trying to get in ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am very disappointed that after only a few months the charger has a difficult time connecting.  It acts like there is a short it in and I have to place it just right for it to charge.  Also, the rubber on the band is coming apart.  Since the first one came apart so quickly, I have not switched to the second band yet as I am waiting for this one to break completely first.
review_title: I am very disappointed that after only a few months the charger has ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: True to their word, even though I purchased my Fitbit through Amazon (who does not carry a warrantee on sports equipment), when my Fitbit battery died at 10 months, Fitbit honored their 365 day warrantee.  I provided documentation of my original purchase, and they sent a whole new unit--no charge, no argument.  It's great for tracking walking, sleep, and whatever you want to enter manually, like weight. It does as promised.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was very excited to get my Fitbit Flex before Memorial Day.  It's Labor Day today and with it has completely ended the romance of the product.  The device in itself did a decent job tracking my steps and I was particularly fond of the sleep tracker.  The first Flex i got failed, and FitBit's rather slow customer service finally replaced the device.My biggest complain, however, was with the cheap rubber band that the tracker came with.  I had the black band.  It started its inexorable deterioration almost immediately after I unboxed it.  It started to lose its sheen within a few days.  The edges started to pale in a couple of weeks.  The band that came with my second device (my first device lasted just a couple of weeks) started to rip where the rubber met the glass.  I took pictures and sent to Fitbit and they replaced it.  The new band did not lock well and today, finally, it popped off (I'm guessing).  One minute, walking through the Dulles airport terminal, it was on my wrist and the next minute it was gone!  I think I'm going to get the Jawbone Up or wait for the Samsung or Apple watches.
review_title: A decent tracker with a poor band

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The flex is my favorite compared to the ultra and one models.  Because you wear it all the time, into the shower etc, you don't forget it .  Its battery has allowed me to go camping without recharging or syncing for 5 days.  All the data downloaded flawlessly when I got back to civilization.It is my speedometer, if you don't measure your activity you can't change it.  I've used the fitbit line for more than a year now and am very happy.  Great service, great product.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had the fitbit for 8 weeks now. I have made a few life changes based on the information it gives me but I have not given up anything.  I still have sausage gravy for breakfast, eat an occasional steak, still drink my soft drinks. What I have done is try to make sure that I burn more calories each day than I take in. It is so easy to see and do the the website. I have set goals for intake and calories burned. This means that sometimes I pass on dessert and sometimes I may walk an extra 10 minutes during the day. Nothing really life changing. The result is that I have lost 16 pounds in 8 weeks and have never felt hungry or like I was giving up anything. I wish I had this years ago. I strongly recommend it to anyone.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So far so good I just got it but had a flex 2 and couldn't keep it synced to my phone. Had a hard time get the first sync but after that its great.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I absolutely love the idea of the FitBit. Unfortunately, I've had it for right at four months, and I'm on my fourth replacement. I've followed all the steps, cleaned the connectors, not showered in it, etc, and the tracker won't hold a charge after about two weeks. The FitBit customer support has been awesome, and have sent replacements out every time. When it works, this is a great product.
review_title: I absolutely love the idea of the FitBit

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Works well as an activity monitor.  Does NOT track sleep cycles like REM sleep but I did NOT expect it to.  It does track hours of sleep (manually by tapping on it when you go to bed and when you wake up) and can track if you are 'restless' at night.  The strap is a bit of a disappointment.  They really dropped the ball here on multiple fronts.  Pliable plastic bands have been around since (cheap) Casio watches in the 80's with no issues of rashes or premature wear.  While I did not get a rash my band did start to tear after only a few months of what I would call really moderate activity and only once a week charging so I was not taking the unit in and out of the band a lot.  Poor design and poor durability of the band.  The tracker itself is sufficiently durable.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Keeps track of everything for you. For fitness contests, excellent. For work out plans, superb. The dashboard is easy to download. The device even tracks sleep pattern.  It is interesting to note exactly how much you sleep especially as rest is essential to good health. You can also manually track food and water intake using the device. I rate it excellent and I haven't even fully experienced all it has to offer.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Best purchase ever! I am motivated to reach my goals moreso now than ever before. Seriously, a friend suggested, I got; then my hubby joined the fun! Awesome to compete! I like to match, so I also got bands in different colors. I do wish they had just a red, green, pink, purple pack, since I have all the rest, and all the combo sets would give me repeats, but buying them separately is more expensive. Mini conundrum, but GREAT PRODUCT!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: DOES WHAT IT SAYS IT WILL DO MOST OF THE TIME. FLEX IS BETTER DESIGNED BECAUSE IT GIVES YOU A DIGITAL READOUT WITHOUT GOING TO YOUR COMPUTER, PHONE OR IPAD. BUT FLEX WAS RECALLED DUE TO NICKLE FINISH ON BATTERY. APPLE WILL COME TO MARKET SOON WITH THIS KIND OF DEVICE WITH ALL THE FUNCTIONS ON FITBIT PLUS A LOT MORE. EXAMPLE HEART BEAT. BUT IT WILL PROBABLY COST YOU A LOT MORE THAN THIS PRODUCT. IT IS A GREAT IDEA WITH AVERAGE EXECUTION.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The product has some cool features but its band is complete garbage. I had it for less than a week before it came off while wearing it making it lost forever. I struggled to get the band to clasp each time I put it on and ordered a custom leather band to replace it but now I lost it while waiting. I can't imagine getting another because of the horrendous band.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My wife and I both bought these.  They both ended up being difficult to charge.  Even after cleaning the contacts with a toothpick like is recommended the charging issues continue.  My wife's finally stopped working.  There are many other choices out there.  I would try another brand if given the chance

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex is really just an expensive pedometer.  I've had it for over a month now.  You have to physically log exercise- other than walking and the Flex does not correctly log walking on a treadmill unless you swing your arms and I still don't think it's accurate that way. The sleep monitor portion does not correctly monitor your actual sleep.  If your body is just still, the Flex thinks you're asleep.  I think a monitor that checks your pulse would be more accurate.  I'll keep it, but will look for a better one as soon as this wears out.
review_title: Expensive Pedometer that's not that accurate

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: There is a lot to like about he Fitbit Flex.  It is light weight and comfortable.  There is a lot packed into this small unit.  Easy to set up and keeps a really accurate (to my experience) track of sleep and steps.  Daily syncing is a breeze as the Flex is able to connect with its dongle throughout the house.  Paired with the free apps and, if one were to actually use, the Fitbit Dashboard on the website, I think that this technology would have been a real benefit to me.  I say would have because I had a major flaw with mine - the clasp on the band.The metallic clasp, that is supposed to secure the band and the Flex to the wrist, has two small(ish) prongs that are pressed through slots on both ends of the band and are to hold it in place.  However, the clasp on mine was not very secure.  Today, I looked down and the Flex was gone.  It being so comfortable, I did not notice that it had fallen off.  I will say that it may have just been my fault, but, with something in this price range, I made sure that I pressed down on the clasp each and every time I put it on a left the house.For that reason, I cannot recommend the Flex; at least not because of the potential, easy loss of your investment.  A bad band?  My fault that that the clasp did not fully engage?  Either way, the clasp should be a bit more secure, even with butter fingers.  If yours works great, congrats.  If you are considering purchasing, just be aware of that the clasp may not be fully secure.Thanks
review_title: Good unit ruined by an ineffective clasp

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I want my money back the charger broke after the 2nd charge and just simply didn't work. I had my before photos, workout regiment and diet in place I was gonna credit Fitbit when I lost 100 pounds but no dice! You just lost out I will do this without technology if I gotta. This is the only bad purchase I've ever made on amazon and at 100 bucks for a hard working man it was an expensive mistake. Should have went with Nike...
review_title: Worst Amazon Purchase Ever! I want a refund

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought the fitbit flex because I'm a server at a restaurant, and I was curious whether I was actually burning as many calories during a shift as I thought I was.  I'm not trying to lose weight, just stay the same and maintain a healthy lifestyle.  Buying this tracker was a great decision.  While there may be some phantom calories that get tracked because of inaccuracies, it can't be all that far off.  I'm able to adjust what I eat based on how active I am throughout the day.  I recommend syncing this device with the myfitnesspal app on your phone.  It works extremely well, and I've been really happy with the other features like the sleep tracker.The best part about the fitbit is probably the social aspects on the site.  I'm a competitive person.  I like that you can add friends who also have one and compete.  You can join groups based on where you live.  And of course, the stats that the device is able to give you on yourself are very motivating to keep you trying to beat your own personal bests.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: First Fitbit I have ever purchased and was very pleased. It's very comfy to wear on my wrist and easy to use with my phone to track my progress. Also love that you can romve the band easily for charging or to replace.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the flex less than 6 months ago and the thing stops working for no reason. At first I thought it was the battery but it doesn't seem to be the issue. I got new bands and that seemed to help for a week or so, I also tried the reset button and sometimes that works but it seems like I have to reset more than the battery needs charged.
review_title: ok but I am going to try a different brand

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fitbit!  It does EXACTLY what it's supposed to do: 1) I know when I'm spending too much time sitting on my butt and 2) it appeals to my competitive side, I hate to see my name falling in the rankings so that makes me walk more.and I can't say enough good thing about Fitbit support, they are awesome. I found a Fitbit on the street, and Fitbit sent a postage paid box for me to mail it to them, with the intent of reuniting it with its owner.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The app with it  is great for tracking my progress.  It does not track my steps accurately, a 3 mile walk is showing up as 1.87 miles.  There are ways to adjust it, but just haven't had time.  Wish I had gotten the next level up for pulse rate and other amenities.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This Fitbit was actually a replacement for one that died on me. I absolutely love this product. Buying one of these was the best thing I have ever done for myself. I have been overweight for many years of my adult life and struggled with exercise. This little beauty helped me get moving! Helps motivate me with it's "rewards", badges..not food. In one year I have actually lost 88 pounds, got my motivation back, actually joined a gym and only have 24 pounds until my goal. I highly recommend this product to those who have lost their oomph and cannot seem to locate their "get up" because it really did "go"! I don't have to watch life go by anymore...I get to enjoy it again~~~~~
review_title: Find your Get up and GO!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my Fitbit Flex. Since I sit at a desk all day, I can set alarms to remind me to get up and move around and fill my water glass. I can track my food intake, water intake and exercise all in one place. I love the weekly updates where I can easily see my best and worst days. It keeps me motivated.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for myself as a birthday present. It worked great for five months. For that first five months I could not say enough good things about this device. After at nearly 6 months old, it would refuse to charge, refuse to sync and wouldn't hold a charge.  I am currently dealing with fitbit tech support trying to get a replacement.  If you can find a deal or don't mind blowing $100 go ahead and buy this item.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really like my Fitbit!  I like the work week challenges with co-workers, we can really get competitive! I can track my steps which is encouraging to see how far I've walked throughout the day. And it encourages me to walk more to reach my goals!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Absolute rubbish! Great idea but is so intermittant in proper function that i havent used it for months. I just tried to charge and syc with new iphone, but once again it wont charge. This happens often. If you do buy one, make syre that you have a paper clip handy, as you will have to poke it regularly to get it charging.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought it to monitor my sleep as I have Periodic Limb Movement Disorder. I enjoy seeing how well or how poorly I slept in the morning. I know I don't use all the features, but I use it daily for the purpose I bought it. I enjoy the weekly summaries I get for steps taken and how much sleep I got. I know I don't use all the features it has. It is hard to get the clasp to fasten without jamming the knuckles in my thumb. Wish it had a different clasp.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My daughter gave me this device for my birthday.  It is costly, but I particularly like the sleep monitoring feature.  Otherwise it seems to give me essentially the same data as my Omron pedometer, which can also be linked to a computer file.  Perhaps this will work better once I try it with a phone or a tablet.  The website to which the data is posted is somewhat clunky and inconvenient to use, but all the data are there, so that's a plus.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Irecieved this product end of September 2016 today is 2/22/17 and it stopped working last Thursday 2/16/17. Won't  charge or sink.  I feel like this product should last more then 41/2 months. It was sold by Amazon so I was told no warranty.
review_title: Defective product! Poor performance for cost.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex features are amazing and the compatible app on smartphones offers great overviews of your exercise and activity progress.  The product features gets 5 stars.  However, after a couple of months of use, the front lights no longer work and I returned the product.  Understanding this could be a defective product, I will not give it a lower rating, but there was disappointment with the lights no longer lighting up after a few months of use.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I picked this up because I end to forget things like eating healthy and drinking when I am on a two week camping trip I take every year. My Fitbit Flex kept me eating and drinking properly. I love how it celebrates when I reach my step goal as well. I think this product is great for people that get too sidetracked to take care of themselves properly.
review_title: Keeps me in line and healthy

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This item worked for one month, then would no longer accept a charge. The manufacturer was contacted via phone and promised an email with instructions on repair or replacement. No such email was received. Both the product and manufacturer’s response were a disappointment.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Purchased this for my wife this past month. Arrived quickly and very well packaged. She absolutely loves it, especially the sleep pattern mode. She wears it all the time to record her steps.Only issue that she has had is that the wrist latch opened and it fell off. No damage, but the clasp needs checked to be certain that it is tightly hooked. I will keep this issue monitored and add to the review if any new unlatching occurs.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I am on my second Flex.  They are great when they work.  If the battery dies without charging it takes days of sitting on the charger to come back to life if ever.  Me an my wife both have them in order to get the flex to charge we have an assortment of rubber bands and folded pieces of paper to get the flex to charge.  I dont know if any of the other models are better but be prepared to be dissapointed
review_title: Must be a McGiver to charge

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: My wife has been through 2 Fitbit receivers and so have I. She is going to be on her 3rd one in 7 months. After my second one I had to stop wearing it because I broke out with a rash on my wrist under the wrist band. Add up the receivers in 7 months. It is 5 if they ever respond. This is unreliable and we will not spend any more money on any Fitbit products.
review_title: Not reliable and broke out in a rash.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the idea and the implementation of this, HOWEVER, I hate that I have lost 2 of these devices.  yes, I had one, lost it off my arm, BOUGHT ANOTHER, and lost that one off my arm.  it fell off while I was using it.  and I don't know how accurate it is when you drive in a car.  I work on an ambulance, and put a lot of miles on the ambulance and it told me I exceeded my walking goal by 15000 steps.  yes thousands.  when i don't think I walked a mile.  my suggestion is wait till this device has a better design, in both hardware and software.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit! However, I do not like the bands. I have had nothing but problems with this style of band.  Within days of wearing them, they begin to come apart just above the lighted area.  It almost looks like a hinge is coming apart.  I recently switched to a watchband style for my FitBit & I love it.  So much more sturdy, a better value & no problems.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I would rate this lower if I could.I do not expect things to work perfectly every time but what I judge a product and company by is how they respond when there is an issues.  Based on the company response both by email and inadequate phone support.We purchased 2 fitbit flex bracelets back in June of 2013 and wore them daily. About  2weeks ago we noticed one of the bracelets was having trouble accepting a charge and there fore not lasting very long.  I did basic trouble shooting determined the either the unit or charger were defective. I contacted the company via their contact form to open a case.Despite the fact that this I a known issue with the device they chose to delay argue and did everything not to honor the warranty.Hold times were excessive expect to wait over 15 minutes if you get a person.Once I spoke with a rep their information showed that the unit was not charging properly and instead of working to resolve the issue they decide to offer a no win solution.Buyer beware.
review_title: Stopped charging after 4 months and horrible customer service

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the functions this has. I do wish I did my homework on what the others did so I could of chosen different options. But this one functions just like it says and I LOVE LOVE LOVE the challenges. (The only thing I dislike is that the band gets dirty so easily and the edges turn blue, so I would go for black or get a ton of different covers to wear on a daily basis)
review_title: I love the functions this has

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my fitbit, but the band is horrible! It has fallen off a couple of times but luckily I found it. I ended up buying one that is a watch style band and it's amazing. Love the fitbit!
review_title: Love the fitbit, but the band is cheap

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for my daughter in law for her birthday who asked me for it. She has been dieting and she says this has really helped her in her weight loss with the calories burned and steps taken daily and more...She loves it!
review_title: I bought this for my daughter in law for her ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The positives are that it is a good step counter and syncs with a lot of weight sites. (Lose it, spark people, weight watchers) But the GPS is REALLY inaccurate. I did a hike today that I have been doing for years. It is VERY steep and I know it is about 1.5 miles to the top and 1.5 miles back down. By the time I got to the top....(about 45 minutes) it said I had done 10.75 miles. (In 45 minutes) Not sure what happened there but I'm guessing I shouldn't rely on it for anything but a step counter.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: One of the best health investments, ever. I do not go to bed until I have met my minimums, which tripled when I got the Fit Bit. My weight is down more than 10 pounds in a month, my Fasting Blood Sugar has dropped more than 10 points between this and a product called Cinsulin.There is a recall on the FitBit Force (but not the FitBit Flex. The recall is based on a less than two% skin rash reaction. They are not getting mine back and I will testify to it in court on their behalf.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Loved mine so bought the family one as well.  We love the ability to link up through the app and I love the fact that I have lost 20 pounds because I can track the calories in an easy way.  My daughter loves the sleep tracker even better than her Apple app.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have wore it for two days now, and I totally love the fact that I am aware of how much walking I do, and it motivates me to walk more. I always was curious how long I slept and even if I was resting at all. I logged 8 hours and 14 minutes last night. I had restlessness 26 times, can you believe that it actually tracked that? Of the 26 times I was awake for 6 minutes. I love this thing! And I think that you will too!!!!
review_title: and I totally love the fact that I am aware of how much ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This Product has one major issue it want stay on!!  The band is held on by 2 metal pins and during the course of normal activity the pins can become loose causing the band to fall off your wrist.  The app and tracking tools all worked great and will help you stay on course to your goals but be aware its only a matter of time till your on a run and your band falls off.  I had my band fall off on a run 2 times and this last time it went unnoticed till it was too late. The last thing you want to worry about when working out is keeping track of your Fitbit for that reason I would recommend going with another product that can hold up better to normal Activity.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I decided to purchase this product due to my boyfriends family member who was sporting it. It was an impulse buy for me but I am extremely satisfied with it. It's quite simple to set up, use and charge. I love the website, the manuals, the wristband! Everything about this product. Do wish it came with extra color wristbands but understand why they sale it separately. Overall, extremely satisfied with the product and delivery. Prime is the best thing we ever signed up for. I would recommend this product to everyone who wants to keep track of their fitness choices. Research it and get it! You wont be displeased.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have been using the Flex for a couple of months now and am very happy with it.  I love the fact that it tells me where I am at in meeting my activity goal for the day and that it tells me how I am sleeping.  I use the website to track my food, weight, etc. in order to help me with the program of losing weight.  So far I have lost 8.5 lbs.  If you really use it to it's potential, you will be very happy with it.The only downside I see is that the goals are not very flexible.  They are set automatically based on your weight loss goal and cannot be manually adjusted. This is something they should look into.
review_title: Fitbit Flex is well worth the money

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Extremely inaccurate. Never notified me on the app when the battery was low. Did not record active minutes correctly or even close. Borrowed my friend's Fitbit and wore both at the same time and they recorded different steps, mine tracked 78% of what the second device recorded. Went to Amazon to exchange and replace this obviously defective one they sent me and I was 2 days past the 30 day window. Big waste of money!!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is truly one of the worst products I've ever owned. 1) To start, I was not finding much utility in simply knowing how many steps I took (it doesn't really register tough workouts), the sleep measure I didn't find accurate.  2) It malfunctions constantly, overwrites its own data when syncing to the App, resets itself, etc.  3)  customer support is not helpful, provides no path forward.  They would not agree to exchange or refund.  So this has become a complete waste of $100.  I would not recommend it to anyone and can't believe this company has made it this far.
review_title: Poor product design, function and utility

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this and just not very happy with its performance. The strap broke after a month and I had to buy more from amazon.  While wearing it while asleep the strap came off.  Thank goodness I was in bed. I prefer the body media, although that is a little bulky and I have to take it off going through the airport.  Fitbit is a good idea, but I don't think it is a very good device, at least not yet.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Had a lot of trouble getting it to count steps accurately.  Does it pick up bouncing in the car when you go over bumps or what?  I just knew I didn't get 10,000 steps in one day!Wildly inaccurate.And could not always make it sync when I was within 20 feet, often had to sync it manually.More hassle than it was worth to me.Gave up.
review_title: Had a lot of trouble getting it to count steps ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have purchased three Fitbit products they fall apart within weeks. I ended up buying replacement bands only to have them all fall apart. Resorted keeping the Fitbit in my pocket or tucked in bra which of course made it easy t lose.  The pedometers on phones are much better. Save your money

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It stopped working after the first week.  The battery gets discharged completely within 4-6 hours and it takes overnight for charging.  Contacted the manufacturer on July 12, 2014  and so far (July 14, 2014) there is no response (except for the following automated reply…)Fitbit- Customer Support Case #: XXXXXXXXXJUL 12, 2014 | 02:17AM UTCThank you for contacting Fitbit.This is an automatically generated acknowledgement that we have created a support case for you.Check your case status, and update your case online: Case #XXXXXXX - One Tracker [Windows]: …No updates or support so far.  Very dissatisfied with the product and customer- support.
review_title: It stopped working after the first week. The battery ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got this thinking that it could help watch my sleep habits. It only records when I went to sleep, not whether I tossed or turned. I wore it a few days and then stopped. That was weeks ago. Obviously, that is my fault. However, today, I was shocked to receive an email congratulating me on having a 5,000 step day. The problem is that it hasn't been charged or on my wrist or anyone else's in several weeks, meaning that the email I received is 100 percent false.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fitbit, it is fun and keeps me focused on fitness. Only one huge problem. The wrist bands do not hold up I have just replaced mine for the third time. I must admit this is getting to be a little annoying, but other than that the product is fun and healthy.Since writing that first review this one stopped charging after 2 or 3 months and I bought another one. I have invested in bands for the fitbit flex so I feel as though I have to stick with it, but I have put around $400 into this product. So far 2 have popped off of me and one stopped working....when will I end this madness?
review_title: I love my fitbit/but not anymore

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I took a 3 hour motorcycle ride and it congratulated me for taking over 12,000 steps. WRONG!  I set it to monitor my sleep; it reported I got ten hours of excellent quality sleep when in fact I got very little sleep and was restless all night.  Amazon's excellent refund policy kept the hassle away. I can't recommend this Fitbit but I sure can recommend Amazon!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Unreliable product with no support available. Tech problems occur; currently sleep cycle feature does not work.  No understandable, reliable support is available from Fitbit team in Philippines. One hour on phone; no resolution; great difficulty in understanding tech aid. Product is good in theory, but without technical support (and it seems you will eventually need it) and inability to replace defective product, I strongly recommend going to Consumer Reports and finding an alternative.  And I am usually a very positive person.  This product is way too much trouble and unreliable.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: We bought this Fitbit Flex for my wife.  It worked great through two charging cycles and then went dead, refusing to take another charge.  This must happen a lot, since Fitbit has a Web page devoted to suggesting ways people might get their Fitbits to charge - they say it could be a bad charging cable, a defective charging base, or that the Fitbit itself will not accept a charge.  Since it is estimated Fitbit sells over 2 million activity trackers per year you'd think they could figure out how to make a unit that works reliably.  Fortunately, Amazon Prime has accepted our return and will be sending us a new unit.Our two star rating is based on five stars for eight days and zero stars after that.During my wife's brief time with the Fibit on her wrist she learned two good hints for hopeful overachievers - if you vacuum a lot, or if you teach and write on a chalk board, Fitbit will give you credit for walking many extra steps!  I imagine orchestra conductors also get incredible scores.Update - July 7, 2015We returned the first Fitbit using Amazon Prime's excellent return policy.  We ordered a replacement unit and so far the new unit has worked perfectly!  I am increasing our rating to four stars.  The current unit merits five stars, but I am sticking with four stars since we had a bad experience with the first unit, which indicates some percentage of purchasers may encounter problems with their initial Fitbits.
review_title: First Fitbit worked great for two charging cycles - about eight days!  Replacement unit works fine

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Had to replace the one my daughters & family gave me as a birthday gift over 2 yrs ago. Came packaged just like my first one & I wear it all the time !
review_title: Came packaged just like my first one & I wear it all the ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I can see where the Fitbit Flex might be disappointing to individuals who are serious athletes.  In my opinion it fits the bill as a motivational tool for people that are looking to become more active and get some feedback on their progress.I agree that there are times that it does not accurate reflect my activity, but it has motivated me to swing my arms as walk.
review_title: I can see where the Fitbit Flex might be disappointing ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: For the price it's a good step counter. But just wearing it doesn't make you walk! However, buyer beware, the band clasp wears out over time and can get hooked and fall off your wrist. I had that happen with my first one. I bought a band that buckles for this one.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really like this. However, I lost it! Sad, but true. The problem is the funny clasp on the wrist band. If it had the kind of clasp you see on a running-type watch, I'd still have it. The band has a clasp that is bound together by a little metallic clip, and that must have popped out as some point. I like the technology and the phone app. If you are more careful than I, you will like this very much.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: i saw a lot of reviews stating that this was not a very good item.  I love it.  It tracks my steps and tells me when i hit my goal. You can set the goal for whatever you want. It has a silent vibrating alarm which i think is probably my number 1 feature. I haven't used an alarm since i bought it.  the battery lasts about a week on full charge.  I haven't seen any of the problems that other people have stated.  i did break one of the fasteners trying to get it back on but i have a backup from the other size band that was sent.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: When I first received my Fitbit Flex and tried to charge it it wouldn't charge. Then I saw that it didn't fit snugly in the charging cradle. I had to use a flosser or a paper clip to force a snug fit and make the connection. This has devolved to the point of having to apply more and more force until it won't accept a charge no matter what. Add to that the fact that syncing via Bluetooth is an exercise that requires much patience and prayer and you can understand my disappointment. I paid a hundred bucks for a product that really wasn't ready for the market. I like what it does when it works but I really resent being Fitbit's beta tester. And I don't trust that it won't happen again. Bye-bye, Fitbit.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought the Fitbit flex a few months ago to take part in my company's fitness challenge. In the beginning I didn't pay attention to the counts, but it would be all day walking before I could hit my 10,000 steps for the day. Then my husband challenged me saying it's not tracking steps right so we turned on the runkeeper app while going for walk and did this experiment for 2 weeks. After this experiment it was proven that my Fitbit counted only 2/3 of my actual steps. I am very disappointed now, knowing that I paid $100 for a faulty product.
review_title: Counts only 2/3 of real step, faulty piece may be

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Mine fell off my arm after only 6 weeks of wear. Save yourself $$ and buy the GARMIN. FitBit needs to put a clasp or safety slide on the band. The band became detached (I think when I pulled up my sleeves) and I didn't notice it fell off my arm. I contacted them to make them aware of my problem and offered a solution. They wouldn't replace it and offered me a 25% coupon for my replacement BUT I could only purchase it through their online store. The products from their online store are $20-$25 more and you have to pay for shipping. Needless to say, they did NOT stand behind their product.  I will replace it with a GARMIN product. I don't recommend this product due to the ineffective band and lack of support from the company!!!?
review_title: I don't recommend this product due to the ineffective band and lack ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for a Christmas gift for my husband.  It worked great for 5 weeks, and then the battery stopped charging.  We tried all of the "repair" techniques that are suggested for the product, but to no avail.  When we contacted American Distributors, the company that we bought it from onm Amazon, they said they could do nothing for us as the Fibit was over 30 days old.  I paid $92.49 for it, and I think that is very expensive for just 5 weeks of use.  Won't be buying this product again, or ordering anything thru American Distributors again.  Very disappointed.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the Fitbit and so does the wife for whom I also purchased one. The BIG problem is that I purchased the Fitbit for her birthday and part of the order was an order for the 3 bracelets of different colors. SIX MONTHS they have been "backordered".  BS.  Something is rotten with this claim of backordered.  I see the package of 3 bracelets available everywhere.  I want my order completed.  Amazon has been NO help.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Worked well for a while and was very pleased. It then stopped working properly and found it very difficult to reach Fitbit for assistance. So difficult that I did not reach them and gave up.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have tried everything to get into shape and lose weight.  I finally found my muse in Fitbit.  It reminds me to get up and move every hour, it tracks my sleep, it tracks my calories intake vs. output, and it counts my steps and miles walked.  Now I can't fool myself - Fitbit is constantly monitoring me, but in a positive, reinforcing way.  Can't say enough good things about it and am looking forward to finally getting to my goals.
review_title: Love it, Love it, Love it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Super sad about my Fitbit. Purchased since I didnt want a HR monitor and the HR Charge was too bulky. However, since purchase have had nothing put issues. Device will not keep a charge for more than a couple of days. It never seems to want to plug into the charger correctly and as of 4/20 will not take a charge at all....wish I had never purchased

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Good purchase for about 6 months then began to not sync. Now over a year later I have to reset and spend hours trying to sync when i have to change an alarm. It's just not worth spending that much time syncing for the data anymore... I have been very easy on it with no water or rough activities but still is having major issues.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this a few months ago, and between this and an app I have been using I have lost 30 lbs so far.  It would have four stars if it had a clock since I wear it on my watch hand.  I was going to get the Force, but once I saw the reviews I stuck with the Flex.  For the people who worry about the clasp being a problem, it breaks in pretty fast, and it has not fallen off my wrist.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Terrible. Not only does not on even connect to my smart phone, despite the fact that it claims it will, bit it doesn't accurately track steps or sleep, as it claims it will. I am thoroughly disappionted. Do not buy this, I would return it if I could.
review_title: Terrible. Not only does not on even connect to ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this about two months ago and have had more bad days than good days with this device. At first it wouldn't even work at all. After I finally got it working it worked as expected for about two weeks. Then the battery started dying within a day. It would not track my sleep movements. It would say I only took 16 steps all day. I are super disappointed and will look for a way to return it or get a new device. Plus if you read the help pages you will learn that it only tracks hand movement, so if you have your hand on the cart at the grocery store or on the rails of your treadmill it may not count your steps. Then you have to add it into your account ad an activity, but any free tracker can do that much. I didn't have high expectations with this device. I just wanted it to track my sleep and my steps, but it cannot seem to manage even that. Not worth $100.
review_title: ... this about two months ago and have had more bad days than good days with this device

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had this Fitbit flex less than 2 months and it is no longer working. I only used it according to directions. And of course it is not returnable.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Accurately accounts for steps taken, unlike other models that count all movements. Encouraging to see one, two, three dots appear (1,000 - 2,000 or 3,000 steps taken). System can be programmed for what user desires from novice to extensive or long distance walking. Will enjoy this for a long time. Husband is now aware of how sedantry he is, it may be a life changer. Time will tell.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'd love to be able to say this was a great thing for me, but that's not proven the case. For this to be useful, it would need to be much easier to use. There is a LOT of fiddling with this thing in terms of charging, syncing, and connecting. Support was nonexistent and this turned out to be a waste of money. I'd recommend going with something else.
review_title: A big disappointment and a waste of money. A fail. cumbersome to charge, sync/connect, and wear. No customer service to speak of

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very hard to program it, as the lights blink and change "modes" randomly, every time you touch the band.One of the rubber bands broke-off after 30 days of use. It was replaced by the makers. The incident tells a lot about how long the product will last.The steps and calorie count are definitely far from accurate, and almost make no sense.The sleep monitoring is a "payd for" service. Extra, not included.
review_title: my worst purchase on Amazon ever.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased two Fitbits, one has worked fine the other didn't seem to want to sync right away but then seemed to be fine, now that the warranty has just expired a few weeks ago, it has quit syncing again and registering the steps completely wrong.  I am really disappointed that this happened.  I really feel that it should last longer than that and I think this was a lemon from the start.  I should have returned it right away but it seemed to start working... until the warranty ran out.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have been eying this for a long time and finally make the purchase as soon as there's stock on Amazon. I'm impressed with it's solid build and seems reliable. So far I'm satisfy with it as Fitbit could link to multiple Apps and these Apps adds value to my flex. It's quite accurate in terms of tracking my number of steps but my only concern is as I'm wearing it all day, it is perhaps too sensitive that it tracks the momentum of my hands as well. I sit in the office throughout the day and actions such as typing and stretching gives additional steps to the flex. Perhaps this could be fixed by firmware to make the flex smarter in identifying the types of activities i'm doing. Apart from that personally I don't feel comfortable with the flex being on my hand when i'm sleeping at night. It could be a personal thing but it is not as comfortable as it seems since the wristband is made of rubber you will definitely feels abit hot and uncomfortable at night. Perhaps it's just me being not used to wearing anything on my hand when i sleep.Nonetheless, I'm very satisfied with my flex. If the steps are more accurate i'll give it a 5 star :)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the Flex - yes those who point out that the metrics will be slightly off are probably correct but I think they're not appreciating current limitations in hardware and software and missing the larger point. What the Flex will do for you is give you some feedback on your activities and will plugin very nicely to Fitbit's whole ecosystem. You can (and I do) track your daily food, weight, activities, and water intake.The point to all of this though is to get an idea of what you are taking in and an idea of how active you are in a given day. Sure it may not be 100% active but after gathering data for a period about what you do daily it's easy to spot trends in how well you are (or are not) taking care of yourself.I've had my Flex for a couple of weeks now. When I initially picked this up I also the Aria scale that is integrated into Fitbit's metric gathering. I would recommend those getting one of these to take advantage of the extras that Fitbit offers and keep track of your trends over time.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: When the Fitbit is charged and working, I love it. It motivates you to be more active. But the problem I have had over the past two years is that after awhile it stops charging. When I bought my first one two years ago, after some months it stopped charging and they sent me a new one under warranty. When the second one broke, my sisters bought me one as a gift. That one stopped charging, so I just ordered my 4th. Seems like a lot of Fitbits in just two short years. This is their last chance. If this one stops charging I am done for good.
review_title: If you can get it to charge, it's fabulous...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased two, one for my husband and one for myself. Its an absolutely great product to help keep you motivated. The drawback, though - its no easy task to put on the wristband. And the flex is so lightweight once you get it on that you never even realize that it has fallen off and is now lost. There needs to be an easier, more secure wristband - a $100 is a lot of money to just "lose".

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love this! It helps me easily keep track of my exercising via my iPhone, the battery last for days prior to needing charging and it's easy to work. I would recommend the safety devices to hold it on and I don't swim or shower in it for fear that it'll stop working. Someone I know went swimming in his and that was the end of it.
review_title: I love this! It helps me easily keep track of ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So I actually did enjoy my fitbit, but there's a reason they've lowered the price. It's way too easy to lose. The little clasp pops open very easily. This needs to be fixed. Also, the durability of the band isn't good. I actually purchased a set of 10 additional bands because the life span of my original fitbit wristband (the lost one) lasted for about 6-8 weeks.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've had this for just shy of one month, and I noticed this morning that the wristband is separating where the band connects to the dot display.  While the Fitbit captures some interesting stats, I don't think the band is quite ready for prime time.  I work in an office and beyond light workouts, there is absolutely nothing that I have done to subject this band to any form of torture test.Replacements will cost $15 a piece - to be honest I'm not that keen on sinking more money into more rubber wristbands that are not terribly comfortable, and have a 30 day lifespan.  One additional item: If you are used to wearing a long sleeve shirt, the rubber tends to catch on the cuff.From a dashboard review perspective, of the space provided for 9 tiles, one is geared to the upsell of their "premium" service, and another is dedicated to "badges."  I'm sure some are excited about the ability to earn cute little merit badges, but for myself, I'd prefer to have a product that lasts more than a month.I'll give their support team an opportunity to address my concern, but even if they replace the band, what is to stop the next one from breaking?

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black

The software would alter the calories you burned that day to only contain activities and not your daily burn based on your base metabolic rate. article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have been using the fitbit for about 3 months. I loved the fast shipping, and I initially loved my fitbit. However after only two months it started to act up! article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have used the Fitbit for over one month. It has met and surpassed my expectations! It records the number of steps I take each day and the calories I have burned; how many hours I sleep each night and my patterns of sleep; the battery has a long life that last several days; AND it looks great on my wrist!!  It's an amazing little device! The only draw back is that you have to input your daily food intake which is a bit cumbersome. Overall, I highly recommend the Fitbit for all health enthusiasts!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this product after previously having a Fitbit Ultra.  I ended up returning that product because of a faulty charger, and I did not end up wanting a new one shipped.Recently a bunch of my friends ordered the Fitbit Flex and have had good feedback with it, so I decided to give it a try.  This one has a faulty charger right out of the box.  Once the Fitbit is in the charger, it needs to be "pressed up" into the charging pins for it to charge.  This is a major inconvenience, especially since this is a brand new device.  After a bit of searching, I have found that this is fairly common (e.g. see [...]).  Per the thread and the Fitbit site itself, I have tried cleaning the ports, multiple USB ports / wall chargers, and multiple resets of the device itself - nojoy.I have not reached out to customer support yet for a replacement, but hope I can get a new charging station without having to go through the trouble of shipping this product back again.Frustrating.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this after having a fitbit one. I thought the wrist flex would be more convenient because I lost the fitbit one pretty easily. I like the features of the flex, but mine quit charging after 1 week of having it. For $100, the flex should be better than that. Also it's a little annoying because there is no watch feature on the flex. So I have to wear my watch and the flex. It's too much on my wrists.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The functionality of the device has been good with only 1 immediate depletion of the battery.  It happened once and hasn't happened since.  Usually get 6 days of battery life out of it.  The sleep mode is also a little finicky. It is neat seeing one's activity for the day.  For any color besides black, take into consideration that it will get dirty quickly and will need constant cleaning.
review_title: The functionality of the device has been good with only 1 immediate depletion of the battery

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like what the Fitbit Flex does - when it works...  About every 6 months I experienced a problem with either the tracker itself or the wristband.  This wasn't a problem, that is until the problems occurred AFTER the limited 1 year warranty. I don't expect to replace it again.
review_title: Expect to replace charger or band every six months

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The reason I gave the Fitbit Flex one star is because after only a couple months of using it, it no longer works. Either my charger is defective and no longer charging the unit, or something is wrong with the device itself; maybe the battery stopped working.Aside from it not lasting very long for me, this is a great device overall. If your goal is to become more active, this will definitely help. It helps you define a clear goal (the default goal is 10,000 steps walked per day which can be changed through the Fitbit website) and try to reach it every day. There are some pros and cons for this specific device, from my experience, in my own opinion.Pros:+Helps track activity throughout the day+Companion website is great, you can track calories/water on their website or you can import calories consumed from a different smartphone app.+Good motivation+Can be showered/bathed with; waterproof up to a certain depth.+When it holds a charge, it lasts for several days. I only had to recharge it a bit more than once a week, maybe every 5-6 days.Cons:-If you don't move your Fitbit holding arm while walking/moving (i.e. you're holding something in your hand, hand is in pocket, etc.) then it won't monitor any steps.-Activities other than walking/jogging/running must be manually added on the website-Some activities (such as using the elliptical) have a very inaccurate means for being manually added (i.e rather than putting in the amount of revolutions completed in the given time frame you would rate the intensity of the workout as light/medium/difficult)-The sleep monitoring aspect of this device is not very accurate. It takes me a long time to actually fall asleep and I'll lay still in bed for a while and the next day on my sleep it'll say I was asleep but rolling around even though I wasn't asleep yet.-My device stopped working after only a couple months of use.-For those who don't yet have smartphones with Bluetooth 2.0, the only way you get feedback is tapping it twice and seeing the blinking lights. There are 5 lights maximum, each blinking light represents 20% of your goal (1-20%, 2-40%, 3-60%, 4-80%, 5-100%). It's better than no feedback, but for how much the device costs it could be a bit better, maybe displaying the exact number of steps taken and the time so that it's like a fit watch (I'm waiting for the next version of the Fitbit Force).All in all, this product has some pros and cons. If anybody ends up reading my review, it's up to you if you feel the money is worth the investment. Based on my experience with the device which I had, I'd recommend either buying Fitbit One because it's less expensive and does essentially the exact same thing, except it'll actually tell you how many steps you've taken, or waiting for the new Fitbit Force to come out (Force was recalled because of skin irritation, they're coming out with an updated safer version or a product with a different name). As I mentioned, my device stopped working after a couple months, so personally I'm not going to buy another Flex but I may have just gotten a defective device. I still have faith in the company, but I do find it unfortunate that my product didn't last long, so I'm giving it one star because what I received was an expensive pedometer which didn't last long enough to be worth the purchase.UPDATE 7/20/2014:I was thinking about buying another pedometer-wristband device but I didn't want to give up on my Flex so I looked online for some solutions. When my Flex's tracker was in the charging dock, it wouldn't flash any lights or give any indication of charging. I cleaned the connectors on my charger and tracker with some rubbing alcohol, and I noticed small pieces of corrosion or something on the tracker's end so I gently scraped that off with a pin. I used the reset button on the charger twice and now my Fitbit works again! As a side-note, I have a new cellphone now which is bluetooth compatible with the Flex and the app is quite good. I upgraded my review from 1 star to 3 stars since my device is working again.I feel like the Flex had good potential and will help them pave the way for Fitbit Force, but I feel like Flex doesn't really have any advantages over the One or Zip even though it's significantly more expensive. One and Zip both have the ability to actively display the steps, calories burned, etc. on LCD displays. The technology to give the Flex an LCD display has been here but instead I feel Fitbit played it safe with the Flex so they could have it compete with Jawbone UP and the Nike Fuel thing. It's not a huge deal that I have to look at my cell phone and open the app to look at my steps, but in hindsight I feel like I should've bought the One or Zip because it's just more practical to be able to see my steps in real time on the device tracking my steps rather than relying on my cell phone or computer to see how I've been doing. In my eyes the Flex is a step backwards from where the One and Zip were, and being able to keep the Flex on my wrist 24/7 is a disadvantage compared to getting rid of the LCD display with real-time step count.
review_title: It Was Great While It Lasted!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black

review_body: Very disappointed in this product. I liked it for the first five days that it worked, and then it would not charge and the battery died. article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've been a Fitbit member for two years and I have upgraded from the Ultra to the One and now to the Flex. I had been interested in the Force before it was recalled and I just couldn't wait for Fitbit to come out with the replacement.  I've had the Flex for about a week and this thing is amazing.  I forget its on half the time and just today I was washing dishes when I forgot it was on and had both hand almost elbow deep in water.  Pulled my wrist with the Flex out of the water and the thing is still the same as the day I got it.  Couldn't ask for a better product.  I might still upgrade when Fitbit releases its next tracker, but for now I'm beyond happy.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm already self motivated so when I got this for Christmas, I added to the fitness fire! Easy to set up, easy to monitor your daily activity. You get motivators if you are almost there for steps, and the sleep pattern watching is excellent. I learned I don't lose all that much sleep anymore when my college student (home on break) comes home late!!! Now I'm using the food tracker to log my meals and seeing if I can lose 5 pounds. I put it on most aggressive goal, and it calculates for you, based on exercise and food input where you should wind up for the day (surplus of calories or not). Totally awesome, and even if you are already fully motivated you will love this. My friend was just motivated to get one too once she saw my excitement, and we're syncing up to be fitbit buddies.
review_title: Love it Love it Love it!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: With all the hype around Fitbit products, I thought this was a great find.  After my first day with the device I have to say I am underwhelmed.  The design is cumbersome and it appears someone just got tired of thinking in the middle of the engineering process.  Set up is relatively easy but your information is either tethered to your phone or your computer.  Too bad they didn't make the band a bit wider and include a data display on it.  If I have to sync with a phone or computer to see how I am doing, then I will just use the free fitness app that comes with my Android.  So if you are out trying to get to your step goal, you won't know where you are until you consult your phone or computer.The wireless sync dongle that comes with the kit is very small, has no wrist band or loop to hang or attach the dongle to something and it is likely to get lost soon after you unwrap the fitbit.  To charge the unit you have to remove the tracker from the band to do so.  Could no one figure out how to recharge the unit while still assembled?The band is difficult to close and is likely to fall off if you don't get lucky in attaching it. Surely there is a better way to attach the band--like the old buckle method or a plain old stretch band.Finally I have my doubts about the accuracy of the counter.  I can't believe I traveled 2900 steps while frying pork chops.  If I cook of full meal I will easily make my 10K step goal.This product needs some rework.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Just needed something to count steps. Don't think it's that accurate. I Shaked my wrist before to see what it does and it registers It as steps. Vibrations also sets it off as well. Battery usage is good though. Can go about a week or so until I have to recharge it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
