review_title: Nifty device but unreliable holding band

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was really enjoying my fitbit Flex when it all of a sudden stopped working a month into use. I emailed Fitbit help service through [...] and they were able to walked me through some different steps to figure out what exactly was going on. We were able to figure out what was causing the device to stop working. They we're very quick and professional with their email replies and I have no complaints with their customer service. From the first email I sent they replied back to me within a couple hours.I was disappointed that the Flex stopped working, but they are working on getting me a replacement since we were able to work together in deciding that the device was defective. I've read a lot of negative reviews about their customer service, but wanted to post that I had the opposite. I'm not going to lie, I didn't like the fact that there was no phone number to call, but all in all, it worked out just fine to do everything trough email.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased my FitBit in Oct 2014 and wore it 24/7. It was helpful in maintaining my weight and a healthy lifestyle while it worked. It was fine for about a year then the battery started having trouble maintaining. I tried to clean it and conserve battery, but it stopped working around Christmas 2015/New Years 2016. I haven't worn it since January.Is this a common problem? Is there a way to fix it? I would like to get back into a healthier lifestyle and use a tracker again, but I don't know if I can/should fix this one, get a replacement or if I should be looking at other models.
review_title: Great for about a year followed by battery issues

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Had to get a second one, the first one stopped working after 2 weeks. But the return process was quick and easy and the new one works just fine
review_title: But the return process was quick and easy and the new one works just

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Pro: Two wrist straps (small/large), immediate feedback on steps/activity, sleep tracking to identify troubling nights. Download the app if possible (smartphones) and grab a few friends to compete/challenge one another.Con: Many reviews indicate water resistance, but you will notice marks where some of the water slips into the device. Shower with it at your own risk.
review_title: Great for immediate feedback, handles ok in water

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had my fitbit Flex since January 2014 and love it. I was really going strong, keeping track (training for a half marathon on May 3rd)  of everything until I broke my leg the day after Valentines day. :( just started logging again and love how motivated it keeps me. I'm not up to 10,000 steps but I'll be back in no time and plan on doing my first half marathon in October instead. THIS HAS BEEN WONDERFUL to see my progress since I broke my leg. I recommend it to everyone.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Would not recommend at first kept track on treadmill was only off tenth mile or less now a week later off by a half a mile. If traveling on bumpy road logs in steps and some just driving with lots of curves. Have not been able to use sleep mode tap it putting in sleep mode but still logs walking or in my case driving. Over all a $5 pedometer seems better7 months later fit bit fully charges and dies half a day later do not buy
review_title: Would not recommend at first kept track on treadmill was only off ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought two flex fits. One for myself and one for myself. Ease of set up was amazing. I love the "time to wind down for bed" and the wake up settings. We don't even use an alarm clock anymore. Also works well with apps such as Lose It! and Map My Ride. Well worth the purchase price. Would definitely recommend!
review_title: Ease of set up was amazing. I love the "time to wind down for ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: After a lot of research, I decided on this product. I needed it for the vibrating alarm and to count steps. I am a casual walker so it is perfect for me. Perhaps if you are buying this for more intense cardio get the next level up!The app works very well on my iPhone as well.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Charges, syncs while in charger, but fails while not plugged in. Seemed to work before the update was applied. Fitbit customer service was very helpful and sent a replacement. Will update review once that is received and evaluated.
review_title: Christmas present for daughter that doesn't work

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It was great for 1 year but now it won't charge so I'm a bit frustrated

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought this for my daughter who is trying to get in shape for her first 5k.  She loves every feature it has including the sleep tracking mode. She tracks her time and has already made great strides to reach her goal. I also sent her the sassy black with white dots and the red extra bands and she loves it.
review_title: She tracks her time and has already made great strides to reach her goal

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The instructions are horrible.  Actually, there are none included with the package. Rather, you have to go to a website to learn about the Fitbit. Even then, you're really left on your own to figure out the blinks and the app.  The Fitbit itself is ok though I question some of its results. It does, however, serve a useful purpose of making you aware of your activity levels.
review_title: Might be better off going to a better model

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had a FitBit One.  I kept losing it because it would get knocked off my pocket.  Eventually, I lost it and could not find it.  That's when I got a Flex.  If it ever pops off my wrist I notice it immediately and pick it up.  It works great in tracking my steps, distance and calories burned.  it's easy to use and feels good on my wrist.  The FitBit software program is easy to link to the Flex and keeps track of my activity as well as my food, glucose levels and blood pressure.  it makes it easy to provide my doctor with my daily readings during checkups.
review_title: FitBit Flex - Easy to use, Comfortable to wear and

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this fitbit for my daughter as a Christmas present. She began charging the unit Christmas day and after two days it only shows 1 led light on power up. I tried doing a reset as the manufacturer's website explained sitll nothing. I have contacted the powers at be about this but no help on why it won't work. I gave up trying to get help from the manufactures website as it is worthless. I will go to Best Buy to get another one.
review_title: brand new and would not charge

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Good item, works well, synchs and charges. Would buy again

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my Fitbit most of the time. There are times it just stops working. I have found that I can't wear it in the shower. then it stops working. I love all of the information I can get from it. When it stops working, sometimes it is a couple of days before I discover it and I don't have that information. I do think they could do something better with the band, at least make it easier to put on.
review_title: I love my Fitbit most of the time

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Overall works well but does give you an idea in your mind that you are doing more than you really are. Best used with a app like My Fitness Pal. but does measure steps well but does not measure very well when you are jogging on a treadmill. I think it should measure that as active minutes and it does not always. But I would definitely recommend it for someone that is trying to measure their activity which is really what This is for..
review_title: Best used with a app like My Fitness Pal

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: finally got to put the thing to full use as, sadly, i rolled my ankle right after i got it in the mail...looked forward to having it help me get back on track.  the first weekend i was ready to put it into full use with reasonable progress on a daily step count i looked to my wrist and found it missing.  the 'clasp' had apparently come undone and it was gone.  i wondered about the nature of the closure when i first set the thing up.  my suspicions were confirmed. now it's gone and well over $100 with it.also...it left something resembling a mild 'burn' patch on the skin underneath its monitor location.  lasted around 2 weeks, but is gone now.  not happy ... wasted my money (but hopefully not these two cents)

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've only had this two and a half months and the battery doesn't charge anymore. It's either the battery or the charger that's broken. I guess the only way to find out is to buy both but I'm not doing that. A huge disappointment!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It's harder to use than expected. If you don't tap the window correctly, especially for sleep and awakening, there are not accurate readings. There are too many steps to change settings, and it's not intuitive to use. That said, I rarely take it off (I don't get it wet),the band has softened so it's not as hard to put on, and I sync it often. I've given up using it on my phone, use it only on the computer.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was bought as a xmas gift and that person really enjoys it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Had to send the first one back after 5 days it would not connect by bluetooth. It previously had. No matter what we did restart, re-register, et cetera...BUT we went online and filed return, next one came in two days and we printed return label for broke one and dropped off in box. No hassle. New one works great so far...3 months and counting.
review_title: First one dud, 2nd fine! Fast customer service

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Purchased this in February 2017, worked fine the first 9 months.  Now, the battery won't keep a charge.  Too annoying to have to remember to plug it in every night to charge, especially since it used to last for 5 days before needing a charge.  Won't bother buying another FitBit.
review_title: Battery won't keep a charge more than 24 hours.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I didn't get to experience the issues that other users did.  That's because I just spent the last two hours figuring out that their software manages the power to the USB port so poorly it was actually causing my perfectly functioning laptop to randomly crash and blue screen constantly.  This wins the prize for worst software I have used in maybe the last 10 years.  I don't recommend buying this product (especially until this issue is fixed).  Also, this kind of error should never happen in the first place and I'm not the only one it affected.
review_title: Software is so bad it can cause your computer to crash constantly

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very motivating!  Especially when you're close to your 10k steps..you want to just march in place to get there at the end of the day :)  Nice to link up with friends and compare activity too.  I've heard of people having contests at work where the person with the least steps buys lunch on Friday.  Sounds like a good idea to me!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've been using my Fitbit for over a year now and it's fantastic. I bought this one for some family members, and they all love it too. It has actually gotten us up doing more as we compete with each other. I think the Flex is the best one too because it allows you to get different bands. This comes in handy when they break after months of use.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the fitbit in general but after about a month the charger stopped working! I now can barely charge the fitbit, I have to hold down the piece into the charger to get it to charge. I have tried the suggestions on the website (cleaning the prongs, etc.) and nothing has worked. I wouldn't buy a fitbit again for this reason.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I ordered two fitbits (one for myself and my husband) less than 45 days ago. My husband's just stopped working last week and he requested a refund. We haven't heard anything back from them and it's very disappointing. We love the product but I wonder how good the "45 day guarantee" really is since they haven't even contacted us. It is very frustrating that no one is getting back to us.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Absolutely no issues with my fit bit.  It does exactly what it said it would.  I did take the advice of others and regularly charge it every 4 days and wipe it off before charging it to keep it functioning well. I appreciate that the website allows me to keep track of my food intake.  The calorie counter I was using gave me a grade for the day and for each food item I ate.  That is very helpful.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It's great but you can only get info on your computer or cell phone. Lights are a little confusing to figure out at first. Pivotal Living, which is only $15 a year gives you a free bracelet and all the info is right on the bracelet screen. HOWEVER... the fitbit is a lot more comfortable to wear as the Pivotal is really made for a large wrist.
review_title: Like the size. Fit is comfortable.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit was a gift for my husband. It motivates him to move more and try to get better sleep. My only disappointment is in the band. It is not very secure and his wristband fell off twice in the last two weeks. I wish there was a replacement for the band since I would be very disappointed if he lost the band. Otherwise, I'm glad I purchased the Fitbit because I'm sure he will spend less time watching tv and more time moving. I didn't want to purchase the more expensive Fitbit because my husband said he didn't need the features that it offered.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this around mid June. As far as it's functionality, it works just fine. It tracks steps very well and the software works well enough. I have no complaints there. However, the wrist band started to fall about after 1 month of daily wear. The tracker stopped working after 2 months. Customer support was very good and I received a new unit within about a week of submitting my initial request for support.
review_title: Product works but is not durable

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great fitness tracker. Helps me keep track of the calories I burn and gets me free stuff via my insurance company! They give out stuff if you have these kind of trackers and they see you are working out every day. Get at least 10k steps a day and free stuff!! Only downside is no clock but Fitbit does have other models that do include a clock

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: A great product when paired with the fitbit app (I run the app on iPad) . I have improved my excercise routines and sleep habits in a matter of weeks via fitbit feedback.  I wish the wristband was a little easier to close but I got some aftermarket poly-rubber clasps for a few bucks on Amazon that make the wristband easier to close and stay closed. I wear the fitbit in the shower, so only need to take it off every few days to re-charge.
review_title: A great product - but wish the wristband was a little nicer

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This simple device, like a string tied around a finger, reminds me everyday to walk, take the stairs, jog, and stay active. I've had it for a few months now and never take it off except to charge. It held up well until a few weeks ago when it stopped holding a charge. I contacted customer support and they were fantastic, quickly rectifying and fully resolving the problem. Hats off to Fitbit. Highly recommend.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Get the Charge. The band on this style is not secure enough and falls off frequently.  I was lucky enough to find it a few times but finally lost it for good.  I do love the product though, great technology and a good motivator to get out and move.
review_title: Great product but poor band design.  Lost within a few weeks.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I searched around before purchasing my Fitbit Flex. I wear it everyday and have had no issues with it. I've had it for several months now and the battery life is good. About once every 10 days or so I have to charge it. Even then it only takes a short time to charge. I do not wear mine in the shower, nor has it gotten wet so I can't speak to the quality if exposed to water on a regular basis.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love my fitbit.  It was amazing to me how much sleep I don't really get.  I find it very useful.  Just don't leave home without your charger.  I'm out of town this week, and forgot to bring my charger.  Turns out no one sells replacement chargers.  I ordered another one from Amazon that will take 3-5 business days to get to me, but stores do not carry replacement charging cables.  [I've checked Best Buy, Target, Dick's & Radio Shack].  Disappointing that I will probably lose a few days data.  It really does motivate me to be more active.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Does not hold a charge. We reset it constantly and even followed FitBit support recommendations. Only once did it last more than 3 days. On average it lasted 1.5 days on a single charge. Highly disappointed. Customer service said we were not charging it enough. We would charge it for 5 hours, they said 3 would be sufficient but then told us we only charged it to 70% (After a 5 hour charge).Other than charging issues great info, just kind of pointless if you have to take it off every other day for 5 hours a day.
review_title: Highly disappointed. Customer service said we were not charging it ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love just love this!!! I love how u can set alarm on it, tracks your steps, sleep what your burning!! Btw if u misplace it , u can set alarm from your phone On it an find it in minutes , it buzz so loud!! I'm so happy I pay for this, after wearing it to work, I got 5 other co workers thAt went out an brought it! Proud owner of the Fitbit flex

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I've only had it for a week, so I can't testify as to its durability--but it is comfortable, easy to figure out, and really helps me stay on track with respect to calories in and calories out.  I've tried a couple of different types of pedometers in the past, and they all fell off or broke.  This is much more convenient, don't have to remember to turn it on or off.  I love the little buzzy feedback it gives when I meet the first goal of the day.  Love the dashboard and the logs for food and sleep and weight.  All around, very very happy.The Aria Scale, on the other hand, I sent back because I just could never get it to talk to our home wireless system.  I'm fine with my good old Weight Watcher's scale.
review_title: so I can't testify as to its durability--but it is comfortable, easy to figure out

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have really been much more motivated to get more exercise so that I meet or exceed 10,000 daily steps. The sleep tracker part of the device has really given me new information about the quality of my sleep (or lack thereof). I sleep far less soundly than I thought I did, and as a result, it has been recommended that I get a sleep study.I wish that there was a better way to know when the device needed to be recharged, as sometimes it is out of juice and I have been unaware.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So I originally purchased my Fitbit flex from Amazon and I wore it religiously for about two weeks. I would take it off in the shower but otherwise it was always on my wrist. I used the alarm feature to help wake up in the morning and keeping an eye on my steps was addicting and fun! The unit was working and charging as described via USB then suddenly after recharge it wouldn't hold a charge. I contacted customer service and was ecstatic that they would send me out a replacement right away!I got my replacement flex, followed the instructions to replace it on my dashboard and charged it up via USB on my computer. I put it on the next morning and it died 2 and 1/2 hours later. I thought maybe it just hadn't gotten charged like it should have so I left it on the usb charger over night and put it on the next morning only this time it didn't register ANY steps or give me any lights.I contacted customer service yet again and they determined that the second unit I got was defective and sent me out a THIRD unit.Again I followed all instructions and JUST IN CASE there was something wrong with the usb port I was charging on I hooked it up to a different one. I charged the unit for a few hours until it said full, and put it on. It seemed to be working FINALLY. It went one whole day tracking everything just fine, I used the sleep mode fine, woke up the next day and was wearing it all day. Went to bed again the next night and put it into sleep mode from which it never woke up. No lights, no steps counted, and when I plug it in to charge it gives me one light. It will charge to all 5 lights and then when taken off and tapped, it does NOTHING. Putting it back on the charger results in it showing ONE LIGHT again.I have reset each of these units per the instructions on the website as well to no avail.At this point I'm not sure I even want to TRY to contact customer service because it seems like all they do is send me out yet another defective unit! Is there some big batch of defective units being sent out and I was one of the lucky ones to get caught up in this batch?What other reason can I come up with for 3 units going bad on me? Do I have electric based telekinesis that is EMPing these things to death in my sleep??
review_title: Third times a charm? Not this time..

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This is the second flex I've purchased. THe first lasted several year with only one flaw, the wrist band would come undo and I'd often lose the flex. This purchase is to replace the flex that I lost and could not find. Unlike the first flex, this on doesn't hold a charge at to my disappoint, fitbit does not stand behind their products. I would expect given this product is a few months old that fitbit would replace it but all they point to is online help pages. I'm moving to garmin, I use the garmin gps for biking and it works great. I would suggest you look at Vivofit before any fitbit product
review_title: this on doesn't hold a charge at to my disappoint, fitbit does not stand behind their products

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have never had any skin allergies of any kind until I wore the Fitbit Flex for a week. I developed a dark red scaly rash where I had been wearing the Flex. I stopped wearing the device and it took over a week for the rash to completely heal.I looked online and found that several other people have reported the rash problem with this product.Contacted Fitbit support over a week ago, but still have not received a resolution of this problem. At this point, I recommend avoiding this product.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Stopped working after only 8 months. I also realized that it was not always counting steps as it would increase "steps" with minimal arm movements, so not really as accurate as I would want it to be for a fitness monitor.
review_title: Not Really Accurate and Stopped Working After 8 Months

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: These worked great for about 3 months then my husband stopped wearing his and I thought he didn't like it.  It turns out, it would not sync or hold a charge.  About 7 weeks ago, mine did the same thing.I assumed it would have a 1-year warranty.  I should have checked - it seems the warranty ran out in February and now I have two fitbits that don't work.  I didn't realize this was a disposable product.For the price, it really should be better quality.  I don't recommend it.
review_title: These worked great for about 3 months then my husband stopped wearing ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought my Fitbit flex 5 months ago. It is so temperamental! Sometimes does not track steps, won't charge, doesn't work at gym ect. I have to reset it often. Some days I don't notice that it didn't work all day. It's so frustrating. I called Fitbit and they were terrible to work with. I finally said forget it I'll order a new battery and finally they sent one. It still acts up regularly. When it works I like it. Sleep part doesn't work good either. Spend more money and get a better one!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the fitbit flex.It makes me think about walking more each day. The step part is easy to use and keep track of steps.  The bracelet is very comfortable and I like the fit.  I read a review that it was very hard to get the clasp fastened.  It think it is easy to do.The calorie counter part needs to be improved.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I returned this because it doesn't show any information on the unit itself, and perhaps I didn't read the description completely.  Previously I've owned the Fitbit that clips on your belts and you cycle through all the different info - after losing 3 of those during the last 5 years I decided to try this version.  I just didn't think I would like having to connect to a computer to see the info.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love it!  Had the UP by Jawbone & it stopped working after a month so i got this one.  It does everything i need with one app.  I was using 3 apps before to get everything i wanted.  I like that i can check my progress easily & it is a wireless update.  I had to plug my other one into my phone to update which was a pain.  Its very comfortable to wear too.
review_title: Love it! Had the UP by Jawbone & it ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Enjoyed the Flex, but decided to trade up for the Fitbit Charge HR. I like being able to see the number of steps instead of trying to guess from the dots that display on the Flex. The Charge HR also has the capability to show the date, time, calories burned, floors climbed, and even allows you to set it into 'workout' mode.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The Fitbit Flex is great for the person that wants to change their lifestyle but not ruin their budget.  It will collect the data you need to encourage yourself to work a little harder, walk a little further, or sleep a little better. I highly encourage someone that has never had a fitness tracker to start with this one. It can literally change your life.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got this for my boyfriend's Christmas gift and he is addicted! It promotes walking and the sync activity can be customized (so it's not draining your iPhone battery) which is a great feature. There are two band sizes so if one is too big, you can swap it out. Battery life of the actual fit bit seems to last a few days and you can be notified to charge the device via email.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: ok... decided to buy this fitbit.... NO INSTRUCTIONS in pkg.... just a website.... www.fitbit.com/setupall this was give me a site that said I needed ITUNES.... so I downloaded.;..BUT... still no instructions.... do i need to do a download on my Iphone 4 or ???  Really dislike these products that do not have step by step instructions for computer/gadget nerds like myself!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love the sleep-tracking function, and how easy it is to wear everywhere (unlike armbands of years past). Would like to spring for the new Charge HR when it comes out next year. Syncs wonderfully with MFP now that I figured it out! In the Android app for MFP, I had to go to settings, steps, and choose FitBit Tracker as my device (I had Nike Run and Runtastic on there, which kept MFP from uploading the FitBit info). I got one for my mom, and my friends have them, so we do the challenges and competitions. It's been great to encourage walking more.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have 6 fitbit wristbands.  Only one of them attaches to my wrist properly.  The little prongs on the others just do not go in the holes.  As a result, I lost my first fitbit out shopping one day.  It simply fell off my wrist somewhere.  I have the different colored bands and one of those  is the only one that works properly.  Otherwise, I love the fitbit but the bands definitely needs some work.  I am motivated, in competition with family members and having fun with it.  But just hope it stays on my wrist....an expensive toy to lose and I have 5 colored bands that I cannot use.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I ordered two fitbits (one for myself and my fiance) and we love them.  We love them and even compete with each other to see who can get the most steps.  I love the sleep monitor, but I'm a little skeptical of how it works.  It is interesting to see my sleep patterns though.I wish it had a clock and step counter rather than just the dots, but I knew what I was getting when I bought it.  I originally purchased it because the company I work for started a Wellness program where I get points for the steps I walk.  It meets my needs for that. Definitely worth what I paid and very pleased.
review_title: Overall good quality and gets a lot of use.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I finally joined the hype and bought one since I need to track steps for work to get an insurance discount. I'm so glad I finally did! The band is comfortable to wear and I've noticed it has made me a lot more competitive and active to get my step goal!
review_title: I'm so glad I finally did

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So Motivating and Fun!! I'm a 64-yr-old grandmother and compete with my brother, daughter, niece, grandson and great-nephew. I'm getting outdoors more to walk and enjoy seeing and hearing the birds and feeling the breeze. I'm listening to more music as I also step to the beat indoors, and have discovered current musical artists that I like. My health and fitness levels have improved. All because of Fitbit. I highly recommend it for all ages.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got my flex about a week ago. I'm impressed with how easy it is to use. Clasp takes a minute to get used to, but it is NOT impossible by any means. I like to wear a watch every day and the flex feels a little bulky with it...I've mitigated that by wearing the clasp side on the top of my wrist and it can almost fit underneath the watch face.Step counts are pretty accurate, and you can see the device counting if you're walking and looking at the app at the same time. The ability to sync with My Fitness Pal and Endomondo is awesome.What is driving me nuts is the sleep tracking. Last night, it said I was in bed for 9 hours, fell asleep within 6 minutes, and didn't wake up once. What does fitbit tell me my total sleep time is? 1 hour 21 minutes. I have NO IDEA how they got this number. This has happened 3/5 nights I've worn it - no time spent awake but less than an hour of actual sleep time. My device sleep setting is at normal, not sensitive. These readings are throwing everything else with the dashboard and other tracking off.Has anyone else had this problem? I don't know if it's a faulty device or what, but I'm really not satisfied so far.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The clasp isn't strong enough to keep it on your wrist, so think twice if you are very active. ON THE FIRST DAY, I had it on a total of 14 hours from 10:25 pm until 2:00 this afternoon when it fell off somewhere between the Dr., running errands, and returning home. IT IS LOST BEFORE 24 HOURS OF USE DUE TO POOR CLASP DESIGN!!! I did like the functionality of the unit, especially the sleep  and steps mode, and the iPhone fitbit app, but I'm extremely disappointed that the unit fell off so easily when I wasn't even doing anything strenuous.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I can't live without my fitbit.Been using it constantly for the last 4 months and it has helped me lose 10 lbs.  It keeps me motivated to go walking every day, count my calories, and take yoga.The silent alarms are wonderful for waking me up, reminding me to take my meds, and reminding me to go walk.Highly recommend for someone who needs a gentle reminder to get fit!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: After 1 month the wristband broke. Bought a new one. After 3 more months, the equipment does not charge. Bought a new charger  and the equipment still does not work. Simplifying: THIS IS A LOUSY PRODUCT. STAY AWAY OF THIS THING.
review_title: After 1 month the wristband broke. Bought a new ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I loved this product but it only lasted 7 months. For the price you would think it could have at least worked for a year. I bought one for my mom at best buy and hers only lasted 3 months. Great idea  if they could make it work for longer than a few months and she is in her 70's so its not like she was tough on it. These things aren't made to last and I wont buy another.
review_title: Great idea but only works for a few months.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: To paraphrase Goldilocks, this member of the FotBit portfolio is juuuuust right. I am not a fitness enthusiast, and this product does all I need it to do. I have recently started using the silent alarms throughout the day to remind me to get up from my desk and move.
review_title: The Goldilocks of the FitBit Family

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: So far so good.  We bought this for our daughter, who plays a variety of sports.  We are having a hard time getting her set up online with it, even thought she is 13.  The fit bit customer service wait on the phone is so long we keep giving up.  I wish I would have gotten her the charge HR, because I have one and love it!
review_title: So far so good. We bought this for our daughter

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm in love after 2 days:  this encourages me to be more active than ever before.  It's so cool that I can see my progress throughout the day.  I will walk down the hall when I have a few extra minutes instead of just waiting.  I didn't realize how the little moments could add up to miles and better health
review_title: How little steps can add up to better health

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love many features of this item.  It feels like nothing on your wrist, is secure if clicked in properly and buzzes when you hit your goal.  I have not been able to use the sleep function as it doesn't work as stated, at least for me. Overall, I really like it and if you want an interactive pedometer, this is it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Works great at counting steps. Only actually made me try to reach goal for about 2 weeks before it just made me feel fat and lazy for not reach in the daily goal. But it does do what its supposed to and it really accurate

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got this for my 10 year old son to get him more conscious about being healthy after a lazy summer of too much junk food and video games caused him to put on a few pounds (which he has now lost).  We track steps, miles, activity, exercise and sleep, but not food, water or calories. He loves it when he reaches his primary goal (steps) each day - it notifies by flashing and vibrating.  It is synched to my laptop and an old phone that has no phone service, but can connect to the internet through WiFi.  It is a fun way for him to see days when he is active and healthy versus being a slug on the couch - without pressure from me.  He loves it!  He wore it to Disneyland a few weeks back and it was fun to see that over the three days we were there he (we) walked over 75,000 steps and nearly 30 miles!  If you do get this for a child under 18 you will have to "jury rig" the date of birth information when you sign up otherwise it will not let you register it.  Fitbit should come out with one specifically for kids.
review_title: Fun and healthy for all ages.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I really liked my flex when it worked.  It would log a few steps for my 90 minute walk one day and then the normal amount the next day.  I was very careful not to bring it near water or steam.  I was so paranoid with it.  It died 2.5 months after I got it.  I want another but I won't be spending $100 for 3 months of use.
review_title: I really liked my flex when it worked

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased this for a friend for Christmas and she's very happy with it. It syncs her activity with her weigh-loss program app (Weight Watchers) and provides incentive to move! The wristband that comes with it expands nicely to fit a very large or very small wrist. Good product, worth the price.
review_title: Great incentive to MOVE!! Syncs with weigh loss apps.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: The concept is great but in theory this item was disappointing. First, I have smaller wrists so I used the smaller band. It took me a little time to remove the electronic device portion from the bracelet and transfer it into the smaller band. Secondly, if you're trying to close this bracelet by yourself, the clasp is not single-user friendly. Next, nowhere was it listed (prior to purchase) that this won't work with an iphone 4 (it says many more--- please update and be specific about which devices will sync with the fitbit). Lastly, the my fitness pal app has more up to date foods than the fitbit app does. I shouldn't have to create items in the food log that have a bar code or are popular items like Chobani greek yogurt flavors. This item is already on its way back to Amazon for a full refund.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I ordered one in November and loved it for the several weeks that it worked properly.  Then it stopped working.  It wouldn't record steps/movement or charge.  So, I returned it to Amazon for a replacement.The replacement worked well for about the same amount of time.... then same thing.  It stopped working correctly.  I haven't yet decided whether to replace it (because I like how it works WHEN it works) or simply give up and request a refund.
review_title: Take Two - Still Doesn't Work Properly

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love it. I don't think it is particularly accurate (if I do a kickboxing workout with a lot of punches step quantity soars) but it's all relative so I do think it's a good source of information. I had the model that you clipped to your pants and lost three if them. This becomes easy to put on after the first one or two times. You get the hang of it and the holes get stretched.
review_title: Love it. I don't think it is particularly accurate ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Only negatives are that when shopping with a cart there is no way for it to track steps and if you are on a bumpy surface doing anything sometimes it goes into sleep mode as if you were tapping it. I love that it tracks calories burned and my sleep.  I wish it tracked stairs climbed and heart rate. The other fitbit are too bulky for my everyday use.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my Fitbit was skeptical but it does motivate me to move more

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this for the wife, it really helped her notice those days that she had been sedentary at work.  After a month and a half it only held a charge for about 4 hours.  Yes, she tried everything that Fitbit recommended to fix this problem and none of it worked.  I found her a Garmin that has a year long battery in it and after she got over the fact it wasn't a cool Fitbit, she ended up liking it more especially not having to deal with the charging downtime.At the same time I had purchased the Flex, I got my mom a Fitbit Charge and it is still going fine.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very poor product and FITBIT needs to step up their game.  I've had 3 and all quit working fairly soon.  I would have gone to another product but had data on my phone that wouldn't transfer.
review_title: Very poor product and FITBIT needs to step up their game

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: i bought two fitbit flexes over a year ago and loved them until mid September.  They pushed an "upgrade" on 9/07 and the only thing I have been able to track since then is steps.  Nothing else will synch on my dashboard.  Customer support has been horrible!!!!!  Despite multiple phone calls, emails, screenshots, etc and even after being assigned a "case number", every time I talk to them, they tell me that they are not aware of any issues.  By the end of the discussion, they finally admit that yes, there is a problem but they don't know how to fix it and their engineers are working on it.  For more information, check out Fitbit Community at fitbit.com.  There are literally hundreds of complaints about the issue there.
review_title: Fitbit Flex is just a very expensive pedometer

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I found that the bluetooth (main reason I chose this over the Jawbone UP) unreliably syncs with my phone. I made my target while knitting(!) one day. I faithfully wore/used the device for several months before coming to the conclusion that I was deeply disatisfied. Amazon will not accept the return at this point, so I am stuck with the device plus the three additional wrist bands I purchased.Could go on. I'm back to using my digital pedometer. Sigh!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought both my husband and myself the Flex as a Christmas gift.  I do like mine, however it is not accurate all the time.  If I workout at home, it does not register the "active minutes" even though I have been very active.  I do like that you can track calories, but am disappointed that you have to manually enter all foods with the nutritional info for it to register.  It would be nice if there was a built in register of foods.  My husband is already wanting to upgrade because he wants to track his heart rate and calories burned and be able to view it on the Fitbit without having to get into the app on his phone.  Good product for price if you are looking for basic step counter.
review_title: I do like mine, however it is not accurate all the ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was a gift for a friend.  She loves hers ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Enjoyed for a long time. Have upgraded my Fitbit since.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I had the zip for a few months - it was free from work for our fitness program. I wanted to upgrade to track more things.My biggest worry was charging the unit. It charges pretty quickly and I can take it off and charge while I watch tv. I'm sure if I did it nightly it would only take 10 minutes or so. I do it about once a week.I love the sleep feature. Although I sometimes forget to turn it to sleep mode... or forget to turn it off.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was very happy with my fitbit for a few weeks.  My yesterday totals are added to my today's totals and I can't get it to show only my today's totals.  It shows yesterday's totals correctly for everything.  But, all of my today's total's are merged with yesterday's totals so, it appears that I have worked out awesomely.  I have tried calling Fitbit without any success.  I am so discouraged right now.  I thought this was the perfect little device.
review_title: I was very happy with my fitbit for a few weeks

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Would totally buy again. Helps me hit my exercise goals and is very close in measurement to the online BMR calculators. It can sync with a lot of free apps which I use for health and wellness (myFitnessPal and Pct, MapMyRun, etc). I was upset at first because my husband's Force was so much cooler, but since the recall, I'm glad I have the Flex.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Love my FitBit!!! It has definitly made me more aware of how active I am each day. The sleep function on the Flex has to be turned on and off, which gets forgotten some nights/mornings. Not that it's a huge deal. Cool to see my sleep patterns on when I'm awake, restless and asleep.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Placing this device on your arm clocks each movement of your arm as a step, even if you have not moved your feet at all (it is designed for being on your arm).  There fore it is very inaccurate.  The band is very difficult for a lady to put on by herself.  The idea is a good one though, if they can just correct those 2 things.
review_title: My feelings for the Fitbit flex wireless gadget.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought the Flex.  I had trouble setting it up to laptop.....quit that, never could get it to work  and then hooked up to my cell phone.  On line instructions were confusing. They kept making you come full circle back to the initial question.  I've  had it now for a month.  Getting used to it; however, still have difficulty changing it from day operation to sleep monitoring.  I wonder if there is something out there that is better.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got this for my husband. He loves it. Very slick and lightweight. Tracks the steps pretty accurately. He loves the sleep pattern option too. Two issues: 1. The band broke about 8 months in. (He does wear his every day. Doesn't shower with it but he does plays sports with it.) We just ordered more bands. 2. The battery stopped charging about 6 months in. Called the company and they got us a new one free of charge. Overall, he loves the product and would recommend it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This tracker has really helped me become aware of the amount of steps I do (or sometimes don't) take in a day.  I had some issues with my FitBit, but I contacted customer service and they were super helpful and resolved my problem.  I haven't had any issues with the clasp as some other reviewers complained about.  The FitBit has been essential in my 20 lb weight loss in 2015!
review_title: FitBit takes care of its people!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought it as a Christmas present for my daughter. She has loved it! No problems to report. The band is a bad design and is a challenge for her ti fasten at times. Be sure to buy the protective bands to keep it from falling off! They are sold separately and cost abiut $5 for 10 of them.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: First- we ordered this and though it said delivered, it disappeared before we ever found it...no worries! Amazon send another one out overnight and voilà!We love the flex. Bought one for my husband after I was given one for my birthday. We don't care for all the fancy schmancy stuff that's include ON the other Fitbits. It tracks everything we need it too, and does a wonderful job at that! Great product. We're planning on getting these for family member birthdays! (Those who don't already have them.) are challenges towards each other during the week have become quite competitive (in a good way!) love it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great tool to keep me active. The constant reminder of the Fitbit on my wrist is great.I also like the bit about logging my sleep. Very helpful.  And - I linked this with MyFitnessPal to help me stay on track with my diet.I am making gains in activity and consciousness about my weight.Was a little pricey, but if it works well and helps me get some weight off, then it's worth it!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got this for my wife as a gift and she loves it. Very easy to operate with her I-phone and with our laptop as well. It has held up pretty well during the year that she has had it. Only recently did she discover a crack in the band. We are think it is from a son show loves to play with it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm so happy I purchased this. I have it in the color teal, which I LOVE. It did take me a couple days to get used to wearing it all the time, since I never wear bracelets or anything on my wrist, but now I don't even notice it. In terms of putting it on, it did take me a while to get the hang of fastening it but now I have it down pat. While I haven't seen it counting more steps than I actually did, I have noticed that sometimes it says I've been asleep longer then I know I actually was. But thats the only negative I can think of. It's amazing how obsessive it is- in terms of looking up sleep quality and your step count, and so far I can say its definitely made me put more effort into being active! Where before I would spend more time sitting down reading or watching TV, if I look at the ap and see that my step count is low, I will purposely get up and walk around. I also think having 'friends' on fitbit is a great idea, because that definitely motivates you to keep going- my coworkers and I certainly get competitive to see how many steps we can do in a 12 hour shift.I've owned this for almost a year now and I still wear it everyday and try to be more active everyday because of it. Unlike others, I haven't had any issues with it that I couldn't fix by resetting. Definitely a worthwhile purchase

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Was really enjoying using the fitbit flex.  Really easy to set up, not the most accurate thing but received consistent feedback, which was very motivating.  Then after six weeks it stopped working.  I tried to contact customer service by email (since there is no customer service phone number readily available).  It took 24 hours for them to respond, and that was after I went on Facebook and complained.  I've yet had someone be able to help me trouble shoot.  Ironically, one email gave me a phone number to call.  After waiting 25 minutes on the phone they automatically terminated my call.  Basically customer service is non-existent.If you do buy this, buy it from fitbit.  They give you 15 extra days to return (45) compared to amazon (30).  Now I have to hope that fitbit will replace mine.  Additionally, neither company gives a full refund

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Very good product, does what it says.  I did have a problem with one of the bands breaking where it is attached to the fitbit scanner. I had worn it for several weeks and I could have caused the damage, it didn't come that way.  But I replaced it with another band and it works great.  I'm happy with the product.
review_title: Very good product, does what it says

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I have had my fit bit for over two years now and love it.  It motivates me to want to work out and watch what I eat .  I love the different bands that you can get.  I also love the wide variety of bands that I can wear.
review_title: ... my fit bit for over two years now and love it. It motivates me to want to work ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It's a good product for anyone who wants either help motivating thhemselves, or who wants to keep track of their activity levels.  I really like how it cann keep track of your sleep too, though if you want it to record with any accuracy, set it to "sensitive".  A lot of food groups are programed into the program and the ability to addfood is also nice.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Got it for my husband and he has enjoyed being able to check his sleep and his steps

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This was a great purchase until it stopped working and no longer charges. Now my husband cannot use it and it is pretty much trash. Of course we purchased this in July and it is now the end of August so it is apparently too late to return it. Needless to say we are very unhappy with this purchase!
review_title: Broke after 1 month, now it is completely useless.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I purchased the Fitbit Flex about a month ago and it's dead...dead...dead. I loved it, loved how well it tracked real steps, not just arm movements and gave me an idea of how much to eat. The sleep tracker was messed up I feel, but I didn't need a tracker to tell me I don't sleep well. The cheep band that comes with it is pretty useless...popped off about a week into having it and luckily I felt is slide off or I would have lost it. Bought a better band that latched like a watch band and also a fashion band to wear to work. It died this weekend, would not charge at all. So people, shop around...this product has not gotten great reviews and now I know why...lesson learned.
review_title: I loved it, loved how well it tracked real steps

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love it! Its simple and easy to use. My husband was going to buy the step up from the flex, but i told him i didnt need caller ID or heart rate. It has everything else. So far it has work like a charm. Its very encouraging to see your progress. Motivating to get to your daily goal.
review_title: I love it! Its simple and easy to use

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I was a little surprised that there weren't any directions or setup instructions included in the box and that i had to go online to their website to figure out how to use the wristband. There isn't much to it, but if you don't know how to activate it, it is a little bit difficult. but once you get used to using the wristband and the app and website it is a very encouraging tool to get you on track with steps and exercise. i did find that it doesn't track all the activity or the steps so you have to manually keep track of some stuff. and sometimes the band does go into sleep mode when you are clapping or for me it went into sleep mode when i was cracking an egg when baking! very strange. so you have to watch it a little bit more than i would have thought.
review_title: good after you get used to it

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Band is causing bad rash with itching and redness along with some swelling. Talked to customer support. They gave me a case number and said I'd be getting an email. I did receive their email with cleaning suggestions and a suggestion of going to my doctor.  I'm not expecting a refund. I love my fitbit.  I just want a band I can wear without issues.  I have three bands I've tried and they all do the same thing.  Not happy!!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I love this fitness tracker except for one thing. I bought this because on the fitbit website it says that it is compatible  with evo 4g lte. Turns out ITS NOT!!!!! I'm very upset about this because being able to sync with my phone was a big part of my decision to spend 100$ on this. I am only able to sync with my PC.  Why does it say its compatible  when its not?!?!?!?! I'm so upset
review_title: It is an awesome tracker but....

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I like the Fitbit as an activity tracker, but I am less than satisfied with the rubber wristband that it comes with. I've had mine for about 3 months, and my band just broke. I have been easy on the product. I take it off when I shower, and I have only worn it around 50% of the time I've had it. The band broke in a spot where two materials are glued together. It is where the rubber band connects to the semi-clear lens through which the Fitbit's lights shine. A brief facebook and google search showed that I am not the only customer who has experienced this. When I attempted to order a replacement band from Fitbit, I was shocked to see that they are backordered. The expected wait on a new band is 8-10 weeks! There appears to be a strong demand for Fitbit bands.....I think I can tell you why.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this for my wife for Christmas ... I've already had to return one because of shoddy design/construction.  The replacement isn't much better.  My wife wishes she had asked for something else.  Word to the wise ... don't buy it.
review_title: Shoddy product that I do NOT recommend

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Overall I like it keeps tab of steps and comparing with friends, etc. The wrist band broke after two months of use. Sleep tracking is a joke. I have two fitbits and neither working for sleep tracking. The sync is also extremely slow (not sure it's the Fibit or my galaxy S3 phone app).
review_title: Overall I like it keeps tab of steps and comparing with friends

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this for my wife.  She has a very hard time fastening the wristlets gizmo.  Also the little unit is very difficult to remove and insert into the wristband.  Seems like a few simple design changes would make it far easier to manipulate.  Combine the charger with the wristband.  Use Velcro or similar for a closure.  The design sucks....
review_title: Hard to use for someone with even slight dexterity problems.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Great product. Having come from the Fitbit One, I was surprised to find out that it didn't include the counting of stair flights. It is on the package, so the error was mine and not in the product. This one is harder to lose than the FitBit One! Battery life is good. I have had no problems with the band. I do miss seeing the step count, versus the dots. The online tracking is motivating.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: While I love the tracking app, I am very disappointed in the battery life. I haven't even had it six months and it will no longer hold a charge for more than a few hours. My previous Jawbone made it a year before it died. I wish I could give it more stars, because it's fabulous when it's working, but more often than not, it isn't. It was wonderful for the first 4 months! I am trying again with a different model because I prefer the tracking app to competitors.
review_title: Lifespan of battery disappointing, but GREAT tracking app.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: This has been great for getting the 10lbs of winter weight off that I put on each year.  love that I can compete with friends.  It keeps me moving and accountable.
review_title: This has been great for getting the 10lbs of winter weight off that ...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I definitely walk more and exercise more in general by having the fitbit.  I also really love fitbit customer service.  A few months after I had it, it stopped working.  After explaining my situation to their customer service, they sent me a new one free of charge.  They did the same for a friend of mine who lost hers at Disneyland the first weekend after buying it.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I think I could put on a straight jacket easier than this bracelet.  The reason I gave it two stars instead of one is I do love what it can do as compared to UP but, seriously, the mechanism for fastening this bracelet is maddening and discourages me from putting it on. I dread having to take it off and charge the unit.  I have read where it gets better with use but after 4 days I am still spending more time trying to fasten this bracelet than should have ever passed the quality control inspectors.  This is a real defect.  I have used the other Fitbit devices and enjoyed them.  While I have this one, I do not enjoy it.  The UP band design is a simple put it on, take it off. Although, not as good technically, I'm going to go back to it until Fitbit redesigns this one for humans.
review_title: Great if you could actually put it on

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: i bought this device after the birth of my son because I wanted something simple, user friendly, and that would keep me accountable for exercise. I planned to use it mainly on the long walks I'd been taking with him several times a day. Unfortunately, when I push him in he strolled my steps rarely register. I've had instances where I walked for hours and came home to find that it only registered like 1k steps and 10 active minutes. It's happened several times. There's no point in buying something like this if it doesn't work unless your hands are free. If I hadn't had it for a month already, I'd return it. Waste of money.
review_title: not for those with small children...

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm returning mine.. My first one after less than a month said " searching" when I synced in to the app. So it no longer worked after that.. The replacement sucked too since it definitely doesn't count your active minutes correctly or your sleep correctly AT ALL..

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Bought this for my girlfriend at the time and she had nothing but trouble with the device accurately tracking her movements and sleep patterns.  She hated it and wanted me to get my money back.  I thought the device was cool for what it does and how it reports but I've never used it.  I gave it three stars because my girlfriend allowed me to get my money back for returning it.
review_title: She hated it and wanted me to get my money back

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: It does everything that I want it to do. It seems accurate too. I wear it while on the treadmill and the mileage is the same. I love the gps and voice command when I run on the road. It's great that it tells you when you've hit a mile marker and what time it is and your average pace. As far as being waterproof, I don't wear mine in the shower because I don't want to risk any funkiness occurring. I also dry off my fit bit after exercising and really anytime it gets damp. article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I bought the Fitbit Flex wireless in late October 2014 and it started dying in December, before completely "giving up the ghost" in mid-January. Caput. Toast. Worthless. Shot. After tree months of use. I initially purchased the Fitbit Flex because use of this product was promoted by my health insurance provider, which monitored my exercise patterns via the Fitbit online dashboard software and, if I met certain fitness goals, rewarded my medical coverage Visa debit-card with money that could be used for co-pays, office visits, etc. etc., up to $1000.00 per year. So, since I workout a lot, it made perfect sense for me to buy the device. I used the Fitbit specifically and strictly as instructed, recharging the battery every five days, without any difficulty for the first two months. I averaged about 65,000 steps a week since wearing the device. I never wore it in the shower. The battery never got wet. I didn't use the battery to prop-up an uneven table-leg, or anything ridiculous. It just started going haywire in terms of "taking a recharge" before Christmas. Sometimes it would charge easily. Then, the next week it would charge (indicated by the green "fully charged" indicator on the online dashboard) but, the very next day, the battery would be low or near-dead. Thereafter, the thing might charge again for three days. Or maybe two. Or four. And then back to two. There were no obstructions in the charging unit or in the battery's anodes. I ordered a new charger, in case that was the problem. It wasn't. Different electrical outlets, of course, were tried, just to be sure. That wasn't the problem. The device just gave-out and died completely after a couple weeks of erratic functionality.I definitely enjoyed the Fitbit while it worked, but let's face it: you pay $99.00 for what is essentially nothing but a very rudimentary, very basic odometer and motion-sensor unit. The online software that receives and interprets the raw "motion-detected" data is FREE, and this online dashboard is the only cool thing about the product whatsoever ... and it isn't even really part of the actual product you paid for. Of course, the software, too, becomes useless if your $99.00 odometer just suddenly up-and-dies after only three months of use. Looking at nearly 2,000 crappy reviews, here on Amazon, I was irritated to discover that I am hardly alone in my experience of this rip-off product's tendency to konk-out after several weeks or 2-3 months. And, of course, after having the thing for three months, it is not returnable.You know, I get it. It's a money-grab. These things are probably made in China at a production-cost of a few bucks per digitalized battery-unit and maybe a few cents for the rubber wrist-band. If these things lasted even a year at $99.00-a-pop, I might be inclined to call it worthwhile, in my circumstances. But barely three-months before you have to buy a brand new one? Forget that! Read my review, and then look at the over 1,700 other 1-star reviews for this rip-off device and draw your *own* conclusions about the Fitbit Flex's potential worthiness as part of your longterm exercise and/or health-benefits regimen.
review_title: READ MY REVIEW: Think Twice Before Paying $99.00 for This "Gadget"

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: Let me start with this.  I've had this all of 36 hours and I'm already MADLY in love with it. Having tried (and hated) another product (Polar Loop), I think I've found a winner.IF YOU ARE ABOUT TO HIT THE "PURCHASE" BUTTON- A WORD OF ADVICE: You'll want to look up a silicone fastener ring for fitbit- I'll link it here if this will let me.  The version I bought had about 10 rings in a package for about ten bucks... you're about to buy a decently priced fitness band, it's worth the ten dollar investment for the extra silicone fasteners, and here's why:Before buying this product, I read some horror stories about "I bought it, loved it, it fell off, and I don't know where and I'm devastated."  Thinking it was just a once-in-a-blue-moon occurrence, I bought one.Within the first two hours of wearing it, the band came off twice.  It's extremely lightweight, so the only way I noticed was when I heard something hit the floor.I wasn't doing anything strenuous, it just fell off, which is weird, because it's not exactly easy to fasten, but it's apparently really easy to come un-done.I got onto google, searched a minute or two, and found this- a simple, eloquent solution to a design flaw that will save you from losing a somewhat-pricey wrist band.THIS IS THE ONLY BEEF I HAVE WITH THE PRODUCT.  That said, I still HIGHLY recommend it if you're trying to get on a good fitness track- I just also highly recommend taking the steps to ensure you don't lose it, because that would ruin my day, and I'm sure it would ruin your's also.If it will let me, the link to the product I bought:  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00L7TOUYU/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1Doesn't have to be that one, but you'll want something similar.Other than that, a great product!  Just trying to keep others aware of this risk!  Good luck with your new bracelets boys and girls!

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black

I wore my Zip and Charge and the same time and went grocery shopping, while pregnant and pushing my then 3 year-old in a cart + the groceries. I had a 1000+ difference between the 2 trackers! That's a HUGE difference for a grocery trip. The Zip (worn at my waist) was way more accurate.Also, I started noticing that on Mondays, my steps went way up wearing a Charge. Reason...It's our laundry day and I am constantly folding clothes AND MOVING MY ARMS - NOT MY FEET.Back to the Flex...It's a great intro Fitbit for your child. They are popular and kids want to wear them. I see my kids competing with their friends and relatives. It's a great way to get kids moving and keep them moving. HOWEVER, If you want an accurate one, try the One. It does everything the Flex does, plus you can track your sleep and stair flights. (I am for 25 flights of stairs a day! It makes a HUGE difference in my calories burned, even if I don't get 10,000 steps in.
review_title: Great for my kids - not for me.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I'm not normally one to fall in love with a little gadget, but this is one that I really enjoy.  First, let's start with the fitbit itself.  It is a simple band that contains a removable pedometer (you remove it to charge it once a week).  It is about the width of the Livestrong band that I have worn for years, but a bit thicker.  In terms of style it is unobtrusively plain and won't draw attention to your arm.The band itself uses a system of snaps where two posts go into a slot.  Although it can be a bit hard to get on, once it's on it will NOT fall off.  I've used mine through vigorous exercise and banged it on things and it stays right in place.  Although I think the band could be improved there aren't nearly as many problems as some reviewers would have you think.  The package comes with both a small and large band.In terms of accuracy, it certainly does an excellent job of counting steps.  I've tested it while swinging my arm, while not swinging my arm, while driving, etc.  It has a very minimal false step count and does well counting even when the band is on an arm that you aren't moving (although on the treadmill you will need to move your arm a bit because you are stationary).  In terms of converting steps to distance, for myself it was spot on.  I did a few tests both on the treadmill and off and it is less than 1% off.  However, this can be greatly affected by one's stride - mine is apparently very, very average for my height.  This can be set though (for both walking and running) so there is no reason it can't be made accurate with a bit of testing.The fitbit can also act as an alarm (it vibrates), which has to be set from either the phone app or website.  The fitbit also can notify you of your progress by vibrating and through flashing lights when you hit your step goals for the day.The battery life is fantastic.  Even though it has an always on bluetooth connection and is constantly working throughout the day it lasts for at least 5 days (often 7) on a single charge.  It is very impressive and makes the product infinitely more usable since you don't have to take it off but once a week.The software is the best part though.  Through both the website and app you can get graphs that show your steps, calories, distance, and sleep quality.  Essentially the graphs are what sets this product apart.  You can track it through time and when you start checking it multiple times per day it really motivates you to take that extra walk around the floor or the stairs instead of the elevator.  You can also "compete" against your friends and family and see how your steps compare to theirs.  The app also has features to allow you to input your diet information as well as give specifics about your activities (i.e., running vs. walking vs. biking) so it can give a more accurate calorie count.In summary, this is a great little motivational tool.  It is a bit pricey at $99, but for me it was well worth the money.

article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got a fitbit flex about 3 months ago and was pleased with it despite that fact that sometimes it was very slow to log my active minutes. The messages on their support page indicate that their engineers know of the problem and are working on it--but they have been working on it for months and there is no resolution in sight. article: Fitbit Flex Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband, Black
review_body: I got my first Fitbit flex just over a week ago and immediately had trouble setting it up and getting started. I charged the device overnight and tried again the next day to no avail. I tried everything listed on all the help and FAQ sections of the fitbit website and still could not get the device to sync with the fitbit app I downloaded to my iPhone, iPad and laptop computer. I searched high and low for a phone number to contact for help because I was still excited about the product and wanted to get started right away. Nope, no phone number, only email, which I was immediately notified it could take 2 days OR LONGER to respond to my email due to high volumes. I sent an email to "customer service" (if you could call them that) and 2 days later, when I finally heard back from customer service I was instructed to try all the SAME EXACT THINGS I had been trying over and over again from the help sites (and quite frankly, treated as incompetent by the guy who was supposed to be helping me). After another day of back and forth emailing (with no new suggestions) it was determined that I had a defective product and was told I would be sent a replacement. When my replacement came yesterday, I went about all the same set up strategies and AGAIN, I could not get the product to sync to the iPhone app. I was however, successful in getting it to sync with my computer. I thought maybe the problem was with my iPhone as it is over 2 years old and getting a little sluggish lately. I tried to connect it with my company issued iPhone to test my phone theory and was able to sync the device with that phone. Great! I was up and running! Some of the lost excitement was beginning to return! Before bed last night I tried to sync again to see my overall results for the day and set it to track my sleeping and again, I could not sync. I am now coming to find that I can only sync the device to my home computer or to my phone only once it syncs to my computer first -- then it will send the latest update to my phone. This is a HUGE disappointment as I don't use my home compter as often and would like to be able to track and view my progress throughout the day.And, I checked my steps after I spent an hour at the gym last night and it greatly underestimated my workout. It tracked only 2 minutes of activity and only 1,100 steps... So basically, i just paid $100 for an ugly black bracelet with inaccurate pedometer capabilities. I hate it. I just want my money back but don't have the energy to engage in another week long email battle just yet.... Save yourself the trouble I have experienced and buy something else....
